reviews.review: Must see!. Only did te climb to the top. Absolutely a nice city view! The steps were not bad. Highly recommended.
A must see. The most beautiful architecture and one of the most impressive monuments in San pettesburg, you can find a lot around.
Holy Church. This was a beautiful Cathedral. You can also climb to the parapet to look over St. Petersburg - need to be fit though. Listened to the Vespers at 4pm - quite delightful.

Remarkable Cathedral. You must see this amazing cathedral....especially its interior with the remarkble Rotunda view looking up at it from inside the building. You can also climb the stairs and see a grand view at the top of St. Petersburg. What a remarkable cathedral and city!!!!!

Totally not what you expect from a cathedral. If you can walk up the stairs (any there are a lot) the walk to the tower is definitely worth it.I was very lucky that I decided to walk in on one of the days that there was a service happening. It was beautiful so if you can find out when a service is taking place that will be a bonus.St Isaac's is not a full-on cathedral anymore. The architecture is awe inspring and has been well kept however the cathedral became the centre for anti-religion under the communist regime. There is an amazing history to hear about whether you are religious or not.I tagged on to the one English guide there on the day and he was really informative. I didn't book and was again lucky there was an American couple in need of a guide as well so we joined forces.Definitely worth the visit.

Do not enter, climb!. The Cathedral is very good from the outside. Really good.The sightseeing from the viewpoint 43 m above the street is highly recommended. The stair itself is worth seeing and climbing that 200 steps up.The museum inside is not worth the money you pay unless you fancy glossy mid-XIXth cent. kitsch made from expensive materials, or like guides, telling you 200 years old gossip in a really bad English.My recommendation: take the ticket to the viewpoint only - it is much cheaper and really cool.

Opulent interior, imposing exterior, pickpockets. There are pickpockets victimizing the crowds seeking tickets. Once you're safely inside, you see lots of glittering opulence and artwork. The view from above is worth the climb,
Golden experience. Worth for visit for sure. Golden experience which doesn't take too much time to go through. We were lucky to see the holy ceremony too.

Great place museum. It's a beautiful church and it has one of the most amazing views in town.The colors inside are amazing.I am not a fan of churches, but this one has some historic context and it's really beautiful.

Great view from the top over St. Petersburg. Went to visit the church and enjoyed listening to the well made audio guide. It's definitely worth to go up the 250+ steps and get a nice view of St. Petersburg from the top.

Awesome Large Cathedral. This is a very large cathedral – and one of the top five largest cathedrals in the world. It took forty years to build and was completed in 1858. It is located in St Isaac’s Square. The main dome is over 100 metres in height. It is plated with pure gold. There are sculptures of angels on the dome. The cathedral’s facades are decorated with sculptures and great granite columns are made of single pieces of red granite. It looks awesome. When you enter inside, your jaw will drop. The doors are made of bronze and have beautiful designs on them. The columns within the cathedral rise majestically. They are made of lapis lazuli and malachite. The floor is made of granite. There are paintings by Russian artists and mosaics. A large, brightly colored stained glass window of the Jesus Christ is inside the main altar. The cathedral is open daily (except Wednesdays) between 10.30am to 6pm. During the summer the cathedral has extended opening hours in the period from 1st May to 30th September 6pm to 10.30pm. Admission prices are 250 Rubles per adult and 50 Rubles per child. You pay an additional 150 Rubles to climb up the 300 steps of the colonnade to get nice views of the city. I would recommend visiting this cathedral.
sooo beautiful inside. so much art work inside, your eyes don't know where to look, it is very tasteful and opulent at the same time.

Top view is superb. The tickets are separated: museum (RUB250) and colonade (RUB150). Make sure to buy the ticket before 17:30 as it's closed at 18:00. About 200 steps of the stairs, the view is worth to climb up.

A must see. First stop on our tour and as we lined up beside all the other buses were herded into the magnicifent church. So big in area and height with visual treats everywhere you looked with gold being the main feature. We were told the many interesting details of this great ediface but it just washed over me as I was awed with the splendour of its whole and feeling quite small in comparison.
Art . I was staying in a hotel in front of this beautiful place my view every morning was this great cathedral with all the elegancy in the world.
Wonderful,historic church building.. Now classified as a museum by authorities,it is well worth visiting.Climb the Colonnade on a clear day for spectacul views of the city.
Worth a visit. This is likely one of the best preserved and most beautiful church in the city. High ceiling, nice spaces, beaufiful icons.

World’s largest orthodox basilica. While Saint Isaac’s is Petersburg’s largest, it is also the largest orthodox basilica and fourth largest cathedral in the world, by volume/space under the cupola. It’s dedicated to Isaac of Dalmatia, patron saint of Peter the Great, who was born on the feast day of St Isaac. This is the fifth cathedral incarnation constructed at the same site, which to 40 years—1818 to 1858—due largely to the mammoth undertaking constructed on an unsecure foundation which required 25,000 pilings driven into the boggy land. That’s good to know, especially since this basilica’s capacity is 14,000 people. There are 112 stone columns, each weighing 117 tons. Soviets stripped all religious ornamentation, and in 1931 converted it into Museum of History of Religion and Atheism. During WWII the gold dome was painted gray, to keep Nazis from bombing the building. (The gray color blended with almost constant rain clouds.) This worked! Nazis bombed more than a quarter of Petersburg’s historic buildings.As a cathedral/basilica, it exceeds all expectations. As a museum, most art objects have religious connotations. Both aspects are excellent and make this a must-see museum. I was fortunate to be part of a guided tour, so there was much information not readily available to the lone visitor. Enjoy!

Outstanding!. The guide was very intelligent and careful, told a lot of interesting facts, showed a lot. If you stand in the middle and look up, you will see the heavens and a bird. It's so cool! We were touched and impressed.

Beautiful square beautiful cathedral . This cathedral is beautiful, I always stay in hotel nearby to enjoy its view. The building and cathedral is impressive by it size and dimensions, inside is beautiful but there is more amazing . The must to do it to buy ticket to go to in the top of the building, it is by stairs so you'd better make sure that ladies will not wears heels and that everybody from your company have conditions . But the view on Peter center is great and one of the best in city
Superb. Fantastic 'decoration' inside - wall to wall, floor to ceiling magnificent. Well worth paying extra and climbing the numerous steps to the walkway to have a 360 degree view of the city

Worth the climb. We found it a bit tricky finding the ticket office, were probably there too early, but then found a machine that issued tickets easily in English on a card. We just paid for the climb up to the top; stairs were easy and not nearly as worn and difficult as many English churches, and the views right over St Petersburg at the top made it all very worthwhile. It put the canals and rivers and various areas into perspective and fun to look down on all the different domes and streets.
Magnificent. Go inside and experience the faithful praying. Also go upstairs (separate entrance fee). Its worth it

Lapis and Malachite. The building is colossal. As the largest orthodox basilica in the world, it also takes fourth place on the list of greatest volume of space under a cupola.For me, the use of columns overlaid with the brilliant blues of lapis and the brilliant greens of malachite, offsetting the striking rich red of the garment worn by Jesus, that shines brightly from the rear of the Sanctuary thru the open Holy Doors of the iconostasis……..provides a visual distinction from all other churches I have ever visited. It is a remarkable interior.I wish we had time to climb the colonnade stairway to the roof for the view of the city and presumably placing us closer to heaven.

Amazing. This cathedral is beautiful inside and out. Stroll around the outside an admire the beautiful architecture. There are several steps to go inside but worth it. The inside is just beautiful. Gold , stain glass. Just sit and enjoy.
Stunning. Great Cathedral, large and very interesting though very packed with plenty of restful corners for quiet reflection. Plenty of art and great carvings to be admired

St.Isaak cathedral is an amazing place to visitt. this is one of 10 must see places in St.Petersburg.if you ever seen Capitolium in Washington,D.C you will be very surprised how architecture style is similar

One of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever seen.. It's a beautiful cathedral with the famous status in the square in front. The Church is beautifully decorated with mosaics and frescos. The doors are cast bronze with 3d scultures. Very very beautiful place. There are no toilets in the cathedral so allow time to walk around maybe 40 minutes. They have a souvenir shop inside if you want to purchase some items although the prices are a bit on the high side.
Should not miss this. Spectacular inside and well worth the climb for excellent views of the city. The climb is quite ease compared to others in the world
Heart of the city. Very nice cathedral, in the heart of St. Petersburg. Definitely worth a visit. Interior is less impressive, but also worthwhile.
Beautiful Place to Visit. Apart from the 272 steps to the top, overall is good experience. Went to see the sunset and it is so beautiful.
STP City Tour. Nice and beautiful cathedral with giant column/pillars. I didn't got chance to climb upstairs as my schedule is very tight...

Hard to describe the opulence of this cathedral - well worth a visit. This cathedral's painted and mosaic artworks, along the guilded vaults and walls make it a treasure. There are many steps to the top and there are better views of the city to be had elsewhere. Spend your time inside studying the art.

A must see. This is another church in St. Petersburg that is a must see. The architecture is unique and the interiors are very colorful and full of paintings. The architect of the cathedral is also displayed inside. The last supper depicted on the wall is excellent.

Amazing Large Cathedral. We were taken here on our tour and found this to be an incredible place. The outside is impressive with giant stone columns and the giant gold gilt dome. Inside is even more impressive with amazing paintings and decorations and of course more gold gilt. They also have mosaics which had deteriorated during communist years but which are now being restored. This church has an amazing floor with inlaid granite and marble. There are also giant columns inside with 10 made from malachite and 2 made from lapis lazuli. Many international tourists walked up the steps to the outside observation level with panoramic views of the city although we did not. This is a must see attraction.

A MUST during your visit!. This is a beautiful cathedral! Both from the inside and the outside is amazing! You should get the ticket to go to the top of the cathedral. It will give you a beautiful view of the city.It is also worth it to visit during the night time!
Please show proper respect.. I visited this cathedral and it is in the middle of Nevsky Prospect. Very beautiful place and so vast.

Beautiful and worth spend your money!. It cost about 400p for getting inside the cathedral and up to the round balcony at the top of it. Not so expensive in my opinion.Inside the cathedral was well decorated and beautiful.I think there's also a free tour of the cathedral but only in Russian. Anyway, you'll find so many tourist from many nations here that you can follow and listen to the history from their guide if you come alone and don't have any info about this place at all.At the top, you've to climb not-so-high stairs, you'll have the nice 360 degree view of St.Petersburg here. I kinda liked this place. :-)

Blowy up top. We actually went into the museum a swell as climbed the "few" steps to the top. Inside was impressive due to the size, however, the interior could not compare to that of the Church of the Spilled Blood. Do this one first. A very different style and impressive but in a totally different way. The height point is the climb to the dome. Not for the faint hearted and you do need to be reasonably fit. I have a bad back and I struggled. The views are stunning even in the blinding rain and gale winds. Worth a visit.

Incredible . This is one of the must see places in St.Petersburg. The museum part is amazing, but make sure your health condition is good before you climb up to the upper deck which requires separate ticket. The view was worth it but you have to climb like almost 200stairs.
Beautiful Cathedral. This was also a very good choice to visit. It has wonderful history and very impressive interior. beautiful
Vatican like. This cathedral is most impressive in size and beautiful interior. The upper column walk is not for all ages.

One of Three Must Sees in St Petersburg. Along with the Hermitage and the Church of the Savior, this is tied with the top must sees and must dos in St Petersburg.Crowded, sure. A little unsafe due to the pickpockets, yes. But, oh, this is so gorgeous.Just amazing the thought of the work and the resources that were put into making this place of worship.If you do not go here, you have not visited St Petersburg.
Not bad to visit. If you see every thing in nevsky street it is its turn to visit.you will find a nice view to city from the roof.

Impressive cathedral worth a look. This is a very beautiful cathedral and worth an hour to go through it. It is a very busy place with lots of tour groups so if you are patient enough, you can see everything you need to within an hour.

You gotta see it to believe it!. Visited this magnificent Church on a tour. . . it was simply a marvel on the inside. From the external looks you would be thinking another medieval, gray church. But on the inside it is one of the most spectacular looking churches; the artwork, mosaics, and religious scenes on the ceiling/dome. Photos are allowed, simply no flash though. Very busy during the day; tours are a great way to gather the history, significance of this church. Can't say what is the admission price due to organized tour which did the work on that front. Don't miss this church in St Petersburg. . . you won't believe your eyes.

Takes a long time to get admission tickets, but well worth the wait. We arrived early one morning to queue for entrance tickets, and it was fortunate we did, as the queue was over 100 by the time the staff arrived. Inside the Cathedral is magnificent, and a one off beauty from a different world.

Another wonderful visit to a must-see St Petersburg cathedral. This Cathedral has imposing and magnificent columns to greet you, and an intriguig climb up and down the many steps to gain an impressive rooftop view across the city. Highly recommended an a wee adventure.
Nice to see. Very nice view from the top of the cathedral, there is a entrance fee to the cathedral and another entrance fee for the roof view.

Austere can be beautiful. Well worth the trip, but if you're expecting an ornate cathedral, this isn't it. The tombs of many important rulers including Peter the Great, Catherine the Great, and Nicholas and Alexandria and their family are buried here, Well worth a visit.

Good Views from Colonnaded Walkway. If you are going to take pictures of St Petersburg, Colonnaded Walkway is one of the best view point. It is at a height of above 50 meters. You could get there at sunset. It is open overnight during White Nights.

Wonderful . Huge and so great place. It's a museum but it's also still a church. Mosaics are not like spilt ed blood one but the church itself is amazing. Had the opportunity of hearing a choral singing.

Great view to Neva river and St Petersburg. ...you just have to climb some steps 😊it was around 16 floors if I remember correctly. But the steps are not high, so it is doable for everyone. The cathedral itself is gorgeous, it is fourth biggest in Europe. And the view over the city is very nice.

Beautiful.. It is actually an active Church unlike what one of the other reviews said. A side Chapel will hold a service now and then. It is an amazing Church inside and unlike others in the city. Should be on everyone's must-see list.
Grand. This beautiful golden domed cathedral is eye-catching.The interior is opulent and you can climb over 200 steps to the top for a view of the city
Stay outside . We went inside to see the cathedral but it ended up that we have to use 200 stairs to go up and see St. Petersburg from the top.
Great restoration of a huge space. This former church is carefully restored and the active worship space is very prayerful. For sheer space and decoration it is amazing.
not to miss!. superb sight,very well maintained,amazing artwork on the ceilings.stained glass.just dont miss this one.

Amazing Place. Everybody should visit St. Isaac's Cathedral without hesitation. History of this cathedral is amazing. In my opinion audio guide is needed for better understanding. You can see marks of the world war on the south west side columns. Moreover you definitely go upstairs to the roof for amazing view of Petersburg.

Did NOT expect what I saw....WOW!. Soaring ceilings. Check. Columns of lapis lazuli and malachite. Check. Breath taking paintings and mosaics. Check. Stained glass and gilding. Check. Stunning chandeliers. Check. Stunning.

Love it! Words fail to describe the grandeur and stunning interior.Beautiful and grand. The largest cathedral in the city, i think. Words fail to describe the grandeur and stunning interior.Nice view. Beautiful and grand

Truly beautiful and historical. When first entering the cathedral your eyes are immediately drawn to look up and stare at the beautiful artwork on the ceilings and tall arches, with bronze accents. I found a google app called Indoor guide that allowed me to have a private tour using my earbuds and my cellphone as I walked around. Cost was minimal and worth it. Using the app, I walked through the cathedral and listened and learned about the different sections. Since I was alone I really enjoyed this.
Georgem. Was there yesterday and was taken aback at the work that has been done in restoring this magnificent building to it's former glory, must see!
Love it!!. Fantastic place. Nice view. You'll love it because of its architecture and you should visit this place!
Surprising the beauty of the Cathedrals in Russia.. I was surprised that this and other sites were maintained so well and not pillaged or destroyed by the former regime(s). Beautiful and grand.

Superb. The largest cathedral in the city, St Isaac's Cathedral – another grand monument with unbelievably beautiful artworks, tapestries and mosaics. Words fail to describe the grandeur and stunning interior – just visit.

Celebrity cruise to Russia. We joined celebrity Eclipse at Southampton, and traveled to St Petersburg, stopping at Tailin Estonia, Warmondom Germany, Helsinki Finland, Stockholm Sweden, Copenhagen Denmark. We stayed two nights in St Petersburg and arranged two trips, one to a local indoor market to buy food with two of the on board chefs. We then were guided by a lovely Russian girl through the streets of the City, where we had a Vodka tasting session and sample Russian food. It was a great experience, especially on our return to the ship, where that evening the Chefs cooked the food for us in one of the theme restaurants. It was fantastic. The second day in the City we toured Cathedrals, which were extremely busy with thousands of other tourists shoulder to shoulder trying to move around. Our guide was very good, and she tried very hard to keep us all together using the head phone system, which was crucial for communication. Some of our group became nervous of the situation and we're pleased when we returned to the ship. The City in places is very poor, but the Russians albeit tough looking were very friendly and whilst in the Market on the first day, we're happy to barter on the cost of the food with a smile. The whole cruise was wonderful with the other destinations a must to visit. (Not enough space here to go through each City that we visited) A wonderful ship, our 4th time on board. The cost of the excursions have increased dramatically over the past years, with many people complaining about it. You can of course arrange your own excursions, by taking local taxis, or open top tour busses. The entertainment is fantastic on the ship, with many bars to suit all tastes, even an ice bar, where experienced mixologist perform wonders with cocktails. Try and buy a drinks package, because, if like me you enjoy a good Gin and Tonic it will work out very good value. My favourite bar was the Sky lounge on the 12 deck, with panoramic views to the bow overlooking the sea.We could not fault any of the staff at all. So friendly and helpful. If you fancy a cruise and never been before, my advice is to try a taster cruise for two or three days to see if you like it, because it is not for every one. I love the sea, so it's for me and my wife, who enjoys just as much as me. We have cruised with many companies and most are very good to be honest, but with Celebrity you can arrange some good deals direct.

Took photos from the outside but didn't go in. This place is also very busy. All around the building are buses. It is difficult to get a photo up close to the church without any obstructions. We didn't go in because of the line-ups. Again, it is not an active church, but a museum

Mixed feelings. I had mixed feelings about St. Isaac's. It is a huge, impressive building. The view from the collonade is absolutely worth paying for - I was there at sunset and got nice pictures where the city shined in golden and red tones. But when I went inside the building - currently a museum - I had a weird feeling. What the Cathedral has to show in opulence, evident in the gold and marble all around you, it seems to lack in beauty. To make things worse, a rather ugly modern art exhibit was covering one of the chapels.If you do not have a lot of time, my suggestion is that you forget the museum and climb to the collonade.PS: if you visit the Fortress across the river, you may be able to take nice pictures where St. Isaac's can be seen. It is quite a view.

An Impressive Dome on top of An Impressive Church. Not as popular as the Church on Spilled Blood, this is a quite impressive structure both inside and outside. The inside of the cupola is magnificent and the bronze doors are spectacular. Everything inside is absolutely beautiful.
Gorgeous Interior. This was another must see. The interior is vast and ornate. All Russian Orthodox churches are worth seeing, but this one with its mosaics was a particular treat.
Iconic church. This structure is so enormous and please try and climb to the top, view is spectacular. Most people just walk on by but worth a peek indie

What a Great Surprise. This Cathedral was not part of our original tour itinerary since I preferred we see The Church of The Savior on Spilled Blood instead, and stick to my choice. We were taken to it as a bonus because it was raining very hard and we would not be able to complete a proper city tour. So glad we got to see it. Just by seeing the size and beauty of the Bronze doors you know this is going to be huge. The size, opulence and works of art in mosaics are unique. The columns, arches and mosaics will definitely impress. The great dome, honoring the Holy Spirit, the main iconostasis, showing the malachite and lapis lazuli columns, and the sanctuary seen through the Holy Doors were my favorite.

Extraordinarily beautiful cathedral. This orthodox cathedral is incredible both inside and out. It is a large structure with impressive support columns and fine exterior sculptures, carvings and statues, topped off by a large gold plated dome. The interior is extraordinarily ornate, colorful and finely detailed with countless exquisite mosaics covering the walls. Don't forget to look up - there are surprises in each of the smaller domes and the ceiling paintings are every bit as good as those you'd find in any Italian cathedral.

Largest Orthodox Church in Russia. St Issacs is a major Catherdral in central St Petersburg. It is now a museum with a $250 ruble charge to enter. There is a separate charge if you wish to access the collade on top and climb 200 steps to the top. It is quite large with many interesting doors, paintings, alters, and columns made of malachite. The walls are covered with mosaics. It has a very high dome. There are lots of large tour groups inside whenever you go. We unable to hook into an English speaking guide..but the inside is well worth seeing.

Well.... Hm, interesting and not. Maybe i was not in the mood. It was raining outside. But, nevertheless its a nice place with some knowledge to offer for thouse with years and eyes to see and hear. Recommended as a curiosity but personally i wasn't "wowed"

Beauty to the eye. Learnt so much in the short time outside....apparently the gold plating was coated in mercury to make it stay in place and shine....which means a lot of people died in order for us to admire this magnificent building....a must see!!

The view from the top is exhilarating. The church looks beautiful from the outside. We did not visit the insides of the church (I think it's a museum now). But you can buy a 150 ruble ticket to get to the top and see great views of the city

Opulent Cathederal. Although dwarfed in its exterior stature by the Spilled Blood, St Isaac's has a more opulent interior. The massive walls and domed ceiling are completely covered in mosaic tile and it is stunning. Take a while to walk around and don't forget to relax your neck as you marvel at the magnificent artistry.
Stunning Church. Grand, its so large. The dome was an easy landmark to spot from many places in St Petersbug, its massive. Lovely

Go up to the Colonnade during sunset!. I went up to the colonnade during the sunset and the view was spectacular! You get a 360 degrees panoramic view of the city, simply stunning. You also don't get as many people during that time of the day, won't have to be squished together with thousands of other tourists.Unfortunately the museum was closed when I went, so I can't comment on that.
Beatifull. It is another MUST attraction in St. Petersburg...This church is very impressive and mostly recommendedAs all local attractions for foreigners it is not cheap...

Spend extra for the trip to the colonnade!. The museum is something to see, but the view from the colonnade is spectacular. It's a bit of a climb. You'll huff and puff, as I did, if you're out of shape, but the steps are easy to climb and you can hold on to the railing! At the top, you can walk around the exterior of the dome and see unique views of St. Petersburg! The city tour buses start from this location.
Superb Church . You can get churched out at time but this is a must see . There was singing when we went in and although recorded it sounded very good and added to the visit .

Simply superb. Can't miss going inside the cathedral if you are in St. Petersburg. The architecture is beautiful and its breath taking from inside. We bought tickets for the museum and not the roof top walk which was a good decision if you got to chose between the two. Although I feel that they should have a single ticket covering both. The inside of the cathedral beats some of the bests around the world.
Very impresive cathedral. One of the main monuments of the city ythat you must see and visit if this is your first time in the city.
Beautiful. A beautiful space, sheer opulence everywhere that you look. This church also has an interesting history, including a period as an anti-religion museum!

Golden dome and exquisite interior. Visible from a large part of the inner city and extremely popular with tourists-(22 buses when we visited). Full of beautiful mosaic pictures on the walls, and on the interior of the main dome (maybe 33 meters up?) is a silver dove flying with a 3 meter wing span

Large cathedral with beautiful paintings inside . Stunning paintings line this square shaped cathedral in the very centre of the city. Facing Neva river.Ornate paintings and sculpture cover the inside of this museum. Worth your money.
Fabulous!. For me the best of the St. Pet's churches. Very much worth the visit, looks as impressive on inside and the outside.
Amazing architecture, beauty and view from top. One of the pillar of st petersburg beauty. It tells the story of russias artistic, architectural and cultural prowess.

The architecture is impressive but nevertheless.... The architecture of the place is very impressive, so are the interior decorations. However, I am not a fan of major gold decorations in churches, I have noticed. I prefer Gothic styles. St Isaac's is definitely quite a sight though but I would recommend to go to the very top of the dome of the church - this is the best view of the whole attraction. We had a guide showing us around but sadly, the only historical information we were provided with was 'Peter the Great was born on St Isaac's Day, that's why he dedicated this church to him.'. The rest of the tour was 'We took this material from Finland/Ukraine/wherever and we built this church from it.' which I found highly disappointing. I don't really care where they stole the materials from, and how they built the church. At least I don't care enough to hear about it for half an hour.

The viewing platform(Colonnade) had best views of the city. I only went up to the Colonnade, it was the last day of our trip and for once the weather was perfect, sunny and not too windy. You can get separate tickets for the Colonnade and the cathedral itself, with different prices. There are ticket machines outside, not all seemed to accept cash, which I found out when I was rushing to see it before I had to get back to the port, until I figured out some accepted cards only. It cost RUB 150.00. Because it was a beautiful day it was busy so it might take a while for you to take the shot you want. But worth it. Definitely was a fantastic way to say goodbye to the city. Things to note though, It's closed on Wednesdays and it has different prices depending on what time of day you are visiting. There are evening openings of the Cathedral and Colonnade in the summer but it's good to note it's double the price of the daytime admission. And the Colonnade is open at night for the White nights when the bridges are up and it's RUB 400 (June 1 - August 20). Last admission in the evening is 5.30 and it closes at 6PM for daytime admission. Summer evenings admission 6 pm to 10.30 pm. So pays to check your times.

The most impressive Cathedral of Saint Pete. The inside is very magnificient, majestatic, opulent, very rich, and elegant, something that the Russian buildings lack, specially in the insides...I was very overwhelmed by the beauty of the inside. It worths definitely a visit this building...

Amazing chruch in scale and glamorousness. Simply looking at the outside, it is astonished on the huge marble pillars outside. Following instructions before entrance, tourists may select to buy tickets for (1) church; (2) corridor and bell tower or (3) full. It is more attractive to see the church since it is really decorated beautifully, colorfully, amazingly and gracefully! It is so grand and featured with different holy saints pictures but surprised to allow taking photos!

Exquisite. I felt I Was in heaven. The cellings, the doors, altars, iconos of mosaic, The paints, floor, vaults, esculptures, archivoltas, everything are so special, well preserved, and shows how big artista are The russians, although, THERE are art works made by italians.A y way, visit this place is delightful.

An enormous structure that dominates the skyline.. This is one of the largest churches in the world and can seat upward of 10000 churchgoers. It has a very large cupola with gold angels surrounding it and worth the entrance fee. The church stands in a pleasant garden area near the Neva River, near old palaces now theatres and museums, the Admiralty and a statue of the Peter the Great. Worth combining them all and great for your photos.
Stunning!. A beautiful cathedral. very interesting architecture and decoration. The place offers a guided tour along with the ticket, which was perfect. Don't miss!

Iconic!. Excellent! This one of the main sights to see if you go to Saint Petersburg. It is a lovely building and takes you breath away when you see it. You can spend a lot more time than you realize there just admiring the beauty of it all. The place itself has many little areas to explore and stairs to climb so be prepared for a fair amount of walking. For sure, highlight of any trip to St Petersburg!
Must see. Loved every second of it! Absolutely gorgeous inside, so much history behind it. If you go to the top, spectacular view of the entire city!

very impressive showcase. This cathedral is a must see when you visit St Petersburg. Everything inside shows the wealth and craftmanship of that time. Like the carved bronze doors (20 tons). One of the highlights of my trip ...

Lovely on Sunday morning . As we arrived it was raining so we sheltered under the columns. the ticket offices by the main door are for guides the ticket office for individuals are around the back of the Cathedral but use the self service machines near the front door as they take cards and cash and much less of a queue and its instructions are inEnglish Spectacular inside and on a Sunday at 1030 the alter gates were opened so you could see inside which is rare.
Opulent interior. The interior of St. Isaac's is amazingly opulent. You can buy a separate ticket to climb to the Colonnade --- on the outside, just below the dome.

Another must-see!. This is another must-see when in SPB, and like the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood, it is a museum rather than a working religious building (which means you can take pictures - otherwise prohibited in Russian orthodox churches). The inside is stunning, with colourful paintings covering every inch of the ceiling. If you enter just before ticket sales close (at 17.30, I think), you can enjoy the building with relatively few visitors around in the last few minutes before closing time.Entrance to the top of the building (150 rubles, over 200 steps) is separate from entrance to the museum, and tickets can be bought separately.
St. Isaac's Cathedral. Truly one of the most beautiful churches I have ever entered! The mosaics were just breathtaking. If visiting St. Petersburg don't miss this gem.

Nice view from above. The line for the tickets was long and tiring, the cathedral is quite interesting, but the main thing to see here is the beautiful view after you climb about 250 steps. We thought it worthed it!
Wow!. The exterior really doesn't prepare you for the interior space. Just standing under the Dome is breathtaking.
Another gem in St Petersburg!. It's the fourth largest cathedral in the world. The bronze Holy Doors on the interior open to reveal a huge stained glass representation of Jesus. Absolutely beautiful!
Nice. Nice cathedrial but u cant take photo inside,it has just one small interance and the same az a exit, u have to becarfull of ur handbags
An Amazingly Beautiful Cathedral.. I think St. Isaac's is a must see museum in St. Petersburg. You can climb up to the colonnades for an extra fee and it's worth it... especially on a sunny day.

Amazing . Went on a whim. Was just randomly wandering around the city waiting for a call from my son. Decided to go in. Well worth the time. Especially climbing up to the top of the dome. Could see the whole city. Simply gorgeous. The tour inside was gorgeous as well. Did and audio tour in my language (English) and leaned a ton about the cathedral. Definitely a must do. Bi may go back if I have time!!!!
Huge cathedral. This cathedral dominates the main part of the city. It is impressive to see and has ways to climb to the upper levels.

St. Isaac's is very impressive!. There are very few impressive churches outside of Italy, but St. Isaac's Cathedral in St. Petersburg is definitely one of those precious few. I'm not really a religious person, but I do enjoy artwork and architecture. This building was made in the middle of the 19th century and today after 150 years it still looks amazing, must be the shiny golden dome.

Astonishing exterior and interior!. The exterior is very impressive. The golden dome St. Isaac's Cathedral dominates the skyline of St. Petersburg. It is plated with pure gold and is decorated with statues of angels.The exterior is made of with gray and pink stones, decorated with sculptures and red granite columns.The stunning interior is adorned with incredibly mosaic icons, paintings and columns made of semiprecious stone malachite and lapis lazuli. Everywhere you look you see beautiful paintings, marble, gold, in the walls, in the ceiling and in the floor. Also worth mentioning the chandeliers and the interior of the great dome, honoring the Holy Spirit. A lot of people recommend to climb the 300 steps up to the walkway accessible to tourists located in the cathedral's rotunda of the uppermost dome, to enjoy the magnificent views over the city. My husband and I decided not to climb so many steps. Tip: Buy entrance tickets at the street-level ticket booth located at the right of the tourist information booth, almost at the opposite side of the cathedral entrance. Beware of pickpockets. When my husband was buying the tickets, a young girl well dressed, which was just beside him in the line, unzipped the pouch he takes tied at the waist. Thank God the wind had blown the girl's scarf her toward him and he realized what was happening before he had been stolen.

Must place to visit. . This is a lovely place Main attraction is different types of stone and marble used. This attraction also has a platform you can get panoramic views from . This is an extra cost and have to walk up steps to get to it. But worth it on a clear day .It is also open until 10pm at night do you can get some great night pictures of the area . Warning: the ticket office closes at 5.30pm so do need to get your tickets before this time if you plan to visit between 5.30 and 10pm.

Sumptuous beyond belief. Totally unprepared for what I was about to see, I was totally speechless at the magnificence of this building. I don't want to give too much away but St Isaacs must be one of the most opulent buildings ever constructed in human history. I mean..... monstrous MALACHITE columns???? This is totally NOT to be missed.

Lovely and Impressive Museum. It is difficult to think of this place as just a museum but it doesn't function as a church any longer. Gorgeous rich colors and towering structures make it visually very appealing. The book sold inside contains a lot of information about the building and the narrative around this massive and beautiful museum, If you are going to visit, do double check the hours as they are different from the hours that the ticket office is open. On the day we went, the ticket office AND the automatic ticket terminals, were all closed from 530 until 600pm on the dot. It was a very odd part of our visit but we did it. Also remember that it is not a church and admission isn't cheap at around $15 US. The staff either do not speak English or appear totally disinterested in humans even if you want to buy items at the souvenir stands inside.
Must see. Make sure that you are there at opening time ahead of crowd.Walk up to the Colonnades. To enjoy the view over St.Petersburg.

Great views of St. Petersburg and beautiful artwork inside. Beautiful artwork inside and great views of St. Petersburg outside. Definitely a must see! During WW II this cathedral was spared but you can still see areas which were damaged from shrapnel.
Beautiful architecture. Another must visit catheral displaying russian architecture. one of the best churches. entry fee applicable. best to hire a guide to enjoy.

Amazing!. Just go into this magnificent structure and be awed. It it inconceivable how these structures were constructed and makes on wonder . St Pete, or Leningrad, is a magnificent city but also go on to Moscow which is fabulous.

A good visit. Entrance was 250R and 150R if you wanted to do the canopy walk. It was nice inside, except I had just come from Church of the Spilled Blood, so not as good as that. On exit, you have to walk back around the building for the entrance for the canopy walk. It is approx 30 steps up a spiral staircase and then across the open for the last 20 or so. A great view.

No-Museum but Yes-Colonnade. Like most of the visitors to St. Isaac's Cathedral, we had a choice between entering the museum or to climb the 262 steps to the colonnade. We decided on the later and paid our 150 Roubles each. Climbing the steps was easier than we thought since most of the steps were wide and even except the last part of narrower with steel steps. The scenery in the colonnade was excellent for viewing the city. We were are to see all the places we walked that day. The whole exercise was well worth it.

breath taking....don't miss. St petersburg is an amazing place. Too many places to see and this is one of them that you need to see. Amazing architecture inside and outside. we went with the guided tour so bit rushed but we really enjoyed it
Beautiful. Such a beautiful building both inside and outside that it makes it difficult to stop taking pictures and edit oneself

Great views and great interior too!. The climb to the top of the 200+ stairs is worth it, to get fantastic views across the city; but also inside the building is just breathtaking art and design and architecture and history. Spend a couple of hours taking it all in. Wonderful!
Beautiful 19th Century Neoclassicism. A stunning church, beautifully restored. Great views from the colonnade on the roof. The bronze doors are exceptional.
Amazing. During the war the Germans left this building fairly unscathed, except for a few shrapnel marks, as it was such a prominent landmark.Lovely building with some fantastic views from the dome.

Absolutely gorgeous!. St. Isaac's Cathedral is actually a museum. It is really large, rich and gorgeous inside! Save some time to just take in all the details of the beautiful architecture and the details of the ceiling , walls, pillars and mosaics. Also, you can buy tickets to go up and have a panoramic view of St. Petersburg.

Stunning. One of the most beautiful churches I have seen. The church is huge and built with luxurious materials (green and pink stone pillars) and lots of golden ornaments. The level of workmanship and details were simply amazing. A must go.

breathtaking views. I'm glad I didn't read how many steps to walk up to the viewing balcony because I may have passed on the opportunity. So glad I didn't. The view from the balcony is breathtaking. You can buy either a ticket for the balcony, a ticket for the interior or a combined ticket. I highly suggest getting the combined ticket. The artwork in the interior of the Cathedral is quite beautiful, especially the mosaics.
love the views. I never went inside, but going up on the top level is fantastic. I'd do it again if I could.Downside is that you have to walk up there, no elevator. And its quite a stairway.

Beautiful Cathedral. No visit to St P is complete without a visit to St Isaacs, you buy can buy separate tickets for just the inside or also to climb up to the steeple, which gives amazing view of St Petersburg and well worth doing, even if the steps are a bit of a lung buster! Cost for the combined ticket was only R400 which is under £5, a bargain!!!
Surprise. This site was a delightful surprise to me. I didn't know what to expect and it is absolutely beautiful. Be sure to add it to your itinerary in St. Petersburg.
Go up!. Get up and enjoy the view. Take your camera and make some beautiful photos from the top of Cathedral. You will need to use stairs, but the view is breathtaking.
Worthy part of 3 cathedral tour. It's worth an hour or so or your time in St. Petersburg, but just how much grandeur and opulence can you stand? Glad we saw it. Don't need to go back.
Open latter so good idea for early evening visit. A very large cathedral that was interesting but not great. For an extra fee you can climb to the top of the dome and get a good view of the city.

Stunning and unique. There is something so magical about this building. The views and the architectural features are amazing! Well worth the visit to the top. You will enjoy stunning views from there! You can take audio guide to explore the cathedral to the fullest!
Interesting. Amazing outside - didn't go inside because we ran out of time, It is a church that the communist govt turned into a museum for Atheism!!!

Don't miss this one. This cathedral has an amazing interior... check out the columns and ceilings...just wow.Entrance to the place costs 250rr and an audio guide is available for 200rr.A must do while in St Petersburg

Beautiful. This is a beautiful place - take a guide who can share the history including what happened during the war and the Soviet period. Photos are allowed without flash. You can get to a walkway high up outside for an extra fee which gives you an amazing view of the city.

Beautiful historical cathedral . Love all the historic cathedrals and palaces in st Petersburg , they are all so beautiful . The cathedral is in a quiet place just a few streets from the main town. We didn't go inside because it gets really busy, but just as beautiful from the outside.

Massive and grand with great views from top. You can see why this Russian orthodox church took over 40 years to build, it is huge and ornate. From the gold dome to the bronze doors, this place is opulent and meant to be awe inspiring, which it delivers from the first minute you walk up to it. If it is a pretty day go to the top and you will see a great view of the city. Unfortunately it was raining today.
Beautiful building . This is a wonderful place that should not be missed on your tour of St Petersburg. Solemn, remarkable and worth the time to explore outside and in.
largest Russian Orthodox cathedral. The largest Russian Orthodox cathedral (sober) in the city. It is the largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest.dnt miss walking on the roof
Sensory overload. Majestic and impossing from the outside, but completely overwhelming inside. A complete explosion of granite, gold and paintings. Just stunning.

Colourful Cathedral. Large, bright and colourful. Magnificent altar decked in silver and gold. Huge expanse inside but easy to walk around. Gold dome on top is gigantic. Columns are enormous. An architectural triumph. Worth a visit. Didn't get to Colonnade as we visited late in afternoon and it was raining. Expect views would be excellent from the top.
Grandious. Beautiful and awe inspiring. We did not have much time as we were on a city bus tour off a cruise ship....too bad. There is just so much to see in this City.
Monument forever. Beautiful look, nice square, a lot of places to sit around- and definitely very nice inside. Have to look during even short visit to city

An unexpected surprise. We stopped by to go inside, cover your head ladies and men take your has off. There is a winter Church on the ground floor and a summer on the first floor. There was a service going on and the singing was beautiful. When we returned downstairs we were invited into a small room where 5 Priests sang arcapello for us, it was a highlight of tthe visit. There are very important people buried here including the Romanoves who have their own room.

Typical European Cathedral. We visited St. Isaacs as part of a St Petersburg 2 day tour. I found the cathedral to be very typical of what you would find in most parts of Europe. It is much more beautiful on the inside than on the outside. It is certainly worth a visit, but it does not have the spectacular "Wow" factor of the other places we visited in St. Petersburg.
to visite. is necessary to visit this church. but it is not important to go on the top. buy a single ticket to visit only the curch
Another fantastic place to visit. another of St Petersburg Cathedrals now a museum, a must when you are there. We are so lucky that it was saved for the people

embrace it. another must see at St Peter, a lot of history is there and more of peace of mind and peace of soulregardless of which God u pray for,,,,, embrace the place and enjoy the peacelovely, must see

Amazing Views from the Colonnades. Imposing exterior, interior not quite as majestic as some of the other area churches...the view of St. Petersburg from the Colonnades though...priceless...well worth the steps to get there.

Took Longer than 40 Years to Build. From outside, the 21.8 m golden dome that took over 100 kg of gold leaf to coat it, was eye-catching. On the inside, the interior was even more grandiose. No wonder it took over 40 years (1811 - 1858) to build it. Difficult to imagine how it was done then and the thinking behind it. Didn't get the chance to climb up the colonnade (visited in July a few years back). Worth visiting.
stunning views. From the outside it looks a bit grim, but if you climb the many stairs, there is no elevator, you are rewarded with stunning views of saint Petersburg. Try to go on a clear day.

Another great landmark in Saint Petersburg. This cathedral is just near our hotel so we have seen its magnificence each day. Last night we visited it after dinner. Wow! Such a huge expanse inside and such use of rare stone and colourful frescoes. I wanted to take the stairs to the colonnade but it started raining, so this escapade will have to wait another day. The gold coloured dome is gigantic and the columns around the building are impressive. I would recommend this to all visitors to St Petersburg.

One of the biggest Cathedral's in the world. According to our tour guide St. Issac's Cathedral is one of the 5 biggest Cathedrals in the world. There is a lot to see and admire in the Cathedral. Good for history lovers

Superb rooftop views. Beautiful interior but it is the rooftop views that are worth the climb. 218 steps up lead to the roof. It's an easy climb so take your time and enjoy the glory of St Petersburg.

A must in Saint Petersburg. One of the biggest cathedrals of the world. We visited both the museum and the dome at 6pm (tickets are sold from 10am to 5.30pm and from 6pm to 10pm). The dome entrance costs 300 roubles and the museum 400 roubles. There are machines to sell the tickets both next to the ticket office and next to the main entrance. The Dome offers an amazing view of Saint Petersburg, totally worth to visit. There are 110 stairs so no hurry. You need to exit the dome and go back to the street before going inside the museum. The museum is outstanding. The iconography and the bronze doors are beautiful. Malaquite columns are quite impressive as well.
One of the must sees!!!. Apparently this is no longer an active cathedral. However it looks stunning, both inside and out, and should certainly be visited!

The colonnade is worth the trip. If on a rush, it is very recommendable to climb the 262 steps up to the colonnade. Great photos and views of the whole city can be found at the top of this church. The inside of the church (museum, as they call it) is an opulent orthodox church. If you don't have time to visit both this one and the Church on the Spilled Blood, the latter is the better choice. Prices to the colonnade remain the same throughout the day, but the museum does not accept reduced fees for students (ISIC card) and has a higher price from 18h on. Pay attention to the times and try to visit the interiors in the morning and the colonnade a bit before sunset, if possible. Closes on Wednesdays.

Visit the Colonnades for a great view of the city!. St Isaac's is one of the world's largest cathedrals and has excellent mosaic icons and ceiling paintings. The colonnades around the dome of the cathedral (separate entrance ticket required) give excellent 360 degree views of St Petersburg

Beautiful Cathedral!. I think that it is the most beautiful cathedral I have seen till now and it will be pretty hard to top this. The mosaics are absolutely breath taking as are the natural malachite and lazulite columns of the altar. The colors are amazing. After you visit the museum climb the 162 stairs till the base of the dome. you will have a beautiful view of the city. Go and see the cathedral during the night. It is beautifully lit.

THE panoramic view of St Petersburg. Our family had had enough of churches, so we opted to climb the dome to see the view. This panorama of St Petersburg is not to be missed. We enjoyed it especially because we did it the last day, so we were able to identify many of the places where we'd been. If you're not into stairs, though, you might want to skip this one.

Enjoyable Visit with no hassle. Buying tickets is quite easy for these landmarks. We bought the combined ticket for the Cathedral and the panorama viewing platform. It's a shame you have to exit the cathedral and walk all the way around to re enter for the Viewing platform, especially in the pouring rain. Viewing platform is stunning, full 360 views of St Petersburg

Be sure to climb the stairs to the collonade. The views are amazing from there.. You can purchase a ticket separately for the clim, and it is also open after dark if you want to see the city lights from high above. Definitely worth the climb (about 250 steps total) but not for the claustrophobic. The cathedral itself is nice, but less impressive inside than others in St. Petersburg such as the Church on the Spilled Blood or the Kazan Cathedral.

Wow, Impressing. This cathedral is incredible, we visited as part of a tour and were very impressed with the size and the décor of the Cathedral. This is a must see in St Petersburg along with the Church of the Spilled Blood

Very nice . The Cathedral itself was fine, but it's all about the tower, from up there you can literally see the whole city! PS: If you're a student show them your isic card to get the ticket for 159 Rubles instead of 300.

The church with the well seen gold dome.. We were here on a tour and did not have the opportunity to climb the many stairs for the view. The inside of the church is gorgeous, but represents the huge amounts of money spent on its creation. It has mosaics, and huge columns of malachite and lapis lazuli (or a stone related to that). It is definitely worth at least a short visit to take in the excessive ornateness. The exterior is worth gazing at, as well.

Both Colonnade and Interior are must visits. Note the "museum" is the church interior, and the collonnade ticket gives you spectacular views of St Petersburg as well as the cathedral dome and bronze angels. The interior contains first class mosaics on giant easels, in addition to both frescoed and mosaic-adorned walls. Massive solid granite columns inside and out, some incredible marbles and stones no longer mineable on this earth. Stunning cathedral.

Wow! One of the Must See in St Petersberg. This edifice has gone thru at least 3 major wars and many minor ones and revolutions and still stands. The most poignant photo of St Isaac's that I saw inside the church was the field of cabbages in front of the church during the siege. Must ser
marvellous. either inside, up of 260 stairs which you can get the 360 view of city is on of the best memorise of st.petersburg

Impressive Cathedral. We were brought here during a one day tour of St. Petersburg when we stopped on a cruise ship. This cathedral was closed on a Wednesday but they opened it especially for cruise ship tours but none of the shops inside were open. It was lovely to have less people in there than normal and it was very impressive on the inside and outside.

Largest Orthodox Basilica in the World. This basilica has an interesting history. Less than 80 years after it was built, it was turned into a Museum of the History of Religion and Atheism by the Soviet government and the foucault pendulum was put in place as a statement that the earth being flat meant that a god couldn't exist. The museum was removed after the fall of communism but this is a very unusual story for a basilica nevertheless. There are great English explanations of the museum's history and construction itself inside.It's used for worship and other uses now. I was lucky enough to witness a worship service and a wedding on the same day.

Come here for the views!. The views from the colonnade provide one of the best urban panoramas in the world. Had enough of churches and baroque in general and didn't go inside the cathedral on this visit.

Best bit is the Collonade. The inside isn't too bad, but resembles a lot of similar churches in the area. For both this an the colonnade you enter through the front and exit at the rear so if you want to do both you have to walk back around to the front to go again.The view from the colonnade offers a great view over Saint Petersburg.

The Fourth largest dome behind St. Peters, Vatican, St. Pauls, UK, Duomo at Florence. An impressive cathedral with a colonnade that provides a wonderful view of St. Petersburg. Make sure you see the model that shows how the tall columns were wenched up right in the early 19th century.
Interesting place. The Catherdral's central gold dome is one of the largest in the world and covered with 220 pounds of gold. It took more than three decades to complete...

Great views. The museum part of the church is closed on a Tuesday but at 150r you can walk up to to the top for amazing views over the city. On a clear day you pretty much can see the whole city. It is a climb from the ground outside up to the top it is 270 steps, 262 from the entrance, believe me I counted them! Tickets can be purchased from around the side of the church or if you go up the 7 steps at the entrance they have a couple of tickets machines that you can buy the tickets from.
Outstanding Monument. Beautiful church, amazing architecture, outstanding view from the upper colonnade. Must visit. Wednesday is closed.

Amazing views . We didn't visit the cathedral itself. Paid 300 roubles to climb the tower. Be prepared, it's 300 steps to the top. Once you get to the top you are rewarded with an amazing 360 degree view of the city. A definite must do.
Beautiful cathedral. Massive cathedral with good views from the top. Impressive architecture and one of the must-visit sites in St. Petersburg esp. for photography enthusiasts.

Amazing View from the top. I bought the ticket for visiting inside & went upstairs to see the beautiful city view of St. Petersburg. Tips: please wear comfortable shoes as many stairs to go up and very tired.

A cathedral to outshine all cathedrals. Our hotel was just across the street from the cathedral, but it was three days before we finally took the tour. The size, and detail is so astounding. The design, the gold trim, the colossal size is mind-blowing. I have traveled throughout Italy, Spain, and France seeing all their cathedral finery, but St. Issacs tops them all.

Stunning. Stunning. How did they ever manage to turn this monument into an Atheïst Museum? The sheer beaty, the construction, don't miss it. Ticket office is on the opposite side of the entrance, a typical Local habit it appears. The pilars on the western side still show the schrapnel marks from WW2. It was as far as the German guns reached.
Amazing beauty. Would go back for sure as there are so many details to look into! They have free Russian tours starting regularly, which is great, free and very informative!!!
Very beautiful vies of the city.. The climb to the colonnade worth every step. A beautiful view of the city. The catedral is monumental and very impressive, each column seems like a rock.

Stunningly beautiful. Take time to visit this beautiful cathedral. The beauty of the floors, mosaics and stained glass means everywhere you look there is something to appreciate. The external building presents the equally impressive architecture and golden domed centrepiece.

St. Isaac's - inside good, upstairs greater. By "upstairs" I mean the observation deck, which requires a separate ticket and a separate line, but is well worth the cost and/or wait, you get an incredible view of the Neva and the whole city, not to mention a fun walk up a spiral staircase. The interior of St. Isaac's is cool too, but the views from the dome are the best.
Impressive cathedral with interesting history. Buy tickets at kiosk around the back of cathedral, get separate tickets to climb the tower to the colonnade at the same time...great views of the city.
An absolute must.. In the high season booking in advance is the best way to get access without queing for hours. Dazzling interior to view little by little.

Big, be sure to go up. buy the tickets in the automatic machines. Maybe the best church in St. Petersburg. Again buy the tickets in the automatic machines (church and collonnata). From the top you have a nice view of the city.

Great view from the top, but otherwise just another church.. The church, as all others do, has a great history and several claims to fame (including, as I recall, being one of the heaviest in the world - who knew?) Anyway, the inside is indeed beautiful, but Russia has no shortage of beautiful churches. Why go? Well after a small fee and a difficult climb to the top (not recommended for the infirm) there is a half decent view over the city.
Visit at night!. Fantastic views of the city with all the buildings floodlit. Just magical and a great experience! Worth the climb up and spectacular even in the rain!
Interesting. Lovely old church. Again top tourist destination and very crowded. I would say a must see if in St Petersburg. Very interesting ceiling

Massive and Impressive Cathedral. We had the opportunity to visit St. Isaac's in 1977 when St. Petersburg was under Soviet rule. The cathedral at that time had long since been seized from the church, but they used the center dome for a large pendulum used to demonstrate the effect of the Earth's rotation. Still, the cathedral was impressive and memorable.We returned this summer and found the cathedral equally impressive.St. Isaac's is one of the largest cathedrals in the world. Much of the size is due to its great height and the large golden dome. The exterior of part of the dome is currently under renovation, but you can still see most of it and the interior is unaffected.While the size is impressive, its the lavish opulence and artwork that makes it especially amazing. It's almost impossible to list the many intricate and grand details - the enormous dome, pillars made of malachite or lapus lazuli, over 150 murals or paintings, stained glass, marble, gold, etc. Together it is awe-inspiring, but take some time to view just a sample of the many details and they are exquisite as well.You can also tour the tower at an extra cost, with its great views of St. Petersburg, although if you are sensitive to heights this may not be for you.St. Isaac's is one of the most popular attractions in St. Petersburg. It's definitely something you will want to see.

One of the most beautiful buildings in the world. We have visited this beautiful place on the last day of our stay in Saint Petersburg. Saint Petersburg is one of the most beautiful cities in the world and this cathedral is a must must must see. Unbelievable place. We went on observation deck and inside. Simply wow. It was being built for 40 years!!!
Amazing place!. Worth coming to the City to see this and other amazing architecture! Don't think three days will be enough! Make sure you bring an umbrella as it can rain suddenly!

Reminds me of St. Peter's . We visited this lovely cathedral while renovations were being completed. Although some parts were blocked off, there was still a lot to see. There is a great model of how the cathedral was constructed. Having visited many cathedrals in Europe, St. Isaac's was very reminiscent of St. Peter's at the Vatican, however, missing all the lovely statues and embalmed Popes! Another example of how the Russian Royals and aristocracy loved gold and opulence!

Our beacon!. Depending upon where you stay in St. Petersburg, this enormous building can be a beacon, particularly if you are walking much of the city. It sits in the center and if you only ever see the outside that is enough. However, to get inside is wonderful. There is the option to climb the stairs to the top for a birds eye view of all of St. Petersburg, can do during the day or evening (did not do it but wish we had!).

A place for marble enthusiasts. Can have a bit of a crowd - climb to the top is manageable and worth the views. The church itself is a bit of a big empty church with beautiful marble everywhere. If you don't have a tourguide to give you crazy interesting tales, you can breeze through this site rather quickly.
Nice to visit. Recommendes site to visit in St Petersburg. Climbed to the top and gives great views of the city. Nice looking church from the outside.

Amazing Cathedral. Amazing cathedral to check out, but probably not the top attraction in Saint Petersburg if you aren't interested in religion. The ticket office was quite crowded and YOU HAVE TO BUY SEPARATE TICKET TO ACCESS UPSTAIRS!

Symbol of Imperial Russia. St. Isaac’s Cathedral took 40 years to build (1818-1858) but once complete, it became one of the most impressive landmarks in the city and a symbol of Imperial Russia. The cost of construction was as fantastic at 1 mil in gold rubles. St. Isaac’s dome is plated with pure gold and rises 105 m high. The structure rests on 10,000 tree trunks, and the building features 112 granite columns and accommodates around 14,000 visitors. Its interiors are lavishly decorated with mosaics, sculptures and icons. Walk up the colonnade (300 steps only) to enjoy a magnificent view of the city and to stay fit. Photography is permitted.

Celebrated!. Saint Isaac's Cathedral is one of the largest cathedrals in the world. The Russian Orthodox cathedral is dedicated to Saint Isaac of Dalmatia, a patron saint of Peter the Great. Tsar Alexander I ordered the Cathedral to replace an earlier church. The Cathedral took 40 years (1818-1858) to construct.In 1931, the Cathedral became the State Anti-religious Museum. In 1937, the profile of the Museum shifted to “historical and artistic”. In 1990, the first worship service was conducted in the Cathedral. At the present, the church remained primarily as a museum within the “Museum complex premises”. As we visited, we would see it as a museum and the impression of a church fade into history. What a mutilation it had caused when some people injected a crazy Anti-religious Campaign!

Grand. Super crowded a St Petersburg engineering marvel. Exhibits of the architecture and difficulty of building. Beautiful interior, no chairs (supposedly standard in Russian Orthodox churches - you need to suffer for your faith). Lots of marble and pictures of the Holy Family and St Isaac the patron Saint of the Tsar who built the church for the peasants far away from the rich part of town. The front stairs are really steep like tall a real climb for old people or children. Really humid.
Night Visit of Isaac's Cathedral. Unfortunately we din't visit the museum because it is closed at night. But you can go upstairs and admire a magnificent view of St. Petersburg! It was a great night!
Monolith on St Isaac's Square. Visited twiceonce to view the city in the evening from the colonnade.Second time to enter the cathedral itself. A very impressive place and very imperial

Magnificent architecture . We spent around two hours inside this marvelous church. The walls and ceiling are a work of art. Don't miss the dome with the view over the city. Watch out for the 201 stairs to climb to the dome. A must see and take pictures.

Great views, although 260 steps!. Got tickets to the colonnade by accident, having not understood the lady at the ticket booth :) Bit of a shock being confronted with an endless spiral staircase, but....! It was worth it! Nice view of the city and you get a good idea of how St Petersburg is really laid out. It was a little rainy that day but I think on a clear day it would be fantastic! Open late too for nice evening views. Worth a visit!

Loved the dome balcony. Very nice Church, worth the hike up to the top to enjoy the view of Pieter from one of the tallest buildings. There is a separate entrance for the balcony on the dome and for the church.
Wonderful!. Not just a cathedral, it's history, Wonderful, amazing, majestic. We love it.Enjoy your time here.Must see.
Another gem in Russia. This one if the another place of Interest in St . Petersburg. Located not very far from other attractions it is also a place not to be missed.

Great view of the city, marine sky theatre and the bronze horseman. We opted to walk up the dome instead of visiting the interior. The hike up was easy, large wide stairs and you get there sooner than expected. Wonderful views.

Magnificent Dome!. When we pulled up in front of this church, we were awe struck by the magnificent gilded dome which is over 328 feet high and is plated with pure gold. This was an expensive church to build. St. Isaac’s was built in the 19th century by the French architect, Auguste Montferrand. It is one enormous cathedral that features incredibly detailed mosaics, icons, paintings and columns made of malachite and lapis lazuli. It also boasts the most impressive views of the city from its dome (you have to climb 300 steps to see this view). The façade is decorated with sculptures and massive granite columns (made of single pieces of red granite). Within the main altar, there is a large, brightly colored stained glass window of the "Resurrected Christ". We were told the church can accommodate up to 14,000 standing worshipers. Admission Fee – Wheelchair accessible.

Some impressive features. We saw this cathedral, along with the Church on Spilled Blood and Kazan cathedral on the same tour. This was, for me, the most impressive of the three, with magnificent bronze doors, enormous columns of malachite and lapis lazuli, a glorious set of doors to the Sanctuary. Despite all the religious art etc it still doesn't have that church-like feel, probably because it became a museum in Soviet times, and whilst there are now religious services in part of it, it feels more like a tourist attraction than a place of spirituality.
Historical. Historical place... Good for taking pictures... Evening is the best time... Sunset time... At good location with many other sight seeing around.... Sometimes tooo much crowd
Great view from the roof colonnade. Beautiful building and the view from its top. You can see most of the city there. Price is growing after 5 PM.

Dominates the skyline.. This is the church whose golden dome dominates the St Petersburg skyline and was built between 1818 and 1858, our guide told us, in a fusion of architectural styles. It is the fourth church of St Isaac to be built in St Petersburg, mainly because Peter the Great was born on the Saint's day. Alexander 1 ordered this fourth construction and 7000 people attended the consecration. The interior is decorated with oil paintings and some mosaics but the plan for much more ornate decoration came to a halt when the Church of the Spilt Blood was begun. The huge columns weigh 114 tons each and are held in place by gravity alone. The icon columns are of bronze and malachite and the dove, 100 meters up, is finished in silver. Although it is now a museum, some services are held in a side chapel. Again there were many people here but it was not such a scrum as in the Church of the Spilt Blood. Perhaps because this church can accommdate 14,000 people standing. As we were on a tour, we did not have time to climb the 300 steps up to the colonnade for views over the city.

St Isaac's Cathedral. Absolutely stunning outside and inside, our hotel room overlooked this great building! Certainly worth visiting inside breathtakingIf your brave enough you can walk up the outside ladder to the dome !! Gets very busy nothing in English and none speaks English.

Sunset in St Petersburg - from St Issac Catherdral Colonnade. Not only the grandeur of the interior and the architecture of St Isaac's Cathedral worth seeing, the walk-around of the colonnade with the complete view of St Petersburg is very much spirit lifting. I recommend the visit to the colonnade during sunset, the lustrous reflection of the sunset on the buildings of St Petersburg might enhance your vision of the imperial city over a hundred years ago.

Pretty but go careful. This place doesn't open till 11 so we didn't get to see inside. The outside is lovely and it's close to the water and also next to a lovely park with fountain. We were advised by our guide to not use the public toilets as they aren't safe. By the park there were lots of people sleeping on the benches who were clearly hungover from drugs or drink. Definitely not one for solo travellers.
St Isaac's. We were lucky to visit this twice, despite the weather. Magnificent stonework inside. Also, look for the beautifully crafted models inside of the church.

A very large church with one of the biggest domes in the world. This church has the reputation for having one of the largest domes in the world, behind St Peters in Rome and a few other large distinguished churches.The inside is now a issue with a massive iconostasis with the scene of the Resurrection behind. A visit would take at least an hour to take in all the signts
Colossal. Magnificensce of this architechtural masterpiece admires me all the time i pass it by or have the luck entering itHistory carved in marble and stilled at IconsFeel the Power of this place
Grand and interesting. One of the key sights in St Petersburg. Interior is interesting and worth seeing but I also recommend taking a relatively easy walk to the top for a good view over the city.
Worth a visit. The cathedral is very large and not very interesting from the outside however the interior is quite impressive with many separate areas to view within the main church.

Massive Gold Dome. Right now they are doing maintenance work on the great dome, so unfortunately your pictures will have scaffolding in them. I wish I had had more time because the climb up to the colonnade looks fun. And I hear the view is great.
Class apart. Just visit for class interior, and view from top, Kiosks are available for ticket but please note that the kiosks are not supporting credit card which are not having 4 digit pin.

The ceilings.... As with all the attractions in St. Petersburg, this church does not disappoint. The building itself is s work of art. As with everyplace we visited, the ceiling hols amazing paintings. Don't forget to look up.

Absolutely astounding!. What a wonderful place! I have visited this place over a period of more than 40 years. Soviet, Perestroika times and recently. It had been restored to a fully functional Christian worship place - thank God for that! The exterior and architecture are very impressive. The Cathedral fits nicely in the landscape, which is just by the Neva river. However, it doesn't compare to the beauty and splendor of the interior which richly illustrates Christian faith. An absolutely must-see for anyone visiting St. Petersburg!

Extraordinary doors. The black doors are in fact brass on wood and weigh tons. Much renovation in evidence but as with other churches in St petersburg fascinating on all levels...history, art, religion.
Prayers. We loved the fact that people are waiting in line to see the Icon and pray. Very big and impressive. Kutuzov is barried there, and he is the hero here
Amazing church, the pride of St Petersburg. Frescos look down upon you from vaulted ceilings that soar to heaven, mosaics and terrazzzo floors mute the footsteps of hundreds and thousands.

Another Cathedral But worth the time. St Issac's with the golden dome stands out from most other churches in the area. very popular with locals and visitors it offers much more then be a cathedral. it has history

Absolutely beautiful Cathedral. One of the places that I would say are "must visit". Astonishing architecture, and breath taking interior. From the colonnade you will have beautiful view on the whole St. Petersburg.
Can't stop visiting such a lovely place. I'm in love with St.Petersburg such a historical city and one of my favourite place is Isaacs Cathedral. Will highly recommend.
Absolutely awesome!. Very beautiful Cathedral State Museum Memorial. Filled out by the history! Absolutelylove this place!

Astonishing. If you think that the outide is amazing you'll be astonished by the interior. I don't think I've ever seen so much gold in a single place. Once entered you don't know where to look because of it's size.Personally I would like to stay inside for a week to see all the ditails of the ceiling and of the walls.Paying an additional ticket you can visit the colonnade and see the city from a different point of view.The only defect is that the entrance and the exit are on two different sides of te church, so you have to walk all around it twice if you want to see also the colonnade.

Beautiful Cathedral. The expression "built to the glory of God" is brought home by the power of this cathedral. Except for the oppressive and ubiquitous Chinese tourists taking selfies of themselves with everything religious the facility was lovely.

Amazing and Intimidating. The dome of St. Isaac's Cathedral dominates the skyline of St. Petersburg and its gold-gilded cupola can be seen glistening from all over the city even from the outlying and more remote locations of the city.The church itself is an architectural marvel and intended to be the main church of the Russian Empire. Auguste Montferrand, an outstanding French architect, built it. It is the 4th largest cathedral in the world after St. Peter’s in Rome, St. Paul’s in London, and Santa Maria del Fiore in Florence.The columns are amazing and intimidating. They are made of single pieces of red granite and weigh 80 tons each. Inside the church, many of the icons were created using mosaic techniques and the iconostasis (a wall that separates the altar from the rest of the church) is decorated with 8 malachite and 2 lapis lazuli columns. The cathedral can accommodate 14,000 worshipers, but now it primarily a museum and services are held only on significant ecclesiastical holidays.In St. Isaac’s Square, you will see the sculpture in honor of Nicholas I.
