The sculptor Piotr Klodt was the architect and he was so precise in his calculations that there are only 2 points of support for the mounting of the horse.
Not your typical Russian cathedral. Western style cathedral, one of St Petersburg highlights. A masterpiece of workmanship and engineering.

Little St. Peter's. If you only have time to see one Cathedral in St. Petersburg, this is the one to see. Quite amazing are the 56 solid granite columns that adorn the four points of the compass, each weighing 114 tons. Although not nearly as large as St. Peters Basilica in Rome, the soaring sense of volume is very much the same. The interior is fabulous with murals, statuary, and gilded details everywhere. For example the mural depicting the Last Supper is, if I remember correctly, 24 m2. Also there is a model of the scaffolding used to erect the enormous columns which were installed first with the cathedral built around them. This was a surprise to us and was one of the highlights of our visit.

A St. Petersburg must see. St. Isaac's Cathedral was built by Peter I and cost more than ten times the price of building the Winter Palace. There are over 400 paintings, sculptures and mosaics inside and the interior can accommodate up to 14,000 people. The cathedral is huge and can be seen from a distance of 25 miles (40 kilometers) on a clear day.

Another must see in St Petersburg. The entrance is marked by the great columns and the decorations inside are incredible and well worth a visit. There are lots of large well preserved mosaics. You will not be disappointed.
Opulence. A must visit. You will be blown away by the sheer opulenceof this Cathedral. Have a good look at the mosaics

Great place to visit. I totally recommend visiting it because it is possible to see what happened with a beautiful chrurch and how it was transformed into a museum. Interesting story of church is displayed on panels. Amazing interior.

The world's largest Orthodox Basilica. There are separate entrances to the Cathedral and the viewing dome (the Colonnade) so be sure to ask if you want to see both (and you definitely should). It is the world's largest Orthodox Basilica and is exquisite inside with awe-inspiring, breath-taking views wherever you look. The Malachite columns have to be seen to be believed. It is a Museum with some signs of active worship returning. Photography is allowed. The views of the city from the Colonnade are incredible - it is the tallest structure in the city after all. There are 262 winding stone steps to get up there but unlike St Paul's in London, there is one way for up and one way for down so you aren't struggling past people coming the other way. The perfect way to orientate yourself with the entire city spread out below you. A must see.

Gorgeous Cathedral. A must see site and a must have photograph if you are getting married (we saw at least 3 wedding parties come and go within 20 minutes), this is beautifully architected building with a magnificent gold come on top. This is a must see landmark.
Old Cathedral. Old and nice cathedral with full of history and artifacts. The architectural design is amazing. It's one of the best tourist spots.

Different things to watch.... As impressive as the interior with all its imagery and golden splendour is, it seems to play into the hands who probably have not visited it for religious purposes.Our visit was cut short by the fact that one of our tour members was practically swarmed by pick-pockets roaming around the cathedral, ambushing the many tourists. A typical ploy is to offer something for sale, like a calendar, and as the victim pulls out the wallet or feels for it, make it disappear... Extreme warning: the numbers make it very intimidating to protect yourself... stay in groups and DO NOT REVEAL WHERE YOUR WALLET IS! Do not buy or show interest in buying around this site, is my advice. Even the overpowering beauty of the interior of this church will not return your lost goods to you...
Dominating famous church in the city center.. Must see. Be aware of long lines. Perhaps best to visit together with tour groups. You can tour the top of the dome if you want.

great view. the most striking thing about this cathedral is its great view form the road in front.it is located on a very busy square,with loads of tourists.the cathedral itself has very good architecture.

A magnificent very high Cathedral, with splendid marbel arches and wall paintings. There are lines outside to buy tickets, at least in the summer time (you can buy tickets to the museum and to the observatory at the same place), but the view inside is really astonishing - you can't understand how it was decorated and painted so high...everything there is very invested, decoration and paintings are marvelous - it's definitely the most beautiful cathedral in Saint Petersburg
Awesome!. Overwhelming inside with the size, mosaics and icons. Was an active church, but now a museum with a small space for worshippers. 3 rd time in St Petersburg and happy to see it again.
very well perserved. Very nice looking on the outside and so warm and inviting once your inside. We skipped the line up with our guided tour and we were so very impressed

Golden dome one of St Petersburg's iconic sights. This is definitely a grand Russian Orthodox cathedral and a landmark sight in St Petersburg, a must-see while you are there. Before you even go in you are struck by the magnificent golden dome and the grand facade with sweeping granite steps, columns and impressive sculptures. Inside it is an enormous space filled with visual delights - mosaics, iconostatis, malachite columns and stained glass. Wow. Recommended. Note: If you look carefully you can see shell holes in some of the columns outside the cathedral.

Another stunning edifice.. The beauty of the interior is stunning and well worth a visit as it's less than10 minutes walk from Nevsky Prospekt. The view from outside is also great and reminiscent of the Capitol building/St Paul's cathedral. Entrance tickets can be purchased from machines outside @ 250 R.

Gorgeous.... I was truly amazed at all the beautiful places and things to see in St. Petersburg and this Cathedral was no exception. It is well worth checking out, and take note of the dome that is covered in gold.

Overwhelming architecture . It is a must see. The whole area is cheerful and amazing. There is a garden In front of the church where you can sit and watch all the lovely details of the church. It is very crowded so be careful of pickpockets. If you have a knee problem be careful in climbing up and down the stairs.

Big and top view. The church is beautiful and enormous as most things in Russia. Don't be lost like me and pay to go up and enjoy a nice view of the city, I think it must be wonderful but I only saw the top part when I was leaving.

A fascinating insight into the Orthodox faith. Inside and out it is of its period and not to the taste of all. However, I was lucky enough to catch a service (they are held occasionally in what is essentially a museum) with magnificent singing, the iconostasis was open and the Russian devotion to icons was well in evidence. Very moving.

St. Issac Meets Peter the Great. The Church of StIssac is one of the dominant churches in St. Petersburg Catherine the Great erected a statue to Peter to help solidify her position. (photo below) The church demanded the statue face the church which meant a minor royal palace faced the rear of the horse. The church won out. Beautiful view from a nearby bridge.

What a massively spectacular Cathedral!. We were absolutely amazed at the size and beauty of this Cathedral! For those who think that there are no churches in Russia...you are so wrong! This was such a gorgeous church - beautiful inside and out! If you go to St. Petersburg - this is a must see site!
Disappointing. The church itself was nothing special, not really worth going inside. The view from the gallery on the dome was quite nice, and definitely best enjoyed on a sunny day!

Worth to go to the colonnade. The St. Isaac's Cathedral is very beautiful and can be visited in 15-20 min + tickets.
Thus the colonnade is worth to visit. Beautiful 360 view on the city. Not that hard to climb even for not that fit people (easier than the Notre-Dame de Paris) at least seemed so. Around 180 stares and rather wide.

Majestic. There is a part inside where they still perform service and it was the most interesting part for me. Architecture inside is grand, imperial, rich and gold everywhere. Nice view from the top, but very crowded and it is a challenge to get a nice photo if that is your reason for climbing.
Impressive. Gigantic church in the heart of St Petersburg. Again I would use SPB tours to get you to/from and give you the walking tour.
Impressive. Gigantic church in the heart of St Petersburg. Again I would use SPB tours to get you to/from and give you the walking tour.
Churches. Immensity of scale. The foundation engineering alone to build this structure is incredible, let alone the art work and embellishment that adorns it surfaces

Must see cathedral . Definitely a world-class Cathedral. Tremendous art in every inch of the inside and floor. It is absolutely beautiful and quite stunning. If you're anywhere near I would highly recommend it. And a quick trip up to the colonnade for the view of St. Petersburg is exceptional. Get the combined ticket when you first purchase it and you're good to go. Only 400 rubles for both
See SPB from the air. When you visit this beautiful church make sure to pay the extra to walk around the colonnade from which you will get a 360 degree view of SPB.

Spectacular. My wife did not go into this one as she was tired from a long day and this was our last stop. This was absolutely spectacular and not what I expected. The site is one big room with a numb of alcoves etc. Truly wonderful. Be very careful though re pickpockets. One member of our group was feeling a it tired and went outside to rest. He lost his iPhone. Apart from that, pick pocketing is going to be a problem anywhere in Europe but don't let that stop you from seeing what you should see. St Isaacs is one of those sites.

Magnificent. As you near this cathedral the exterior seems massive. Once inside the beauty of the interior dome dwarfs the view of the outside. We didn't spend as much time here as we did some of the other cathedrals but it is no less spectacular. It is easier to do this one without a guide than the otheers.

St Petersburg. This is a hugh cathedral, the dome can be seen for miles. The inside is also hugh, lots of history Its not a bad idea to do some homework on the buildings such as this, as there is so much to take in on one visit.
Amazing building. Entrance fee, small waiting line, but absolutely worth seeing! Amazing architecture and structural design in order to build it on such soil.

On of the must-see pleaces!. Exterior and interior of this increddible church is splendid. We were not able to go up on the dome beacuse of the wind but still the iside was great to study. But it was crouded during the day.

Must See in St Petersburg. So much history in one place. Burial place of Peter the Great through Nicholas II. The cathedral itself is very ornate and beautiful. Very busy with Tourists but everyone was very willing to give up there place so the next person could get close to the tombs. Russian history to be seen.

Superb!. The exterior dome was under cover (maintenance it seems) when we toured the cathedral, so getting that perfect shot in spite of the beautiful day would not happen. I really loved the interior of the cathedral, in some ways more than the Church of Spilled Blood with the mosaics. I don't believe there were any mosaics at St. Isaac's but just incredible architecture inside. St. Isaac's was the most crowded I've ever seen and literally elbow to elbow around 3:00 pm. Our guide advised us of pick-pocketers, so everything from my pockets went into zipped and then snapped and carried over the shoulder camera bag. We had no issues. We highly recommend this Cathedral. It was very beautiful even in the crowds.

Great historical cathedral. Great atmosphere but better after tours have finished around five thirty pm the quietness and finesse of the art which can tell it's own story if you have time to look at it

Top City View. Now more a museum than a church (allowing inside photography without hassle), there are many worthwhile views inside of the dome and icons..... but after you've visited a number of Russian churches, you tend to get overwhelmed and they begin to "blend" together. But, one unique feature of iconic St. Isaac's taking the winding staircase to get incredible views of St. Petersburg. It's not far from the Winter Palace, so this is THE venue to get your best photo of the city's most famous landmark.Separate entry fees are required for the outside view from the dome and to go inside the cathedral, so get both tickets at the booth.

Good site for getting perspective on the city . There are two separate tickets for this - 'museum' which is the former church interior and cupola. I didn't see a combined option. Beware - someone made a rather amateur attempt at pick pocketing while buying tickets. Views from the cupola are great - well worth the 200+ step climb. The area seemed under construction so perhaps there will be more room to move on the roof when that's complete. Church/museum is spacious - much more so than is typical for orthodox style churches typicallyEssential stop for a visit to St Petersburg

You can feel the Omega Waves. St. Isaac’s Cathedral looks more like a government building than a cathedral with its classic Greek marble columns and colossal gold dome. The humble exterior barely hints at the rich interior lying behind its doors. Walking inside, the overwhelming nature of the cathedral is instantly evident. The sheer size leaves an unforgettable impression. Gold is in abundant use throughout. Your eyes are first drawn to the lower stone walls of marble and granite void of icons, then upwards towards the mosaic icons and murals climaxing at the main dome with its vibrant fresco and at the center of the cupola hangs a silver pigeon representing the Holy Spirit. Just as impressive, the incredibly beautiful altar with a huge stained-glass portrait of Christ framed by two massive golden doors and 10 malachite and 2 lazurite columns dividing the portraits of holy figures lining the wall. Bathed in soft radiant light, the interior inspires reverence and contemplation. My husband loved this Church. He kept asking me if I couldn't just feel the omega waves radiating.
Great Cathedral with wonderful views.. To spare the line, the tickets for the colonnade could be bought for 150rub at the automatic machines.
Incredible art and iconography. Worth the wait and the crowds! This cathedral is spectacular in its art and icons, and is a must-visit for anyone to St. Petersburg.

Couldn't go in! But so pretty! . We were not able to go in because they were having a special service when we were there. However, I suggest you at least do a drive by of it because it's beautiful to see.
Stunning!. This is absolutely beautiful inside. Make sure you look up in the dome to see the gold covered statues of the 12 angels and intricate artwork.

Use the ticket vending machines!. I felt sorry for all the people who stayed long in the queue under the rain, while the machines just did the job without any queue.Massive volumes inside and outside, but not a “must visit”. We only did a quick tour inside. Not much to see unless you a good guide (book or staff) to provide explanation.

Good finale of our tour. After two full days of touring St Petersburg from Pushkin to PeterHof, we were running out of energy when our guide Natasha from TJ Travel announced one last attraction, St Isaacs so off we went. A very good choice to end the Tour.

Another cathedral. If you like churches and cathedrals this place will impress you. After having done many others including the Vatican they do get a bit much the same to me. However it is certainly well maintained and is a magnificent example of the architecture of the time and I still marvel at how these great structures were constructed without mechanical aids. The frescos and ornate carvings are incredible and you also have to remember that during WW2 St Petersburg (Leningrad ) went through massive destruction and as the same with Peterhof the restoration work carried out is first class. If you have the legs for it the climb to the top of the building is worth a look but to be honest it not such a great skyline as can be seen of other city's. As I said worth a look but if you have travelled a lot you wont be awed and if its a busy day you will be ducking selfie sticks as you negotiate the narrow walkway.
Photo Shoot. Stopped only for photo shoot of this impressive building. Unfortunately did not have time too enter which is a shame.

Fourth largest dome church in the world. Its gold dome (101.5 m high) stands prominently in St. Petersburg skyline. The 112 single block red granite columns further enhance its tremendous size. This is the 4th largest dome church after St. Peters in Rome, St Paul’s Church in London and Duomo in Florence. Equally impressive is its interior of the main dome, four smaller domes, mosaic painting on the wall and all the reliefs and sculptures. The stain glass “Resurrected Christ” is right behind the altar.Due to its immense size, you need to take photo from far away. The best will be from the St. Isaac Square. When you are there, you will see Monument to Nicholas I. This is said to be the only horse statue standing on 2 legs only.This is another must-see in St. Petersburg.

Wow!. Incredibly beautiful museum/church. The outside columns are massive. Inside, the walls and ceiling are covered with beautiful mosaics. Their is also a display on how this magnificent structure was built. Not to be missed.

My personal highlight. We visited as the first stop on a tour and the inside was just "wow"! - and then we climbed the 219 steps to the 360 degree viewing colonnade. It was simply fantastic viewing the skyline of the city and a dream for a photo enthusiast (whether amateur or pretend pro). We loved seeing everything in perspective and understanding how the city was put together - which made the rest of our tour and our visit even more memorable.

Gorgeous cathedral. We visited this cathedral as part of our SPB tour and it was a stunning example of the architecture and mosaic art during the era in which it was built. The huge mosaics on the walls and the domes of the cathedral portray many religious scenes that may have been wasted on me as a non-Christian, but I had no difficulty standing in awe and admiration of the pure beauty and magnitude of the art. The beauty is inside as well as outside. The exterior of the dome is currently being refurbished but it doesn't take away from the overall beauty. As with all sites in St. Petersburg, you really need to join an organized group with an outstanding tour guides fully appreciate the art, history, and religious significance of these amazing structures.

Fascinating church . A huge church outside and in. Climb the 201 steps to the balcony and you will have a treat with panoramic views of the city, river and canals and landmarks. The park across the street is nice we saw mNy brides taking pictures in Saturday afternoon. It seems like a local favorite for back ground in wedding photos. It is really beautiful.

Be prepared for the masses (and that's not services!). What a magnificent cathedral! Opened in 1858 as the center of worship in St. Petersburg, then made into a storage facility during the Soviet rule. It has since been restored to it's full magnificence. Many treasures of art and religious icons. The Alexander Nevsky Chapel is stunning.There is an admission fee. Photos are allowed without flash.

Big and famous church / cathedral. I'm not really religious person, but this church was quite amazing. One of the "must see" in St. Peter. Ask for audio guide in your language. Really popular, prepare for few hundred other people =)

Beautiful cathedral. ALthough it does not rival the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood and situated on the opposite side o the church, St. Isaac's Cathedral is definetely worth a visit. The entrance is for free and the cathedral is huge. Even though, expect to find many visitors inside.
Private Tour 4 couples with Ivan of Tailored Tours. The inside of the church was spectacularly gold guilded with beautiful paintings, rich architecture and of great historical signifigance.

No.3 Cathedral in the world (following St Peters in Rome and St Pauls in London.. Apparently there is 12 tonnes of gold-leaf employed in the decoration. The gold-plate to the domes is by a, now outlawed, mercury displacement method, but has stood the test of time.
massive church. massive church but interior not as interesting as the Church of Our Saviour on the Spilled Blood. go early in the day to limit the queuing time for tickets.

As impressive as st-Peter. Only one word comes to your mind when entering st-Issac's....wow! I found this church to be more beautiful than St-Peter in Rome. It is spectacular, colourful and magnificent. A must see.

Impressive even if you've been to many cathedrals. This one requires a private or small group guide to appreciate. Russian history is fascinating and this church has seen a lot of it. Landmark domes can be seen from all over St Petersburg.

A walk to the top a must!. An impressive church/museum that is on the tourist route. Don't worry about lining up for tickets at ticket office just go through entrance gate and there are ticket machines in English, quick and easy. Walking up the 260 steps to the copula is well worth it, great view of the city.

Wonderful view from a roof and should be your first visit. When you buy your ticket don't Forget to ask to have also the roof visit(tourelle) and you will have 200 steps to reach it. You will get 360° view on the city and all the possibilities of visit during your stay. Inside the church you will find beautiful different marble.

Absolutely immpressive. The first I did in St Petersburg was visiting St Isaac's. The Church of the Savior on Blood is probably the most famous one from the outside, whereas the Sankt Isaac’s Cathedral is the most impressive from the inside with its giant dome from which you have a stunning 360 degree view over the entire city, its canals and the shipyards.Check out my blogpost for more pictures and insiders tipps :) http://franie-travels.com/2016/03/04/church-hopping-in-st-petersburg-russia-franie-travels

Not to be missed. This imposing building captures you as soon as you get through the huge door. Take time to enjoy it. Stop and pause when a crowd stands in front of you, there are many groups on a whistle stop look and a bit of patience will find you with room to take it all in.
Beautiful Cathedral!. You will marvel at the beauty inside. It is the 4th largest Cathedral in the world! Gorgeous mosaics and gold
amazing cathedral with nice viewpoint. Plan 1-1.5 hour for visiting the cathedral. A lot to listen and remember and capture. The viewpoint has wonderful view to the city.

Amazing *****. Not a great lover of churches and cathedrals, but this one is a must see. Took 40 years to build, and it is easy to see why.
Camera is a must, but no flash!,
Stunning.

Do not miss. If churches and cathedrals float your boat then St. Isaac's is a 'must see'; unfortunately, when my wife and I went the weather was very poor and the colonnade was closed so we didn't get to climb the 200+ steps for r what must be a spectacular view. I would go again to make the climb. Certainly worth a visit and, like everything in St. Petersbug, inexpensive for 'western Europeans' and absolute buttons for any Londoner
Orthodox Church. Greatly built orthodox church. Entrance is free, photo taking is allowed. Gives the idea of how it was like at the past.

St. Isaac's Cathedral Museum. St. Isaac's Cathedral s manly a museum. Entrance fee is required and because of what it is and where it is makes this a very popular attraction. Once inside, be prepared to be wowed! The Icons are beautiful and are still n use today, please be respectful to those who are praying to their Icon. Where ever you loo, there are mosaics, Icons and pictures, from floor to ceiling, there is beauty to be seen and because it is a museum, they allow photography, I took well over 200 pictures when I was there, Stand under the dome and loo up, even more artwork. Like other Cathedrals, there are dome tours, where you are able to go outside and see St. Petersburg from a panoramic perspective, great if you like heights, definitely not for the faint hearted. Well worth a visit and no matter how many times you visit this building, you will see something new!
Another 5 star gem. Wow this city has highlights, this was the last one we visited and I didn't expect it to be so majestic.Note - be careful a member of our group had his iphone robbed here.

Awesome view over St. Petersburg and nice inside. One of the favorite spots in St. Petersburg is definitely this Cathedral. Not only it's amazing from the inside but you can get a nice view on the top over St. Petersburg as well. During approx. Jun 1-Aug 1 (not 100% sure what the exact dates were) the walkway on top of the Cathedral is open until 4 am so you can get a nice view at night or during sunrise. You should go there twice, during daylight and during night time as you cannot get the great view of St. Petersburg during the night.
Definitely go all the way up. What a beautiful cathedral with a wonderful history. It took 40 years to build this place! I barely have the patience for my website to load.
another fabulous building. try to go early as this place is very popular and fills up quickly with more tourists. one of the best places to visit along with dozens of others.

Beautiful Old Orthodox Church. While it is not as colorful and dynamic as the Church of the Savior on Blood, it is still majestic and beautiful. Too bad it remains a museum and has not been restored to its proper and original use.We enjoyed the view from the colonnade level. Be sure you are in comfortable shoes and are ready to walk up 200+ steps. Most of the steps have a low amplitude, only the last 50 or so are normally spaced.

Impressive cathedral. This massive cathedral dominating the St. Petersburg skyline is located in St. Isaac’s Square. I didn’t manage to go in and have a look (entrance fee required) as it was closed; don’t make the same mistake as I did by going on a Wednesday! It’s their off day then.
Amazing. Loved it and because it is now a museum the alta doors are open to reveal a beautiful stained glass image of Jesus christ

another mighily impressive building in St Petersburg worth seeing 3rd only to St Pauls Cathedral and another one I. very impressive structure with pillars that look like they will stand for ever. Supposed to hold thousands inside
The highest point of St. Petersburg. A must see place in the city for history and art lovers. The architecture is unique and important for the time it was constructed.

Impressive views from the top, climb it at night. This is a monumental building which still serves as a church only during important Orthodox feasts and celebrations. There are two separate entrance fees, granting access to the museum (the interior of the building) and to the impressive cupola which offers great views over St. Petersburg.During the White Nights (summer months) the cupola is open until 4 am, so do it then.
Amazing Architecture. Mesmerized the second time i came here after almost 15 years. This is a definite place to visit once u are in St. Petersburg.

A dignified cathedral.. We had been to this cathedral before but had been unable to get inside it. We had gone up to the gold dome and had see the spectacular views of the city from there - and that alone is worth the visit. But the inside took us by surprise. The outside is grand and dignified, with strong pillars and sculptures, and carved scenes on the gables. The huge doors have religious sculptures and carvings all over them, both inside and outside. And the inside of the church is virtually completely covered in religious paintings. There are side chapels, at least two large mosaics, a dove in the centre of the dome. Wherever you look, each view is different. The building is now seen as a museum, but it was clearly built and decorated as a very grand church.

Best skyline view of St.Petersburg. One can walk almost on the very top of the building. Magnificent views of St. Petersburg. Inside there is a museum of the history of this Church as well as special exhibition devoted to the Romanovs. To fully understand the significance of this place it is better to prior read about the Cathedral or have a guide.

Beautiful Cathedral !! Exquisite Architecture !!. This cathedral is amazing in its sheer size, design and detailing.... from the outside as well as from inside !!!It was pretty crowded when we went, try not to go at a very crowded time of the day.its very tempting to take lots of pictures but before you do that, i would suggest you soak in the sights, sounds and feel of the place. Avoid talking too much and just get a feel of the place.Walk around the cathedral, light a candle maybe and then you can take some pictures before you leave but the beauty of this place is in quietening the mind and experiencing its energy!

Just another church? I don't think so!. Our guide joked about the ABC tour, Another Bloody Church! This cathedral is worth a visit to see the mosaics, sculptures and lapis lazuli and malachite columns.

the best best part of your travel. It was about 1h from our hotel . The road had good view but when you rich the palace you face with a luxury view that never be forget.It has 3 garden , golden statues, a fountain that ends in finland golf. English garden is so amasing . Better spend time there one day belive me it worths. Outside the palase there is a bazar which you can buy many good price souvenir. Forget all markets at city!!! It is the best trade.

Don't skip the Collonade. The interior of the church is amazing, the ceilings, the altar the walls, the floors are all a masterpiece.The highlight of the church is the Collonade , it's a 220 stairs climb but well worth the effort. The view of the city once you get there is breathtaking with all the churches , the spires and the rivers laid out.

Amazing Cathedral!!!. I visited it everyday during my short stay at the city! The priests are always there. The spiritual atmosphere is great! Also the church has a small shop, where we can buy so many art crafts which fit to all pockets.
Exquisite Cathedral. This cathedral is absolutely jaw dropping. It's shear beauty and history is a must see when visiting St. Petersburg. Our pictures don't do it justice.
Beautiful.. Unfortunately, we did not have enough time to go inside, but the outside facade with its great golden dome was highly photogenic.

Second to spilled blood cathedral but it is a must stop. We were lucky to avoid the crowds with our guide, got us through the massive crowds. It is very historical and understanding it's importance in Russian 's culture a must visit
Climb the steps!. Be sure to climb the steps (a separate ticket) to the top for panoramic views of the city! It is worth it!

Nice trip, nothing special.. It is nice to spend an hour or so here, but the audioguide we took was of extremely poor quality and it took us longer to decipher what the recording was saying than actually visiting the church. We much preferred the Church on Spilled Blood as it was more interesting, but since st Isaac is one of the main sites in St Petersburg, it is good to have a look.
St Petersburg. Well worth a visit. Magnificent outside and inside. The history of the place during WWII is very interesting.

Better than expected . After 2 days of touring SPB I was not looking forward to another church, but this surprised me. It was far more beautiful inside than expected. This is a working church so be respectful of worshippers coming in, if you're lucky you may get treated to a choir like we did :)
Amazing!. I have been there twice. Last time when I was 15 and year 2016. Nothing changed over the years. The only difference that back then it as not so crowded.Classics are classics!

Beautiful cathedral, amazing views of St. Petersburg. St. Isaac's is a big and lovely cathedral right in the middle of St. Petersburg. It's maybe a 10 minute walk from the Winter Palace. Lots of people visit, so there is a long line even if you get there when the place opens for the day. Be sure to buy tickets to climb up to the roof! The interior of the cathedral is opulent and beautiful, with lots of booths where you can buy souvenirs. But our favorite part was climbing the stairs (I don't remember an elevator) to the observation deck on the roof. The entrance to the stairs is outside the cathedral, but it's well marked so you'll find it. It was a gorgeous day for us and the view could not be beat. Walking around the outside of the dome gave you a 360 degree view of the city. Fantastic!
Wanderful Cathedral. Wanderful Cathedral you have to wisit.So shin, so bright, so colorful and so big, with a lot of gold and beautiful frescoes.

beautiful inside and out. the cathedral is widely visible from almost everywhere in St Petersburg, so it's easy to find. A lot of tour-buses outside as it is on every tourists must-see list - with good reason. As it is considered a museum rather than a church, you can take photographs inside.

Go all the way to the top. Another nice attraction. Be dazzled by the interior, see the hand-craftmanship and be amazed of the level of details. When you are done, take the long walk up the stairs all the way to the dome. Here you will get a breathtaking view of St.Petersburg.

A must see . You may want to consider visiting this cathedral even if you have seen all the Cathedrals in world . I try to avoid redundancy but St. Isaac's is the 4th largest cathedral in the world but more importantly the world largest orthodox Basilica. This cathedral also survived the German invasion during the Second World War . There are remnants on the exterior columns from the front lines . As Saint Petersburg lost power during the war the cathedral was painted in green to camouflage the building from the there early . It's best to get there early . Otherwise you'll be entrapped with the crowds from the cruise
City view from the tower. Buy a ticket to the tower. The stairway is ca 200 steps. From the tower of St Isaac's Cathedral you will have a great view over the city.

great cathedral to see absolutely!. One of the most beautiful churches in St. Petersburg.Designed by the architect Montferrand, it has many frescoes inside the dome and walls; There are also several mosaics which have replaced the frescoes because more resistant in time.You can visit the inside (also with audio guide in Italian) of the church and also climb the 262 steps to enjoy the panoramic view from the 43 meters high.low entry costs (150 rubles for the panoramic visit and about 350 for the interior).Must see

Wonderful inside and fantastic walking around the rooftop. The cathedral is pretty special inside with wonderful mosaic's and the large stained glass window is brilliant. If you are up to it the 300 steps up to the top of the columns enabling you walk around the roofline of the cathedral is particularly neat and will give you awesome views of the city. The view of the cathedral during the 'white nights' period is neat.

Largest orthodox cathedral. Unassuming on the outside, richly decorated inside. It is the largest orthodox cathedral and both museum and functioning church. The floors and walls are decorated with rich marble and granite from all parts of Russia. Very beautiful.

Totally Fantastic inside. A must see no trip will be complete without a visit to this Museum
Beautiful artefacts lots of history

The inside is pretty splendid but the view from the roof top was even better. I had been inside this orthodox basilica before but had not climbed to the outside terrace before. If you are physically able to take this walk up I recommend it. The views from there are pretty.

Impressive. This is an impressive building any way you want to look at it. We have seen numerous "churches" and "cathedrals" all over Europe and beyond, and this stands out as one of the better ones. Great architecture, inside and out, beautiful paintings/icons, fantastic looks, great history.
Very Beautiful. This was a very beautiful cathedral. it was crowded but well worth seeing. It was an interesting look into the history of the church in Russia.

Well worth a visit. At times, I feel "churched" out on long European trips but I still enjoyed visiting St Isaac's.
It is the largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest (by the volume under the cupola) cathedral in the world.
However, the displays of the historic / previous buildings were very interesting. So were the bronze horsemen statue outside and the mosaics inside.
Magnificient. Not big as the outside can make you think. But what a splendid place, the mosaics, the light, the floor, the ceiling, the atmosphere, a place you cannot miss when in St.Petersburg

Big cathederal. This is a big place with huge dome,it is very ornate inside and colourful.It has a interesting history and it is worth reading up about it before going. Unfortunatly our age made going to see view a no no but bet it was wonderfull.

Gorgeous view!. The view on the top is absolutely spectacular. It offers a prime view of the city and despite the "long" walk up the stairs, it is worth it.
Inside the church, you are offered a perfect example of russian architecture, which you should prioretize to view.

Just looks like any other catherdal, until you step inside. From the outside, you are totally unaware of what waits for you inside, unless you have seen pictures...... We were on an organised tour, the best way to see it, and learn about its history. It is not now a functioning cathedral, but now a museum. Built during the over many years in the early 19th century, the cathedral remains one of the largest Orthodox churches in the world, its golden dome dominates the skyline from a height of over 101 m Designated as a museum during the 1930s, the ornate interior,features highly decorated granite and marble columns. The silver dove on the inside of the main dome has a span of 3 mts...

Just a quick photo stop. We just had a quick photo stop here and it was magnificent to see the stance of the place and it has a view of the river . Lots of buses park here as it is a large intersection

amazing place. Stayed in hotel just beside and planned to visit last day. Almost did not make it, simple reason all places in St. Petersburg you have to wait in a very long line, to buy tickets. There is so many beautiful places to visit, but it seems that Russian tourist authority is trying to make it as difficult as possible. You have to buy tickets 2 different places to be able to go inside and on the roof. Why? To spend another half hour? Beside those "small" issues fantastic view from the roof and amazing art/paintings inside.

St Pauls in Russia - do take the trip up to the viewing level at sunset. Truly awesome architecture. Do read the history of this place beforehand if you won't have a guide. The entrance fee to WALK up to the viewing gallery is very reasonable and open until 6pm. Best to go late and on a sunny afternoon.
Great view. I wasn't too interested in the interior, but it not really my think. Great views from the top. It's a must be get a perspective on the entire city.

Mesmerising!. This Cathedral in not only amazing on the outside but when you go in you won't believe how beautiful this place is! This could be your las stop of the day since they are open super late! There is two kinds of tickets, one to go into the cathedral and the other one to climb the steps to go to the top (two hundred and something steps). During summer time they are open until 4AM, but you can double check before going. To go into the cathedral the entrance is 400rub and you can buy the ticket in the machines they have at the front! Don't miss this place!

If you want a nice view of this go to the W Hotel bar and terrace!. I didn't actually go inside of here but a friend and I went for drinks on the W Hotel bar and terrace which had an amazing view of the cathedral at night. I could've stared at it for hours!

Go up the colonnade! . The sheer size of St Issacs is something else entirely however if you're in St Petersburg then this place is worth visiting! We didn't go inside as we had been inside numerous religious buildings on our visit to Russia and instead we went up the colonnade at about 10 at night which is only available I think during the long white nights of summer. It was breathtaking the view of petersburg and you really could see everything! We would highly recommend it probably at any time of the day however we thought it best for the sunset and also the lack of tourists up there was also good for photos and such. Beware it can get windy if it is on the ground so be prepared for cold up there!
BEAUTIFUL CHURCH. When We went to St Petersburg Russia and took a Tour of the City We went into this Curch and OMG GORGEOUS. The Artwork and Artiecture was Outstanding. It was a huge Church.

Centre of town. This is another St. Petersburg icon which is very much worth a visit. Outside there are venders set up selling anything and everything. Some costumed buskers will pose with you. Because it is so near the Hermitage and other sites, it is worth a look, otherwise not.
Massive. Huge orthodox cathedral which is full of genius drawing from the bible there are no seats and Elua our guide said they have to stand to show respect to God it is amuse see

Nice cathedral with a view. The cathedra is nice to have a look inside, but more of the same regarding other cathedrals. Climbing up and see the view from the top is highly recommended, there is no elevator however it worth the effort.

Amazing cathedral!. Another must-see of St Petersburg!! The columns both inside and out are all one piece, the decorations inside are amazing with (or course!) heaps of gold everywhere - really a must-see!

Superb views. We arrived soon after opening and managed to enjoy the panoramic views in relative quiet, but the crowds arrived within the next 30 minutes and then it became a frustrating jostle. Tip: Go early or late in the day to avoid the masses.

Fantastic Place to visit. This church turned out to be the jewel in the crown of sites in St Petersburg on our recent tour . Impressive from the outside but completely breathtaking once you enter. A must see if you are in St Petersburg.
Lovely views. Great square to walk around and take pictures of the monuments around. Loved all the pigeons! The only down side, there were numerous cruise ship buses parked in the square.
Duomo Climb. We only bought tickets the climb the duomo. Even with loads of buses out front and a line to enter, the climb goes quickly-30 minutes total up, around, and down. Great 360 degree views.

Stop on a tour. We were on a cruise trip and this was a first stop. The Cathedral is massive and it is so picturesque. A walk leads to the Neva river and the parks and sights all around are worth exploring. The only drawback are the people around dressed as Russian aristocrats who want to pose for pictures. Need to fight them off but they seemed fairly harmless.
largest orthodox basilica. It is the largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest cathedral in the world. You can climb to the top of the dome for a great view.

The ceterpiece of St Petersburg. This church is definitely the center piece of St Peterburg. Distinctly visible from quite far, the trademark dome literally defines the look of the city. Spend at least an hour in the garden across the road in front.
Very Nice Cathedral!. A must visit in St. Petersburg. One of the best Cathedrals i have visited. Lovely architecture and such a positive vibe about it.

Nice place, my photo will tell more.. We have been in St. Petersburg really a lot of time, but in St. Isaac this was a first visit.
Very beautiful for photo. Evening tickets for kids a little bitt too exspensive (no discount at all).

Amazing murals. What an awe inspiring building ... trying to describe the interiors cannot pay them justice ... truly beautiful and a must to see. The mosaics are just unbelievable! So impressed we bought an icon.
Every Cathedral is different.. This Cathedral is amazing. The artwork, mosaics, statues, etc. are worth seeing so don't miss this one.
Beautiful. We saw this as a drive by during the city bus tour. The main point is the hugh gold dome. It used to be a cathedral, but the state has turned it into a museum.
Awesome cathedral. It was obe of the great cathedrals in st petersburg inside so many icons definitly must visit here the golden roof is made fromm the real gold it is fantastic
Another beautiful SPB cathedral. Great Cathedral to walk around and be amazed. Very ornate and beautiful. No more than one hour needed.y

A MUST see. Climb the stairs to the colonnade for the magnificent view!!!. It is not a functioning cathedral now, it is a museum. A very impressive building which is absolutely worth visiting. Please do go inside too, you won't regret it, the decorations inside are stunning. And I strongly recommend to climb up the stairs to the colonnade (you will need a separate ticket for that) for the AMAZING views of the city. Lots of other great things to see nearby too, thoroughly enjoyable.

Went in just to have a look around. We entered the cathedral just to have a look around. It was quite lavish inside but really is just like any other orthodox cathedral, but bigger. We were told this was the largest orthodox cathedral in the world.

Stunning and Amazing!. What an amazing site. The Cathedral is massive - just massive. The scale of this structure cannot be underestimated. We were guessing you could fit five or six Church's of Spilled Blood inside St. Isaac's. I had forgotten from our last visit how much mosaic work was done inside the Cathedral. The scale of the work is massive, making the work even more impressive. For a better understanding of the history and relevance, you should have a guide take you through the site. St. Petersburg is filled with amazing palaces and history - but St. Isaac's should not be missed.
Beautiful Cathedral. This was one of our highlights. Though not as well famous as the Palaces, this Cathedral is extraordinary, Reminds me of the Vatican.

Impolite Russian ticket controller. It's one the most beautiful Cathedral that I have ever seen in my life!! BUT there was a blond Russian woman who was controlling the tickets at the entrance of the top of Cathedral. When we were trying to put our tickets wrongly into the machines, she started to shout at us in Russian very impolitely!! She was yelling to us instead of helping us!! She was shouting to us as much as possible so that Everybody was looking at us as we made a mistake!! Maybe she insulted to us, I dont know but she was likely saying bad words!! So if she does the same thing to you, call the police!!!

Australian Travellers. This cathedral ranks second to the Church on Spilled Blood in my opinion. Again lovely Russian architecture and in a central location so easy to locate. Although we did not have the time to look inside, it was just as impressive exploring the outside and hearing the history. One not to be missed!

Overcrowded like everywhere else. Yet another stunning building - inside and out.Vast sums have been spent restoring these historical sites and they are a huge draw for the vast numbers of tour groups visiting the city.I'm not trying to make any political point but as with every other location we visited in our 2 day visit, this was overcrowded, to the detriment of being able to get a proper view and "feeling" for yet another national treasure.

Wonderul in central St. Petersburg. Beautiful in the central part of the city. Great restaurant selection nearby, one is called The Library, with affordable, Russian cuisine in sort of a counter-culture bar atmosphere.

Very impressive. This enormous building is very impressive. It dominates a whole area of the city with the great dome being especially prominent. Our schedule didn't allow us time to see the interior, but the massive marble columns, some of which retain damage from World War II, are awe inspiring.

View over St. Petersurg. The Isaac Cathedral is a hotspot of the town.Inside You have all the religious decorations in all sorts of stone / marbelTake the trip to the rotunda and You fave the most faboulos view ove rthe city.

another impressive cathedral. This one ranks second in my list of St Peterburg's cathedrals, after Saviour on the Spilled Blood. It is nonetheless very impressive by dimensions.Visit the colonade (tower) with great St Peterburg's views, especially the sunsets would be beautiful there. During the summertime, white nights, the colonade is open until 4am and I imagine that the night sights would be magnificent.

The musuem is close on Wednesday. Why on earth they close the museum on Wednesday, I am yet to understand. I should have read our guidebook more carefully, but we ended up being there on Wednesday (our last day in the city), so we could only do the rooftop walk (which opens everyday). I can't comment on the interior of the cathedral, but the rooftop is good enough to do it alone. St. Petersburg is a beautiful city from the top, so don't miss the chance to view it.

Most beautiful interiors and best architecture. Most beautiful interiors and best architecture. Beautiful paintings and very well maintained. Another must see monument. Huge pillars made out of single piece of granite.
St Isaacs cathedral. Beautiful ornate as so many Russian orthodox churches are simply spectacular, must not be missed we has a guide from Alla tours and she was great with details about everything

Nice view at the top. You can climb to the top (not to many stairs) at see the view of the whole city! If you have the St. Petersburg card you have to go to cashier #6 to exchange the coupon with the ticket (Don't forget to have always the book with you)

magnificent cathedral with excellent tour guides. loved the Cathedral, the tour guide ( part of the ticket cost) was very knowledgeable and was willing to answer questions and spend an extra few minutes with people that had comments.

WOW - NOT JUST ANOTHER ATTRACTION. Simply awesome
St Petersburg has a mass of amazing attractions and St Isaac's is one of the best
So much history in one place

Must Visit. Must visit for all tourist
Amazing architecture with paintings etc.
Do take a guide to help & understand the history.
Centrally located

The dome is plated in solid gold. This museum is beautiful. The artwork on the walls and ceilings is spectacular. The dome is coated in gold bonded onto solid brass. It is a very busy visitor attraction but well worth going inside.
Easy Location. Is quite a place to see and getting in is easy. Not likely to be crowded worth your time. You'll be walking by it anyway as you shop and sightsee.

Architecture at its Best. The architecture can be highly admired
It is so beautiful
We bought complete ticket for both
The view from top was awesome
A must see place

Go Inside. After you see so many churches this one does not stand out from the outside BUT you must go inside to see the beautiful marble and semiprecious stones. Of note is that there are 112 granite columns that went up before the walls of the cathedral were constructed. Also, check out the stained glass window of the resurrection behind the altar.
Stunning cathedral but crowded. Truly a stunning Russian Orthodox cathedral but more of a museum than a active cathedral; services only twice a year. Go early. Cameras allowed.

On top and inside - both are must and incredible.. From the top of the cathedral the view is stunning. You can see 360 degree panorama of the beautiful city, right from the heart of it.Inside they offer a free tour - make sure you wait for it (it starts every other 15 minutes or so). It explains a lot about the cathedral.
Wonderful Orthodox Cathedral. Massive space, beautiful decorations of paintings and mosaics. Working chapel where you can say a prayer and light a candle for a loved one. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful interiors. Well worth a visit, even if you have already been to too many museums and churches! The interior is amazing. We didn't climb up to the top.

Not as good as Church on Spilt Blood, but still nice. I see everyone else raving about St. Isaac's, and, to be fair, I did not climb the stairs to see the view, but I just don't think it's all THAT special. It's pretty, but honestly looks similar to any other large domed European cathedral. It is an architectural feat, and for that I can appreciate it.However, if you only have a limited amount of time to spend in St. Petersburg and have to choose between St. Isaac's and Church on Spilled Blood, there is no question that you must go to Church on Spilled Blood.
Good view. Many steps up and down, but it provides a great view of St. Petersburg from the dome. There are two entrances: one for the cathedral proper and one for the view.

Beyond imagination. Must-see! I was blown away as I stepped in to the museum of this cathedral. It's so beautiful, and maintained so well. It's small though, but if you keep looking up to the ceiling and all decorations, it's worth it. I went in on a Friday evening, no big tour groups. Day after, first in line for to go all the way up in the cathedral, I had the most amazing view of St Petersburg. It won't get any better than this! After 20minutes with only a few others, the tour groups came up too. I was amazed, didn't expect it at all, all my pictures are flawless without any effort. If you go up in the cathedral, be warned that the wind is really strong there. Highly recommended.

Saint Isaac's Cathedral has breathtaking views of Saint Petersburg. . Saint Isaac's cathedral is located in the admiralty section of Saint Petersburg and is a fine example religious grandeur viewed through an imperial lens. The building is not regularly used for religious services, so it feels far more like a Museum than a place of worship. This also makes it a good place for visiting because it might seem awkward to intrude on people while they worship. The interior is vast an cavernous and is decorated with splendid columns, icons and paintings. If you pay extra, you can visit the colonnade, which is accessed by climbing around two hundred stairs. The effort is worth it though because the platform offers access to a 360 degree unobstructed view of the city.

Ready for a climb and view.. The dome is being renovated but it is well worth seeing the inside of this beautiful Orthodox Church. I strongly recommend buying a ticket to go on the colonnade and climb to the top with over 200 steps but the view of the city is remarkable from here. The interior of the church is massive and the paintings representing biblical stories are remarkable.
Breathtaking place - A MUST SEE. A lot of history here ! Every painting has a great story and is excellent. There is so much to see and learn here.

The largest Russian Orthodox cathedral. The cathedral was ordered by Tsar Alexander I. Was finished under Montferrand's direction in 1858. I would definitely recommend to visit that place in order to see the stunning beauty of the interior and take a audio guide to listen to the history, it will make your visit more interesting.

Fascinating and beautiful. Looking at the history of most of the buildings, churches and facilities in St. Pete you get a sense of the long term relevance but also the devastation and subsequent dedication to repair post WW2. Very significant place with interesting war-era history.

Probably most beautiful interior of all churches in St Petersburg. The church is not just large. The Kazan Cathedral for instance is probably even larger. But St Isaacs interior is so rich and beautiful. It is very popular, so be prepared for large number of visitors. And if you have got the time, climb the stairs to the colonnades for a nice panorama of the city.

Taj or better than that!. Awesome structure, decor and willingness of staff to exhibit this great Cathedral.Human suffering notwithstanding on its construction, this is absolutely great work by human being, fourth one survived which says about its tragic history of its evolution.
highly recommend to visit this state of art.. unbelievable, awesome, beautiful, charismatic, spiritual, historical treasure of St. Peterborough. watch and pay.

World's Fourth Largest Church. This is a beautiful church built on a grand scale. It is the world's fourth largest church and a masterpiece building. It is always amazing to see what the mind of man can create when truly honoring God.
Gorgeous!. Definitely recommend every tourist to at least see it from the outside. Very famous attraction in SP and in general for anyone just visiting Russia

Mostly de-Consecrated - - Enormous and Gorgeous. This immense and beautiful cathedral was a museum dedicated to showing the virtues of secularism under the Soviets, and remains a museum (without that propaganda) today, though one chapel is once again a religious site. The able bodied can get a ticket that includes climbing to the outside cupola, from which there are stunning views of this stunning city.

Unbelieveably over the top beautiful. This is a beautiful building inside and out. The richness of the decor is absolutely stunning. That it continues to be used for worship services makes it even more special.

great!. Great monument and a masterpiece!
i recommend you to go to the rooftop see the city centre from like 30 meters high.
and of course you have to get inside as it's one of the most beautiful open churches in Russia
very good. Very nice! Inside so many icons, сhurch painting . Were on the roof, from there you can see the city from a bird's flight. Only 150 rubles –really recommend it!

Beautiful Inside and Out!. This church has been here for a long time and has damage to some of the outside pillars from the time of war. It was beautiful inside with many mosaics. Definitely a worthwhile stop.

Part of 2 day tour with TJ Travel. Only saw this cathedral from the outside for a photo shoot. This did seem very popular tourist site. Unfortunately the weather was a bit downcast so did not get the full effect in photos of the golden roof which is covered in real gold.

Nice church. No so much different from the great churches from European cities we had to visit.
If you do not speak the language you should take city tour

A Warm Haven on a Cold Day. Definitely worth a look. An interesting and impressive cathedral with great paintings.
The view from the colonnade was excellent although crowded.

This is one of those must see locations. Absolutely amazing but watch your belongings. There are pickpockets around. Don't let that put you off. The building, architecture, details and paintings are amazing

Impressive. Went up to colonnade. Great views of city. HUGE Granite pillars and staircase impressive. Must be freezing in winter!!! Take jackets and hats.
150 R each
Imposing, magnificient architecture... and great look from the colonnade!. You can see a panoramic view of the whole St. Petersburg from the colonnade. Evening tickets are cheaper - go for them!

Night visit at St Issac Cathedral. We decided to go at night .The website snd other internet websites dvised to buy tickets before 22:00 when they close the ticket office . Well this bus wrong : tge ticket office is open constantly till 4 am. (They go take breaks if 15 minutes max )Ticket costs 400 rubals.The climb is 261 stairs . Do be ready.Tge view of the city is fantastic. You can actually see the whole city with beautiful illumination .I would recommend not to miss. We went after dinner and it was an unforgettable event.

See both the church (museum) and spectacular view (colonnade). The cathedral -- called the museum, presumably because it stopped being used as a "full-service" church in 1928, and even became an anti-religious museum in 1937 -- is a stunning work of art regardless of your religious point of view. The interior continues the rich decorative style with extensive guilding and craftsmanship seen in many Romanov cathedrals and palaces. It was interesting that the cathedral was started in 1818 by Alexander I, demolishing and replaced a previous cathedral on the site that had been completed just a few years earlier, but which Alexander seemed to consider disappointing and unworthy.Access to the Colonnade provides a splendid view of St. Petersburg in all directions, assuming the weather cooperates. You do have to climb (and eventually descend) approximately 250 steps, so be prepared. If you want to visit the Colonnade, it requires a separate admission from the Museum -- buy both tickets at once, so you don't have to wait through the ticket line twice.

Magnificent Orthodox Cathedral (Sobor) in Sankt Petersburg !. In the end of Voznesensky Prospekt (Ascension Prospekt), one of the most important boulevards beside the Nevsky Prospekt in St.Petersburg, is located this gorgeous orthodox temple. That is a largest Russian Orthodox cathedral (sobor) in the city. We decided to see the interior of the Sobor and also to mount to the colonnade for the views of St.Petersburg from atop.The cupola (the dome) is very impressive one and it rises 101.5 metres above the ground. The dome is plated with pure gold and is decorated with twelve statues of angels.The Cathedral is located in Isaakiyevskaya Square where can be seen the famous Astoria Hotel. Before, here in this square was situated the glorious monument to the Peter the Great on the horse, so called the Bronze Horseman, but later was moved closer to the Neva embankments. Also there is an equestrian monument of the Tsar Nicholas I in the front of the Cathedral.The Cathedral is dedicated to the Saint Isaac of Dalmatia, who was the saint patron of Peter the Great.The exterior is faced with gray and pink stone and features 112 red granite columns with Corinthian capitals. The main fronton or pediment is richly ornamented and carved in bronze with the features from the Bible and St.Isaac himself blessing the Roman Emperor.The interior is quite impressive as well, since the volume under the cupola comes as the fourth largest in the world counting among the cathedrals. The main gate or doors are of bronze , then iconostasis is very nice, consisted of the malachite columns, then comes the Shrine to the Wonderwork and Sanctuary with the display of Saint Isaac in the red vestment. If You point out Your glance above, You'll perceive suspended underneath the peak of the dome a sculpted white dove representing the Holy Spirit.Outstanding Cathedral of St.Isaac, here in St.Petersburg, that's for sure.
A must. While in st Petersburgh this is a must - it's open until 10pm during summer. It's worth it to climb up 220 steps for the amazing views of the city. The ticket cost just over £3
Worth a visit. Amazing building which reminded us of a slightly smaller St Paul's Cathedral - well worth a visit. We didn't climb to the top as it was late in the day.

Mistaken review of Church of Spilled Blood. I just wrote a fairly long review which was intended to be of St. Isaac's Cathedral but which ended up being assigned to the Church of Spilled Blood. So please see my comments talking about views (which the Spilled Blood Church does not have) for my thoughts on St. Isaac's. Perhaps the Tripadvisor staff can correct my mistake.

Buy Both Tickets: For The Cathedral and The Colonnade. We bought tickets only for the cathedral and were pleased with our visit, but did so not realising that you cold not access the views from the colonanade without a separate ticket. The queue was far to long to go back for that. The Interior is stunning and huge. Worth a a half-hour visit.

Tickets to the colonnade means climbing up for views of St P'burg. We ended up climbing to the dome as we bought tickets to the Colonnade. It was quite confusing as you could buy tickets to the Colonnade or the Museum. We wanted the church! Apparently that is known as a museum! Anyway it was fun to go up but it was an overcast grey day so the photos across the city weren't great. Would be good on a blue sky day.
ornate and incredible history. St. Isaac's Cathedral is a must see in St. Petersburg.... incredible history and one of the most beautiful domed churches.

Great View of the City. If you want a great view of the city, then this is the place as no building is taller than this cathedral. You need to purchase 2 tickets separately (one for the inside the cathedral and one for the top of the cathedral). Tickets were 250 RUB each. Be careful going up to the top of the cathedral. It's over 1,000 steps (no elevator) and very narrow. Take your time to go up (rest often) as it is going to be tiresome but it will be worth it. The view is just unbelievable. You will not be disappointed.Inside the cathedral is huge and beautiful. It is well worth the visit.
St. Issac's Cathedral. Did not climb to the top which is probably the big attraction of this Cathedral. To note, it closes between 5.30 and 6.00 p.m. each evening but is open late.

Great cathedral. Beautiful cathedral with amazing views. It is open during the day and at night. You can see the palaces and the entire city from the top of the cathedral. The inside is beautifully decorated. You have to pay separate for the different areas but go ahead and visit.

Spot the dove on the middle of the dome!. Make sure to stand at the middle of the dome, step on the nail, and look up on the dove that symbolizes the Holy Spirit. The main highlight of this visit is the stained glass image of Jesus Christ in the middle of the church.
One of the most beautiful churches. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have visited. The marble and frescos are beautifully restored. Reminds me of Italian churches.

Fabulous View from the Top. The interior of the church is imposing and grand, but the best part is probably the view from the colonnade below the dome. Its worth climb the (helpfully numbered) 250 (or so) steps for some wonderful glimpses of the city.

Huge! . This place is MASSIVE. Just the size of the building from the outside is very impressive. We visited both the museum and the colonnade (211 steps to an outside viewing platform). Both were well worth doing. The views were fantastic however there is no lift so don't even attempt this if you have poor or restricted mobility. The museum does have disabled access via a ramp - it was stunning inside. A very grand building, filled with culture!

Awesome sunset view. This was across from our hotel and we enjoyed seeing the sun set behind it every night. One night we climbed up to the colonnade (262 steps on a spiral staircase) and were rewarded with a spectacular 360 degree view of the city

Lightness, grandeur, inspiration. Saint Isaac's Cathedral is impressive by its height, lightness, and the beauty of its decor. The variety of marble and the height of the columns are very impressive. One is drawn to look up! A must see!

Well worth the visit. We visited St Isaac's at 18:00hrs and had to queue for about 10 minutes for tickets. There are tickets for the cathedral @ 400 RBL and the colonnade ( the top of the cathedral) costs @£300 RBL. They can be bought separately.I did both. The interior of the cathedral is worth a visit and my wife stayed and viewed the religious art whilst I went up to the colonnade. This has to be the best 360 view of the city. I was lucky in that it was a clear sunny day and could see for miles. Well worth the approx 250 step climb. I went around the circumference 4 times spotting something different each time. There is a very nice park nearby and public toilets at the edge of the park before crossing the road to the cathedral. They cost 20 RBL but are spotless.
Just amazing. This cathedral is just amazing the inside and outside is absolutely brilliant and the beauty of it is wow!

St Isaac's Cathdral. Largest church in Russia. Gold dome is incredible and visible from throughout St Petersburg. Many tour groups visiting here so a visit early in the morning is recommended. Within walking distance of The Hermitage so both sites could be combined.

Very impressive. This cathedral was impressive in size, style and stature... Very beautiful. Unfortunately a member of our team had his wallet stolen while climbing the steps into the Cathedral... Watch ou tfor pick pocket but prepare to be stunned

Wonderful Cathedral, well kept. Take your time and try to be here when not too many visitors.Plan at least one hour to see everything. If there's a guide take advantage of all the most interesting facts to be seen. Climbing the tower is worth the effort but may not suit everybody.

Amazingly Beautiful Cathedral. This is a truly amazing cathedral. The depictions are done in mosaics, which makes it more interesting. The stain glass work is breathtaking. An absolutely beautiful place and well worth a visit.
Breathtakingly huge!. I is a great feeling being inside this amazing cathedral. Its size is breathtaking. The interiors are equally amazing!

Views are great. We climbed to the top only, the inside was closed. I would not recommend the climb for little kids the elderly or those afraid of heights. I'm not great with heights and had some worry. The views were beautiful and worth it, but I'm not sure I'd go through my fear again for it.

Great place to see the city and opulence.. I walked around on the outside perimeter the first day and got great views of the city. You can really get your bearings from that point.
The next day I was able to go inside and it was just lovely. The architecture and paintings were great.

Incredible. We didn't have a guide and just went because it was across from our hotel and it was easy to get tickets. Its truly magnificent and breath taking but I think it would have been more interesting if we had a guide

Gorgeous cathedral . Highly recommend taking the 264 stairs up for a look out over St Petersburg. Then inside to see the restoration ( still in progress) and the incredible mosaics. Can be accomplished in a few hours.

Fantastic views of the city, and interesting exhibits inside. Visited the Cathedral on a sunny morning in January. The main reason to go is the fantastic panoramic view that can be gained from the viewing platform under the dome. You can see a long away across the city and you get a chance to take in all the different districts and areas of St Petersburg from the docks to the domes and the spires. Well worth it. Underneath, you can go in the cathedral itself. Quite quiet, only a few visitors when we went. Very impressive decoration and design inside, the architecture is very impressive. There were a number of interesting exhibits about the construction as well.

Not really impressed. This Cathedral (which was actually turned into a museum during the communist era) looks good from outside, built in a Byzantine style; very majestic and huge but is in my opinion way too big to inspire any mystic or religious emotion. A pure gold dome, huge rooms and hallways, massive columns, bronze doors and all that Orthodox opulence and paintings and golden decorations didn't quite appeal to me. A massive kitsch.

Climb the top for a magnificent view of SPB. Did this on the first day and got a wonderful overview of the city. A bit crowded, but it was a sunny day in SPB. I have been told that there are only 70 sunny days, and we were lucky to enjoy 4 of them. Climbing the steps to the top isn't too difficult...enjoy!

Just great. We went in the evening - around 8p.m. And it was not crowded at all. Good, very informative excursion and a long, long climb up the colonnade. Just a reminder - younger children and elderly, in my opinion, should not endeavor the colonnade, it is quite a steep climb and there is no return - you go down through a different ladder.
IT is a museum. Nice place and huge building. Spent one Hour insidie to visit IT. Stunning g view from the top but you have to gain IT after 262 steps.

One of World's Best Cathedrals. Another do not miss site. Historical details are best understood by engaging a professional, local tour guide. Again do not short change your time in this city. We only had two full days & would suggest at least one more.
Another beautiful church. All of the churches in St Petersburg are gorgeous and this one was not an exception. Definitely worth a visit.

Another beautiful church. St Isaac's is beautiful church that was included in our 2 day tour of St. Petersburg. They have done a great job of restoring it after years of neglect after WWII. Note that on one side of the building you can see the bullet holes from the 3 year siege of Leningrad during the war.

Beautiful interior. The exterior may not exude the same level of awe as some of the other monuments of the city, but believe us that it is worth some time to visit. We did not climb to the viewing platform but spent all the time admiring and photographing the beautiful interior iconostasis art. The dome is well illuminated and such a beautiful sight your neck will ache from looking up too long. The malachite columns are really impressive since it is not usual to obtain such large pieces easily. Must be really expensive!Not to neglect the exterior, the large doors are engraved so beautifully that you cannot believe they are chunks of metals of several tons. It was unbelievable too that that 112 columns of solid red granite are used to hold up the entire structure.So, all round much to be savoured from architecture wonder to beautiful iconostasis and the awe in use of materials that is not exactly abundant.

Must see. One of the largest and most beautiful cathedrals in Saint Petersburg. After seeing the richly decorated interior, don't forget to climb the stairs to enjoy the views of the city. You need to buy a combined ticket to see both the church interior and to be able to walk upstairs.

Even more amazing. This was a surprise to me. It reminded me of St. Peters. It's just full of wonderful artwork. I know it's not terribly old but it's still gorgeous. Pictures don't really do it justice, you need to take video to get a sense of how big and beautiful it is.Tip: When I got to the front door there was a group of people just standing there. I thought there was a hold up but it turned out they were waiting for their guide so I just walked past them to the entrance. So don't hesitate to move forward.

Impressive Cathedral. This cathedral remains one of the largest Orthodox cathedrals in the world, its golden dome dominating the city's skyline from a height of over 101 m. Designated as a museum during the 1930s, the lavish interior features highly decorated granite and marble columns and pilasters. The main iconostasis is, framed by eight ornate columns. The dome, one of the largest in the world, is covered with almost 100kgs of pure gold. Get there early and beat the hordes.

Worth the climb but do go inside. The second day of our visit and we were becoming a little gold drunk but we stuck to it and made the effort. Well worthwhile. Great view from the top of the steeple all around St Petersburg. Do not miss going inside. The interior is fantastic

Exceeded my expectations!. Haven't seen any cathedral as grand and rich/luxurious anywhere in Europe!If you'd like to get inside buy 'museum' ticket (250rub) and if you'd like to get on the top (definitely worth it!) buy 'colonnade' ticket (150rub). Make sure you're not charged tourist prices (500rub each I think)!

Beautiful . We visited the church with small children and found it to be one of only a few attractions that are stroller friendly in the area. The building is beautiful, especially inside and worth the entry fee.

A must see but watch the crowds . The Cathedral is a must see in St Petersburg with the fourth highest done in Europe and incredible Lapis Lazuli and Malachite columns inside and huge granite columns around the outside. The crowds were huge with lots of pushing and shoving to get around unfortunately.

A wonderful building. Just viewed this wonderful building from outside but it was magnificent. I bought an original painting of this building because it is so important in the centre of St. P. and dominates the area ....
Added to our tour at our request. Amazing mosaics, Just amazing. If you have time, be sure to come here. We loved this cathedral. Now more of a museum.

Huge. The art in here is amazing the whole building is a craft in itself, gold on the dome, you can walk up 200 plus stairs and walk around for panoramic vies. Inside the painted ceilings and walls are again magnificent
Go after 1800. The church was almost empty after 1800, it's the best time for a visit. Pay attention for the mosaics and the store mini stores.

Another Impressive Cathedrahl!. If you like history, this Russian orthodox cathedrals, now a state museum, took 40 years to complete (under the eye of Peter the Great, Catherine I, her son Paul I and finally finished correctly by Alexander I.The Cathedrahl is the largest in St. Petersburg, and the gold dome is 4th largest in the world. The restoration of the religious icons is beautiful and worth your time. The paintings inside the domes and on the massive walls depicting religious scenes are impressive. A guided tour or self-guided "boxes" are needed if the history is your focus.NOTE: Unrelated to Cathedrahl, but important- across the street is a WC (bathroom) but there is a charge of 20 rubles. It is clean, and has real toilet seats, toilet paper, soap and water and a poorly working dryer. Bathrooms are few and far between so it's worth the stop

Of all the Cathedrals I've been to this is my favorite, second only to St. Peter's in Vatican City.. Of all the Cathedrals I've been to this is my favorite, second only to St. Peter's in Vatican City. The mosaics, stained glass, the malachite and blue lapis columns, and the peace found in the monument to the Lord is beyond description. I wish I could explain how beautiful it is, but you can only understand by seeing it yourself.

Impressive . Another impressive cathedral. After climbing more than 200 steps, one could have a view the city. The inside was also captivating and one would wonder at the amount of man hours spent on the works.

St Issacs. The Cathedral is just stunning on the inside and out. A guide is very helpful to explain all the detail in side, from the different stones used inside, the mosaic pictures, the dove in the ceiling, the types of architecture, and the orthodox beliefs

Climb the colonnade!. I didn't go inside, but I went up the colonnade (a relatively-easy 200+ steps) about 30 minutes before sunset and stayed until the city lights came on. I'm not sure I'd bother on a grey day, but on a clear evening it was a great view of the city, especially as I'd spent the previous two days exploring it extensively and could pick out all the landmarks. There is a continuous track explaining what you're looking at... but alas only in Russian.
