climg to the top. Beautiful church in the heart of the city. If your fitness level allows and you arent afraid of height, make the climb to the top of the dome. You will be rewarded with 360 degree vistas of the city.

Must see. Thus a must see place. Entry is by tickets. Students get discounts (around 50%), with student id.The columns and building workmanship are truly magnificent. Nothing is mentioned anywhere (where visitors can see) about the construction of this cathedral, who (designed it, built it), where the stones were cut and brought from, the documentation of the design (like design engineering drawings, building plans, etc.) Magnificent building.The colonnade requires a separate ticket. Not recommended for people with knee problems or health issues. You have to go up the stairs about 280 steps on a spiral staircase. Then go down the other side. The view is magnificent. The columns were amazing and huge. How did they left it up this high? What technology or tools were used?
Incredibly beatiful...breathtaking:). On yop near the there is an excursion that makes you so proud of the city and Russia. Fantastic memories :)

Visit In Early Part of Tour. Like my comments for the Catherine Palace, visit this museum on the early part of your tour so you could experience other sites that is definitely superior to this museum and do not feel anti-climactic. This is an impressive looking structure that is feeling more and more common in the Scandanavian area.
Better go inside. The outlook is better at the Church of the saviour on the spilt blood but the inside is as good. This is one of the musts in St Petersburg

Opulent . My sister & I decided to climb to the top of the church first. This was a great plan on a beautiful morning. We had great views of the city and it wasn't too crowded. Then we toured inside the church. At the time we went there were no English tours & I was glad we had a travel book with us to read about the history and the areas to focus on. There is so much beauty to see with some much detail in everything.
Must visit . To feel the spirit of St Petersburg, visit St Isaac's cathedral and go up to the colonnade to see the rooftops and feel the tremendous greatness of the place!

Another a must see in St. Petersburg, Russia. Like my review title, St. Isaac's Cathedral is one of St. Petersburg must see! Its a marvel and true work of art. I am truly lost for words. Our whole experience as a whole of St. Petersburg is un describable! One should see it to believe it. Kudos to SPB Tours for making our trip a memorable one.

Awesome panaromic view. The golden dome was charismatic n we were attracted to it from far. It is very colorful, religious n iconic must see in St Petersburg, very interesting. At the end of the day with the sun going down n drizzling n horse cart outside, it's beautiful !
Panoramic View. A must do! Climb the steps to get a panoramic view of the whole of St. Petersburg! there is also a museum inside. Tickets are different for the panorama and museum.
St Isaac' s Cathedral. One of the most beautiful churches that I have seen. A definite must see when you are in St Petersburg.
Another must to see. Really impressive. Can't miss it. Impressive outside. Impressive inside. Another jewel of Saint Patersburg. Budget time as line may be long

Fantastic views. I must confess to choosing not to visit the museum so can't talk about that. I did climb the 270or so steps to the colannade for spectacular views of St Petersburg. Still spectacular despite the rain that was falling consistently! It's cheap to do this (150 roubles) and the ticket clerk spoke English. Note that the colannade is open all of the time, it is the museum that is closed on a Wednesday. Definitely worth doing and should be on your list of "must do in St Petersburg"

Wonderful panoramic view !. Yes you can go inside to see the temple and its very colorful and kitsch religious pieces but it's not very interesting. THE most attractive thing of this place is the "colonnade" view at the top : you will climb around 200 steps and will have the most beautiful 360° view on the city, on the Neva and all famous monuments. At the end of the day with the sun going down, it's beautiful !
Worth visiting. St. Isaac's Cathedral is worth visiting. One of the best ways to learn about the Russians history, culture and faith.
Another Cathedral. Traveling around Europe, one tends to get cathedral'd out. That said, St. Isaac's is magnificent, inside and out.
St.Isaac's Cathedral...the most beautiful. This is in top of attraction in St.Petersburg. We saw the Cathedral and we did also the panoramic view. But the cathedral inside is a true pearl.

Most stunning building in Europe. You definitely wouldn't expect it from the outside, but the artwork and architecture inside the building is stunning. I have never seen a more detailed, beautiful building. We took time to go to the top which was quite the adventure. It was a little congested at times but well worth the view over the river and St Petersburg.

Spectacular. The history of this cathedral and the beautiful mosaics made this one of the highlights of our trip. The perfect sunset on a rooftop bar after the tour brought the magnificent dome to life, a blazing ball of fire. Worth the visit

Ms.. Large and beautiful cathedral. Very impressive. Stunning mosiacs. Interesting display showing how it grew from the size that it was in the beginning to the great Cathedral that it is today. Definitely worth seeing. Approximately 45 tour.

Interesting, but not informative. The most interesting part of St. Isaac's Cathedral is the ascent to the walkway around the cupola, from where the view on a clear day is magnificent. This is certainly worth while. The interior of the church, now a museum, is quite beautiful (one part is currently under restauration and not accessible), but we could not find a shred of information about all the artwork. While the ascent to the walkway costs 300 rubles (about 4,5 Euro at current rate), the entrance to the museum is 400 rubles, which we found a bit exaggerated for the experience. Personally, I thought that there were too many souvenir stalls, even for a museum, at least three, if not four, in a comparatively small space.As to my opinion, St. Isaac's Cathedral cannot compete with the Church of the Saviour on Spilt blood. If I had to choose one for a visit, it would be the latter.

Beautiful view from the top. We walked to the top of the dome and it was the most beautiful view of the city! Really cheap entrance and totally worth it. Recommend going towards the end of your trip, then you can spot all the places you've visited and get a sense of the city and really appreciate what you're looking at.

Amazing view from the top. Amazing place! The inside of the cathedral is covered with amazing art, gold and amazing things, I have never seen a place like this before. It is also possible to go (almost) to the top of the cathedral to see the view of the city. This is highly recommended and you can take some amazing photos from here.
Kutuzov rules!. Amazing icons, especially of the whole family of saints. Devalues the coinage, somewhat. Soviets made it a museum of atheism.

St. Isaac's Cathederal. You can climb to the top of the Cathederal. It is 150 rub. to climb the staircase 300 steps. On top you can see the Cathederal bells on each side and there is actually gargoyles on top where you can take photos of the city. I didn't have a chance to go in the Museum.

Great Architectonic and art Cathedral!. This Cathedral is one of teh most beautiful I ever visited in the world. Alos is very nice located, near a square and near downtown, you can walk to go there from downtown.
The most beautiful cathedral in Peter. Now it's a museum, and you can enjoy the beautiful view of city from its second floor which is for extra pay.

Huge cathedral. Probably best for photos outside as it is so big. Most people who tried to climb to the top gave out. There are parking spaces in front where you can take beautiful photos without even going inside. You will get amazing photos of you are in shape enough to climb to the top though Largest orthodox basilica and 4 th largest cathedral in the world. There is some beautiful world of art and description of architecture inside.

My first experience of the city. Visit this cathedral first and climb to the dome platform and get an excellent idea about the city and its other highlights. Comfortable walking shoes, steep but wide staircase and you can make beautiful panoramic pictures.
Awesome view . Nice view from the top I have lot of view in lot of area in this city but this touched my heart I have lot of thing to say я люблю Россию

Make sure you climb the Cupola for the city views. Another example of amazing restoration works performed over 60 years to bring this magnificent cathedral back to life. The marble, alabaster, gold and frescoes inside are just stunning, and if you are fit enough to take on the 210 steps up to the cupola, then the city views are well worth the climb.
Great. Well worth a look around for the admission price. You can see pretty much all of the city from the viewing platform around the dome
Wonderfull ciy view. Very nice and wide city view from the roof of this cathedral. It is connected with a little but of fitness activity climbing stairs. It counts about 2 hundred, too easy for me.

Awe inspiring . An awe inspiring example of the grandeur of the Russian Orthodox churches. Architecturally stunning from outside and beautiful inside . We happened across a requiem inside and just stood listening and looking at the beauty. Despite the crowds it felt peaceful and beautiful. A guide helps to explain the history and detail.
Must visit!. A stunning cathedral -- massive and gorgeous. If there's singing, be prepared for a moving experience (even for the non-spiritual.)
Big church . Very big church . Inside lot people . Wait to see the Saint icon of Saint Maria . No loud inside and very good feeling . No ticket to get in!!

Awe-inspiring. This is a stunning example of Russian Orthodox grandeur and well worth visiting. We only took the museum visit, which is actually just the church interior, due to time but the colonnade addition would be worthwhile I suspect. No flash photography allowed. A tripod would be good although I saw no one using one. You can still get some fantastic shots though with care. Don't forget to look up as well as view the high altar.
Amazing. how beautiful is this church from outside but from inside it is much more beautiful ,you can take photos as much as you can and the best are from the top of it .enjoy

Impressive church. It is a major cathedral, impressive in construction, design, showing riches of a vast land. It worths to go up to the Colliniade/ rooftop as well, stunning views of Sankt Petersburg

Big and beatiful. The biggest church in town and when I say big its very big, take also the trip upstairs to the dome if you go here , its worth it , lots of mosaic and paintwork inside, nice place to go.

Unmissable. St Isaac's Cathedral is well worth a visit and I would recommend both the museum and the colonnade ticket.The interior is beautiful and grand with so many things of beauty to see, it is rich in cultural and religious history and the stewards are both knowledgeable and eager to help. I found it to be a lovely mix of both interested tourists, pilgrims and local worshippers, which added to the authenticity of this visit.After your time inside St. Isaac's the climb to the top of the Cathedral is breathtaking, although there are over 400 steps I believe, neither I nor my 21 year old daughter found it too arduous. Once out on the exterior of the cathedral, you are met with 360 degree views over the city and also a birdseye view of the building....it is unmissable.However, I would not recommend this part of the visit to anyone with health/fitness issues or young children, as the safety barriers are perfectly adequate but not robust for small children.
Highlight. Different again . We took a real guide and it was worth doing so. If you know a local the prices for a guide or taxi are 20% cheaper. Don t miss the panorama.
Beautiful. It's a very beautiful cathedral with super helpful guides. Like all other museums (I know this is a cathedral), they have an audio guide in English.This is one of the must see in Spb

beautiful interior. i love to visit Russian Chathedral, this is very big one most interesting. a lot of visitirs. if you spent more time then sit and see something beautiful inside and the people. you will love this.
A bit disappointing. Compared with other churches and cathedrals in the city this is interesting but has nothing outstanding.

Don't miss the Colonnade views. A stunning building with mosaics and icons a plenty, although externally it is quite dull.Open until late in the evening. From May to September. A must do is a visit to the Colonnade, but beware there is a climb of nearly 300 steps. The view of ST Petersburg is worth it! 250 rubles to visit main Cathedral and 150 to climb to the Colonnade. If you need an audio guide it is 100 rubles. Total GBP approx £5.

Climb to the Top. A lovely view of St. Petersburg awaits you from the top of the Cathedral. We lucked out, it was a beautiful blue sky and an hour later it was snowing! The interior of the church is nothing spectacular, especially after visiting the Church of our Saviour.
Stunning views of the city from the dome. Great first stop if you want to get a bird's-eye view of the city. Not too strenuous climb to the top. The interior is magnificent too.

Great view at the top tower. Climb to the top of the tower, there are great views of St. Petersburg at the top of the tower. The inside of the cathedral is grand as well. You must purchase tickets separately for both.

beautiful cathedral . This beautiful place was created out of an unpopular series of churches on the same site. learn about how they installed the enormous columns (over 100tonnes) and how they constructed the dome as well as more about the icons and decoration.
Great View. One of the best places to have a panorama of whole St Petersburg! It has a great architecture, I have been on lyrics out side of it

Incredible and almost overwhelming. I am not usually a great fan of old cathedrals but this is an exception. The art and colors of this building are phenomenal. It is a place of light and creativity no matter what your religious background. Inspiring!
Awe. Totally worth visiting. It's just astonishing from the outside. I'm pretty sure the interior will be even more interesting but unfortunately we could not find it open for the public to visit.

Go to the top. This inside is a big open space and let's in nice light through the dome. It has a couple of nice tiled artwork and some good looking doors, but you don't need much time inside. Go up to the dome. The view from the top is amazing. You can look out across the entire city and see all the other attractions poking above the rooftops. I personally like being above the roofs and this view doesn't disappoint.

Across From our Hotel Angleterre. St. Isaac's was a short jaunt out the front door of our hotel and across the plaza. It is immense...fourth largest cathedral in the world...and certainly one of the highlights of the city. Gold everywhere with icons, mosaics and paintings. With so many beautiful churches in the city, it certainly is worth the visit.

Beautiful architecture. We did not go inside, but you do not need to go inside to appreciate the beautiful architecture on the outside. Make sure to climb to the top to see a fantastic aerial view of the city.

Imposing church with real history. Great building with s very special history, simply adds to the beauty this city has to offer.I did a free walking tour to learn about the history...... Well worth it!
St Isaacs St Petersburg. It's very worthwhile you can go up and around the outside but for us the beauty is in the inside with gold filer grey and lovely painting plus a very religious Cathedral

One of the most impressive cathedrals in Russia. You just can't realise how big this cathedral is while get inside. It's really huge. And all murals and mosaics inside the cathedral only increase the effect. There are a lot of fascinating history stories related to the St. Issac's Cathedral, so in my opinion it's better to find a good guide beforehand. Don't forget to take the roof visit. I'm sure you'll like the St Petersburg's panorama view.
Well worth the visit. Like everything we say in St Petersburg, the Cathedral is enormous and magnificent. Full of beautiful marble carvings and wonderful Icons.
Just amazing . I've seen a lot of Cathedrals, including some in Rome but I must say this might have them all beat. Make sure to buy both scenic and museum ticket in one.
Interesting visit. Very nice church don't forget to take the roof visit to see panorama view on St Petersburg, it's high but worth the view.
Worth a look. One of the world's biggest basilicas. Even if you have seen the world's best churches, this is worth a look. Magnificent.

Glorious use of marble, malachite, lapis lazuli, mosaics and colour with wonderful lighting. A really beautiful church, with a strong Russian feel to it. The lighting is marvellous and the use of colour, marble, malachite, lapis lazuli and mosaics extraordinary fusing into a harmonious and inspiring whole

The best in St Peterbug. Interesting the view this is different from other cities, I think there are not such or similar Cathedral in other cities as I know and there is situated an a big open place in the city center. Yes you have Milan, Paris, other cities but I find this Cathedral typical (ok Italian) and different

Excellent. St. Isaac's Cathedral State Museum-Memorial is a very wonderful building. you can visit the all city from top of the church with extra fees. in some part of building (for example the stone columns) you can see second world war effects.

great views from the dome!. The golden dome of St Isaac's can be seen from all over the city and is therefore something of an icon/landmark for visitors to St Petersburg. The exterior is impressive in scale and, in the columns on one side, you can still see shell marks from the WW2 occupation/siege of the city. It's on the inside, though, as in many Orthodox churches, where the true splendours lie. We particularly liked the bright green and blue columns amid all the splendid decor.We also paid to go up on the exterior colonnade, just beneath the dome, and this was well worthwhile, as there are great views out across the city. We made this visit independent of our tour group and it was not expensive, only a few hundred roubles. One note of caution - the tickets were being sold outside, some distance from the entrances, so this necessitated a far bit of toing and froing and some long queues. Well worth it, though.

Worth going up the dome for the view. The view from the dome is really worthwhile and the inside of the cathedral is stunning. There was also a mass taking place in a side chapel so there was also a chance to hear the sung service. Ticket booth and machines available to buy entry tickets round the side and at the front entrance.

You want to enjoy a great view, climb up the stairs to the top terrace. As many of the great chruches in this town, the Isaac is monumental, once again a "must see". If you climb up the stairs you will have a great view over St. Petersburg on their top circuit terrace.
Gorgeous views. We took an evening tour ticket for the top of the Cathedral. The views of the city were gorgeous. Got to see sunset from the top.Stunning views.

Worth seeing - rain or shine. These are basically two attractions (and two entry prices) - the colonnade and the museum. Great for a panoramic view and great for a rainy day inside. Read up on the history and how this was saved during the Leningrad siege.

Good for a panoramic view . There are two kinds of tickets available..to the museum and to the colonnade..I only took the latter. The climb up is not very gruelling..a spiral staircase with small steps..however the commentary on the loudspeaker was in Russian..so did not get as much out of it as I would have liked. Plan it for a clear day.
Highly underrated. A do not miss!. Wonderful exterior. Great views from the top. breathtaking interior. Not to be missed. One of the best experiences here.

Great view!. On this very afternoon I was lucky enough to have such a nice, warm and sunny weather! I enjoyed a view over the city and just chill a little bit, after such a rush day at Hermitage. It's a perfect place to finish your day of walking around this marvelous city. I didn't manage to get to the cathedrale 'cause it was pretty late and I didn't want to miss the view during such a wonderful weather. You can buy a separate ticket from a machine accepting credit cards - great way to save a precious time!

The view is worth the climb. Gives you terrific views over the city. Well worth the climb! The ticket office is away from the entrance so make sure you buy before heading to the entrance. The automatic machines are easy to use and you avoid the queues.

Perfect sunset!. We went to this place in the end of the day to have a perfect view of the sunset, and it was magic! We could see the city from every side. Was our last day in St. Petersburg so was a perfect way to end our amazing trip.

Curious Blend of West & East. St Issac's is supposedly the 3rd largest cathedral in the world behind St. Peter's in Rome and St. Paul's in London. Don't know if that's true. It doesn't feel that big. Despite its external appearance, the plan is a modified basilica, which is actually pretty dull. The mosaics are impressive. I did not go up to the colonnade. That is probably worth doing.

Impressive building. St. Isaac is a very beautiful church right in the middle of St. Petersburg. The interior is as impressive as the exterior. To look up into the dome is a truly beautiful sight. As for many of the churches in St.Petersburg you need to buy a ticket, about £3 for adults and again students get a reduction.
Fantastic st Petersburg. Another church worth the visit. Quiet on an early snowy evening. The church of spilt blood is better though.

Grand and historic. This cathedral has seen so much history, it has been used as a food store during the terrible war, turned into a Soviet relic during the Communist reign, and of course seen so many Russian Tsars go by. The dome is the fourth largest in the world, and stands out from the sky when you fly in. Don't miss the mallacite columns with the intricate mosaic work.
St Isaac's Catherdral St Petersburg. A jaw dropping interior and fabulous views form the top of the dome. A MUST SEE when in St Petersburg
St. Petersburg Cathedral. This is another don't miss churches of St. Petersburg. It is easy to see several of them in a morning since the ate all close to each other
impressive. This is an enormous building with an impressive interior, right in the centre of the city. Absolutely recommended!

Colonnade only. Colonnade is worth the price, and the steps. Being that high up on a cathedral is at once amazing and dizzying. Gives a good sense of place and is worthy of a visit.The vista is primarily of rooftops, and plenty of urban blah, but you can see some of the landmarks - or at least pieces of them.We didn't visit the inside, which is probably soectacular

Stunningly beautiful. This vast cathedral is well worth a visit. The building itself is amazing inside and out. The richly decorated interior with painted icons and scenes over every surface is something to behold. If you are fit enough to walk up the 262 steps to the colonnade the views over the city are amazing
Amazing. Impresive from any angle, we went on a sunny day and I thought it was the shiniest cathedral I've ever seen ! Do not miss it in St. Petersburg, amazing outside and inside !!

Shines bright from afar. We were flagging a bit on this trip so we just admired this one from the outside... church fatigue... all the buses with the tourists were just starting to park and head inside so if you want to visit the inside consider arriving early before the tourist buses..

One of the Five Tallest Domes in the World. This spectacular cathedral has one of the 5 tallest domes in the world,and has many very special features inside such as the alter, doors, and ceiling. Not as incredible as Savior on the Spilled Blood or Saint Peters & Paul Fortress, but still very much worth visiting.
Quick visit. The church is very beautiful. There is not a great deal of information to take in the museum.The view from the columnade was amazing and well worth the admission price.

One of the sights that should be seen. Interesting and evocative interior and the granite columns are awe inspiring. You can climb up to and go around the rotunda for fantastic views of the city. However, be aware that there are a lot of steps ( spiral ) and at the very top a straight staircase which has open steps. This can be a bit scary for some people ( such as me ).
One of the must sees. Beautiful cathedral. We went in late March so not crowded. Walked the 200 steps up to the balcony and the views were lovely.
must visit this cathedral. one of the place in Saint Petersburg must visit , this building one the tourist attraction and nice architectural design...

Nice cathedral but not the best in the city. Go here if you wish to have a paranomic view of the city by climbing up the cupola. But in terms of exterior and interior, there are better places. The interesting architecture would be the doors that are carved but you can see them from the exterior. It would be a nice 30 minute visit to the place and a nice starting point of your tour of the city as you can visit the cupola, the church, then stroll to the bronze horseman nearby, then walk to palace square and thereafter visit the winter palace. Nice starting point for your trip.Note that the cathedral is closed on Wednesdays.
Fantastic church - amazing views!. Climb to the tower (200+) steps and enjoy the stunning views over St Petersburg. There really isn't a view that can beat this one!

If you like gold, this is the place for you! 😄. The amount of gold is overwhelming in this cathedral... I personally didn't find it too beautiful due to the feeling of getting a bit too much of everything. It's impressive, though. A climb to the tower is worth the effort since the view from there to all directions is stunning.

“Glad we can visit”. This large domed orthodox Cathedral reminded me of the dome of the White House, it was so majestic. In front of the cathedral there stood a beautiful monument of Nicholas I and at the other side of the cathedral on Senate Square, is another famous monument “The Bronze Horseman”. The cathedral itself is so gorgeous with ancient paintings on the ceilings and walls, mosaics arts everywhere and marble columns. The tour guide told us the museum put great effort to restore and maintain the cathedral. I’m glad we had the opportunity to visit.Happy Travelling!

Beautiful museum - great story. A quick walk from the Hermitage. We loved the story about the technology behind how the cathedral was built and then hearing what happened during the Soviet era. Gorgeous paintings and mosaics.

Church With Amazing Architect. Cathedral located in the center of the city , It's a museum from Inside. My advise is go inside the cathedral and ask the guid about history, he will tell very historical things don't forgot to ask about basilica . You can Also go on the Top of the Cathedral by 269 stairs to definitely worth view at the top looking out over St Petersburg .This is the largest orthodox basilica and 4th tallest cathedra in the world . local people says that makers use 5000 tons of marble used to built this cathedra. Best time to visit early evening for capture best moment form the top of st. petersburg . About entrance fees its 300 rubles for inside view and 150 view for top. you must pay for audio guid worth 100 rubles.

Amazing architecture and craftsmanship . The inside of the Cathedral is breathtakingly beautiful, decorated with gold paintings and mosaics all over. The size is hard to grasp - the depicted dove floats 100 meters over the floor and has a wingspan of 2 meters, although it looks like a normal size dove. The roof has a nice view of the city, but is no must.

Great view from the top!. This is the largest orthodox basilica in the world. It's one really magnificent building. In my opinion it is the best to visit it during the white nights period. If you go inside make sure to ask for a guide, because they will tell you really interesting facts about the basilica. Make sure to ask about the mechanism which opens the huge doors.If you're fit you can climb to the top and there you can enjoy the beautiful view from the top. Because there are lots of tourists, I think that the best time to visit this place is early in the morning so that you can enjoy more time at the top. However during the evening you also make some great pictures from the park in front of the basilica.

Most impressive interior of a cathedral in St petersburg. This was the last cathedral visors in St petersburg and the most impressive interior for me. There are 112 huge columns that support the Cathedral that weigh over 100 tons each. Rent an audio guide for two people for only 100 rubles to learn more about how they construed the Cathedral as you view several models on display.one portion of the interior was under renovation/restoration but that didn't hinder the visit one bit. It's worth it to get a ticket to climb the 300 steps up the tower for the city views at the top and to appreciate the scale of this historic cathedral that has been rebuilt and expanded four times.

Amazing views over St Petersburg. This is another "must do" if in St Petersburg. The climb of 262 steps is definitely worth the view at the top looking out over St Petersburg particularly if you get a clear day. Entry 250.00, 150.00 for the coloande and 100.00 audio guide. 1to 2 hours is all you need, get an audio guide - it is worth it.
Climb the stair!. Amazing views. A good climb but so worth it! The view are spectacular. A look at all of St Petersburg. Only 150 to climb. Not for the frail or unfit.

Cathedral with a view. St. Isaac´s Cathedral is located in the heart of St. Pete and one of the must-see places. The cathedral itself is stunning and the exhibition inside, which tells what was going on in the cathedral during the Soviet time is really interesting.Do NOT forget to climb to the roof, the view to the city is lovely!

Picture stop in high season unless you love mosaics or icons.. Beautiful church and nice story, but if you have limited time or during busy summer tourist season, I would drive by for a requisite picture, but not spend precious time inside… unless you’re into mosaics or Russian Orthodox icons, as they are exquisite.

The Creation Of Auguste De Montferrand!. The Creation Of Auguste De Montferrand! Great son of France and Russia built the main Cathedral of the Orthodox Church in the capital of the Russian Empire! Exquisite style,impressive view from the colonnade of the city on the Neva.The pearl of the architecture in St. Petersburg!!!

A very great view. The building itself look very nice. Recommend for people who like architecture. My purpose to go there is to climb the 200 steps and have a great view of the city. U have to pay 150 for that. The entrance fee to the church is 250.

Worth a look to see how religious buildings the world over are so similar. This was the second of 3 churches/cathedrals we saw in one day. The columns are monumental and the scale of the building is spectacular. One or two interesting icons inside and a point of note is the scale model showing you how it was constructed.

Wonderful. As the last Cathedral we visited on our trip, I wondered how it would compare to the Church of the Spilled Blood, Peter & Paul Cathedral etc. But I was not disappointed. It was equally stunning and entirely worth the visit.The highlight for me, was being able to climb up to the Colonnade to see the outstanding panoramic views of the city. While 300 steps up to the top was rather daunting, and very tiring, it was worth every one of them!

Wonderful views from the top of the Dome. There are great views from the Dome (over 200 steps up) of the river and city. The cathedral is also worth going into itself. It is no longer used as a church but has some interesting mosaics etc
Beautiful building built almost completely out of marble!. Beautiful building built almost completely out of marble! Wonderful architecture and a great view from the balcony!
Great views of city . You have an opportunity to climb up to the colanade and view the city. The views are spectacular and you have a 360° view of St Petersburg.
Lovely Church. Lovely Church to see, outside lovely as well as inside. We climbed the 267 steps to top,view was nice,glad we did it.

Fantastic View. The all round view from the top of this magnificent building is worth the climb! There are about 250 steps to go up including the last say 25 in the open. We went up on a VERY cold windy day and it was still a must do!!
Great view from above!. The museum is okay, but the view is really breathtaking. Make sure to go up the collonade to get the best views in St. Petersburg and take a lot of pictures!

VERY NICE NEOCLASSICAL ARCHITECTURE. Saint Isaac's Cathedral or Isaakievskiy Sobor in Saint Petersburg, Russia is the largest Russian Orthodox cathedral in the city. It was built between 1818 and 1858, by the French-born architect Auguste Montferrand, to be one of the most impressive landmarks of the Russian Imperial capital.I recommended for everybody who arrive to st.petersburg,they should go and visit this cathedral.

Good view from the top. I visited here on 27 December 2015.
I loved this place. I paid for 150 rubles and walked to the top.
Good view, I saw many place from the top.
Another thing to don't miss. Maybe is not so beautiful visually as the Spill blood church but have a very nice history under to discover and is one of the strong points of The city!

Another "must see" in St Petersburg. This is another stunning building with a standard of design and decoration that only Rome comes close to. The icons are beautiful and again I would recommend a guide to point out some of the wonders of this building that certainly I would have missed.

Great Architecture, it take almost 40 years to built. This is an Italian style church but using by Ortodox. The building were very detail in structure, almost every detail were design carefully. No wonder it take almost 40 years to built.There was an interesting story about the church architect, that he was forecast to die after church finished to built, so in order to live longer, the architect tried to make the construction as long as it can be.... and it is true after the construction finish at 1958, the architect die.Of course you have to got a guide if you want to know the story....The dome of church was made from real gold, the picture was made by mosaic, and the floor and walls were made from the best marmer they have.Inside the church there are some souvenir shop, that I think the price is good and the quality of the souvenir also quite good.

Amazing cathedral with one of the world's largest domes. This cathedral truly is spectacular. I have been to most of the major cathedrals in Europe, and must say that St. Isaac's is one of my favourites.
While a guide is not strictly necessary, I would never-the-less recommend having one. There is much history and amazing details about this cathedral that you would otherwise miss out on.
Another Gorgeous Cathedral. Beautiful building with impressive columns on the outside. The largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest cathedral in the world. Extensive souvenir shops as well.

Colonnade review only. I have not been inside the cathedral itself, but I did visit the Colonnade in February, 2016. It was only 150 rubles and a brief climb to the best views in the city. You can do this attraction fairly quickly if you want to, so there's no excuse to miss it! Just prepare for wind. A lot of wind.

A dome with a view. We were impressed by the interiors of this cathedral, especially by the materials that were used. The green and blue malachite contrast beautifully with the gold (Russians love gold...). Never saw that effect in any other cathedral. The stained glass of the resurrection of Christ is also exceptional. Don't forget to take the steps to the top of the dome. The view is spectacular. Of course you need another ticket for this entrance...

My favorite place in St. Petersburg. Beautiful, classic cathedral. Gorgeous, traditional, awe-inspiring. My mouth literally dropped open when we entered. Don't forget a head scarf to show respect for Russian tradition.

A must see place. Wow, the architecture, the details, the colors and paintings, status... What is not to like in this place...Make sure you have a quality camera when visiting SPB in general,and St Isaac's Cathedral specifically. You will appreciate the hundreds of photos you can take in that venue only..A must see once in a life time. If you dad a bucket list, Saint Petersburg must be on that list.
Must Go to the Top!. The interior is very impressive; however, it's the view from the dome that is a must. About 300 steps to get to the top but so worth it! Worth every ruble!

Stunning cathedral!. Amazing cathedral, very beautiful inside! Entrance costs some amount of money (not much) and if you pay extra you can take the stairs to the top. There is a great view around the historic center of Peterburg from the top - appsolutely recommend climbing there! Just be aware of a potentially cold wind on the top.

Up Where The Air Is Clear.......... You get fantastic views from the colonnade. Buy a double ticket, museum and colonnade for 400 руб but it doesn't matter if you buy them separately as it still costs the same. Take your camera
No ambiance . Maybe because of the ongoing construction works or crowd I was kind of uneasy in this church. I don't know how much the building's huge construction interferes with this.

Stunning interiors. Well worth a visit. Interiors are phenomanal and on a huge scale.
The audio tour is very informative.
Make sure you get a ticket to climb up onto the dome to get breathtaking views of the city. Quite steep, narrow stairs though - make sure you are reasonably fit!

A Must See During your St. Petersburg Visit. This cathedral is absolutely incredible. The inside is absolutely stunning. For 150 extra rubles, you can climb to the top of the Colonnade which I highly recommend. There is 360 degree view of St. Petersburg and you are able to see the entire city. It's actually not a bad walk up the spiral staircase and is enclosed until you get near the top. I believe it is around 260 steps (and they are even marked in increments of 10) with landings if you want to take a break. Definitely worth the climb. The cathedral and colonnade are definitely worth the visit. From a practical perspective, I went on an icy day and the footpath around the entire cathedral had not been salted and was very slippery so be careful if you are walking around on a cold icy day. It may not seem like a big deal but the taxi dropped me off at the front and I had to walk to the ticket booth which was behind and then back to the front to the entrance. The exit to the cathedral is at the back so you have to walk to the front again to climb the Colonnade so another icy trip so just be careful. This is something you simply must put on your itinerary when coming to St. Petersburg.

Beautiful Cathedral . St. Isaac's is the stand out point of St. Petersburg - you can see the dome from most places across the city and it is as impressive as people say. You can visit both the inside of the cathedral and walk up the colonnade to see the view from the edge of the dome. The interiors are beautiful, despite some renovations currently being undergone which mean the south wing is out of bounds. At the top of the colonnade, you can see all of St. Petersburg, from the port & sea to the fortress and down Nevsky Prospekt. It is around 210 steps to the top so not too far to walk up (you can pause for a break if it's not too busy) and most are internal so those who are afraid of heights, like myself, should be able to make it. Both the interior and colonnade are well worth the (very cheap) entrance fee.

Very interesting . Definitely a place to see along with the church of spilled blood. Beautiful architecture and many interesting facts. View from the colonnade is breathtaking, but don't go if you have walking difficulties because there are 300 steps. Tickets are 400R for museum and the colonnade.

Wonder of the world. I really can't say words to explain how wonderful this place is.... the guide gave us a comprehensive history and it was one of the best places I have ever been-- including the mosques in Istanbul ! If there is a place you must visit , it is St Petersburg ... go on , you know you have to put it on your Bucket List !

Wow. There is so much to see in St Petersburgh St Isaacs is breathtaking did a tour but two days there wasn't enough though the company alla tours were amazing would recommend them in a instant did everything in a small party got us back in plenty of time
Recommend for history lovers. My wife and I enjoyed our visit to this cathedral. The building alone is outstanding! We had our private tour on a weekday morning and loved every minute of it.
Better inside than out. Much more interesting inside than the exterior which is dark and looks more gloomy on a cloudy or wet day.
Fairylike St Petersburg. Climbing in the tower you will discover a beautiful view to the City,special in the evening..it was really Amazing
Magnificent. It took 40 years to build the cathedral. Rich of history, details and colors simply magnificent. A must see.

Very nice. Saint Isaac's is the largest Russian Orthodox cathedral in St. Petersburg.
The exterior is typical neoclassical in a traditional Russian-Byzantine formula of a Greek-cross ground plan and is faced with gray and pink stone, and features a total of 112 red granite columns with Corinthian capitals. The inside is now a museum and is well worth a visit.

One of the most awesome places to visit in St Petersburg. This place is amazing, among all the other churches, this one was one of the highlights. The entrance fee is 250 Rubels, per person, which was worth it since this place is very well maintained. amazing paintings and mozaics inside and the ceiling will make your jaw drop! Pay attention to the door as well, they are made of steel and wood, about 20 cm thick.
Rich history. Amazed by the grandness of the church buildings. The local worshipper did not mind us wandering around.

Nice and authentic. We have visited this big cathedral and suddenly an orthodox ceremony has started. If you can visit this cathedral while there is an orthodox mess, I strongly recommend. The entrance is free and definitively a must go in St. Petersburg

Interesting cathedral, offers fantastic views of the city. St. Isaac's Cathedral is worth going to. Despite not being of any particular faith, I stilled enjoyed the cathedral. Definitely go up the 200+ staircase to the viewing platform. While it was windy, there was excellent 360 degree views of the city. The interior is also quite grand.

St. Isaac's Cathedral is a Great Museum. On September 6th 2015, our tour group accompanied with our SBP guide visited St. Isaac’s Cathedral. This cathedral which opened in 1858 is gigantic and beautiful. My wife and I were comparing it in style and size to ST. Paul’s Cathedral in London, England and St. Peter’s Basilica in Rome, Italy which we have already visited. This cathedral took at least 40 years to build and was intended to be the greatest one in the Russian Empire; however it is still officially a museum today. The interior central dome is very height and magnificently decorated. The paintings are still very well preserved and colorful. We noticed many sculptures and reliefs on the inside and outside of the cathedral, and the many granite columns at the front entrance.A nice photo to take is from the outside close to the Monument to Nicholas I in the center of St. Isaac’s Square facing the cathedral. This tour is also a five (5) stars in my book.

Impressive and scary. Reading the history on the construction of this cathedral makes you realise that the city is built on bones of workers that died. However the impressive achitecture and the many amazing elements make a visit worthwhile. Go there early in the day, queues will be be smaller. Impressive!!

Awe-inspiring.. Loved the rich history and the incredible architecture. I stayed for a long time and really enjoyed the beauty and the power of this incredible structure. So many rich and beautiful decorations. Rent the head sets and enjoy the tour. It was really good.

Stunning and the view from the top is amazing. Another piece of stunning architecture with an interior to match. The steps to the top are rather tiring, but when you get there, the view is breath-taking and definitely well worth the climb.
Sites of the city . Great building make sure you view from the top you can see all of St peterborg you will need to be good with heights

Be prepared to crane your neck!. The murals on the ceilings are absolutely breathtaking, we must have spent nearly 3 hours staring at all of the artwork. One of my highlights of Saint Petersburg and the view from the top is fantastic if you go in the evening
Most beautiful cathedral ever!. Was completely blown away with the art of this building... The gold, every inch outside covered in mosaic images... A definite to do! Loved loved this!

Beautiful. Its beautiful and you will also get a discount of the fee with a valid student ID. You are allowed to take pictures, but a small part is preserved for the church users so don't take a photo of them and respect their privacy.

Lovely Grand. Visited many times. Superior Cathedral Very beautiful inside
Clean and full of people always Must see when visit

Outstanding stone work!. This church is made from several different colour granite (and other ) stones. The grey columns outside are from one piece and makes u wonder how they were tranported (From Finland) and erected in their places. Thousand of workers for 40 years....

Stunning building... You can go inside, apparently.. My partner and I were bumbling through St Petersburg en route to the Hermitage when we came across St Isacc's. It is an architectural gem. We were sat across from the Cathedral in the gardens, taking in the beauty... However, in -12 it isn't advisable to let the cold set in and opted to carry on our way when we noticed 2 people walking around on the upper level.... I'm sure the view across the gardens would have been lovely but we chose not to turn back.

Go for sunset on the roof of St P!. This is one of the must-do locations on your 'church day' in St Petersburg, but make sure to go at sunset and get the best views across the city from the top of the 260-something steps to the collonade. It's absolutely the most breathtaking part of the (outdoor) visit. Meanwhile, inside you can view incredible architectural features, stunning mosaics, and beautiful paintings that adorn the walls. Make sure to look up! Particularly at the main dome, the dove at the pinnacle of the spherical painting is really something to behold.As always, I recommend a tour - I just got the audio version and it was great value for your 50 US cents or whatever it is. I also eavesdropped just a little on the English guided tours going around and they seemed strong as well (although probably a touch more expensive). Finally, there are blessings available in the small altar which you can quietly and respectfully view if you're a non-believer. These give you a bit of an insight into the religious practices and are quite interesting to observe.
Breathtaking. This is one of the most impressive churches I've visited, its really breathtaking. The paintings and ceilings are full of details, is really beautiful. Definitely worth to visit.
Beautiful architecture. We actually visited in 2014, this is such an impressive Cathedral, the artwork and paintings inside were stunning, definitely worth a visit.
Do not miss it. An example of greatness and fantastic architecture, not only outside or on the top with amazing views but also on the inside, simply amazing.

Beautiful Cathedral. Fell in love with it's architecture and beautiful colours and design. The history is also beautiful, one of the most recommended places to visit in Saint Petersburg, Russia.
The church was commissioned by Alexandra I, and has been designed by a French architect.

Fantastic church - the colonnade is a must!!. We visited on the 28th December and there weren't too many queues which was lovely.The inside is beautiful and so impressive. The English audio tour is full of so much information it's definitely worth listening to (even if I did skip a few bits).The really amazing part is the colonnade which we weren't expecting (and I wouldn't have got my mum to go up if we had known!!). It's a 262 step climb to the top of the dome (circa 115m high) and it gets very narrow and windy at the top!! The views are breathtaking and definitely worth it - but probably not a wise choice for anyone afraid of heights or confined spaces (the winding stairs get very narrow).
Beautiful.... What a great place, lots of beautifully maintained architecture and history. Highly recmmend a visit.

Dome was shut. The church was really intersting and pretty inside but I was disappointed that the dome was shut so we were unable to climb to the top which was what I had wanted to do (ive heard its a good view) and wasnt told that it was shut when i brought my ticket

St. Isaac's not for everyone. Climbing the two hundred steps was not the problem, but the last outdoor section, narrow and exposed, gave me serious vertigo. The views from the top seemed okay, from what I could tell. I was relieved to get down. The interior of the cathedral is rather cold and severe. It looks as it was built out of hubris rather than devotion.The building is a city landmark, and rightly so.

Climb the stairs for a great view!. The cathedral is well worth a visit in itself but what most tour guides won't do is take you up the steps to the colonnade where there are great views over the city.

Only got to see this from the outside. Along the main Nevskiy Prospect, it is hard to miss. A beautiful structure once again in the heart of Saint Petersburg and practically opposite the Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood. Unfortunately it was under renovation upon my visit, but beautiful to see from the outside. There is a park in front of it where you can sit and enjoy a warm cup of coffee and do some people watching. Nevskiy Prospect is a more than buzzing place.
The top view!. Definately go on the colonnade and see St. Petersburg from the top! The view is amazing due to a impressive location of St. Isaac`s Cathedral.
Absolute marvel. A must to see! Do go inside and let its beauty overwhelm you! It is easily to be reached on foot or by the sight seeing bus that has a stop here

Comparable to St. Paul's in London. After you have done everything in St. Petersburg make sure you keep 45 minutes to visit this Cathedral. It is immense, it is beautiful. Make sure you make the time to go up on the colonnade where you will get a great view of the city.

Stunning. Beautiful Cathedral - the largest in Russia
You can walk up 200 plus stairs to get a view from the top of the City.
Very pretty from the outside if you go in Winter as Christmas lights adorn the park opposite which make it very picturesque.
Beautiful inside - well worth a visit

Most beautiful interior of a cathedral in Saint Petersburg. Amazing cathedral showing great opulence on the interior with lots of gilt silver and murals. It is iconic on the city skyline and one can get a great view of the city here. Student holders of an ISIC card get a discounted entrance fee. It is a must-see on any visit to Saint Petersburg.
Worth the cheap entrance fee!. This is an amazing Church from the outside and the inside and so reasonable. Also recommend the hike up to the top for the great views
Stunning architecture with superb views over the city.. Visit if for no other reason to view the city from The Colonnade. NB Tickets purchased from booth to the side before entry.
Very nice and adorable cathedral. its amazing good cathedral with 360 view of city... inside of cathedral also very nice ...you have to visit this cathedral once

Perfect view from colonnade . I can only recommend to get the audio guide and get informed about this wonderful church! Totally worth to see! Especially on sunny days, one has a great view over st. Petersburg from the colonnade

Perfect to see the sunset. Perfect to do as I did with my boyfriend. At the last day of our trip we decided to go to the top of the cathedral to see the sunset. Was a good goodbye to this lovely city.

Must see in St. Petersburg. St.Isaac's Cathedral is surely one of Europes great cathedrals - and as the hole city of St. P. it has a lot of history to offer - especially if you are interested i WW ll.

one more place for perfect memories. this is a great place to visit, great location , plus you can go up to the top and see the view of the city from above....the view is breathtaking, but just mind the stairs while climbing, woud not recommend on a rainy day:)
Colossal, Impressive . To think this enormous, elaborate, heavy as the dickens, cathedral was designed and constructed on marshland boggles the mind. The interior is beautiful.

Beautiful inside and a great view of St.Petersburg. This amazing church / museum has a beautiful interior and access to the rooftop for a 360 view of the city. The museum includes a history of the Cathedral during the bolshevik revolution and the subsequent reconstruction.Entrance to the rooftop is a separate entrance and an additional fee.The spiral stairs open up to an outside stair to top. the exit is a separate stair that ends across the street from the park with the statue of Peter the Great. (a very short walk) so plan to do both while you are there.
A must see. A must see attraction in St Peterbourg. So much history, culture, desing beauty and also has a top area to take a walk and a picture.

worth visiting both the museum and the collonade. St Isaac's is more of a museum than a traditional russian churhch,but its interior gives a very good impression of the time it was built in, the influences of the European masterpieces that are incorporated into it: the window (never seen anything like that in any of the Russian churches), the doors (very close to the ones you see in Florence), the dome (you can easily see in any European town)... And the collonade: the view is breathtaking (but definitely put some warm clothes on) and be ready to climb a lot of stairs (!)

The colonnade. It is certainly worth visiting St Isaacs cathedral although not as impressive as the cathedral of the Spilled Blood. Extraordinary to think of it as a museum and even more so as a museum of atheism!The climb to the colonnade is well worth the effort.
Sight Seeing. This place absolutely blew us away, & I don't think our teenagers were expecting to be. It is just such an enormous piece of incredible art/architecture.

A bit underwhelming. We visited late on in afternoon about 4.30. It was quiet and the inside very large and nicely decorated but not breathtakingly so.What I didn't like was you had to go out of the cathedral and walk all the way round the outside to get to the entrance to the colonnade - the balcony which runs all the way round the dome. 275 steps but the views were worth it. After the Saviour on the Spilled Blood church I found it a little underwhelming.

wonderful. when I saw it from out side ,it was one of the best building I have ver seen even out side is like art,inside is mind blowing ,definetly I recomend to go top of the cathedral amazing view of the st.petersburg

astonishing. Obviously it is a must to visit in this city. One of the world wonders both in architecture and art. Admiring mosaics inside. Secret tip: just join and listen the guided groups inside (all major languages) for free.Don't be lazy to go up the 260 steps to the roof - amazing view of the whole city.Entrance is reasonable and there is no queue.

You can't miss it. This Cathedral is the reason of thousands tourists coming to St. Pete. Don't miss a chance to burn some calories and get rid of fear of height, and get on the top of Cathedral. You won't regret it, but be ready to escape from other tourists' selfy sticks and prepare yourself to wait a little to get a nice spot for taking pics.

The Largest Orthodox Basilica in the world with extra rich decoration. It is the largest Orthodox Basilica and the 4th tallest Cathedral in the world after St. Peter's in Rome, St. Paul's in London and the Santa Maria del Flore in Florence. St.Isaac of Dalmatia was the patron Saint of Peter the Great, as he was born on the day that this Saint was celebrated. Built from 1818 - 1858 by French architect Auguste de Montferrand, it was ordered by Tsar Alexander I and the cost reached the amount of 1.000.000 gold rubles, six times more than the cost of the Winter Palace! The 40 years of construction left an expression in the Finnish language - To build like St.Isaac's Church - meaning something that never ends. In 1931, after the Russian Revolution, the building was stripped from all its treasures and became The Museum of Atheism! The dove symbolizing the Holy Spirit, was replaced by the Foucault pendulum according to Copernicus' theory. In 1937 it became the Cathedral's Museum and remains a Museum up to now. Only exceptional religious services take place here from time to time. The design and especially the Dome, influenced the building of the United States Capitol, the Wisconsin State Capitol and the Helsinki Cathedral.There are 112 red granite Corinthian pillars around the building. The portico columns were raised using wooden frameworks, a model of which is displayed inside the Cathedral.14.000 people may stand in the interior that covers 4.000 sq.m. 400 kg of gold, 1000 tons of bronze and 16 tons of malachite, 43 kinds of minerals and 14 different marbles were used for the decoration. The mosaics cover 600 sq.m. surface.24 angels by Josef Hermann surround the Dome, 101.5 m high and fully covered by 100 kgs of pure gold. The bronze doors of each entrance with reliefs by Ivan Vitali are designed after the Baptistery in Florence.If you have time, you may climb the 262 steps, at an extra cost, to the colonnade walkway to have an unforgettable view over St.Petersburg.
Amazing Cathedral!. Worth a visit. Fantastic views and interesting to see. We went there during mass at 17:30 so extra special!

Absolute must when in St Peter!. Best deal to buy "Four cathedrals tour" right here, in St Isaak.It's not every day, just go to their website.Price is unbeatable! For 1000 roubles= 15 $!! you have guided tours of FOUR Cathedrals, including this one and a Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood and 2 less famous.No lines, and you are transported in a nice bus from one to the next seeing the city on the way.Absolute incredible value for a city of this class.Travelling in Russia has never been so affordable.

One of the greatest cathedrals of St.Petersburg. Great impression. The interior is unique. Very rich decoration and unique technologies.We didn't expect that every half our you can join a guided tour.The guide gave a very thorough lecture about the history of the cathedral.The view from the colonnade is also worth seeing. Necessary to visit.
wow. Another fabulous Cathedral. It is just amazing to think what happened in these cities and what was lost, and then rebuilt back to it's original splendor!

Wonderful Architecture. This building has a long history with an innovative construction methods of using the columns. The inside of the building has beautiful mosaics Been a solo traveller I did find it a little difficult to enjoy all the building had to offer because of the number of tourist groups in it. Every time you stopped to look at any feature you ended up with a tour guide crowding you out and talking loudly. Notwithstanding that I strongly recommend visiting this building.One thing I did find of all the major tourist attractions in St. Petersburg was they have DVDs available in a number of languages available with both high quality photography and excellent descriptions of all aspects of the building. I made a collection of these DVDs that I am going through now that I am back in Australia. Having watched these since I came back I only wish I had had them before going there as it would have given me a must greater appreciation of each of the buildings I visited. But I will come back now that I have seen a small part of what is on offer.

Very european from the outside, but inside it is truly a russian-orthodox church. We were lucky enough to visit the church while there was a service on a sunday. We tried to be respectful and blend in. This was a very special experience, seeing a church being used for what it was built and not a museum.Also, it is wonderful example how a western style as classicism has been connected with russian tradition.

Majestic, marvelous and must see. this Cathedral has a noble history and picturesque view both outside and inside.A lot of precious stones and even gold were used in construction. Many wonderful paintings are placed in its decoration. what is more, its top has a very nice place to look at St Petersburg from 100 metres height. There is one more benefit here. It is situated in a very nice district: historical buildings, a nice square and park surround it. You easy find a nice cafe to rest and continue to explore this super city.

Must in St Petersburg. One more attraction that you have to visit. From the top you can see all the great city... Fantastic architecture, great guides inside.Of course it is better to visit summer time, when you can go out at the outside terrase on the top.but even winter time do not miss it....
Very good view of the City..... I was there early in August. It has amazing view,and enjoyed very much.Specially single piece of Gravure worthed to see.
Nice view. You have to go onside on the top and see the nice view of St. Peterbourg.The view is the important thing in my opinion, but also inside is requested one visit.

Magnificent Old Church. Our tour guide commented that, during the heyday of Communism, churches were open, but only as museums. St. Isaac's is a gorgeous old church, with exquisite art and architecture at every turn. You can climb up into a tower to get a fantastic view of St. Petersburg; however, it requires climbing over 200 steps, so it is not for the faint of heart.

Superb Cathedral. This Cathedral has a massive presence. It has one of the largest domes. It is an imposing structure.This place is not to be missed on the tour of St Petersburg.Wonderful photo opportunity.

No.1 in SPB. Visit this cathedral by all means.Everything there is ideal: starting from the graden and square in front of it and ending with the architecture and atmosphere that help you understand Russian art (and mentality) better.

St Pete's Golden eye. The Dome of this magnificent building dominates the skyline of St Petes.Equally you get a magnificent view of the city if you climb the many steps up to the collonade.Extraordinary feat to construct this cathedral.A model of the Wooden framework is on display that was used to lift up the giant columns and set in place.Icon's a shrine and mosaics are evident inside and the giant bronze door's adorned with reliefs depicting history are quite impressive.Not to be missed if you visit St Petes.
Great view!. Visit the church and go up to have one of the most amazing views of Peter. Highly recommended. You can buy tickets for church and colonnade together.

Amazing views. We only visited the outside portion of the Cathedral and climbed the steps to view Saint Petersburg from above. The views of the city from the Cathedral are really stunning. We did not visit the interior of the Cathedral, but only the view form Saint Isaac's Cathedral is a must see in Saint Petersburg.

A must for all the tourists. . The majestic hall with the high pillars and dome of the church, now a state museum, is really worth a visit. The enormous but precious paintings leave a lasting impression. I lived close by and often visited with our visiting relatives or friends. I could never get enough of the St. Isaacs Cathedral. One of my favourite places in town.
Beautiful Old Cathedral. This was a beautiful cathedral with a lot of detailed tilework and artwork in it. Although the outside looks plain, the inside is very ornate.

a absolute must see in peter. a absolute must see in peter plan on a few hours and climb the steps to see the city from a bird's eye view. its amazing and worth every minute. then go inside a get the audio guild to get a real feel of the place
Commanding. St. Isaac's dominates the view at the heart of St. Petersburg, and is a sight not to be missed. The scale is breathtaking and is well worth a visit!
What a view. . The cathedral itself is impressive both inside and out but the view of St Petersburg from the top is stunning. We were fortunate to visit on a bright, clear day to get maximum benefit.
Great views from the roof. Enormous cathedral. The views from the roof on a clear day are excellent. See the city from on high! Be ready to climb over 200 steps to the top though!
Cathedral with a Gold Coated Dome!. St. Isaac Cathedral is one of the largest Cathedral in the world with a gigantic golden dome that towers over a sea of neo-classical buildings.

Outdoors of St isaac's. I'm an outdoors person so I didnt go in. But the building looks really nice from the outside and it is very near 2 beautiful parks. One is Alexender garden and another small park with roses around it. This cathedral is also good for photos at any angle.
Nice view. Seeing the whole city from the top is amazing. You have to go there at least the sun is shining. It's lovely view.

Awe and Reverence Live Here. This cathedral is across from the Four Seasons - and is a beautiful, yet simple place to visit. You can spend a half hour here and feel satisfied that you've seen one of the wonders of the world. You can light a candle for a loved one, buy souvenirs at the cute little shops and get some great pictures. Mostly, the hushed tones of visitors will help you feel peaceful and enjoy a sense of stillness. I was in awe at how beautiful the architecture is inside the cathedral on every inch of the interior. Bring your camera, yet no camera can capture what your eyes will see. There's also a second ticket you can buy to go up to the top and see the city view. If you have time view both the cathedral and the city view. Bring a few rubles to purchase your candle.
A central landmark. Not only was this an architectural marvel but marked a base for us whilst visiting. Well worth a visit to the catherdral but only do the collinade if heights are OK

Recommended for birds eye view of city. Excellent view of the city! Very good way to 'get your bearings'! I worried that view from lower of two colonnades would not be worth it but it definitely was! Upper colonnade was closed when we visited. I can imagine access to this getting very crowded if it is ever open!

Really beautiful. I found the dome mesmerizing. Also enjoyed the history of the dome as a shelter during WW2 and the surrounding land used to grow crops and vegetables to feed the starving population. Really interesting site!
Russia's version of St. Marks. Built by the Russian Czars to rival St. Marks. Great Mosaics and paintings. Bronze doors are very inspirational.

Great for the view so buy a ticket for the colonnade. Interior is impressive but the murals are modern ones. Very extravagant interior and worth entering. 150RUB.
The best part is the colonnade - a separate ticked 250RUB. The view from the top is great. It's around 260 steps.

Another place a must to see. Not that old, but beautiful piece of architecture of the capital city. The gallery on the top not necessary to visit, but the main space with beautiful stones design is great
Nice but not outstanding cathedral. Beautiful inside and worth a short visit but not outstanding. Well lit for pictures. Can be crowded with tour groups.

Brief Stop. We stopped at St Isaac's Square and St Isaac's Cathedral. The Statue is of Nicholas I, very impressive when you consider that the mounting of the horse is just on the two hooves. The ladies around the statue are Wisdom, Justice and Might. While St Isaac's Cathedral was meant to be the greatest in all Russia so large sums of money were spent on this church. It stand on over a hectare of land and has the 4th larges domed cathedral of its type in the world. A number of eminent artist and sculptors were brought in to decorate. Because it was difficult to maintain a constant temperature in the building a lot of the original work had to be replaced with mosaics. Which are just as outstanding.

Just Awesome. Really striking and impressive architecture and stuffed full with the most wonderful art and artifacts. I particularly enjoyed the painting of Eden and the mindboggling, huge columns of malacite and lapis. Never seen the like anywhere else.

Worth a trip to the top!. The inside is quite a spectacle, but make sure you check out the top! It's a great view of St. Petersburg, probably one of the best in the historic city center! Highly recommend! (and it's a nice leg workout too!)
Stunning. Definitely not to be missed! It has an extremely beautiful interior, and the views from the colonnade are worth the effort.
History. While we didn't actually go inside we learnt about how the art works of St Petersburh were hidden here during WWII. Again, so much history
Grandious church. Another place in St. P that is not be missed. It is beautiful inside but the sheer size of the place is mesmerizing. The columns you see under the coupola must be 10 ft in diameter.

This was one of our favorites in Saint Petersburg. We could not believe the massive engineering undertaking this was at the time. How could this have been built? And the incredible mosaics and artwork. Not to be missed- get a guide if you can.

Stunning. Amazing mosaics, lavish sculptural art and monumental columns, two made of lapis lazuli and ten made of malachite. St,Isaccs was once the largest cathederal in Russia. Its gold dome can be seen from all over the city as it proudly sits on its elevated position on the banks of the Neva.
Perfect view of the city!. If you want to fall in love with Saint Petersburg, you have to climb to the top of this cathedral. Just awesome!
Huge. after the Vatican and St Pauls ST isaacs has the largest dome. It must also be one of the largest cathedrals in the world. Full of gold and icons it is a must see

Nice view...many stairs. A great looking cathedral.
We came a bit late (17:30) so we had to choos: going inside or climb to the top to see the view. We picked optin #2,and after 281! Staris we fame to the top for a nice st.petersburg view.

St. Isaac's Cathedral State Museum.. It was out first time to visite St. Petersburg & St. Isaac's Cathedral.
We loved it. So amazing with all the arts architecture and beautiful arts. We would love to come back again if we have a opportunity. We think every one would love it.
St Isaacs Cathedral. Great views from the top by climbing 260 steps. Inside full of colourful mosaics and paintings plus stained glass windows.

Magnificent!!. A giant cathedral which golden giant dome at top. Classic Greece black marble column style. Copper carving Christian saint on door panel entrance and niche.
Inside there are big drawing about Jesus. The last supper and 13 jesu followers.
A window wall carving painting. A big altar. Talisman sell for believers. You should not miss it.

Stunning View and Incredible Church. You can do 2 visits in 1: go to the colonnade and enjoy a stunning view of the city after a 260 something steps climb. Go there right before sunset , the light will be amazing.Then go to the museum / church ( you have to pay again ) and enjoy huge interior very nicely decorated and with a stunning iconostasis. The dimensions are breath taking.Enjoy!

Breathtaking!. We visited St. Isaac's Cathedral twice and were simply in awe! It's just so impressive with it's enormous gilded dome. The interior of the cathedral felt like viewing an art treasury with many painted and mosaic panels and the architecture consists of marble, lapis lazuli, malachite, and did I mention gold? Lol! There is such an incredible amount of detail! It's a definite must-see, and if you are able to climb the never ending staircase to the top, you will see the most breathtaking views of the city and certainly not regret it! I'd love to return again once the snow falls and climb to the top for spectacular snowy city views. They can't be beat!

Beautiful View of the City. Gorgeous interiors of the Cathedral. But please climb the steps of the Colonnade to see enjoy beautiful views of the city. However, please read about all the details of how the church was constructed.

Enormous Church with ornate beauty on the interior. The Cathedral is imposing on the outside and not very ornate, but the giant columns are magnificent. However the interior was the complete opposite. Beautiful lacquer color everywhere. The church is decorated on every inch with delightful objects.
Breath-taking view. Highly recommend to buy the tickets to go all the way up. You get to see the whole of Saint Petersburg from there. Perfect place for the panorama shot.

Hard but beautiful. 411 steps up and down os hard for some people.
But.................The veiw amazing one...
YOU HAVE TO DO IT!!!@@@!!!!!!!!!!!!
The landmark!!. This is a majestic building with beautiful interiors. The sculptures and sheer massive structure. Do take tickets for the observatory at the top.
amazing atmosphere. Once again a place of worship - you feel part of the community here - fantastic icons and very orderly queues to kiss them

Great view of the city from the colonnade. Amazing museum.. We went about 10am, and we had to stand around in the freezing cold as tickets don't go on sale until 10.30am. Still it was worth the wait. The the building is amazing to look at, and has been restored perfectly. The view from the colonnade across the city is fantastic.
Saint Isaac's surpasses Saint Peter's in Rome , without doubt !. DONT turn your back on the Sacred Icons ! The local's will be seriously upset ! The Sunday Mass on the left-hand Altar is wonderful.

More than Just a Cathedral. Our guide told us that this is a former "Museum of Atheism". My question was, "What do you display in a museum of atheism"?
This is, though, a beautiful look at religious paintings (Spilt Blood was mosaics)>

Big church, big dome.. A big church. I was a little over visiting churches by late evening, so I climbed the +218 steps up to the top around the dome. St Petersburg is rather flat with regulation height limits, so it was to get a panoramic outlook. Not too exciting. Huge spotlights made it difficult to take pictures. Climb back down.
A MasterPiece. St. Isaac's Cathedral State Museum is a MasterPiece in St Petersburg right in the center of town beautiful.

Stunning and magnificent.. It is hard to believe that this cathedral was constucted in the first half of the 17th Century. The granite columns are said to each weigh 80 tons each and the mosaic icons must be seen. It is now used as a museum but I believe that services are held on important holy days.

Massive Russian Opulence. Beautiful cathedral with extreme Russian opulence. Once inside, it doesn't seem crowded, but is visited by many tour buses during the day. This is a not to be missed attraction in St. Petersburg.

Majestic. It is quite huge inside..I think its the fourth largest in the world. I was quite amazed by the mosaics, they were simply incredible! I climbed up to the colonnaded walk next to the dome on top; the views were very good and the climb not too hard.

The fourth largest cathedral in the world. St Isaacs took 40 years to build and entailed driving thousands of piles into the ground to stabilise the fenland. Completed in 1858 it became a storage facility after the revolution and later a museum. The dome was painted grey in the war and miraculously it escaped damage. Although it is, in fact, the largest Orthodo cathedral its rather 4-square appearance belies its size.
See it.. Also very beautiful inside. Easily accessed within the historical city center. I recommend you see it.

The most impressive church I saw in SPB. Don't miss this one. I'm not an art/architecture person by any means, and I am not qualified to "analyze" such things, but St. Isaac's was breathtaking. The murals on the walls and ceilings were incredible in their detail and vividness. I told people that while walking through it, I still didn't quite believe it was real! The whole place is incredibly well-maintained and was very cheap to enter, I bought the combined ticket which included the Colonnade (walking to the top of the tower for a view of the city), and I think the total cost was 480 rubles. The Colonnade wasn't so amazing to me and the view wasn't breathtaking, but since you're there already, you might as well go up and see it.
A Must See !!. Interior of the cathedral is magnificent. We were lucky enough to have a tour guide that explained much of the history which made our visit even more interesting and unforgetable

Definitely worth a visit. This is the fourth largest church in the world. The interior is beautifully decorated and mostly a museum, as are many of the old churches. There is a side altar still used for church services. You can buy a ticket to ascend to the dome for a great view of the city.

Cathedral Museum. This was a cathedral with all of the religious trimming you would expect. stunning murals, high domes beautifully decorated and traditional orthodox icons all around you. And today being Sunday we witnessed an orthodox service being conducted on the lefthand side of the main alter.

Outstanding Cathedral. The Isaac's Cathedral is one of most interesting landmarks of the city.During your visit pay attention to the majestic nave with the malachite columns, the dome ceiling paintings and the vaste doors decorated with carved biblical scenes. Climbing 210 steps to the cathedral top balcony is relatevly easy. The steps are wide and used in one way direction. The Isaac's square view from the top is beautiful and the roof angels statues are impresive. At night the building is lighted offering a great photo taking opportunity.

See the city from the above. The old cathedral that was moved back from museum to church in '86 or so. Still charge you to get in, and if you are really after churches - this is worth to see.Besides the church, you can claim almost 300 steps to see the city from the top. Russian-speaking audio running non-stop explaining you what you see. Go up only if air is clear.
Beutiful cathedral. Well reservedGood gidence- they know the material snd explaine real good.There is one mosaic from munich on the chapel
