Fabulous Cathedral. Awe inspiring Cathedral, absolutely breathtaking. This is a do not miss on any trip to St. Petersburg.

Great architecture. This cathedral is one of the most beautiful from all I've ever seen! It looks huge and it is really awesome outside as well as inside. And I liked the view from the colonade! to go up on this high really worth it!

Near other attractions. You may be short for time or scared of being ripped off by taxis. So do like we did and take a quick walking tour of the city. Street vendors will take euros. Lovely museum! We also took a bus tour that gave us time to explore on our own. Even in May the weather was cold and rainy so bundle up.
See this. Again this is easy to get to, and yet another beautiful church, lovingly restored and lots of history.

Scale and design are on the grandest scale. The scale of this building and the way it was constructed is fascinating. The climb to the Colonade is worth the effort even if some of the views are not aprticularly memorable

Beautiful inside and out!. Along with the Church on the Spilt Blood, this is a must see. There are 2 parts: the museum and then the outside colonnade that surrounds the dome. We rented the audio guide and found it very informative and easy to follow. The central dome of the church the 4th tallest (if I remember correctly) and it is surrounded by paintings and glittering mosaics as is customary in the Russian Style. We both got sore necks from looking up so much! We haven't visited the colonnade yet-- but we've heard the views of the city are wonderful.
Golden Globe. Stunning building from the outside, treasures galore inside, it's in a very busy area of the city, so using some form of public transport would be advisable.
Beautiful. Beautiful church in the centre of St.Petersburg! It is huge and inside so rich in marble, icons, gold,..

Best view of the city. This is a great way to get a 360 degrees breathtaking view of the city on the mid level walkway wrapping around the dome, as well as getting a good workout going up the stairs. It gets a bit tight going up but it's not bad and worth it.

It was a great. Our guide Valery answered all our questions, included all attractions we asked and was very enthusiastic. She easily adjusted our agenda as we went along on the day of the tour. She is also a pro at all cozy nooks and off the beaten path of St Petersburg. It was a great cultural experience to hang out with an insider. We were very happy with her knowledge and great personality. Thank you so much!
Definitely walk up to the tower. Basically another neo-classic design church with some interesting touches, but be sure to walk up to the tower for the great view of St. Petersburg.

Another Cathedral. Some very interesting aspects on how the construction took place are shown inside. Some of our earlier building friends were very well informed and managed to build splendid Cathedrals without the modern machines we have now. I personally do not get overly excited about Cathedrals, This one is not an exception. After a tour through the Loire Valley in France a few years ago I can safely say it has to be good to impress me these days.This one falls a bit short of my mark.
Great Сathedral in the city center. The cathedral is located in the city center. On the dome of the cathedral there is an observation deck, which offers magnificent views of Saint-Petersburg
huge. Another must visit, this Cathedral has magnanimous dimensions not forgetting the marshlands it was built on. Totally covered with art works on the inside walls.
Impressive and worth a good look. The size and detail of this Cathedal makes it a must see when in Piter. Also the view from the ring is great.
Must see. So beautiful from inside to outside cathedral. Must see when you are in St petersburg!!! Don't have enough energy to climb up to see great view.
Another Special Church. Again this is a fantastic piece of architecture and full of historic facts. It is on the top list of Church attractions in the city. there is a fee and of course a crowd.

One of the largest Russian Orthodox cathedral. The largest Russian Orthodox cathedral in the city and fourth largest in the world. The neoclassical exterior expresses the traditional Russian-Byzantine formula. This is the fourth version of the same cathedral.

Not to be missed!. This magnificent church now a museum is so amazing in that it is the 4th largest cathedral in the world and holds 14,000 people. It was built between 1818 and 1858 and has splendid mosaics and many beautiful columns build of granite. There is a separate ticket to the dome (covered in gold) that involves about 300 stairs but affords a splendid view of the historic part of St. Petersburg. Learning the history of the building is truly fascinating and well worth the time to seek out.

One of the must-see attractions of St. Petersburg. It is impressive, it is imposing, it is grand and monumental. Did it touch my heart? Not really. What I found most amazing was the model of the actual building and hoisting of the columns, tucked away in a corner. Each of those columns was hoisted mechanically in just 45 minutes? Incredible! What precision planning that took!

Excellent, do not miss neither of the parts!. It has two parts to visit; one part is inside the cathedral where the wall paintings and the alter is quite marvelous, and the upper part where you can see the whole city from above and can enjoy the good weather as much as possible. Do not miss neither of them!

Highly recommend for views!. Really amazing church. The inside is very ornate and has very cool mosaics of Bible scenes and is worth visiting. The best part though is climbing up to the top for the view over SPB, where you can see the other churches in the distance, the Hermitage, the river, etc. Really cool! Not too many stairs in comparison to other churches I have climbed up in Europe, but of course you have to climb up a ways. There is a separate fee to visit the inside and for the tower, but it is not that expensive.
Opulent cathedral. Huge cathedral. The pillars are 100 tons each. The dome is gold plated. The interior is full of beautiful mosaic work. The interior of the dome is stunning.
Just amazing!. Just amazing, architecture, structure, ambience of the place, beautiful feel in the cathedral, really stunning, on the same level at the Blue Mosque in Istanbul.

Magnificient!. St. Isaacs is so grand and majestic that one wonders how they could build something so amazing two hundred years ago. Apparantly it took 43 years to build the place and its not hard to believe it. The mosaics that were made from millions of tiny glass pieces is almost impossible to believe. They used more than 100 kilos of gold to cover the dome which is just unbelievable. Of the so many gorgeous buildings in St. Petersburg, this is a must see for any tourist.
magnificent mosaics. The cathedral is regal to say the least. The mosaic work is the speciality. I particularly liked the storyboards on the gates. Must visit.

A very interesting Russian Orthadox Church. Another magnificent Russian Orthadox church. It is amazing and you are able to take photos. Get a guide to appreciate the history. Close by is some good restaurants and there is plenty of parking.
Impressive. A beautiful building but we only had a photo stop of about 15 minutes. The architecture is a contrast to the more recently built Spilled Blood but both are so stunning.

Amazing. Visit St Isaac's Square whilst touring the city and spend a good while marvelling at the architecture. Don't miss the panoramic view of St. Petersburg from dome, if you can climb almost 400 steps to reach there. The paintings and mosaics are amazing and well preserved.

Regular church services held in chapel to left of nave.. Everyone should see this magnificent church, which resumed its role as a house of worship in 1990, while in St. Petersburg. The altar in the nave is used for services only for feast days. What was interesting was the information imparted by our local guide. She covered the history of the edifice very well using the models which are encased in the west end of the building. She did not discuss the iconography, so you may need a guidebook for that.

Stunningly beautiful Cathedral not to be missed. I was astonished of the size of the cathedral when we entered. The main cupola is very high and all the decorations are absolutely beautiful. Frescos, icons, paintings and the rich gold decorations are stunning together with the marble used for the pillars. We were lucky enough to be able to witnes a service in one of the side altars which included Gregorian singing. So very moving and beautiful with all the candles lit. A magnificent place to visit!

Simply amazingly beautiful. A visit to this stunningly beautiful church is another must see when in St. Petersburg. Do not forget to pick up a DVD in your language at the souvenir shop. It' worth showing to your relatives and friends after returning home.

Landmark Neoclassical-Byzantine Cathedral with Resplendent Interior. St Issac's Cathedral (in Russian transliterated as Isaakievskiy Sobor) is one of the icons of Saint-Petersburg. It is located in the Admiralteiskaya district not far from the Neva River. St Issac's is worthy of a look for its crowning glory alone - the huge fully gold-plated dome roof, identifiable from diverse parts of the city. The 250rbl entrance fee (2015) is very good value because the interior is richly decorated with glittering mosaics & columns containing malachite & lapis-lazuli ornamentation. Good views of the cityscape await climbers willing to walk up the 226 steps to the church's Colonnade.
The Grand Canyon of Cathedrals. There is no way to really get an idea of how breathtaking this cathedral is. Photos can not do it justice and, like the Grand Canyon, you have to see it in person.

Impressive cathedral . You see the St. Isaac's Cathedral some almost everywhere in the city and it is well worth visiting. The columns are impressive and a model inside shows you how they were erected.
St. Isaac's Catherdral. My favorite cathedral. Breathtaking! the crowds were minimal and the cathedral can be seen from most parts of the city.

St Isaacs. Stunning Cathedral, audio guides available in English. Separate entrance fees for both the inside of the church and to go up to the viewing gallery which offer great views over the city. Each cost R250

beautiful and worth the stop. Beautiful Cathedral. We only had 15 minutes on a break from our tour so we hightailed it over, bought 2 tickets and walked around. So glad we did even if we didn't have much time inside. The malachite and lapis columns are beautiful!

Architectural Marvel. Such an impressive landmark, both inside and out. Marvelous sculptures and massive columns. An interesting fact: during WW11, the magnificent gold plated dome was painted over in gray to avoid enemy planes. Truly a must see when visiting St. Petersburg.
What a city. Visited from the outside as part of our two day tour from our cruise beautiful architecture worth a visit take your camera

one of the most amazing architecture that I've ever seen,. one of the most amazing architecture that I've ever seen, for visiting you have two option one is get a ticket for inside cathedral and one separate for balcony that should you go too many stair up . i highly recommend visit both.

Beautiful both outside and inside. Second visit to St. Isaac was much better than 2 years ago when it was covered with scaffolding. We had an excellent guide who presented an amazing stories of how the cathedral was built and the history behind it. The walls are covered with marbles of different colors and mosaics. Though there are many beautiful sights in this city, St. Isaac's is definitely worth a visit.

Really, really big. This took 40 years to build,and you can see its golden dome from virtually everywhere. I couldn't confirm its overall ranking in size nor the height of its cupola although our guide said it's the third highest cupola after St. Peter’s in Rome and St. Paul’s in London. The interior has luscious columns, frescoes, marble and previous stones. Notable: during the 900-day Nazi blockade from 1941-44, the grounds were planted with cabbage to help feed the 3 million residents. The church has a view from its rotunda that I would have dearly loved but alas we didn't have time.
Isaac cathedral. This is very impressive architecture. The detail that has been built into this unbelievable. A must if you visit St Petersberg

Big, bigger, ..... Cathedral. The cathedral is located close to the old city center. This church you have to see. From outside as well as inside it is extremely nice. It is a huge building. Decoration inside is amazing, rich and impressive.
Great view from the top. Amazingly beautiful cathedral inside and outside. Must see. Incredible view from the top. Worth climbing the steps for sure.

the view from the dome. such a vast building. yet so magnificent in its details. the decorations have been restored in an outstanding way. to highlight is that one chapel on the western side is actually run as a chapel and not only as a museum. the view from the dome is so beautiful. well, seeing a city from above is always an interesting moment.

Even more Stunning on the Inside!. If only the walls could talk & tell us everything that happened - but we learned a lot from our fantastic DenRus Guide, Elena, who was so knowledgable about this cathedral & centuries of events that happened here.

Beautiful AND interesting. While not as opulent a style as some of the other churches in St. Petersburg, it has several interesting displays about the construction on this site over the years and how they managed to erect the building and pillars. Allow an hour to see everything.

4 th largest Dome in the world. This imposing Russian Orthodox Church also of the 18 Century conceptualised at the time of planning this city by Peter the great himself , this well planned European newest city of those times.The dome is the 4 th largest in the world...the grandiose structure and its golden dome can be viewed approaching by river from Peterhoff Palace and in the city occupied a strategic location neat the Mariinsky Palace and the Admiralty.

One of the largest cathedrals in the world. This place is one of the largest catherdal's in the world. I only visited the top (which has a seperate ticket) and it offered mesmerising views of the city. If you wish to enter the cathedral, you need to take a seperate ticket.
Amazing. This was one of the most beautiful churches/museums I have ever visited. The columns are overwhelming. You must stop here on a trip to St Petersburg.

Amazing view from the roof. As most of the churches it's a interesting place to visit, you have to purchase tickets ahead and plan a 30 min to 1 hour don't miss the roof a lot of stairs to reach but it worth it.

A must see after the Hermitage, like St. Peters in Rome. This is truly a architectural and artistic must see. We had a guide and was spoon fed. If you are going alone, do your homework. Much of the experience will be lost if you do not. They do have audio but I am not sure that the audio is as good as it could be. I only rented them once during my trip and was very disappointed in that only superficial info was available on the tape. Perhaps the tour guides put pressure to be sure that the tapes really do not replace the guides.
Go to the top!. Again, use the ticket machine and avoid the queues. definitely climb to the top for wonderful, panoramic views.
Top 5 things in St. Petersburg. testimony to the interesting history of faith, art and culture of the Russian Orthodox Church and heritage.

Enormous Cathedral is a site to behold. You can see parts of this from quite a distance even with the built up streets so when you finally get to the square it is in it makes quite an impression and really does tower over you. It might not be st Peters or st Paul's but it deserves to be mentioned with them. Interior is well worth entry fee. Good views of square and some of the city after long climb to top of tower. A beautiful part of St Petersburg. Major site.

Must visit. Beautiful place to visit!St. Isaac's Square in St. Peterburge- is one of the most beautiful places in town.St. Isaac's Cathedral is a grand creation and is one of the main symbols of the northern capital.

A Memorable part of St petersburg. An inspiring visit, in the main even if only to admire the mossaic paintings, that is those copied in marble form from the original oil works. The sheer size of the Construction is a wonder of the world, as is the method which they will explain to you. No matter your religion you will feel moved.
St Isaac's. Fascinating solid building. Didn't go inside but can be done if time permits. Again interesting history and amazing to see the gold covered dome up close.

Beautiful Cathedral. If you are visiting St Petersburg you must stop off and see this beautiful Cathedral.We stopped off in St Isaac's Square whilst touring the city and spent a good while marvelling at the architecture.
Pretty but not a Must See. Pretty, but just seeing from the outside wasn't one of the highlights of our trip. There are so many other things to see in St. P. that I might skip this if time is tight.

St. Isaac - well worth a visit. Lovely cathedral - tickets are 250 roubles each( from ticket office at back) - Dome beautiful and you can for extra go up the colonnade to see pretty good views of the city
Beauty and magnificence. Dreamy, one of the most beautiful cathedrals of the world. Don't lose the panoramic view of St. petersburg from dome.
St. Isaac's Cathedral. nice cathedral. if you can take the 400 steps to the top, the view is well worth to see. buy your tickets at the entrance gate. about $4. photos are allowed in inside.

Awesome. Most beautiful museum, centrally located on St Isaacs square.
Well worth the 250 rouble entry fee.
Did not go up to the galley, which was an extra fee, the interior was stunning enough on its own!

Enjoy the view from the top. I was not go inside just took stairs to the top to see city view.
Value to do even have a long ques and so tired.
sight seeing. one of the best cathedral's in St Petersburg. a must visit. if possible go up to the observation deck to see the city from birds eye view.

Beautiful Cathedral. This cathedral was used during WWII to preserve some of the precious art and sculptures as the Germans attempted to invade St. Petersburg. The inside of the cathedral is beautiful. Worth a visit.

Enjoy the Square that St.Isaac's is located in!. One of those places that is in a great setting resulting in the outside being as interesting if not more than inside. We spent a lot of time outside admiring the square and the buildings. We think that this is one of the great squares in St. Petersburg and for architecture matches other well known one across the globe.

Inspiring . There is a lot of beautiful and amassing places to see in St. Petersburg nevertheless St. Isaac's is a most see. When you first walk through the entrance you will pleased you did, truly inspiring. Include the trip to the top if you are able as it is great overview of the city. When mid afternoon on a Sunday, no lines.

Superb Collonade views. Beautiful building like so many in Saint Petersburg, however, the difference here is you can climb to the collonade for spectacular views of the City. The climb isn't for the feint hearted with over 200 steps in all around a spiral and upper metal staircase, but the views from the top are worth the effort.The interior of the Cathedral like most of the churches is beautiful and it is quite unique in the structure supporting the dome.

Beautiful view. climbing all the stairs is absolutely worth the view. The dome of the cathedral is amazing. We want there during daytime, but I'm pretty sure it's amazing to see the view and lights in the evening as well.

Gob smacking. . This cathedral is stunning from the outside but inside leaves you speechless . Not a huge crowd when we went in so we were able to stroll around easily and have a really good look. There was a service going on in one of the small chapels and it was a privilege to witness this.
GO FOR THE VIEW!. The church in itself is beautiful, but not so different from many others. St.Isaac is unique for the view.If you climb to the top (doable) you see the whole of S.Petersburg!

Beautiful building, be sure to visit the roof for awesome views over the city.. Beautiful building, not grand in scale but absolutely breathtaking inside. It is worth getting a separate ticket for entry to the roof of the building for great views over the city. Be sure to go on a clear day, and as with anywhere in St Petersburg, visit during the week if you can as it can get very busy at weekends.
Imposing, glorious Cathedral. Magnificent and enormous on the outside, inside walls tower over you with beautiful gold paintings!!

Great view . One of the most beautiful buildings in St Petersburg, the interior is stunning and very impressive in terms of size. One has to walk up the stairs and enjoy the fantastic view over the city. A must when visiting St Petersburg.
Massive. Huge. Imposing. Lovely. Quite a feat to construct. Found a shady spot & just gazed. Wife went inside & was complimentary about the inside decor. Very crowded.
Outstanding panoramic views. We only visited the colonnade to experience the amazing panoramically view and what an incredibly beautiful view it is!

Imposing. A massive edifice. Stunning architecture with its massive carved doors marble columns and interior design. Very interesting models showing its evolution from a relatively simple chapel to the current opulent structure.

Wonderful view at sunset.. I get church burnout so wont review the interior. However, the view from the cupola (separate admission) was exceptional. 360 degree views of SPB, well worth the 230 or so steps, especially for sunset. Also no tour groups then .....

panoramic views-stunnig. Skipped the inside as we had been in nearly all the other Cathedrals, so opted for the walk up the steps to the dome platform,amazing views of the city!You have to be quite fit to go up the steps and it gets very busy no matter what time of day.
Lovely views. We only went up to the colonnade but it was worth it. A little crowded but people moved on quite quickly so you had a good view. Cheaper before 5.30pm .

Must-see attraction of Saint Petersburg. The cathedral is already stunning from the outside with a beautiful golden iconic dome. What's inside is mesmerising. The beautiful art and architecture is, what I say, something you only see in Russia. I also had the opportunity to light a candle in the church which was a nice experience. In the museum, there is a gift shop, where there were beautiful gold art of different saints for sale. They actually weren't expensive...much cheaper than if I bought them from my town and I had the great chance of buying a beautiful golden painting of St.George. Will definitely want to visit this great cathedral if I'm ever in Saint Petersburg again :)

Amazing view from the colonnade. Apart from the museum inside the Cathedral which is magnificent, I also recommend to climb up to the colonnade. It's not very hard to go upstairs and you can see how many steps did you go and calculate how many left. The view from the top is amazing. Almost all of the top sightseeing are there. You can even see the Bay of Finland. Strongly recommend to see!
A picture. Just an average site/building in a city with tons to see. Took a picture of it and moved on as it is overshadowed by the other great places in the city
Amazing view of St Petersburg. Incredible cathedral offering an amazing view of St Petersburg. Nearly 300 steps up, but definitely worth it:)

Beautiful Church to Visit as Part of yr St Petersburg Tour !!!. Beautiful cathedral to see. Don't need a lot of time. Most tours will have this on their agenda. We used TJ Tours who were great ( see our review)

Only viewed outside but incredible building. Saw St Isaac's Cathedral as part of an organised city tour, with a stop of for photo opportunities. The Onion is pure gold (communism at it's finest!) and the cathedral an imposing figure in a pretty nice area. Beware of the dressed up scammers nearby, they want photos with you and charge a fortune after. Saw lots of people scammed.

The onion domed cathedral. Amazing paintings The size of the pillars is overwhelming.
Love the models showing how the building had changed

Outstanding art and architecture. It seems that every town in Europe, no matter its size, has a beautiful cathedral but the art and magnicrnt ceikings in St. Isaacs puts it at the top of my life. It is still used as a place of worship and, while it is very magnificent, ito is not so far over the top that you cannot enjoy it. Anyone who has attended church in their past can relate to the paintings in this stunning masterpiece.

A Gorgeous Cathedral. It took 40 years to build this imposing Cathedral, and it is the 4th largest one of its type in the world.It is decorated with gigantic one-piece granite columns, each weighing over 100 tons. That statistic, as told to us by our tour guide, left us staggered. The carved metal and wooden doors are very detailed, and depict a lot of historical events.Inside there are inlaid mosaics, sumptuous paintings, mosaic floors, and carved art sculptures made of precious and semi-precious stones. The massive stained glass window of Jesus at the rear of the Church is absolutely stunning – to say the least.The Golden Dome is phenomenal from the outside, as well as from the inside. Do not forget to look up and see the six-foot white Dove in the center of the Dome. It is truly amazing.We recommend a visit to this awesome Cathedral. We guarantee that, like us, you will be moved by the sheer beauty and grandeur of it.
A must see in St Petersburg. With so much to see in St Petersburg it is hard to prioritise. But i think this goes up the list, just very impressive

Oppulent church. This is a gorgeous, must-see church when in St. Petersburg. It is beautiful inside and out, and the scope cannot be measured through pictures. It is a popular stop for tours so it can get a little bust at certain times, but it is well worth a visit whether you are religious or not. The paintings and mosaics are amazing, and everything is exceptionally well preserved. It is a great view into the grandeur and power of the former Russian Empire. Climb to the top for spectacular views.
Another Must See!. Beautiful outside and simply amazing inside. Even the carved doors are amazing. From floor to ceiling with the mosaics and paintings, all I can say is Wow!
A very beautiful cathedral. A large cathedral, with very large and very expressive icons. Very nice doors. Huge columns of iconostasis and many semiprecious stones in them.To do a tour on the roof.
Nice view. Must see when in SPB. Awesome paintings inside, and incredible views if you feel like making the climb to the top. Well worth the money!

A Living Church. Of course the church is beautiful and filled with historical relics, but what makes it extra-special is that it is still a place of worship. So nice to see the little babushkas with their scarf-covered silver hair offering prayers!
Appropriate attire is required.

Don't miss. Beautiful and rich shows how it was russian empire befor the revolution.
Paintings and mosaics are stunning.
absolutely fabulous. When you go inside you feel a majesty. It should definitely be on your list of things to see and photograph while in Saint Petersburg.
St. Isaac's Cathedral. A place worth visiting if you have the time. Good but other attractions are even better. Still would suggest that this should not be missed.
Beautiful!. This was an amazing cathedral! The paintings and mosaics are stunning. Be sure to pay the extra few dollars to go to the top - the view is amazing!

Walk upstairs for a great view!. This is a great place to visit, take a time to go all the way through learning about its history. My recommendation is to go early in the morning so otherwise you will find lots of people.
Try going upstairs for a great view of the city!
Climb the steps!!!. We climbed all 262 steps at 10 p.m. and enjoyed a wonderful light spectacle 360 degrees, very worth the effort!
An evening visit. 300 rub to get on the top. Beautiful skyline. Worth of visiting while in Saint Petersburg to get a bigger perspective of the city.
Great views. It was hard work getting up the stairs but the panoramic views of the city were well worth it. Cheap and they do a student discount with the isic card.

Awesome. The highlight of our visit to St Issac's was achieved after climbing approximately 250 steps which brought us onto the dome of the cathedral and from there the views of St Petersburg were simply breathtaking and were well worth the effort. A great opportunity to add spectacular memorable photographs to your album. The cathedral has been brought back to its former glory and has undergone enormous restoration.
A really beautiful church. One of St. Petersburg top attractions. Very easy to visit right in the city center. Very beautifully lighted at night.
Vow!!!. My favourite church in St.Petersburg. It is huge and has rich interior full of marble, mosaics,... Impressive!
Beautiful. This was just one of the many great things to see in St Petersburg! We went early and that was an advantage.

Check out the panoramic views. Although the inside isn't as amazing as the other churches take the 200 plus steps to the top to get a panoramic view of St Petersburg on a sunny day. Well worth it if you are not scared of heights

Not covered by all tours, but worth visiting!. St Isaac’s Cathedral with a delightful golden-domed creation was built during Romanov dynasty, for Peter the Great. It was the tallest structure in St. Petersburg. Massive columns in front, ceiling frescoes and walls with lavish mosaics are the reasons to go. Inside, scale models of the Cathedral's designs - small to current, as well as model showing how the columns were erected are also interesting.

Go early to beat the tour groups. Outstanding view from the colonnade, plus a beautiful, marble-faced interior with old paintings and guild-work on the ceilings.  Go early (10:30 am) to buy tickets, fight the guides buying hundreds of tickets for their tour groups, and then head straight up to the colonnade before it gets crowded.

Gorgeous. Visit at night to miss the crowds.. I'm loving the lingering White Nights. Even though it's technically over, the churches are still open until 10:30. I've visited both St. Issac's and the Church of the Spilt Blood around 930. A totally different (not mobbed) scene from daytime. Go, enjoy, get your pictures without 20,000 other tourists. Then swing by during the day for a few photos of the outside. A much much saner experience (if you're not a fan of crowds, at least)

Phenomenal cathedral. It's a must see with a tour guide. Marvelous construction and history. If you travel to Moscow and see tsar bell, they used the same concept to raise the bell from the ground as for the cathedral columns.
Great views. . Climb up the stairs to the tower and look across the city. Wonderful views as you walk around the tower.
Must visit. The landmark u could se from everywhere.The climb of the colonnade was steep but worth it.The museum inside was well exhibited
Worth stopping off for. Such a spectacular sight to see and the fourth biggest dome church in the world. Well worth a visit with great views from all around the church.

Beautiful Inside - Frescoes & Marble. Definitely worth visiting. Very serene feeling inside, despite its huge size (4th largest cathedral in the world).
The columns inside are made of granite, malachite and lazurite. There's beautiful religious art including stained glass. And a magnificent dome with frescoes and paintings.

Visit to the exterior of St. Isaacs Cathedral. We went on a guided walk of the city and was taken to this cathedral, well outside of it. It is very impressive with its golden roof. There's a lovely park in front of it where we stood and took photos of the cathedral.It's a shame we didn't go in, but that wasn't in our tour, you can walk to the top of the cathedral and look out at the view. We saw many people doing that and they were standing on a veranda just underneath the gold dome.Well worth a visitto this cathedral, even if it's just to the outside to see it.
best view. do visit the viewing deck. Its a must -visit. The cathedral was closed on the day of our visit but we could go to the observation deck.
Scary stairs and nice view. Interior ok, view from the collonades impressive (but the last set of stairs is not for the faint hearted)
Nice Facade and architecture.. Nice facade, Nice park across street, Was closed when we went. Lost of vendors with junk to sell. HAH!
Big and Interesting!. Nice and big church. They show you how they were able to build this church without cranes which was neat.

St. Isaac's Cathedral State Museu-Memoroial. St. Isaac's Cathedral State Museum-Memorial in St. Petersburg Russia is an amazing example of architecture and beauty. A place not to be missed on your visit to St. Petersburg.

Amazing Cathedral that while being a Museum is also Still a Church. While in St Isacc's there was a religious mass going on with a few people in attendance. It is basically a museum and so well worth visiting while in St. Petersburg. The dome is HUGE and the church/museum has been restored to its former days.
Must visit it.. I am not the proper guy to talk about cathedrals but this place is a MUST-VISIT one,especially the colonade.The view to the city is great.
Don't miss it.. Beautiful church! Much more ornate on the inside than most of the Russian churches. Be sure to visit the top of the dome for a great view of St. Petersburg.
Beautiful view of the city. Great view from the top of the steps. Take your time and you'll make it. Nice panorama from the top.

Huge even by the Russian standards. Huge church which is one of the main sights in St. Petersburg, worth visiting. If you are lucky to have a guide, you will hear a story how heavy columns were erected and ground prepared for construction of this church of enormous proportions.
A beautiful building!. The mosaics inside this beautifully restored building are stunningly beautiful. This was probably our favourite building in the city.

One of the largest in the world. This huge domed church is one of the largest cathedrals in the world. It was turned into a museum during the Soviet days, but now is open for some ceremonies again. You really need to take a guided tour to catch all the highlights, otherwise you could be wandering around and miss a lot. Very impressive.
Amazing panorama. This church is one of must have in StPetersburg. If you have a power to climb the steps 43 meters up your prize ll be amazing view and panorama.

Night visit. We had bumped into another traveller on a boat trip who recommended a visit to St.Isaac's colonnaded walkway at night - it's open until very late during the summer. We were able to easily purchase tickets from a machine outside and it was definitely worth the walk to the top. Beautiful views across St.Petersburg at night and it wasn't at all busy. I would even say it was a little bit romantic :)
Must see!. St. Isaac Cathedral is a architectural marvel and is a great site to see in St Petersburg. The ceiling is incredible! It surprised us in a good way!

A must do in St Petersburg. Climbed to the top for 150 rubles, great panoramic views. There is around 200 steps so if you're not a strong walker you may struggle, steps can also be pretty narrow.When we were there in August there was some work being done but you have plenty of other places to view the city without seeing construction. It can get busy so try be patient but really worth it.

Visit to St. Isaac Cathedral. Top class, do not miss the views from the dome (separate ticket) and also the interior (called cathedral museum). Better to take the tickets from the ATM machine (in front of the ticket office where there are large queues of people), you can do it with VISA credit card or cash.

Church museum. Very interesting Museum. i was not in colonade.
i just visit it without any guide but it is ok.
It look more bigger inside than from outside
Amazing Cathedral. Issac's was closed the day we visited but we strolled around the outside. The granite pillars are huge. Amazing and enormous.
Another amazing place to visit. Enjoyed our visit to this site. Glad we had our guide from alla tours. We learnt so much about the place.
Amazing cathedral. Excellent cathedral to visit. It has such calm feeling once you enter and there are lots of benches to sit and feel the vibes of the place.

Golden Dome. I think St. Isaac Cathedral was the first attracion of St. Petersburg that I went to visit. It was located in one of the best part of the city and near most of the good hotels of the city, and also in a walking distance from Hermitage Museum.You can see the golden dome of the building even from far away, no wonder it has the reputation of the greatest cathedral of the whole Orthodox world. In front of the cathedral lies the great statue of Peter the Great with his three daughters (if I am correct, fingers crossed).St. Isaac used to be a operative cathedral, but in the Communist era under Stalin it was changed into a museum for religious and atheist people. After 1991 it started working again as both meusem and operative church. However, as of 2015, it is not working anymore. When we got there it was closed for some unknown reasons, later when I passed by it I saw people were frequenting inside and outside of it.I guess the builders of Uinted States Capitol has taken sufficient inspiration from the architecture of this Golden Dome House of God.

Bells are ringing ..... Staying directly opposite st Isaac's was a delight every time the bells sounded I had to open the window to take in the ringing ,just soooo beautiful ..made staying at the Angleterre hotel a joy ,do make sure you get a audio guide ,It is extremely good .Spent a few hours inside ,fantastic don't miss .Didn't climb to the dome ...a truly beautiful building .....with stunning mosaics and paintings ....

A must do. This cathedral is tallest in Saint Petersburg , There are lovely mosaic paintings and very rich Marbles and Granites used inside and outside . There is an entrance ticket but its worth . The colonnaded walkway also has entry ticket but the view from top is amazing . You can see all famous cathedrals from there.
a wonderful cathedral. dont miss going up to the collonnade to get an excellent birds eye view of the city.climb is a bit tiring but totally worth it.

A gorgeous place to see. St. Isaac's cathedral is a sight to behold. The inside is just massive with massive architecture. The colors are rich and beautiful. It's a must see on your trip to St. Petersburg.

Massive Russian Orthodox Church. In comparison with other Russian Orthodox churches, St Isaac's is somewhat plain. What distinguishes it however, is its massive size inside and out. This is not to say it is not beautiful, just that it lacks the magnitude and number of mosaics seen in other churches. Since Russian Orthodox churches do not allow paintings, decorations are generally mosaics. St Isaac's Cathedral breaks the general rule as it has one large stained glass window which is quite beautiful. Don't miss the scale model of the scaffolding demonstrating how the massive columns were put in place with benefit of machines. It's located in a corner to the left of the entrance. Be sure to look up at the ceiling decorations as they are simply staggering.

In the heart of St Petersburg, a haven from noise and bustle. Not an old cathedral in the grand scheme of things but wonderful to visit. Lots of helpful info and photos inside. You ned 1-2 hours to enjoy this place.
Impressive Cathedral. Very impressive gold dome cathedral in St Petersburg supported by 24 massive granite columns. It is equally beautiful inside. Definitely worth a visit.

The Largest Orthodox Cathedral in the World!. St. Isaac's Cathedral is the largest orthodox cathedral, and the fourth largest cathedral in the world! It is built in Neo-Classical style. The exterior is adorned with numerous red granite columns with Corinthian capitals, as well as statues. The dome is decorated with 12 angelic statues. The interior is decorated with columns, pilasters, paintings, and statues made of granite, marble, and semiprecious stone. If you climb to the rooftop, you will see the beautiful views of the city!

Gorgeous. A really impressive church. The colors inside are wonderful. The interior is exquisite. There is a great wooden model that shows how they raised the twenty marble columns. This is amazing given their weight and size!
Visit early!. Beautiful building inside, amazing how it was built. This is truly worthy of a visit . To visit the place, I suggest to get there very early before the turist buses arrive.
Climb St Isaac's for a great view of St Petersburg. We climbed The Colonnade for a great view of St Petersburg, but we didn't visit inside the Cathedral.
Iconic. Wonderful interior. If you are lucky you can sit through a service and listen to wonderful singing. Wonderful views from the upper level if you have the legs for the steps

Climb to the top for double the experience. Another of St Petersburgs amazing cathedrals, decorated with ceiling to floor stunning murals. On our second visit we climbed to the top and experienced the great view of the city from the top verandah.

Gorgeous building. The building is huge and gorgeous. Though we didn't visit the inside, it was a nice experience. I recommend sitting in the park across the street and watching the beauty of the building.

A must!. This cathedral is amazing. You must visit inside. The decoration is elaborate. The ceiling is beautifully painted. The line up for tickets may seem long however it moves quickly. The booth is around the side of the cathedral.

Gorgeous architectural building. You can get different types of tickets, just to enter the cathedral or you can also go up to the colonnade, which gives you an amazing view of surroundings , but you have to go up a lot of stairs. We were with small kids, so went with option 1. The ticket lets you use a tour guide(only in russian though). You enter and wait for a group to gather, as soon as its around 15 people the guide starts the tour. We speak russian so we took the tour, it was very interesting, detailed, of course the cathedral itself is gorgeous, no words can describe.

Beautiful Cathedral.. Beautiful interior and lovely exterior. No need for a tour filled with facts that you won't remember. Go in, appreciate everything around you and then appreciate the views of the city.

An stuning view of the city from a different angle. Greet place to start you journey in St. Petersburg, if you would like to climb all the way into the top of the cupola you don't need to to the huge line that people do to get in the interior of the cathedral just go to the main ticket center and ask for that specific ticket and you are on it! besides of that you will have a marvelous view from the main city center and the surroundings, I will recommend to do this activity in the afternoon that is not that busy and you will not be bumping with guests that I trying to get into the top on their own passe, as soon as you arrive to the top is totally worth it, there are no restroom facilities on the top FYI
ancient. Very beautiful historic sight, a lot of stairs to climb up to the top ! but the view to the city wonderful!
Beautiful church. A beautiful church with amazing altars and many icons. The only thing I didn't like were all the souvenier counters in almost every corner of the church.

the jewel of the city. To my mind St. Isaac's is the most impressive cathedral in St. Petersburg. The colonnade viewpoint is also worth visiting. Though the entrance fee is a bit high - 300 roubles to go up to the colonnade and another 300 roubles to see the cathedral inside. And in the evening the price of a visit doubles. I'm not sure whether there are discounts for students.By the way you have to go on foot up the stairs to the colonnade so it is now recommended to visitors with certain health conditions. There is no lift. In front of the cathedral there is a lovely square with a large flowerbed and some benches - a perfect place to take photos of the cathedral.

Unlisted wonder of the world. St. Cathedral museum or memorial is one of the finest in the world. It is held by massive columns of granite 24 in number. there are a number of Bronze statues covering all sides of the monument. 226 steps lead you to the gallery from where one can get a birds eye view of the city. The square in front boasts of a rare statue of Alexandre on horseback the horse standing on its hind legs with no additional support. The memorial once bombed in the world wars shows its scars in a few places left untouched during restoration I presume to remind the city of the atrocities of the war. All in all not to be missed in this beautiful city of Saint Petersburg which has far surpassed my expectations.
Historically Important Cathedral. Most beautiful Cathedrale, centrally located. Very important historically and a visit is most worthwhile. Photos are allowed.

Must See!. Even without being religious, this cathedral is quite amazing! You can imagine how inspired the artisans must have been when building this cathedral and how much inspiration this building has provided so many generations of locals!
nice place to visit. the place is in 10 min walk from the admiralayteyskaya metro station. it is very beautiful from the outside and less beautiful from the inside.
Interesting and beautiful. Beautiful and interesting, make sure you get the history information as this adds to the experience.

The must see in Saint Petersburg. I am not belonging to the kind of person who says that you have too see certain sights in a cityBut if you have not seen Saint Isaak in Saint Petersburg is like you have not seen the Eifel tower in ParisThe views over the city is amazing and the inside also astonishingTry to get there during the week on the weekend you might wait an hour

Impressive!. Inside the church is kinda impressive. There are a few things in English you can read so that you understand more of the history of the church. The admission price increases after 18:30, so if you are in a budget try to go earlier. However, is slower during the evening so its nice to avoid the masses. To climb the Colonade is a MUST DO! If you do only one thing, skip the museum and do this one. Gives you a great bird's eye view of the city!!!

I can say why he is called a saint. It was a nice walk with local friends after which i found myself as if i am Dante climbing the stairs of inferno :).The building is huge and you climb it all. Then here you are a huge view of the city.Nice experience, strongly recommended!

Afternoon visit. We were on the 2 day SPB De - Luxe tour. We had originally stopped for a photo stop, in the morning of the first day, but returned in the afternoon of our second day for our inside visit. This meant that there were plenty of tourists. As usual in the Russian Orthodox Church there are no seats, people stand to worship.
Holy place. Grand structure / must see in St,Petersburg ,I felt so much blessed after offering prayer inside .don't forget to offer prayers at the Holy Mother's portrait near the altar.
A lovely Church. A beautiful church with exquiset use of all types of marble on the floor and walls. Very sober and beautiful.

Great cathedral in St Petersburg. St. Isaac's is huge. This was an amazing site to see - very large, very beautiful. We visited on a guided tour, and our guide explained a lot about the history and construction that we would not have enjoyed the time there as much without her information. The cathedral is beautiful on the outside as well. I recommend this as a stop on any St. Petersburg tour.
Must See!. Must see!! Walk to the top for some of the best views of St Petersburg. Stunning interior also with some beautiful mosaics.

Impressive, go early to avoid the crowds.. This is an architectural gem. Between the malachite columns and beautiful golden icons a tour on your own will impress BUT to really understand the nuances of the interior hire a guide and spend an hour or two here.
Really impressive. The church itself is wonderful, but the real experience is the ascent to the dome with a wonderful view over Petersburgh. Worthe the stairs :)
impressive building and decoration. must see very impressiv monument. beautifull decorated. try to visit with a guide . lots to tell about this monument

St Petersburg (SPB Tours). The church was part of our tour and well worth the visit we all (four adults) found it very interesting. getting there early was a very good idea and the ques were small when we came out they were very long.

Amazing cathedral. This is an amazing cathedral The entry fees to the cathedral is 250 Rubles and to the colonnade is 150 Rubles.This is now a museum.If you can walk up 276 steps you get amazing view of the city.The door ,the ceilings the columns are all amazing and a must see in St Petersburg.It is lit up and nice to see from outside also at night.
Breathtaking. Take time to see as much of this building as possible. 300 + steps to get to the domes views. The art work is out of this world.
Entrance doors are amazing. The massive wooden doors to enter the cathedral are a sight to see alone. Very cool structure inside showing how they built this place. Must see when visiting SPB.
Just incredible. Well, it's just incredible. Obviously, if you're in St. Petersburg, you've got to see it inside and out. Expect big crowds and lingering pickpockets, though.

Great Views of St. P.. Worth a visit as its one of the icons of St. P. Awesome views from the Colonade not too bad of a climb. It was open later than adverised in the middle of summer so may want to check as its nice around sunset!

ST. ISAACS is a MUST VISIT. INCREDIBLY BEAUTIFUL and historical on numerous levels. A MUST SEE and TOUR when in St. Petersburg. The mosaics and precious stone columns conveyed elegance and beauty while also rejoicing as place of worship and prayer.
Nice view. Ticket to enter is really cheap, amazing view from the top. Walking up the staires worth. Its has open and closing time make sure you are in time.
Majestic!. Breathtaking interior, overwhelms you with its beauty, detail and majesty.Can only be compared to the St. Peter's Cathedral at the Vatican.

Beautiful vault ceiling n interiors!. The external features of the historical building did no justice to the internal and interiors! The beautiful vault ceilings, designs and craftsmanship were magnificent! I felt like I was totally hypnotised during my visit and I became photo- craz! I got stiff neck the day after resulting from staring continuous at the ceiling during my visit to the cathedral.Highly recommend a visit!

A remarkable achievement. We visited St Isaac's Cathedral as pert of an cruise ship excursion to three of St Petersburg's fantastic cathedrals. St Isaac's is truly remarkable in terms of its sheer size, its interior design, the color and detail of its walls and ceilings. Our guide was very knowledgeable about the cathedral and its constructions - undertaken over 10 years - including 5 years to lay the foundations to support the immense weight of the finished cathedral. Inside the cathedral there is a wooden 166th scale model of the cathedral in exquisite detail. We were told the carpenter (a serf) took 10 years to carve the model - his reward for completing the model was his freedom. Plan on spending a good couple of hours here to get the most out of your visit.

Amazing attention to detail. Both inside and out this building is impressive. We were visiting as part of a half day trip, we had a guide who was very good at telling us what all the small details meant. Without her knowledge it would have been easy to overlook the finer details hidden within the décor. There were times where I was looking around in amazement of the vastness of the space and how much work had gone into building it and then painting it. I would recommend coming here as it’s a beautiful church.
must do. what a view from the top of the building. To go up there you need some air. The Cathedral is quite amazing.

Truly amazing!. We've seen a few cathedrals on our trip through Scandinavia, but this was the most impressive by far. Even more amazing than Notre Dame! There is a small chapel off to the side where women are encouraged to wear head scarves. Here also you can see local people lighting candles, etc.

St. Isaac's Cathedral. Fascinating cathedral. Make sure you get a guide to show you around and tell you the history of it. It makes no sense just to walk in there to look around. Do walk up to the colonnade if you can . It gives you a great birds eye view of the city and you can see the layout very nicely. There is a separate fee to go upstairs but it is so worth it. However, the kiosk at the entrance does not seem to work when you try to buy the tickets using an American ATM card. I had to use Rubles to buy my ticket.

The greatest landmark of st. petersburg . I spent a full hour in this cathedral /museum. St. Isaacs cathedral is an Iconic structure thst has no parallel. it has the 4th highest dome of cathedrals in europe. it was built 200 years ago and suffered during the post soviet revolution stage. it has been nearly fully restored now and is one great showcase of art. take an audio guide as I took for 100 rubels and enjoy the history and cathedral fully explained.

Good to see the city of St Petersburg. Owing to it's central location you can easily see the golden dome from everywhere in the city. Good idea to see city view from high place, you can buy a ticket for entry, there are signs on the stairs both on ascend/descend how many steps remains till the goal, so you will never feel tired of climbimg/descending. Ptoho of the inside of cathedral is not allowed. One of the must visit places.
Big Church. Magnificent building both inside and out. A must see if you visit St Petersburg. A bit crowded with many tourists, but worth the effort.

St Isaac's Provides the best view of the City. We really lucked out. When we moved into our hotel, the Hotel Angleterre, St Isaac's was right across the street, so we had lots of time to explore it. We started by buying a ticket that lets you walk up 292 steps to the observation platform that wraps around the outside of the dome of the cathedral. Once up there, the view of the city is fantastic. Walking around the platform around the dome gives you a 360 degree look at the city of St Petersburg. I was with my wife, and it seemed as though everyone was offering to take picture of both of us, with the city view in the background. Once this happened to us, we were the ones making the offers to take pictures. Just make sure you are in shape to go up the winding staircases and the final straight stretch of stairways that goes up the final 60 feet or so.Inside the cathedral (with a different ticket to et in) , you will see beautiful artwork, statues, ceiling paintings and a wonderful floor. The tour guides, if you booked one, provide detailed descriptions of the cathedral, which is now a museum, but is used or services several times a year.
Nice place. St. Petersburg has large number of Church and each one of them is unique. We visited all of them and felt very good.
Awesome views. The cathedral itself is great, however the views from the top are even better! You can see the roofs of St Petersburg, so beautiful

Breath taking!. From the outside, St. Isaac’s Cathedral is a beautiful yet understated building. On entering I was overwhelmed at the extravagant beauty and opulence of the lapis lazuli columns and the dome with the dove in the centre. It was completely unexpected and quite literally took my breath away.

Wow nice decorations. Visit this interesting and extremely Nice decorated Church.As in all religious buildings show respect (women should cover their hair With a scarf or smth), this is a Church in use and not a museum.

must see. This cathedral has been made for celebrating the birth of Alexander. Icons inside are marvelous. Everything inside has been kept so clean. You can spend hours looking at the art been made on the walls and glasses.
Interior is not impressive. My wife and I had a nice little visit but the interior was not that impressive. Not an essential site to see

Beautiful Cathedral Inside and Outside. St. Isaac's is probably the most important church in St. Petersburg and with a visit. It is both a museum and a functioning Russian Orthodox church. It golden dome is the 4th largest in the world. It is closed on Wednesdays.

A real stunner. This is an incredible church. Everything about it is lavish. May be crowded but its size seems to cope with hordes of people quite well. A stupid system where the ticket box is no where near the entrance but a moderate distance around the corner (I guess photos don't get mucked up that way). We also did the view from the Dome (extra fee) which I recommend for excellent views across the city.

Beautiful cathedral. Its a tiring walk up to the top. More than 200 steps I think and they are also marked as we walk up so that we know how much is left. A great museum to look at from the inside as well.
St.Isaac's Cathedral. amazing!!! gorgeous. interior is fabulous.. malachite columns.A definite must when in St. Petersberg..

A must to visit. Such history & beauty I was blown away with this Cathedral. The architecture was amazing and it was so sad that the architect was not allowed to be buried here. Lots of tourists about but easy to visit.

Awesome Saint Petersburg. Beautiful landmark. One of the best architecture in SPB (St. Petersburg).
Neatly maintained and definitely suggest a part of very important and rich history.

Beautiful, imposing but not unique. Do not get me wrong, this cathedral is impressive and it is very beautiful. However I cannot put it in the "unforgettable" category like St.Peter Cathedral in Rome, La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona or Hagia Sophia in Istanbul.It is worth a visit, but take pictures if you want to remember what it looked like it in a couple of year !
A Must See. This church may be simple from the outside, but the inside is gorgeous. Make this church a priority stop on your visit to St. Petersburg

Simply Stunning. This was my first introduction to a Russian Orthodox Church. One is immediately in awe of the height of the dome, and the naturally illuminated dove at its apex. The iconostasis, explained to us by our knowledgable guide, is the centrepiece, fringed by six amazing malachite columns, and two smaller lazurite columns. In all, were were quite overcome by the beauty of the interior, while the external is no less impressive.

Go to the observation deck. The observations is quite a walk since there are no lifts, but you won't regret. You get a panoramic view of the St.Petersburg and the breeze is very refreshing during summer times.
St Isaac Square. only visited the Square. Did not go inside the cathedral. But the area is nice for a walk. well worth a visit
Impressive. St Isaac is one of the principal attractions of the city, and well worth a visit.The location makes it easy to fit into visits to other nearby sights.

Nice to see but nothing special. Maybe because there is so much to see in St Petersburg that this felt a bit like just another cathedral. It was interesting to visit but if tight for time I think you could safely give this one a miss.

Fourth Lagest Cathedral in the World. One of the most impressive landmarks in St. Petersburg! Beautiful gold plated dome visible for miles. Enjoy the amazing iconostasis (chapel) . When visiting, be sure to stand in the center of the cathedral, under the dome and take a picture of the dove.

Stunning example - the nicest we have seen. Brilliant, we got in free as it was st pertersburg day and they had a large service on. Amazing to see such a different service, the architecture was also stunning
Beautiful. I chose to spend my time walking around and admiring the beautiful building from the outside. Such a magnificent building
Facsinating. It is the first place in the city must be visited.The architecture,statues,paintings and other decorations are amazing.It is located in neighborhood of the famous Astoria hotel.

Absolutely the place to visit. This cathedral blew me away. The combination of colours in the church, combined with all the precious stones used for the interior of this cathedral is out of this world. A must see in St Petersburg!!
Architecture/museum/church. Splendid, should visit the interior. posible to climb the collonade with beautifull vieuws of the city. part of the historical and arcitectural patrimonium of the city.

Very impressive. Such an imposing building both inside and out. It is so large inside it caters perfectly adequately for the large numbers of tour groups that constantly file through. The beautiful architecture and decorations are a photographer's delight. Essential to visit if in St Petersburg.
Must see Cathedral. Very beautiful Cathedral. Worth paying money to see it. It really gives us an great idea about the beautiful wall paintings and its history.
Must see. it is by far the most impressive cathedral in St. Petersburg. You should see it both during the day and at night when it is lit up.

A must-see. Really breathtaking mosaics inside and detailed tile work outside. We had a guide for our 2-day tour of St. Petersburg, which helped with additional background. St. Petersburg is one of the great cities of the world.
Must see!. Very famous, beautiful, monumental, historical, shall be visited in any way when you are in S-Petersburg. I recommend you to go up to the viewing point.
Really charming. I loved this Cathedral and especially the view from it's top! The interior is amazing also and how not to mention it's outside look. Amazing.

Splendid. Amazing interior, especially the background of the altar is simply breathtaking to look at.
Make sure to rent the audio explanation system in case you come without a guide, then you will appreciate the church more since you hear more detailed explanation and history behind the items in the church.

Interesting. However I am very surprised that it would be rated #1 of things to do. I would put The Hermitage as #1, Peterhof by hydrofoil as #2, Church of Peter and Paul as #3 followed by Church on Spilled Blood. St Isaacs would not be at the top of my list. Of course it is worth visiting but there is so much more to see at other sights.

The view alone is worth it!. Visit it for the view!Seriously, the view is amazing from up there, even on a cloudy and overcast day!!Steep staircases, but manageable.Didn't visit the inside.The front of the cathedral is a clear copy of the patheon in rome, but since that's mighty impressive, it works well!Interiors I've heard are spectacular as well!

Impressive Cathedral. It is the largest church in Russia, the construction took 40 years to complete. It opened in 1858 and was assigned by the french architect Auguste de Montferrand. During the Soviet years it was used a a museum of atheism. I loved the ceiling painting "The Virgin in Majesty".

Well preserved place with a great tower to visit. Well preserved place with a tower which gives you a splendid overview over St. Petersburg.So, if you are there do not hesitate to visit both, the church and the tower.

Visited on a glorious sunny day with fantastic views!. Going to the colonnade is worth it on a sunny day. Museum is also interesting and I took the audio guide which is a little too detailed at times but you can fast forward.
nice. very impressive and Spiritual. it was a very great church and it was my first experince to see a religious ceremony onsite. that was nice.

HUGE IMPRESSIVE DOME. The dome is the 4th largest in the world and is definitely huge both from the outside and looking up from the inside. Also, the mosaics inside are stunning. Worth the visit for sure.

Climb the dome. The Cathedral was closed on the day we went to visit, but even when the Cathedral is closed you can still pay to walk the dome for some amazing photo oppurtunitys. You can really see all of St Petersburg from up here . We enjoyed seeing all the sites we visited from this perspective.

Majestic. It was the first important attraction I saw in the city and I still remember how I felt when I spotted its golden dome from the distance. Pretty from the outside and jaw-dropping from the inside.
St. Isaac's Cathedral. Make sure to climb to the colonnade for exceptional views. The climb is about 250 steps and the entrance is quite reasonable at 150 rubles (about $3).
beautiful. The detail and impressive size of the church was incredible, with so much history, a visual feast to the eyes and the grand scale is impressive

More to see in St. Petersburg.. Another beauty in St. Petersburg. ....... another must see ...... the largest domed cathedral in Russia. Check out the use of malachite and lapis. Outside stands the hug monument to Nicholas 1st.
Magnificent!. Loved the history of the cathedral and the guided tour. The tour around the dome opens up amazing 360 degrees views over the city and allows you to take a moment and look around.

Stunning Russian Orthodox Church. This church is just spectacular. It seems to be very reminiscent of the Vatican. The golden alter is so beautiful and the art work is stunning. You will not want to miss this church.

Magnificent. From the outside not as opulent as others, but inside, WOW! The mosaic pictues, the dome- look out for the dove right in the centre. Amazing the uses it has had during the communist age particularly. A must see

"6 days of Creation in mosaic...". 'The most... tremendous, grandiose, spacious etc', the cathedral has earned and bears its title :) The mosaic work inside the cathedral is unique, so as are the entrance doors, the colour combinations of marble, the Savior on the stained glass window inside the altar ... the history of construction and restoration and preservation. My grandma told that during revolution someone offered a grand sum of money to dismantle it and sell abroad... the sum must still have looked too little for the then authorities (since many grandiose monuments of Emperor Russia were declared of null value etc.. ) and luckily it is still Russian :)
Beautiful place . Amazing place with respectable religious thingNice pictures and great architecture of this building are attractive

Impressive!. The cathedral/museum is very impressive on the inside. Look up into the center of the dome, the light plays beautifully on the interior. The square around the cathedral is bustling and fun.
A must see. Very beautiful and monumental cathedral, a must see. Go to collonade too to see St. Petersburg from roof tops.

St. Isaac's Cathedral is an outstanding monument of Russian. Famous for its gold-plated dome, St. Isaac's Cathedral State Museum-Memorial features an observation deck offering arguably the finest views of the city. Built during the first four decades of the 19th century, the cathedral remains one of the largest Orthodox edifices in the world, its golden cupola dominating the city's skyline from a height of over 101 m (333 ft).
Impressive. You can climb up to almost the top of the church where you will get a great view over St Petersburgh. The church itself is magnificent
Short visit. Ok quite interesting but not one of the top attractions. The story of its different uses was interesting
St Petersburg - July 2015. Fantastic! Stunning place to visit. St Petersburg is one NOT to miss. Try to go early though as it gets very busy.

Must-see gem in the city center. it was a very grand cathedral with ornate details inside. there is also a chance to go up the dome for. paniramic view of St. Petersburg but better if the weather is good. parking was only available for tour buses around the church so better not bring a car.
Great history, impressive interior. Bright spacious interior - mosaics are impressive. This place can handle more tourist traffic so you can get a good look in 45 minutes with a guide.

Stunning St Issacs. This cathedral is totally breathtaking inside and out and is essential part of a visit to St Petersburg. It will not disappoint even if you are suffering church fatigue. Such history Thank God (literally) the communists didn't destroy it.

St.lsaac's Cathedral State Museum. St.Isaac's Cathedral state museum-Memorial it is the main church of the Russion Empire with museum of the empire. The Church is nice as well as the musuem also nice information.

Gorgeous!. Go in the morning to beat the bus loads of tourists. Gorgeous frescos inside. Do the climb to the tower, spectacular views of SPB and not overly strenuous. The line to buy tickets (morning) took only around 15 mins.

Beautiful and fascinating. This was the first church we visited and it was really amazing Inside and out. Fascinating to see how devout so many Russians are of all different sorts after having been denied religion for so long.
Manifique!. Don't miss to climb up the bell tower for St. Petersburg top view, it is indeed breathtaking. Though it could be a little bit too windy in April.

Cathedral turned Museum..... in all its Glory!. This Cathedral was turned into a museum so photography is allowed. It is another example of a beautiful Russian Orthodox Cathedral, beautifully restored.
Just Amazing!. What can I say about the largest Orthodox cathedral in the world. Magnificent, beautiful and impressive! A work of art and amazing architecture. A must go!

Magnificent church. Saint Isaac's Cathedral or Isaakievskiy Sobor in Saint Petersburg, Russia is the largest Russian Orthodox cathedral in the city. It is the largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest cathedral in the world
Truly God inspired. the mosaic murals were jaw opening. To think an artesian could arrange tiny squares of stone to create a perfect picture.
Great. I liked every thing. It is the largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest cathedral in the world.

Jaw-droppingly beautiful. Magnificent! Even before we entered I was impressed. The columns, the doors, oh my, I was speechless. And then inside! It is one of the most beautiful buildings I've been in, & I've been in a few! An absolute must when in St Petersburg.

Saint Isaac. You have to go on the top to see the sceniary of all the city .
Always a huge queue to buy ticket but when it's open it's going fast

Impressive!. This famous cathedral holds 13,000 people. It is magnificient, boasting impressive facades and interior. It is the only cathedral that I featured in our video of St. Petersburg (see https://vimeo.com/album/3471788/video/132972070).

Nice views from the colonnade. We went up to the colonnades on a bright Summer evening, and the views were great. There are less than 250 steps, wide stairway, and visitors go up from onde side and down from the other, so don't worry about getting too tired.

an iconic landmark. a very "western" style cathedral: for a person actively practicing Orthodoxy (and a native of St. Petersburg), it's too modern and too "European". If people don't mind so-not-Byzantine style, it's definitely a treat. The entrance fee is too steep in my opinion. The colonnade is a separate ticket, and it's not for those with fear of heights. Opulent, huge, and it's something to do in the evening if you're in the area.
must see in st Petersburg.. close to Hermitage , take the tower to top and have a great birds eye view of St Petersburg. Cathedral was beautiful as well with all gold as any monument offer in Russia.

Interesting stories and an amazing view from the terrace upstairs!. Saint Isaac's Cathedral was my first stop in St. Petersburg. The church itself is huge and has many stories to tell, just like its columns made out of material brought from all over Russia. But the best part is the terrace upstairs, from where the view of the city is simply the best - you can see the Neva, the city's main attractions, and of course, the Winter Palace in its unique green colour alond with the many buildings of the Hermitage.

Very nice but bedlam. The church was so busy with large tour groups, private tours and visitors that any spiritual feeling I normally get in a church, particulary one of this magnitude, was missing.It was ridiculously busy which made it difficult to see some of the features. What we did see were spectacular with lavishly decorated.The marble and malachite columns are incredibly gorgeous as are the statues, sculptures and amazing dome.My advise is to get there early or go late and certainly avoid Tuesday's as it is the biggest cruise ship tour day.

Another Wonder of the World. Another incredible cathedral, built in a completely different style. This is more of an European style architecture and the story behind it is another amazing story. The engineering and labor that it took to build this cathedral is beyond unique. The painting here rivals any other cathedral. It is another fee for entry but it is worth it.
Lovely. The church, completely incrusted with mosaic tiles, was wonderful. This is one of the places all people visiting St. Petersburg should visit. It's worth a look.

Russian St Peter's Basilica. Huge dome and imposing pillars from the exterior with cavernous interior and beautiful works of art. Too crowded to have the poignant hush of a cathedral but there is a small corner for believers to light a candle and say a prayer. Extra charge to climb to the tower but we were told the views weren't quite worth the climb.

The Vatican of Russia. I was very surprised to see this Cathedral, as it reminded me of the great works seen at the Vatican, but with a unique use of colors in the marble and granite, and the desire to honor God with the best.Its a must see in St Petersburg !!

So large and so impressive. This is the 4th largest domed cathedral in the world and every inch of it is adorned with sculptures and reliefs. Many precious marbles and stones were used to decorate the inside and again the mosaics and paintings are stunning. So much to feast your eyes on!

A must see attraction 40 years in the making from 1818. This grand cathedral is the third largest domed cathedral in the world dedicated to victory over Napoleon. This place is lavishly decorated and will blow you away. A key issue to remember is that during the summer the place is crammed with big numbers of tourists. Our decision to have a private tour guide was definitely a winner.
well worth a look. well worth a visit,completely restored in recent years, very impressive. be sure to take a camera. we visited on a Sunday which was no problem

St Isaac's Cathedral SPB. This is an amazing treasure to to see, upclose & personal.
To have the privilege of seeing all of the art paintings and history...

unusual engineering, courageous build, a lot of art. the model expaining how this enormous cathedral was built with no modern mechanical means is wonderful. The building is impressivre and the treasures of art inside are breath taking.
Unsettling stairs to the top but worth the view!. A historic cathedral with a beautiful interior. If you climb to the top, be prepared for some step, unsettling stairs. The views are great though.

The paintings are not paintings. Increadible, when you first look at what you think are paintings, there are infact mosaics. Very fortunate that this was partially saved in the "revolution" and has now been almost put back how it was. You will amaze yourself in the most fantastic detail, columns outside on an impressive building, but when you go in, your eyes will widen. Allow over an hour to get the most of the visit. It does get busy of course, but the people do move around.
It's not just a church. It's not just a church.when u talk about somewhere to pray it doesn't mean that location is just for that and this church was in this category.

Lovely, but Kazan Cathedral is free. St. Isaac's is a beautiful mixture of Russian Orthodox and Western Christian architecture, but it will run you 400 rubles to get inside, whereas you can see something quite similar for free at Kazan Cathedral. If you are already visiting Church of the Savior on the Spilled Blood and the Peter and Paul Cathedral, you should feel absolutely free to skip this one.

Very impressive cathedral. St Isaacs is probably the most impressive cathedral in St Petersburg. It starts with the huge granite columns outside. They also have a lot of painting on huge inside that are actually mosaic as the weather destroys paintings. The alter is very impressive with a gray stained glass of Jesus. It is not a working church so you can wear shorts etc. It is definitely a must visit for St Petersburg.

Fantastic climb to top. This cathedral is the most imposing I think in St Petersburg. There are lots of steps to the top so be prepared, but it is well worth the effort. The views are great and it is not expensive.

MUST!. St. Isaacs cathedral is a MUST when visiting St. Petersburg.
You can also buy tickets to go to the roof, where you can enjoy an amazing 360' view of the city.
Breathtaking. If you have not been to the Vatican, this is almost as stunning as St Peters Basilica. Absolutely stunning and worth the visit.....
St. Isaac's Cathedral. This was stunning to see, our TJ tours was perfect, with such detailed information. We would recommend to see this.

A "must see" in St. Petersburg. This was the first cathedral that our guide took us to during a recent visit to St. Petersburg, which has many churches and palaces. The building is amazing and the interior has to be seen. The craftsmanship and artistry are superb-the dome with it's tiny dove-shaped window was worth the price of admission. There are so many examples of fine craftsmanship that must have taken years to complete. We were in awe of the many fine works of art.

Opulence at its best. Amazing. Takes your breath away when you enter. Only spent 1.5 hours here but could have spent the whole day. So much to see and take in. Well behaved crowds who respected the Cathedral and were quiet.

Biggest Orthodox Church.... The biggest Russian Orthodox Church and the 4th biggest Cathedral in the World, its so big thats very difficult to properly describe it. The massive dome on top its almost 100 meters tall and its pure gold showing the opulence of St. Petersburg at its best. Lots of frescos and sculptures inside to admire but a strict no flash photography policy its apply.The building itself its a marvelous engineering masterpiece with a neoclassical russian byzantine style but of an immense size and proportions. By paying a small fee you can access to the observation platform to have a preferential view of the city from the top. Do it if you can manage the steps!!!
nice view from the top. go anytime there, both inside and up to see view from the roof, you can see all of the city's places

Mosaics!. St. Isaac's is amazing. Not only is it huge, it has the only stained glass in a Russian Orthodox Church. They began to make mosaic replicas of the paintings as they knew the climate in St. Petersburg would damage the canvas, however WWII came before they could exchange the mosaics for the canvas paintings.
