As a result, several huge mosaics are on ground level and you can see the amazing skill involved in replicating the original painting.

Beautiful striking landmark cathedral. We were staying in the hotel Angleterre just across from St Isaacs Cathedral and could see it from our window, it was a great landmark to find our way back to. Great views from the walkway and a beautiful painted interior.

Impressive Period Church. Directly across a small park from the Astoria hotel. Take the walk up to the top section for an outstanding view of the city 360 degrees! Front doors are bronze and weigh 40 tons!

Incredible inside. Incredible inside - what does it mean? It's really awesome place: culture, history and luxury in one place and I'm talking only about the building inside. It is really worth seeing.Moreover, there's very good guide system - a lot of them for little groups. Just take a ticket and go.As for the facade, the building appear to be an architectual creation of incredible beauty.So come and see.There are several excursions for explorering the Cathedral inside and outside. And even the one that takes place on the top (go there!).

Smells like russia. Impressive and tradional orthodox church. Its a place of cult, not a tourism atraction. Dark indoors and the strong incense smell matches the serious face of the prayers and grave beards of the monks.It's a cool atmosphere, put on your funeral face, pretend you are there for spiritual enlightment and enjoy.No photos.
Rivals any church around the world. It's hard to articulate how wonderfully laid out this immense church is and it's also filled with absolutely fabulous iconic religious art and sculpture.

Great Cathedral. This is a beautiful iconic cathedral in St. Petersburg. BEWARE-of the the people dressed like Catherine and Peter. First they rip you off by asking for $5 to use your camera to take your photo and then when you have your arm around them for the photo you get pickpocketed. We didn't give them the $5 and as we watched others get ripped off we were amazed by this scam.

A feast for the eyes. This cathedral is glorious to behold from afar, and from up close. The traffic around it is insane with all the tour buses, and people just commuting. The mosaics inside are lovely, as are the diorama's about the construction, and spot the difference between the mosaics and paintings. There is a lot of room in the Cathedral so if you can squeeze between the tour groups you can get better views of things. This is another place that on a tour you will not have enough time to appreciate it all. But it is still wonderous.

Very beautiful cathedral!. It's one of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen. Although some parts of it are being repaired it's really worth to attend! Keep in mind there are ticket machines by the entrance so there's no need to stay in the queue.

A Saint Petersburg must see.. As you ride through and around St. Petersburg, St. Isaac's and it's iconic Gold dome seem to dominate the city scene. We were with a small group guided tour and were lucky enough to not only stop for photos outside the Cathedral, but were able to go inside and take in all the elegance of this beautiful Russian Orthodox Cathedral. It is very popular with tourists and a very important part of St. Petersburg which makes it a must see.
Spectacular Cathedral. Cathedral is restored to the Glory of the Tzar era. Spectacular stone work, icons. Well worth going and spending time under the majestic dome.

And yes it is BIG!!. We saw a lot of Russian Orthodox cathedrals throughout No Europe and while they each had their own unique beauty, St Isaac's is definitely grandiose and awe-inspiring!! The full dome is plated with pure gold as well as having 12 statues of angels. If you are able to go on a tour, do so because the architectural design and building process is remarkable and I'm unable to actually describe and/or remember it all!! If you don't have time to go in, at least have your picture taken in front of it!!

The grandest cathedral of St Petersburgl. This cathedral is for me one of the most majestic churches in a city of beautiful churches. It is the largest Russian Orthodox basilica and is a working church with the main church in use only on Feast days, It's gigantic golden dome is unmistakeable in the center of Isaakiyevskaya and should be included in a walking tour of the center of St Petersburg,
Good for a quick photo stop.. Part of the historic Czar ruled Russia. Beautiful and worth a quick stop for some photos. Not too far from other popular locations in the city.
Breathtaking. A must see and highly recommend to get the audio tour . An impressive piece of history . Please respect the no flashlight photography rule
Wheelchair accessible. Worthwille seeing, the ramp is unfortunatly at least 45degrees, you must need a person to assist you. You will not regret it!

Beautiful. Quiet large space with a huge dome that lights the dark walls that are decorated with murals. So much to look at. More mosaic, stained glass, painted murals. Blues and gold. Interesting to learn how the pillars outside were raised.
Too Crowded to enjoy. This is a very interesting place, however, it was so crowded we could not appreciate.Try to go during off season not in June.

The Granite Columns are Unbelievable. This cathedral dominates the surrounding area and that is quite a feat given all of the amazing sites there. The trek to the upper viewing area is worth the walk and you will feel like you have done your exercise for the day!

Awesome Interior!. It is huge. I was spellbound by the interior of the cathedral. Some steps to climb to get to the entrance. You buy tickets from a machine. Using Rubles is most convenient.Worth paying to get in.

A must.. This is the main cathedral in St Petersburg and you must not miss it. As it is massive, it feels less crowded than other touristic attractions and for good walkers, going up the dome offers a magnificent view over the city.

Spectacular mosaics!. We toured St. Issac's Cathedral with a small tour group. Make sure to take time in viewing the amazing mosaics throughout the interior. Outside you can walk across the square & get an appreciation for the beauty of the exterior of the cathedral. This is certainly a highlight in St. Petersburg not to be missed!

Example of Neo-Classical Architecture in St Petersburg. St Isaac's is a stunning example of neo-classical architecture in St. Petersburg and not to be missed. You only need about two hours to see the entire cathedral complex.
Great views at sunset. Outstanding sight, beautiful mosaics, 200 steps to the top. 400roubles for museum and 300 for the climb to the observation area for the best views over st Petersburg.
Not to Miss. Take advantage of summertime lights and climb to the top as it's open late at night. No need trying to battle tourists in the middle of the day, do it after 9PM.

Avoid a wednesday. The museum part is closed on wednesday.However you can climb the colonnade and get an awesome 360 view of St. Petersburg. You have to climb a spiral staircase of about 270 + 50 steps to get to the top and you will have a birds eye view of St. Petersburg. The staircase is made of stone and is an amazing piece of architecture in its own.
history. Must go and see, incredible mosaics and history. Also, should go with a private tour as you will learn and see so much more.
Impressive Buliding. Very Impressive buliding surrounded by beautiful parkland. lots of souviener stalls wanting your trade in the area you often get to visit this on a St Petersburg tour
Impressive Inside & Out. The exterior of this cathedral looks great from the street, but be sure to go inside... very grand interior. Definitely worth a visit.

fantastic. located in the city center, this fabulous church is one of the best in the world as for its architecture. we have enjoyed a lot the iew form the colomnade. it gives you a great view 360 degrees of the whole city. inside it's a fantastic museums thanks to all its wondres

Simply amazing. The best thing is to go inside and then to the top! From the top ud have a 360° wonderful viwe of the city. There are no elevators so u should be in good condition to walk and face the stairs!
Historically interesting and great views. Quite spectacular, it's a part of the history of this beautiful city but mind you, if it's rainy and windy the trip upstairs to the terrace may be unpleasant

Beautiful Landmark. It is a very beautiful building, I have many great photos on my camera thanks to this church. We learned a bit about it from our tour guide from the cruise ship. Definitely something to check out while in St.Petersburg.

Amazing place one has to see. I have been here several times. And now my American friends have been visiting me and I show them a city and the Cathedral is the place that could not be missed.After they made tour of Cathedral I had heard their enthusiastic reviews: astounding, breathtaking, excellent and so on. Going to see that beautiful man’s creation don’t forget to take a guide. You can book foreign speaking guide for group anywhere from 5 to 30 people (1000 – 3000 ruble) or just take audio guide (100 ruble). There are a lot one should learn about history of Cathedral. Another amusement you get there is ascent of colonnade from where you could see a stupendous and beautiful view of city core, look at roofs its buildings. It is cheaper to visit it during the day as at evening time (after 6 p.m.) you get high price.
Amazing architecture!. Beautiful paintings! Worse part is it's really packed with people. I suggest that you come in early.
Exceptional views from the colonnade!. You MUST see the inside of this cathedral and you MUST pay extra to go up to the colonnade level to see the views of St. Petersburg. It is well worth it!

Great view. We went one afternoon, and seeing the crowds and the long queue to get tickets (even though there was only 45 mins left before closing), we decided to come back early the next day. This was a good decision and we got in the ticket queue 30 mins before opening. This meant that we were one of the first ones in.We made straight for the stairs to get the view which was amazing. The church itself was beautiful, but for us, it was the tower and the views through the angels that made it so memorable.
Must see!!. St. Isaac's is simply amazing! The outside of this cathedral is beautiful, but the inside will leave you speechless. A definite must see when you visit St.Petersburg.
Must See!. Spectacular interior! Unique and filled with artistic riches. It is really a must see attraction. Plan to spend at least one hour and bring your camera!

Stunning Inside and Out!. One of the largest cathedrals in the world, the magnificent gold domes on the outside give you a little hint of what you will find on the inside . . . every tiny space inside this building is ornate. Magnificent colored marble and precious stones and gems cover every square inch. I especially loved the lapiz embedded marble columns. The domes are amazing inside - while touring, don't forget to look UP!
Great Orthodox Church!. Great tour with St Petersburg tour guide. Wonderful, expansive place! Won't take long and definitely a don't miss.
Impressive Cathedral, great views.. The inside of the cathedral os quite impresssive but it's well worth paying the extra to hike up the stairs to the top. Gret views of St Pete.

Dazzling size. Massive in evert way imaginable. There's room for several regular sized cathedrals in this behemoth. Interesting exhibits about how the communists tried to use it as a place to inspire atheism as well as models of how the church was built. Colourful decorations including pillars in deep shades of green and blue - all rounded off with the usual gold ornamental style that's typical of Russian orthodox churches. These days it's a museum except for one small part that still operates as a 'proper' church.
roof top views. a beautiful view from the roof and a panoramic view. make sure you take this in if you are travelling to St. Petersburg
Stunning. Makes you stand and look, crowds with cameras are a shame but it doesn't,t spoil the majesty of this building.
Outstanding. We went to the top and enjoyed the magnificient view. The interior is outstanding with so many icons.

Great View from the colonnade. This cathedral is on the grand scale of St Peters in Rome. The busses pulled up to the base of the building seem dwarfed. The interior is opulent and resplendent in its gilding, the rare stones used in the columns, and the dome is magnificent. If religious sites are not your thing, this is still worth a visit to walk up the 210 steps to the base of the colonnade around the dome. The views are 360 and give a clear sense of the layout of St Petersburg. That said, beware the lines again. Queuing at the ticket booth is old school: a scrum to get into the shortest line. If you do both the museum, that is the church interior, and the colonnade, be prepared to walk around the building twice because oddly one the exits of both attractions are the rear and the entrance to both are the front. and the ticket booth is at the rear too.
A must see. Make sure you pay the extra to go up the colonnade. There wasn't a queue and great views from the top. The inside of the Cathedral is huge and extremely interesting

Cannot Miss. The splendor of this cathedral is something you will not forgot. I would recommend the English audio guide, it lasts about 45 minutes and is well worth it. Also, if you are physically able, climb the 200 steps to the colonnade - it costs a bit extra but was well worth it. Incredible!

Scenic view from the top of the Cathedral. The view from the top of the Isaac Cathedral is just awesome where we get to see the whole city with breeze flowing from all sides and getting a perfect click through camera or a Perfect Selfie is like icing on the cake. Worth Visiting...

Meseum leaves some wanting. so to go up to the roof, 150 rubles,so worth it, it is gorgeous and they have even managed to make it wheelchair accessible a feat for russia which normally doesn't do this nicely if at all, however the museum isn't really worth it, the church is nice, but there are a lot nicer ones in the city. I got the russian student price as i am in school here, but i feel i would be disappointed at the higher price point. Also very expensive gift shop don't buy stuff there.
Iconic. The declaration of excellence in art for the glory of God is unsurpassed. This must not be missed. A very crowded place for all the right reasons. Very moving!
A must for the view. We went just for the view at dusk which is really beautiful. Didn't visit the museum. You can buy tikets just for going to the top. No elevator.

Beautiful!. We visited St. Isaac's Cathedral on our first day of a two-day tour of St. Petersburg. There are so many churches in St. Petersburg, it would be impossible to visit all in two days. Our tour included St. Isaac's. Since this was the only church we went inside, it's impossible to compare to the others. But, St. Isaac's will not disappoint. It is a beautiful place to visit. We did make a stop at the Church of the Spilt Blood. We would have liked to have gone inside since this is the church with all the mosaics. Maybe on another trip!
Startling interior. I had seen St. Isaacs only from the outside. I was unprepared for the magnificent interior. A good guide, and we had a very good guide, is essential
Amazing. Very impressive inside, and a working church as well. You can order a tour, that would be very handy. There are mosaic pictures inside and the decorations really are impressive.
amazing artwork. one should not miss it when visiting St Petersburg. The architecture and art work are masterpieces. Beware of pickpockets.

Beautiful. Beautiful catgedral from outside look.we took tickets of genrenal but it came out as only museum ticket....colonel tickets are 100/150 ruble extra.....so take tickets of colonel too...we missed colonel.
Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful stained glass windows and lavish decoration. Great views from the dome over the whole of St Petersburg.

A very special building--inside and out. Few times have we ever been to a cathedral as special as this one. The history of the building and the builder are enough to draw you into the venue, but the art and engineering will keep you! The mosaics on the walls are the best we have seen--they are beautiful and done to perfection. The size of the stones are so small it is hard to believe they are real!The space inside the building is well planed and delights the eye at every turn. This is one not to be missed! One of the high points of St. Petersburg!

So - it's a Cathedral. We didn't do the Colonade climb, which might have been interesting, and surely would have been exciting given the sign saying "beware of high winds" - but the Cathedral itself, while large and dramatic - doesn't compete with the Cathedral of Spilled Blood for drama, nor with the Cathedral of Transfiguration for Music. I'd suggest either (both) of those over this one.
Beautiful cathedral. No time to pursue the inside, but a very striking building which was visible for a great distance with its golden domes.

Stunning view of Saint Petersburg. The colonnade walkway was a very good experience (But too crowded). 360 degrees stunning views of Saint Petersburg. Totally worthy. The ticket to access colonnade is separate from museum, you have to buy another / package ticket to access both museum and colonnade. I didn't go inside the museum therefore I've no idea whether it's good or not.
Amazing. Beautiful cathedral and breathtaking view from the upper part. But everyone must know that to climb to the upper part you have climb 200 stairs.

Absolutely Fantastic. I have been to many cathedrals throughout Europe. St.Isaac's Cathedral in St.Petersburg is top-notch, in my opinion. Not to be missed! My jaw dropped the minute I entered the cathedral. It certainly has that WOW factor. It's an architectural gem both inside and out.
Jerry&Karen's trip. Great but for the crowds. Otherwise, truly beautiful. The immensity of the place is overwhelming. We were awed by it all
Lovely. Worth a visit despite the queue. Rich in History and very beautiful inside too. Pure Bliss. Beware of pick-pockets outside.
Beautiful example of massive Orthodox cathedral. Fascinating monolith of an impressive Orthodox cathedral with superb & cavernous interior beautifully decorated & adorned

Phenomenal. This church is absolutely beautiful inside and out. This is a must see on any trip to St. Petersburg. To truly appreciate all the intricacies close up would require a visit of several hours.

Nice view over the city. The roof offers a great view over the entire city, although in high season it can be very busy. I recommend buying a ticket for the museum inside as well, it is not only a Cathedral, but has a lot of historical information about the siege of Leningrad as well.
View from the Dome. is not to be missed. Great view of the city! It is also located in a wonderful part of the historic district with a number of good restaurants nearby.
Gorgeous and over the top!. Amazing church that reminded me of the Vatican. You can see the city views from the roof. Marvelous attraction!

Stunning!. The dome of this cathedral is impressive and can be seen from most areas of St Petersburg. The inside of the cathedral is beautiful and has a great display of how the cathedral was actually built. Must see!

Incredible interior. St Isaac's is the largest Orthodox basilica in the world and like all the best neo-classical architecture appears much smaller from the outside than from within.Once inside its true scale really hits you and the phenomenal architectural design and artworks are truly breathtaking in their beauty. Hundreds of different types of marble were used in its construction and gold is everywhere. The huge dome is surrounded by gold-leaf covered statues as the light streams down into the church.You can also climb up to the dome for some fantastic views out over the city. A must when in town.
Breath Taking. The beauty of this church takes your breath away. We spent quite a bit of time here and would go back again.

Great place to visit by day & by night. It is a very nice cathedral.You may visit the inside which is gorgeous.But also you may go to the colonnade (almst the rooftop) - around 250 steps on the stairs. During summer & holidays entrance to the colonnade is open until 4 a.m. (price by night is higher)You deserve this visit!

Beautiful and enchanting. The Cathedral is certainly worth visiting. Its architecture is fascinating and eye-catching. The artwork inside are colorful, exquisite and adorable. May be a bit lacking in variety as compared to the decor and exhibits in Hermitage and St Catherine 's Palace.

on the top of St Petersburg. do not miss the Colonnade for the superb view on the city 221 steps to the top. The interior is magnificent, part of the history of the city. Billets are on sale b the outside kiosk -

Monumental Columns. St Isaac's was constructed between 1818-1858. The mosaics, outrageous sculptures, pictures, and humongous columns are made from malachite, lapis lazuli, and other materials. This was once the largest Cathedral in Russia. It is a jewel and spectacular to visit.
Fabulous xix century cathadral. This gigantic catedral is probably the best cathedral to be built in the xix century. Beautiful interiors with imposing amounts of malaquite.

Beautiful Cathedral. Just beautiful with so much to see. It was originally a church that was converted into a museum. The interior was vast and opulent and was filled with 19th century works of art and mosaic icons.

Great view of the city. If you visit Saint Petersburg go to the top of the cutch. It's very cheap, gives a superb view of the city and the walk up the stairs will check you stamina. Really enjoyed yonder this beautiful city from the top

Beautiful cathedral. Shame about the scaffolding on the front but maintenance must be done. Inside is unbelievable. Mosaic walls, fabulous sculptures and the main attraction is the stained glass widow depicting Jesus. Don't miss this place, it's unforgettable.

St Isaac's Cathedral. Wow! Unbelievable beauty and grandeur. It's a must on your tour. The art is absolutely stunning, the shape of the Cathedral from inside and out makes you wonder about all the work and the talent of the artists who made this masterpiece!

Must see the inside!. This Cathedral is very beautiful inside and out. Guided tours are the way to go in St Petersburg so make sure you get one that sees the inside of this Cathedral. It is like a mini St Peters in Rome.
Breathtaking!. This is a must see. It is well worth the expense. It was one of the most beautiful buildings I visited.
St. Isaac's Cathedral. Hard to keep my mouth closed--so many oohs, Wows. The mosaics were so perfect, so brilliantly colored, and everywhere!
Very thorough tour with our guide. The interior design and décor is beyond description. The reliefs, craftsmanship and art work are amazing and very beautiful.

Quintessential Russian architecture full of history.. We had two opportunities to see this cathedral, we were able to take photos of the outside from many different angles and then go inside by coming to it on both days.

A Georgeous Monument to Traditional Mother Russia. This cathedral ,,,now a museum is just a monument to Russian traditional architecture and a simply overpowering display of Mosaic art, the traditional icons of Orthodoxy; it's just overwhelming and a memorable symbol of the deeply religious fervor of the Russian people, particularly after the repression of religion under the USSR regimes. What added to our tour impression was the crowds of obviously devote Russians. Thsi place is simply memorable and a "must see" part of any visit to St. Petersburg.!

second st peters. this is a very impressive cathedral.very big and the inside decoration must have costed a fortune.definitively a must see for people visiting st petersburg. it is also quite close to hermitage and admirality
Massive. The 4th largest church in the world. Granit columns made of single slabs that are giant and still bear the marks of shelling during WWII.

Great downstairs not so interesting upstairs. Inside is great with a range of construction materials, decoration and architectural features. The views from the collonade although far reaching are nothing special.

Beautiful building. It is an incredible structure architecturally and the artwork is incredible. The colours of the different stones used in its construction and the gold combined with the religious paintings are quite breathtaking. The size of the building is awe-inspiring and the views from the external gallery are well worth seeing if you don't mind the 250 plus steps and the height.
breathtaking museum. we visited on a tour and as with everything we saw in St Petersburg it was beautiful. Thank goodness it was not destroyed in the revolution.

I even had to pay to visit this former church.... It was not worth paying for this Muzeum-church, perhaps it would have been better if I had climbed the church to see the skyline of SPB, but unfortunately, the collonade was closed....

Nice panoramic view of the downtown from the church.... I never thought that this church is very beautiful it doesn't show real Russia, but I loved the experience to be inside, especially on top of the church. You can make really good photos from there what will be good memory.
Beautiful Cathedral. St. Isaac's Cathedral is beautiful. The cupola is breathtaking and the adornments are spectacular. I was especially fascinated to see the worshipers inside.

In top 5 of St-Pet!. Best time to visit is lat spring or beginning of autumn. I have been there several times and still get impressed as I see it. Don't forget to upstairs to see the view and breath a little fresher air.

The best of St Peter !!. To visit the Cathedral.There are 2 types of tickets. One to get inside the cathedral. The other to get to the roof. I recommend buying both tickets. (Students discounts are available on tickets via Students card)The architecture of the cathedral is magnificent. from the statues, large columns, Golden Dome at the exterior to the fine paintings covering the cathedral's interior. you will find models of the earlier versions of the cathedral and know more about it's history.On the roof top, You will get a magnificent view of st peter. you can see all the city with it;s famous landmarks like: kazan cathedral and Church of spilled blood. however you must be ready to climb the stairs to the top.
Visit. A must to see in Saint Petersburg . Absolutely amazing and beautiful , I was not expecting to see such a beautiful Church in Russia.

See it at night. When the glorious dome is floodlit against the night sky. If you visit early in the season you may be lucky enough to see some of the carriage horses being brought out for exercise/training.
Very majestic just like St Peter's Basilica in Vatican city. It's different from other cathedrals in St Petersburg. It's the largest Orthodox cathedral in St Petersburg
Alot of Steps. But very rewarding, very tight staircase winding up with I think 180 steps. but the view is amazing. there was a lift but I think for disabled and staff only.

Beautiful Cathedral. Cathedral is beautiful! You should take an audio tour or a guide with you if you are interested in knowing more about the place. Helps you understand the cathedral, its construction and history better. The colonnade tour is a must, you get to see the entire city from top. Beautiful during sunset

A lovely church. It's a lovely church, and a testament to the rehabilitation of religious culture in St. Petersburg since the fall of the iron curtain. If you're up for a climb, the view from the top is spectacular (according to my sweetie--I'm not a fan of stairs!).

Our favorite cathedral in St.Petersburg, Not to be missed!. If you're only in St. Petersburg for a couple hours or less than a day, make sure this is one of your stops in the city.St. Isaac's cathedral is amazing outside and in. The architecture of the cathedral and its massive dome was historical at the time. You really don't appreciate it's size until you get inside. The walls are completely decorated with paintings and frescos, although to many of the frescos are now being recreated as mosiacs, but it's still amazing.The colors and designs inside cannot be expressed in words and this is also one of the few cathedrals in St. Petersburg that has stained glass.You will be blown away by this cathedral and it's on our list as one of the beautiful we've ever seen in the world.
amazing. totally worth the visit... a fabulous construction, a must in St Pet...dont skip it! Very good guides readily available for any questions you might have

Beautiful inside. Even though it looks fine on the outside, the inside was amazing. Truly wonderful with colourful mosaics, gold ornaments and massive wooden doors. Definitely one of those cathedral you should enter if you only want to choose a few.

Interestign and impressive. St Isaacs is a nineteenth-century cathedral, in the European rather than Russia style, but worth a visit none the less. Don't simply go for the colonnade - which has splendid views across the city, but also check out the church interior.

It took 40 years to construct this cathedral!. What an imposing monument - the fourth largest domed cathedral of its type in the world. It is well worth exploring inside, as well as to climb to the top and enjoy the views. You can still see evidence of the "great patriotic war" on the outside columns, left as a reminder.

Impressive because of size!. Truly massive in size, a marvel of technology for its era! Interesting historical detail: it was finished off with the proceeds of the sale of Alaska to the USA! Poor trade at the end of the day!

Must see inside, roof not really . It is a very beautiful cathedral, it is worthy to see it. Entrance costs 250 RUB (~4€).
On the other hand, climbing to the roof is not that interesting, costs 150 RUB and it is not really high due to that you don't have a great view.

So breathtaking and awesome. Another must stop in St. Petersburg. It's as if the cathedral is shining out to the heavens. This is one of the greatest cathedrals on the planet. Be prepared for large crowds and fast moving tour groups. The mosaics, artwork, floor work and architecture of this fabulous structure are magnificent to behold!
Must See. This is one of the great cathedrals in the world. Despite the crowds, we enjoyed the beautiful, mosaics, paintings, floor and architecture of this fabulous structure.
Visit this place. This Cathedral is the number one to visit! Recently renovated and you can go to top to see the beauty of the City.

St. Isaac's Cathedral State Museum-Memorial. You can go up the cathedral to get a great view of the city. We went up in the evening and there was fireworks but it was too bright out to make it out clearly.
Climb to the top of it, you won't regret. There is a wonderful view of the city from the top of this cathedral, even if it's winter, go there!
2nd best church in St. Petersburg. Do not miss this church, the interior and exterior are special and very memorable. Everywhere one looks a fantastic work of art exists.
Definitely worth a visit. Beautiful old church, stunning architecture, fascinating history as museum to atheism. The view from the top of the Collonade is not to be missed!
Very nice. Amazing church. A must see while in Saint Petersburg. Stunning architecture. The mosaics are so colorful.
Very impressive Cathedral. I have seen many churches and cathedrals in more than 20 years of travelling like a madman. This one ranks within the top 3. A must see.
Superb church. We loved this old church and itts marvelous columns of marble. Don't just visit inside; walk the perimeter and view all the statues and filigree. Well worth a visit.
Spectacular. A must see in St. Petersburg. The cathedral is a soaring masterpiece with a beautiful dove in the center of the dome.
Magnificent. It may look too solemn, but come closer, and you realized it's the heart of St. Petersburg, warm and beautiful, scarred by the war but still living.

must see - DO not buy Petersburg Tourist card.. nice visit, less busy end of day. Do not use St-Petersburg Card... it is a waste of money and most important attraction in St-Petersburg are not included (hermitage, peterhoff palace, Catherine palace, imperial porcelain museum, and many other sites; you will either only recuperate 30% to break even...
Very beautiful, worth a visit. One of the Grand buildings in St. Petersburg. Great architecture with excellent photo opportunities.

Impressive and unique structure. We went on the free tour (offered only in Russian) and our tour guide while not super enthusiastic was very well informed and had interesting facts to pass on. This church has an incredible interior. We went here on the same day we went to the church of spilled blood and it was interesting to compare the French Baroque and Russian Revival styles. One of the most interesting things about St. Isaac's are the mosaics which were designed to replaced the original painting decoration. These carefully crafted mosaics are indistinguishable from paintings until you are right next to them. The entire building is astoundingly grand.
Climb the tower for the sunset. Head here and climb the tower while the sun is setting. It has a 360 degree view of the city and is wonderful in the late evening.

Gold artworks one of a kind. The frescoes were absolutely gorgeous. The gold sculptures were out of this world - I have never seen anything quite like it before. Such talent and beauty. This is one attraction you must see. Not far from the cathedral is a gorgeous Indian restaurant called Tandoor - a must visit eatery. It is about 100m straight down the road from the cathedral exit.
Wow!. You should definately take audio-guide. Going upstairs to see the city is really a breath-taking experience. It's a pity that some part of the exterior of the Cathedral is under renovation...

Massive size impressive. If you didn't know you could mistake this building from the outside for a museum. It takes up a block and has massive granite columns (114 tons apiece, each made from 1 solid piece of granite) The massive gold dome is covered with 220 pounds of gold. Everything about this church is massive. The interior can hold 5000 people. Inside at either end of the church there are pairs of 20 ton carved wooden doors. Only a small alcove is used for Orthodox services now. If you want to go in that part, women must cover their heads. Since this is essentially a museum now there are displays with history on how the church was built, etc. I say do not miss this site
It is very good. We thought it was excellent, but after the Spill Blood it comes at a far second. Great and big cathedral, one of the largest in the world with excellent mosaics.
Vast beauty. Very large cathedral with lovely decor and immense center dome. Certainly worth a stop, won't take more than an hour...
WoW. One of the world's largest cathedrals that dominates St Petersburg. Magnificent opulent interior, stain glass windows,mosaics and other artwork. A must see when visiting St Petersburg
Cold feeling. This was a huge church and interesting as such as well as by reputation. Inside, however, we felt that it was cold and nothing special. Do once, but do not expect too much......

really great experience in St.-Petersburg, absolutely must-see spot. St. Isaac's Cathedral is one of the best places to visit in St.-Petersburg. This experience is an aboslute must for tourists and I strongly recommend it. In fact, this cathedral is luxury and impressive cathedral not only from outside but from interior as well. At the same time there is a possibility to clibm up the stairs to see the city panorama from the top of the cathedral. Moreover, take note that during white night season cathedral is opened during evening/night time, please check the web page to get the details.

Beautiful and imponent church. The church is a good piece of art. We can appreciate all the marble in the exterior, visit this church inside and also climb up to the roof to admire the view of the city.

Visit during White Nights. It is one of the prime spots for any visitor to St-Petersburg. We visited it on a white night. On that days the working hours are longer. Make sure you get both tickets - one to the cathedral itself, another - to a viewing platform on the top. The handrails are small, so it is not recommended for claustrophobic people. The Cathdral itself survived the Siege intact because Germans used it a convenient landmark for correcting artillery fire.
Must see. You can go to the roof and have a great view of the city. Also inside the museum you can see great paintings.

Trip to the top worth it. This is a giant in every sense of the word! Entry to both the viewing deck and interior is at the front and back. The quickest way are 2 ticket machines at the back door which sells tickets for a combined visit or interior/ viewing deck separately. There was a big problem with the machines not accepting almost pristine bank notes which was driving some people, understandably nuts. You can use your credit/ debit card but don't forget to get the tickets which are dispensed under the key pad. The climb to the top isn't really arduous and the views worth it. There is a hairy bit at the top both going up and down, not for the nervous. If you are caught for time I didn't think the interior was as spectacular as other cathedrals in terms of atmosphere (Kazan Cathedral, Monastery of Alexander Nevsky).

Fantastic City Views. Not only is this architecturally beautiful, St. Isaac's has fantastic views from the top. We could see many landmarks from the roof. The interior is exceptional and the exterior has a large columnade with massive doors. If you are on the St Peter's Line ferry tour (72 hours visa free), this is the location of one of the shuttle stops. Plan a clear day to visit the top.

Church no 2 on our itinerary. Quite wonderful - really atmospheric and much more somber than the brightly coloured church of the spilled blood. The icons were beautiful and its a truly impressive building, inside and out.

Must See!. We loved St. Isaac's Cathedral State Museum-Memorial. it is a wonderful pace to visit. be sure when you visit that you get a ticket to the top of the cathedral. The view of St. Petersburg is breathtaking.

Gorgeous cathedral, beautiful views of St Petersburg. As with some of the other attractions, check out the ticket booth for information. They charge separate entry prices for the cathedral interior, the colonnade and audio guide for the interior (by the way - the English version is narrated by Toyah Wilcox!), which is available in several languages and well worth it, as it is very comprehensive. Apart from the golden dome the rest of the exterior of the cathedral looks almost drab and severe compared to the Church of the Saviour on Spilled Blood, but the interior offers some serious competition. This church had fantastic marble and stone interiors with sumptuous paintings, mosaics and floors. The stained glass window of Jesus at the rear of the church is gorgeous and rear lighting genuinely makes him glow behind the main altar. Once you have exited the church, take the just over 200 steps up to the colonnade and enjoy the breathtaking views of the city, you can hire binoculars if you wish when buying your tickets. Plan for a whole morning or afternoon and take your time. You won't regret visiting and like with all St Petersburg attractions, the summer will be crowded and expect to queue for tickets. You will be rewarded with a fantastic attraction however.

Not to be missed. You must look inside AND get up to the boardwalk [joint ticket purchase]! Don't be in a rush ... camera/pictures allowed inside and a definite for the walk. Lots of stairs...nothing too narrow, and all 'one-way'! R800 - early May 2015

Just dazzling!!. Visiting This cathedral was one of the most amazing adventures i have ever joined!!You just stare at the decorations and paintings inside...the large columns outside...leaving no more words to say except"DAZZLING"This cathedral is the 4th largest cathedrals in the world as i remember!!??Never miss visiting this place!!!

Best view of Saint Petersburg. For an awesome photo opportunity with a guaranteed birds eye view of St P you have to go up the Colenade @ St Isaacs - entry price of r150 will provide you with the best view of town guaranteed! Pls note that the queues are long so pick your sunny day and arrive at the ticket booth at 10:15 - don't q on the one at the side as it only sells tickets for entry after 6pm - the normal boots shows the entry time from 10.30

Amazing monument, impressive architecture. Buy tickets for all: inside and outside. The internal is impressive and u can understand how they built up such impressive structure. All the walls are decorated with wonderful paintings as in the past (during CCCP period they were covered or destroyed due to the anti-religion campaign) and some icons and mosaics are renovated and recovered with all theirs magnificent.Our side u find the 200 stairs to the roof: enjoy the gym onto the "spiral staircase" and reach the wonderful panorama on the top: all Peter is under your eyes and the unbelievable view "re-paying " you the efforts to be here and feel frozen by the wind coming through the big marble columns. Make two rounds and discover the city from above. A "must" in San Peter. Around 600 Rubles for in-out visit. Open from 10 to 19 o'clock.Minimum time for visit: 1 hour. *Wednesday closed.
Incredibly beautiful Church. The place is amazing with intricate statuary and stairwAys allowing people to climb all over. At night it is lit up to make a great spectacle.
Nice monument. Centrally located in close vicinity of Nevsky prospect, must visit for anyone visiting St Petesburg. Great paintings and rich interiors makes one awestruck .

Beautiful! Stunning. 400rubles ticket. Looks Roman Catholic but it's orthodox church. Looks like Vatican from inside. View from top is amazing. Tickets cost 400 rubles pax for both church and view. About two hundred stairs to the top.

Interior is jaw-dropping. Initially I wasn't impressed by the exterior but once I stepped inside my jaw dropped. So beautiful. Definitely my favorite attraction in St Petersburg after the Hermitage, putting St Petersburg on par with Paris and Rome in terms of architecture. There is a separate ticket to climb up the cathedral - the view is decent and worth going up.

nice view. We did like the visit to the church. The Cathedral has a huge golden dome that is visible from virtually everywhere.
Especially nice when the weather is decent, as you can walk up the stairs to the top and enjoy the beauty of St. Peterburg from top down. Worth the visit.

One of the major St.Petersburg attractions. St. Isaac’s Cathedral - the fourth tallest domed church in the world, decorated with gigantic one-piece granite columns weighing over 100 tons each! Inside it's richly decorated with inlaid mosaics, paintings and semi-precious stones.One can also get to the colonnade of the cathedral to get a bird's eye view of the city. There is an observation platform there, around 262 steps!Closed on Wednesday.
Better from outside, than from inside. I did expect more from inside, but maybe because I'm not a church type anyway. From out side a great building, and I would rather go to the top, than inside.

A wow building. The architecture is fascinating and the art works inside are interesting too. Even though it is said to be a museum, there was a service going on in a side chapel when I was there. Make sure to pay extra to climb the stairs to the viewing platform at teh base of the dome.

Spectacular! . Both interior and exterior are impressive. The walk up to the top is a must do! Word of warning though, climbing the stairs will take a bit of energy, but the 360 degree view that greets you is spectacular.
Great View of the City. Beautiful church, very interesting story boards that outline the history of the church. The immense wooden carved door were amazing.
Impressive . Grand is the word to describe it. Purchase tickets before but no need to go around building as directions show. There is ATM looking machines up the steps.

Great view from the top, nice church. Make sure to take the steps to the top and get a great view of the city. The inside of the church is impressive as well, but after seeing so many churches in Europe, they all seem to bleed together.

Great experience... I got really lucky as I went there in the middle of the mass... The choir and the priests were singing replying to each other and all the multitude bowing to them. It was an interesting ceremony.
Wonderful ..... One of thé most beautiful church i have ever seen in Russia...... a place of peace and beautiful arts ....

Just impressive. It is hard to say which of St. Petersburg's attraction is the most impressive but St. Isaac's Cathedral belongs to the top. Hard to describe its beauty and spectacular interior. There are some souvenir shops inside with reasonable prices and good selection with no fear to be fooled by seller.

Yet another great cathedral in Russia.. We chose to go up to the roof first, a bit of a climb over 200 steps but worthwhile as you get a great view of St Petersburg.
The inside is what you expect unbelievable colours and gold leaf everwhere.

Really impressive. We saw The Cathedral at 1999, it was under reconstruction. But even though it was worth walking upstairs and looking around. Now The Cathidral and it's Square are amazing. Inside there are excursions and you can find out a lot of interesting facts about St. Isaac's Cathedral. Also you can go upstairs to observation desk and spend some time looking over old city's roofs and streets. Enjoy it!

Imposing. St Isaac's Cathedral is a huge and imposing structure located at one end of St Isaac's Square in the older and more historic part of St Petersburg. Dominated by a golden dome and with red granite columns on all sides, the cathedral is truly overwhelming. At night, the yellow lights add even more drama to the already spectacular cathedral. A minimal entrance fee is collected which is very reasonable considering the spectacle that can be seen inside. Photography inside the cathedral is allowed. The interior of the cathedral is even more marvellous than the exterior. The columns, pillars and beams are made of granite and marble. There is gold decor everywhere including on the icons. The doors are of bronze with sculptured reliefs. A must see!

Critical to the History of St. Petersburg. During the 900-day seige art works were stored here and in the area in front vegetables were grown --- protected from Nazi bombing as the Germans used the Cathedral as an essential marker --- has extraordindary history
Fantastic. Outside you can't guess how beautiful it is. Inside is really huge and impressive. The decoration is stunning.

Colannade adventure. Made the mistake of thinking the Colonnade was inside the cathedral not the bit on the outside. You have to be prepared for a climb of 190 steps inside in a spiral of stone steps and the final 20 metal ones out over the dome to the walk way. It is worth the climb for the views you can really see for miles all across the Saint Petersburg and to see the details of the status on the lower dome. Well worth the 150 roubles and the challenge to your fitness.

Fantastic art, spectacular views, time your visit with a service if you can. There are two separate tickets available, one for the colonnade and one for the museum, or 400 rubles for both, well worth it.The colonnade is a fair old climb, around 300 steps according to the leaflet, however the views are great. The exterior is undergoing renovation currently but you get a close-ish look at the great bells and roof architecture as well.At ground level do not let the term museum put you off. If you ignore the multiple attempts to sell you tourist trinkets there is a fantastic history of the Cathedral, from the new building techniques it involved, with great models and pictures showing the history. I read TA which said there was a free tour so I tagged on to an American couple as they were the only ones speaking English and nobody seemed to mind. I could spend an hour looking at the great doors alone, at 20 tonnes each they must be one of the largest moving works of art? One you have walked around do it again looking up all the time. This is just spectacular, fascinating both in scale, talent and opulence.This is more of a museum than an Cathedral (see the history as a centre of anti-religion in the earlier 20th Century) however the Orthodox church have permission to perform rituals on special occasions. I was lucky enough to see the Easter blessing and it was amazing. I am not a member of the church but appreciated the beauty of the service.

a day out walking. as we within a few miles of the majority of the famous placeswe never walked into most of them as the queues were very large there were a lot of students over here at the same time as well as other tourists

Lovely cathedral in good location. Huge cathedral, well lit at night. We walked up to the Colonade to get a great view of all St. Petersburg. 191 stairs to walk up though.... but worth it for 150 roubles..

The views from the top is amazing!!!. The interior of the Cathedral its amazing, with different halls its really a must!!! Try to go on a moment of a mass, as when the Chorus are singing during the mass moment it makes you chicken skin!!!Buy the ticket to go upstairs at the TOP, the view is breathtaking!!! You will need to be fitness to do more than 200 steps but its worthed !!!
great panoramic view from colonnade. highly recommend!. it was a windy and cold day. We came there to see a sun eclipse. There is great view to whole the city!

Amazing cathedral. Amazing cathedral, we stayed there around 1 hour just looking paintings, interior, reading history. We were lucky as cathedral was not crowded. However it was not easy to understand how to enter, where to pay, no toilet.

magnificent ceilings. There are many churches, but the golden top is just one of the highlights. Inside is a work of art, the painted ceilings are magnificent. We were supposed to go to the top to view the city but it was closed

Just like in France, only BETTER. It's a reoccuring idea here in St Petersburg, so much is like in Westtern Europe, only better, more beautiful, finer decorations, more delicate. Peter the Great and his followers did a cut-and-paste, yes, but often overdid what they had seen in France and Germany. Here is even Giberti's door to heaven (from Firenze chatedral) but better, interpreting Russian religious history. OK, so he can't help it but must also include his only family (Romanov) into the story. It is forgiven, and to some extent also correct, even though a bit too much. It's what any rich person would do, I guess.
Beautiful!. Extremely beautiful a must see! Loved taking photos and learning about the history any how it took so many years to make! Truely breathtaking!
Use a tour guide..... We use a russian guide for this tour, nice explain a history of build and a church is very nice painted, good to see.
See all of St. P from the top!. You need to climb up about a hundred flights of stairs to reach the viewpoint n the top from where you can see all of Saint Petersburg.
The famous cathedral in city. It is recommended to visit this cathedral to every tourist. It is one of the highest ones in Russia, but it is a great architecture monument as well.

It is the largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest cathedral in the world!. Isaakievskiy Sobor (Cathedral of St. Isaac of Dalmatia) in Saint Petersburg is the largest Russian Orthodox Sobor (Cathedral) in the city. It is the largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest cathedral in the world. Today it serves as a museum, but since June 1991, the church community received the authorization to conduct services on special days. Built during the years 1818-1858, by the architect Auguste Montferrand in the late classicism style, the cathedral majestically rises above the city. By visiting the cathedral, many tourists admire the beauty of the interior decoration and the unique collection of monumental paintings of the first half of XIX century (150 panels and pictures). An unforgettable impression leaves the stained glass window in the main altar, depicting the Risen Savior - this is the first stained glass window approved and designed in Orthodox churches.

Amazing view of the city from Colonnade. Didn't get inside the museum as not too much into them but visited the top of the Cathedral. Many tourists fail to realise there is a separate ticket to go there and miss it (happened with my friends) Great view of the city from top, but the wind was chilly, nearly blowing us along with it!

Another Beautiful Cathedral. This Cathedral is definitely worth a visit- the outside is certainly picture worthy with its golden domes and numerous statues. The inside has beautiful, colourfully vibrant mosaics and paintings. An added feature is the lovely view from the top of the cathedral. Have your camera ready.

Well worth a visit. Be sure to find time to visit St. Isaac's - one of the best of the myriad of cathedrals and churches on offer in St Petersburg. An enormous cathedral that can be visited alongside the nearby Admiralty Building, be sure to allow plenty of time to explore the cavernous interior. No extra fee for photography.The extra admission fee for the viewing platform is well worth it, especially on a clear day, as it offers a 360 degree panorama of the city.
Worth a visit. This is a wonderful cathedral and certainly worth a visit if you are in St.Petersburg. Go up to the roof for panoramic views of the city.

Spiral tower with +100 steps. Visited on 4 Oct 2012. This cathedral is unique in its shape; there are about 180 steps that will lead you up to the top of the cathedral to observe the surrounding areas of St. Petersburg. Though it wasn't the tallest skyscraper building like in Shanghai, Beijing, or Hong Kong, it does provide us with magnificent views of the embankment of the Neva River and Vasily Island. Definately recommend to visit here.
a must see in Sint Peterburg. Impressive sized cathedral. as most religious buildings, it is extremely nicely decorated with a lot of emphasis on the 12 apostels in paintings, mosiac, statues

Worth a look but not a 'must see'. The St Isaac Cathedral is bold, impressive building and one of the largest cathedrals in the world. It faces a park on one side where it's best to take your photos from.The cathedral contains some lovely mosaics. If you time your visit right, you can go up to the colonnade for a great view of St Petersburg. The entry price was reasonable although there are quite a few souvenir sellers there but don't let that put you off.Not at the top of my 'must-see' list in St Pete, but worth a look if you are in the area. and have time.Visited February 2013

Stunning - loved it. History unbounded.. Central St. Petersburg - easy to access. Small entry charge. Great place. Full of history. Lovely vendors inside the cathedral with stuff you'll want to buy. Yet another Leningrad essential.

Example of Russian wealth. Breathtaking monumental cathedral with unique mosaics. Tickets include free tours with knowledgeable guides. Great panoramic view from colonnade accompanied by recorded tour.

Carl Faberge - Russian Ballet - Tchaikovsky - Catherine's Palace - But what about Ukaine?. The 1st time I visited here I was amazed. This time it all seemed different. A church is defined as a house of prayer, a place of worship, a house of God. This time it seemed to me as a Pantheon to what money can buy, artists can achieve and architects design - and how 60 spray painters can die spraying the dome with gold. Now I am no way religious, but this building that took 40 years to complete, and as many Tripadvisors comment - is a selling place for Souvenirs. It may be the largest Russian Orthodox cathedral in the world and the 4th largest Cathedral world wide - but to me it just looks like a big lump of art - not something built with loving hands for people to "love their neighbor." Ask the Russian neighbors of Ukraine. They seem to be missing the point somehow. But since Russia were last to free their Surfs,I guess it is going to take some time. Unfortunately.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Must see ofr sure. Preparing for the trip listened to Localoud mobile guide about the cathedral and decided to go. Impressive masterpiece. However, not so Russian-authentic as Savior on the Spilled Blood or Kazansky cathedral. Atmosphere of a church vanished somewhen and now it is more a museum rather than a spiritual place. However, it is grandiose.

Another beautiful Cathedral. St Petersburg is full of amazingly beautiful churches and cathedrals but I'd definitely visit St Issacs. You get a great view around the city from up top. It also had an interesting history.
Grand but gloomy. Nowhere near as impressive as other churches we visited in St Petersburg. It's very dark and not really that much to see.
Wonderful landmark. This church is across the street from the Four Seasons Lion Palace. It has a beautiful exterior and the interior is a typical Russian church.
Lovely. Amazing mosaics, great exterior too. Look for the dove in the top of the main cupola. Fab model inside showing the construction.
Russian churches. they know how to build gigantic churches and fill it with preposterous amounts of gold marble and iconic saints

The best sightseeing in the city. For a very convenient fee you can go at the top of this cathedral and have a wonderful look from SP. If you don't go up to the top you still can admire its architecture from outside. It's quite impressive

the most beautiful cathedral i've ever visited !. the most beautiful cathedral and one of the best religious places I've ever visited !! its inside is totally decorated and there is a priceless effort put to build this place.... must visit !!

Beautifully restored. This is a gorgeous cathedral that is worth a visit. It is an engineering marvel to have been constructed on marshland.The interior colors are vibrant and the mosaics are amazing.

View from the Collonade. Take the stairs up and walk around the dome at the top to get the views over St. Petersburg. Highly recommend. Inside is pretty impressive too! 400kg of gold used. Incredible!
Wow!. Breathtakingly beautiful! Go inside, behold the amazing mosaics. Great deals on souvineers too. Be sure to light a candle if you are into that sort of thing.

Incredible. Its well worth buying a joint ticket which is about 400 rubles to see the colonnade and for entry into the church. The view from up on the dome is breathtaking but bloomin freezing! the church itself is beautiful and absolutely huge, theres a gift shop inside selling all sorts of lovely things including real amber jewellery. photos are allowed although you cant use the flash.

Go up!. The cathedral is worth visiting, go inside, it's nice :) and definitely go up to the tower it's about 260 steps and you can see a large part of the city. I went in winter so it was all very grey and cloudy haha, but i can imagine how great the view is in the summer time on a sunny day or evening :)
Been here a few times. It is a pleasure to visit. Last time I was there they were conducting an Orthodox church service in part of the cathedral. It is nice to see it as a living museum.
Massive & Majestic. This cathedral is a massive landmark visible across the city. It is architecturally dramatically beautiful, and a construction wonder.

Locations of crypts of Russia's last royal family. This cathedral is impressive, but not grandiose. However, the crypts contained there as well as the stories accompanying them make spending 30-45 minutes here well worthwhile.
Wonderful Cathedral . It's the most beautiful Cathedral I've ever seen, a must see! But it's a shame that there are souvenir shops inside.

A huge relic of Tsarist empire. St Isaac's is a non functioning church - amazing large and impressive on the outside but little to see inside. In the communist period it was emptied and it was a museum dedicated to atheism. Now it is being transformed and some chapels have been restored
Great View. What a climb - up 260 steps, then when we thought we were there through a small door and another open air flight to the top amazing view from the dome.
Another masterpiece. It is huge and has a really attractive interior design. The marbles inside the church were worth seeing and the atmosphere is holy.

Awesome. When I walked into this place, its opulence stunned me. I found a place to sit down and just immerse myself in the beauty. You will crain your head following the columns of semiprecious stone soaring high. There is a side chapel for the faithful to pray and light a candle. In the rear near the exit are several souvenir stands and an ATM (what would Jesus say!). Well worth the price. BTW the ticket kiosk is behind the church not on the portico.

Most Beautiful Church. I have visited many churches in Rome and over Europe, and this is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever been in. It was absolutely stunning. The attention to detail was commendable. The malachite columns, the mosaics, the paintings, the tiles, the granite!!! If you are only able to visit a few places in St Petersgurg, this must be one of them!

A must visit cathedral in st. petersburg. This is the largest cathdral in Saint Petersburg. It is a huge cathedral. Don't miss climbing up the 296 stairs to the upper level where you have a 360 view on the city.

Breathtaking views. Beautiful and grand cathedral. Lots of menacing marble pillars inside with beautiful paintings covering every wall. You need a separate ticket to go up the tower (200 steps) for the view of the city. This is a must because the views are breathtaking. Especially during January when everything is covered in a light layer of snow.

Nice view when up top but not a spectacular cathedral. It's of a very impressive size but the truth is that it's probably nicer to take it in from far away from some rooftop bars in Four Seasons and W, while up close some of the beauty fades. If you make the journey to the very top, admittedly, the view of the city is fantastic

Oh, that gorgeous malachite!. This was my first exposure to the inside of a Russian cathedral and I was stunned in more ways than one. All that gold, the extraordinary craftsmanship in those magnificent malachite and lapis lazuli pillars, the sheer opulence of the place, the thought of the conditions people worked under and how many of them must have been needed all raised contradictory emotions. It may be a museum today, but small side chapels are still being touchingly used as a place of worship by ordinary people. We did not "do" a guided tour, but simply wandered around absorbing what interested us most, and I think this was wise.

Not so much.. This was not my favorite cathedral in St.Petersburg, although in fact when it was a Soviet Museum, it was enough of a money maker that it spearheaded the renovation of the Cathedral of Spilled Blood, which is now in the top spot. Pretty things inside, kind of blocky and massive on the outside. If you 're not sure you want to visit, I'd say, "Not so much, don't bother."

St Isaac's. Situated in the heart of the city this is a must see site. There are two options one to see the inside of the cathedral and the other to climb the stairs and to see St Petersburg from the heights of the cathedral. Take the time and do both, well worth the entrance fee and you wont be disappointed

Wonderful. This cathedral is beautiful. You need to buy an entrance ticket of 250 rubbles per person. It is also possible to go up the building and have a nice view of St Petersburg (150 rubbles). Recommended!

beautifull church. in saint petersburg city center, outside the chuch is very big and a little dark, but visit inside : it is beautifull , the visit is very interesting, i recommand to visit this church, on of the best place to visit at saint petersburg

Beautiful. The outside of the cathedral is beautiful with its golden dome but the inside must be seen to really appreciate the beauty of this cathedral. The mosaics, the inside of the domes and the iconostasis are marvelous. Even the doors are beautiful.

Its huge. Its huge and not as pretty inside as other churches. Buy the combo ticket to be able to climb up to the main dome and see it from the outside. In the winter with the wind it can be very cold after climbing the 200 plus steps inside.,

Awesome and extraordinary Cathedral in St. Petersburg. The outside view of this Cathedral looks ordinary, but when you go insight, all the paintings on the Cathedral wall is awesome. But most of Cathedral or churches in St. Petersburg, there are entrance fee, you could pay once entrance fee for 3 churches in St Petersburg, but it is a bit more ... but it is definitely worth it...

Amasing Cathedral. Amasing Cathedral. You must climb to see the great view, it is more than 200 steps, but the view is superb.
It is ridiculous that you can't see the cathedral and climb to the top at the same time. After you visit the cathedral, you have to go around the cathedral and enter to visit the top.

Worth Watching it. One of the most beautiful Museum ever made in St. Petersburg in the history of Russia. It is one of the most beautiful landmark in the city. It is near at the end of Nvesiky Street. There is an Indian Restaurant "Tandoor" on 10-15 seconds walk from it. The dome's are vary beautiful. The bird in the centre of dome is soooo beautiful. The artwork is awesome. Painters from all over the world have made the paintings on the walls and roofs of the Cathedral. Everyone can see the whole city by going on the top of the Cathedral. Its a must Visit.

Superb. Centrally situated in Saint Petersburg this is a place well worth visiting. Its one of the best known landmarks in the city and is only out-done in terms of size by St Peters in Rome and St Pauls in London.The interior is utterly magnificent and the displays are very interesting, although almost exclusively in Russian. It costs the equivalent of £2.50 to get in and they sell guidebooks in English and other languages for a modest sum.

Impressive. At first I was not excited about the cathedral considering the exteriors which is not exactly the inviting type except for the golden tomb but it’s the interiors that shocked me. You are in for a treat as the interiors are bathed in gold and beautiful artworks and not at all making it a disappointing visit.
Massive and beautiful. This structure is ornate and huge. The artwork inside is worth the time to explore. Easy access from the Hermitage.

Great views of the city. Unfortunately the Cathedal was closed so we walked up the 262 steps to get the great views from the top. We will have to go back to see the interior . Impressive from the exterior.

Masterpiece. It's incredible how light all the stonework and high arches feel like. It is especially interesting to visit the cathedral again during bright night and climb to outside observation deck on the level of the dome.

World class piece of art. This cathedral is so imponent that can be in fact compared to the St. Peter's basilica in Vatican city (although the last one is older and has a more richer story). This is definitely one of those places where you will feel like a small little creature. Loved it.

good example of contrast of old and new russia. We have seen so much on TV and films about Russia, the revolution and communism but seeing it for real is amazing. History, Architecture, Wealth, contrasting over years, decades, centuries with the bleakness of communism. The legacy of both visible and living on. Overall a fantastic experience.
Grim outside, Eye popping inside. I wasn't sure if I wanted to pay to go inside because of its grim grey exterior, but wow what an interior! St. Isaac's is amazing, awe-inspiring, and holy!

What does 400 Kg of gold look like?. Occupying a privileged position bordering a square that contains a dramatically carved equestrian statue of Tsar Nicholas 1st, and facing the Mariinsky Palace, this large neo-classical structure with its extravagant gold-leaved central dome surrounded by 4 smaller domes, and built over a 40-year period in the first half of the 18th Cent., would be completely out of place in any Russian city other than the very non-Russian St. Petersburg. Its enormity and architectural style echoes that of the Kazan Cathedral, both of which stand in stark contrast to the Church of Our Saviour with its colourful onion-skinned roof, but it is decorated as profusely and ostentatiously as the latter. Regrettably, it lives a schizoid existence: most of the interior space functions as a hangover from the Soviet era when it was one of the country’s many Museums of Atheism, and less than half is used for religious services. The exterior has some stunning sculptures and friezes, notably above the main entrance on the corner pediments and as well as a large door carved in the Florentine manner. There are also 24 splendid statues surrounding the main dome that can be more intimately viewed when you take the highly recommended walk up the steps to the base of the dome itself, and treat yourself to some stunning views of the city. A further 24 statues adorn the rest of the roof but are hard to visualize in their entirety. Once inside, the huge ribbed dome is the outstanding attraction, its cupola beautifully painted at the top, and below its glass windows there is a circular “gallery” consisting of 12 striking statues alternating with 12 beautiful frescoes of saints and prophets. The roof over the alter is occupied by an awesome painting of The Last Judgment, and the chancel contains a dramatic stained glass window of the Resurrected Christ in flaming red attire. The Spanish Chapel is a gem not to be missed, as is the little chapel containing the Tikhin Icon ----one of the most beautiful work in this genre that I have ever seen. The Iconostasis is a beautiful construction, containing ---- among many notable elements --- a series of pillars made of semi-precious stones such as jasper, malachite and porphyry. To comprehend the treat in store, you have to know that the building is supported by 112 Columns made up of 14 different types of marble; 350 sculptures by Russia’ greatest artists and many foreign craftsmen of distinction; and that the entire structure contains 400 kg of gold. On the practical side, you will need separate tickets for the general entrance and for the ascent to the dome, and they are purchased in two different locations. Wednesday is closing say, but the Church is open from 10am – 7 pm on the other six. I am not sure about the Museum component, but when we were there, the overall themes --- very well presented in photographs and narrative ---- dealt with the history of the church in its many incarnations, and the nature of life in Leningrad (as it then was) during the Nazi invasion.

Blessed to have been there with no crowds.... Late in the afternoon on a winter day, the cathedral evoked a solemn feeling and appreciation for the serfs who died building this magnificent cathedral, the craftsmen who painstakingly built and rebuilt it, and the docents who carefully tend it daily. The place inspires awe and if it had been a clear day, we came away being assured we would have trekked to the top.

Great views. Beautiful church that is now a museum. If you're only going to check out one church make it this one. The interior is amazing amd the winning feature is the incredible views from the top.

The Beauty is Inside. This is a beautiful church which is the largest Russian Orthodox church in St Petersburg and took 40 years to build. I believe that the builder died before it was completed. It does not look special from the outside, but inside, it is magnificent. The murals on the wall are very colorful and huge. We went with a tour which I would recommend. There is a gigantic dome filled with beautiful artwork and a little section which shows all the damage done in WWII.

Glorious St Petersburgh, Russia. There is so much to see in this grand city. We visited during the "White Nights" period in the middle of the year and enjoyed amazing weather, street dining, good food, pleasant people everywhere and then these amazing Museums, Cathedrals and places of immense culture. This is a wonderful city where you can take in the city sights by boat on the many canals that form a grid in the city, you can relax in comfort and explore in safety by day and the days can be light all night...fun. Fabulous!
One of best places . I saw this church with tourists group from Iran.we saw history of this church that showed with old steps by status......
Take the steps to the top. Super view from the top and a great work out to get there! Inside the Cathedral was very beautiful and had some great insights into life during the war also

One of many beautiful buildings in St P. St P is like one big outdoor museum and this is another of its many beautiful buildings to admire.
You can climb it for excellent 360 degrees view.

ONe of the best cathedrals. It is famous with the monuments of Peter The Great and Nikolas I near it. It was built during 40 years period in XIX century, but for it's noe of the amazing chthedrals in the world.

Exquisite Architecture and Art. St. Isaac's Cathedral is impressive, as you approach it, the many statues with superb detail that are placed around the rotunda and under the front veranda, showing their interaction and the coronation is superab; but once inside, the beauty excites the senses to a feeling of disbelief. The paintings, frescoes, arches and ceilings of the Cathedral are a feast for art lovers!My visit was in October, early in the day, so there were no long lines. I could have easily spent a good half day there, taking all the beauty and magnificence of this lovely Cathedral.Jon Lefeber

St. Petersburg from above. The St. Isaac's Cathedral is a well know cathedral in St. Petersburg. When visiting in summer you should count on long waiting lines. Can be avoided if you go early in the morning. I skipped the museum and went straight to the top. The view is wonderful, you have a 360° view on St. Petersburg.

See the most beautiful panorama of St.Petersburg!. The best time to visit of course is in the summer! The view absolutely worth these stairs.. It's pretty high to go up and it's also entertaining way up! You will enjoy it:)

Fantastic! Cathedral Tour THE BEST!!. This was part of a Cathedral tour, which also featured Church on The Spilled Blood. The ornate structure outside and inside was the absolute best ever! This tour covered both several cathedrals which included the entrance fees and ability to take pictures!

Beautiful ortodox cathedral!. The church is beautiful and a guide may be a good idea in order to have a more serious explanation regarding the paintings and mosaics. You can buy a separate ticket to go up the church and see the city view. It can be a bit cold on fall/winter, but the stairs up (about 200 steps) will warm you up on the way. Must see in St. Petersburg. At night the lightning is beautiful!

Go for the roof. Rooftop visit and its views are the best. Of course you will need to climb stairs, but the view will make it worth it.The inside of the museum is interesting for a short visit. I would not recommend the audio guide - it makes the visit unnecessarily long, with comments not really related to the St. Issac's cathedral itself.
Climb the colonnade. Do yourself a favor and climb the 250 steps to the colonnade around the dome. The view of St. Petersburg is unbeatable from up there!

A Very Large Cathedral. This is the largest church in St. Petersburg. Its gold dome can be seen for miles. It is immense and quite awesome. Mosaics murals cover not only the inside walls but can be found outside, also. It was built in the mid- 1800s and appears to be in very good condition. It was a trest to seeit.

Beyond words!. It is one of the most stunning art and architectural places I have ever seen (and have been fortunate to travel widely). Visually, you will feast, and also learn of the Decisions of Vladimir to bring Chritianity to Russia, and of Alexander's choice to maintain Russian orthodoxy instead of catholicism. The peace dove sees all from the dome, the mosaics are captivating, and the iconostasis is breathtaking!200 steps up to the dome gallery to gain a 360 degree aspect of the city - do it!

One of St Petersburg's great churches -St Isaac's lies close to where Hitler planned his Victory banquet. A Somewhat more overpowering building than the early 18th century churches and palaces of the Peter the Great period, the St Isaacs Cathedral is set in a flower decked square and is complemented by the equally nineteenth century Wagnerian Gothic equestrian statue of Tsar Alexander. The setting would have been ideal for the planned victory banquet Hitler already had had menus printed ready for his first night at the Astoria Hotel on the opposite corner to the church
One of the most impressive church. Impressive church specifically for the size of it and in addition to that built by a french architect .
Historically fascinating. The venue itself is amazing but it is the back stories of St. Isaac's history that fascinate. Well worth a visit.

History tour. They have nice informative expositions and photos. I've been here twice before--back in my childhood and later. This time my son absolutely loved the history of it all, told very well by our guide. The colonnade tour had excellent views as well as a good walk.

One of the most beautiful churches I've seen in my life. The cathedral is wonderful! Where you look, has paintings, sculptures and tapestries so pretty that make you breathless! What I liked most were the mosaics are magnificent! Worth, is a must-see attraction. Worth climbing the stairs and see the view from the top of the tower.
Nice view from the terrace.. Nice view from the terrace. But you'll have to climb 201 steps. Be prepared :) Magnificent cathedral.

It is a must visit.. You may skip the inside. As well as you may skip AyaSofia in Istanbul. It is magnificent from outside. But also it is inside. Walk up the stairs to see the roofs of my city. It is one of the things local people love it for.

Superb views. Amazing place - a really good start if you have just been dropped off on the St peter line shuttle bus and want to get your bearings. The climb to the top is manageable and the views are stunning - allowing you to appreciate where you are in the city. Beware if it is wet or getting towards winter, the handrails are rather rusty so make sure you are not in your best coat and that you know where your next pit stop is so that you can clean your hands. Make sure you buy the combo ticket that gets you access to the inside "museum" as well as it doesn't cost much more and and the artwork, castings and interior in general are wonderful. There are a variety of souvenir stalls inside and it is warm and dry if it rains. Well worth a visit.
