An architectural wonder. To add to the beauty of this church, is the detailed description with models of how this church was built. The portraits are well worth a visit.
this place you must visit. I have no words to tell how wonderfull is this place. The museum tour guide, who made a brilliant lecture on the history of the memorial.

Don't miss the views from the tower. We have not been visiting the church itself (we are not so much into churches....) but we climbed the tower in the first nigth of our "white nights".....the tower is the highest building in the old center and gives you a wonderful overview: the Neva river, the old town, all the palaces the bridges etc....try to go there when its no so crowdy! (In front of the church there were sometimes 120 BUSSES parked !

Massive Church. Only had the opportunity to see this from the outside, long line on Saturday and was on walking tour of the city. Impressive building, on my list to stop in again on my next trip the views from the upper area must be spectacular.

Must see! Climb to the top for breathtaking views.. Originally St. Petersburg's main church and the largest cathedral in Russia, St. Isaacs is now a museum. It is built in the traditional Russian-Byzantine style of a Greek-cross. Don't miss the incredible St. Isaac's Gate - bronze doors (fashioned after Ghiberti's famous bronze doors on the Florence baptistery). The interior is beautiful - the iconostasis is flanked by incredible malachite and lazurite columns.We climbed the 300 steps up to the cathedral's colonnade, and enjoyed the spectacular city views.

Another must do in St Petersburg. Magnificent from the outside, even more from inside. Enjoy the artwork/mosaics in the interior. Take time to really browse around and get a good look at all on offer. Also make sure to spend some time climbing out on the top for some excellent photogenic views of St Petersburg. All-in, well worth an hour of your time.

Incredible interior and history. No dislikes. The interior is incredible. Make sure you see the display of how this Cathedral was saved from the Nazi's in WWII.Has gift shops with quality items - not cheap, but worthwhile.
Beautiful. Must see if your visiting St. Petersburg. The detail and grandour of the inside of the church are unlike anything us Chicagioans expected.

Worth seeing. Was staying around the corner from St Isaacs and it has an impressive presence. Inside, the ceiling is spectacular and I really enjoyed spending some time inside - make sure you look up. Climbed to the top for some nice views as well. Definitely worth visiting.

Awesome!. just returned from St Pete. What a great time to visit the city! We were on a cruise from London and we literally were the only ones in the cathedral!! Even the tour guide said it was the 1 st time she had ever seen it like that. Maybe it had to do with the snow! The mosaics and interior were phenomenal! Hard to believe they are not scraping off some of that gold to help their economy!! Definitely worth a visit!

Be sure to check off-season hours!. We received a map/guide from our hotel and the hours were printed for the "on" season. The cathedral closes earlier in the off-season (as with many other attractions in St. Petersburg.) Be sure to verify hours so you don't miss out like we did! We did however get to visit the top of the cathedral, great views of St. Petersburg.

Stunning inside and out. We ended up doing this on a very wet and dark day but the outside of it was still stunning. Just like all the other reviews the inside is stunning and honestly breath taking however there is not much to see other than the architecture and lots of marble. The ceilings is stunning. The colonnade, even though it's hundreds of steps up and back down the views are great however be warned on a windy day it's interesting to try and hold on! Photography is allowed everywhere so snap away
St Isaac's Cathedral - very impressive and a fascinating place to vit. Again an incredible place to visit especially with our guide from SPB. Nothing to dislike about the whole tour.

Wonderful, but other places are even more amazing. St Isaac's is an amazing place - just as others have reviewed it here. The exterior looks a little tired (and when we stayed was not illuminated at night, which is a great shame). There are mosaics, religious icons and artifaxts inside - all worth seeing. But if you have time for only one or two churches then the 'Spilled Blood' or St Peter and St Paul over on the island have significantly greater impact and are truly five stars. Photography is allowed inside, without flash.
Amazing place!. Spectacular! It's very large church, one of the biggest cathedrals in the world. Looks very rich - a lot of gold, columns, paintings. You must see it!
Must see. For sure visit the cathedral when you are in SPB. The stone works inside as well as mosaics are really impressive.
Renewal. Totally wiped out during WWII. Beautiful restoration and lots of included shops for gifts. No extra charge for photos, small active Russian Orthodox chapel.

Worldfamous cathedral St. Isaac's. Liked very much to see this inside, because I have heard of it so many times. There is a saying about this: Something was built a very long time, the saying goes " It was built like St.Isaac's cathedral " Meaning very long. Well, it took 40 years to built. This saying is maybe in every language, I don't know.Beautiful cathedrall.
A big cathedral with beautiful internal.. We found it very beautiful internally, and there are several big doors with nice sculptures on them. It is worth a visit.

Eerie by Night. Across from Angleterre hotel and visited after dinner about 9.30 and brilliant excursion in the dark. Automated ticket service and follow arrows and ascend 200+ steps and a scary ramp to a wooden platform that surrounds lower part of dome with views all over ST Petersburg.Really strange in the dark and few people, but very pretty in the cold and light snow.

Great Architecture. Brilliant Architecture and best for some good panoramic view of the city. Its one of the must do attractions and photography spot of the city. Located in the centre of the city and near to the metro station. Its very to visit and there's a park next to the Cathedral to relax and enjoy a gud ice-cream after the Museum.

Spectacular inside. It is well worth going inside this cathedral to view the ornate details of this church. It is very huge with beautiful doors, dome, floor and statues. Everything is on a massive scale. Make sure to climb up to the dome to get the panoramic view. Well worth it.
Lot to absorb. So much to see and understand. A guide or at least Lonely Planet is suggested. Sit and stare for a while to really appreciate the work in this place!
St. Isaac's Cathedral. Uniquely Russian and the many ceilings are beautifully painted. with an impressive dome. The outside is equally impressive and very Russian.
Impressive. Very very big! Nice paintings, beautiful doors and a lot of statues. Very special, I never seen an ortodox church so big!

The view is worth the visit. The inside of the church is of course amazing however in my point of view..going to the top and having a look at that panoramic view is what makes the visit worth it. A word of advice..if you are there around September..it is bound to be chilly up there so bring your jacket with you!
The Russian St Paul's. A magnificent cathedral, forty years in the making. Very ornate and beautiful inside. Views from the top of the dome are panoramic.
Great view. You may want to get up to look around the city centre as you go out of Neva river. This is spectacular view!

A VISION OF HEAVEN ?. If you are ever lucky enough to visit St Petersburg then St Isaacs cathedral is a must see . Even though my wife and I are not particularly religious , this place transports you to what must be most peoples idea of what heaven might be like . The golden columns soar skywards to take your eyes toward the magnificent dome and everything that surrounds it . The sheer artistry of the place is jaw dropping . Which ever God you worship I'm sure they would appreciate the amount of earthly work that has gone in to making this space a place to repent in a certain style !

Panoramic view and stunning decorations inside. There are ticket vending machines outside the entrance, so you can skip the line at the ticket window. The machines work with ruble bills and language options are Russian and English. Combined ticket covering both the dome and the museum (former church) was 400 rubles (around 9 euros).There are almost 300 steps to the dome, but climbing those reward you with a 360° panoramic view. There is no place to sit up there, so I suggest that you visit the dome first and then go down to rest your legs inside the museum as there are some benches.

St. Isaacs, located next to Four Seasons Hotel. The Russians seem very proud of their churches, even though this one remains as a museum, not a working church anymore. After Perostroika, the Soivet Union banned religious worship. But, fortunately, they had a good sense of history and kept these religious monuments as museums. This is over the top gaudy, with mosaic tile, guilded altarpieces and multicolored marble. The effect is overwhelming, and again you see the evidence of opulence.Be sure to get a tour guide, as they can point out the details and the history that covers this historic church.

Stunning artistry and great views. St Isaacs is one of the largest cathedrals in the World - the 3rd largest domed - and was commissioned by Tsar Alexander. It features beautiful golden domes and stunning artistry throughout. The doors, walls, columns & ceilings are mesmerising. The views of the city from the top are amazing. The Bronze Horseman (Peter the Great) is opposite the front entrance. St Isaacs is a definite must see.

amazing place. gaudy and kitschy - but a definite must. the iconic outside somewhat reminiscent of St Basil's in Moscow hides a hideous over-renovated inside. so glitzy as to feel complete;y fake. If you want the true ambiance of an Orthodox church, go to the Kazan Cathedral.

One of the biggest and beautiful Cathedrals. Perfect... Big, beautiful memorial, both inside and outside. You can spend hours just watching to every small part of it. Take a tour to the viewing terrace - terrific view from there.

Look Up!. Good history, excellent art and mosaics, a very nice icon altar. Take a seat or balance on a companion so you can crane your neck and study the ceiling-very pretty!Comfortable shoes are a must for the hard floors and steps, especially if you want to climb the tower. We skipped the tower but did much enjoy the interior views.

St. Issac cathedral Saint petersburg Russia. St. Isaac's Cathedral was originally the city's main church and the largest cathedral in Russiaone of the most impressive landmarks of the Russian Imperial capital. One hundred and eighty years later the gilded dome of St. Isaac's still dominates the skyline of St. Petersburg. Although the cathedral is considerably smaller than the newly rebuilt Church of Christ the Savior in Moscow, it boasts much more impressive fades and interiorsThe cathedral's facades are decorated with sculptures and massive granite columns (made of single pieces of red granite), while the interior is adorned with incredibly detailed mosaic icons, paintings and columns made of malachite and lapis lazuli. A large, brightly colored stained glass window of the "Resurrected Christ" takes pride of place inside the main altar.The cathedral is wheelchair accessible: there are wheelchair lifts at entrance and exit.
!. It is a must see in Saint -Petersburg! If you visit this church , you will see a Breathtaking panoramic view. I took more than 100 pics!
Great views of the city. The views from the tower are worth the exercise to get to the top. There are really great views of the city from above.
The amount of gold is incredible!. Peaceful, amazing history, well worth a visit if you get the chance. If you stand in the middle and look up there is a dove in the ceiling.

Loved It!. Another MUST-SEE on the list while in St. Petersburg is the beautiful St. Isaac's Cathedral. Photo opportunities abound. History and amazing architecture oozes from it's walls. Photos and words won't do it justice so all I can say is please don't miss this site.Highly recommended!
See St Petersburg from atop. Beautiful church and absolutely magnificent dome. You can go to the top and walk on the outside of the dome, giving you fantastic view over the city. A must!

Climb to the dome. If you are visiting this Church I recommend you pay the complete entrance fee that includes climbing the 200 plus stairs to see St. Petersburgh form the top. For me after the Church of Spilled Blood this one is number 2.

just another cathedral, but with a grand history. I suppose its interesting with a guided tour... the history is quite extrodinary with the hiding of the art during WWI. But if you got the guide book and have to choose... maybe rather visit the Sacred Blood.

Another Jewel. Precious Cathedral, tons of marble, malachite, and gold. Closed on Wed. If you can, get the audio guide as it's a very nice history lesson. Very nice view of the city from upstairs (pay a bit extra).

Colossal Structure. This magnificent building has a wonderful history and was built at the height of the Tsarist rule of Russia. It was built between 1818 and 1858 (a period of 40 years) under the direction of French architect Auguste Montferrand. It is the largest cathedral in Russia and holds up to 14,000 worshippers (standing). Under the Communist rule it was closed in the 1930's and used as a museum. This is a beautiful structure with very large features. It has a huge gilded dome, Large brown granite columns on all facades. The interior is lavish in artwork and icons. It is located in Isaakievskaya Square where it stands alone and can be viewed and photographed from all angles. It costs adults 250RUB to enter but it is well worth the cost as it contains some remarkable treasures. You can climb to the top and walk around the central rotunda and get magnificent views out over St Petersburg. There is tons to see in SP but make sure you put this one on the list. It's magnificent.

Must see. This is a must see landmark in St. Petersburg. Please take the tour inside the Cathedral, the story of the building is interesting, not only from history point of view, but also from engineering prospective. If you are an admirer of Brulov (famous Russian painter), this is your chance to see one of his wonderful works.

Amazing!. The building is quite awe inspiring. It is huge but beautifully proportioned. The paintings and icons are very beautiful. The climb up to the walkway the encircles the dome is worth the effort and the view is great.
ST Isaac's Cathedral. I have read that ST Isaac's Cathedral is the largest Russian Orthodox Cathedral. It is made up of a Museum and further inside there is the "praying" part.
beautiful. Beautiful church with wonderful painting, nice russian architecture, lovely to spend some time in a mystic atmosphere.

A colossal and stately construction. Because of time constraint, our guide only unloaded us at the cathedral for photo taking. We did not even get a chance to look inside which is a shame. It was said to be over 100 metres tall and took "40" years to build, and there is a walkway surrounding the central rotunda at the top which allows people to have a 360 degree view of the Cathedral's surroundings. It must be quite a fit to make the round. We did not do any research on the itinerary provided by the tourist agency before our journey or we could have demanded a tour of the interior which is said to be magnificient by fellow travellors. Will have to leave this to another visit in the future.

Famous place and also to see overall S.P.. We climbed also up to the Top of Church
You can see all of Saint,Petersburg
inside is one of most famous places in the world

Enormous Russian Orthodox Church. Model of scaffolding, showing intricate process of raising the heavy columns was especially interesting, as was model of the construction of the enormous dome. The actual dome is plated with real gold. Interior paintings and reliefs are beautiful. Definitely worth a visit.

Grandios!. That's one of St-Petersburg signatures! It's amazing from outside and from inside. Go on the roof top and enjoy the view (maybe better, when you already walked through the city, then you can recognize some things by yourself). I was there during the day and dying the night, to see bridges opening. Both beautiful. But maybe in the night would be more interesting =)

Great church. Fabulous inside, mosaics and frescos and loads of gold!Best thing is to go up the 292 steps up into the dome and you get fabulous views of the city all the way round. You have to pay separately to go up but well worth it

St. Isaac's Cathedral. The exterior of this Cathedral was stunning ready. However the interior was even more impressive. We were so amazed with the overall decorations and the details inside this cathedral. This is not something you can easily found in other cathedral. This is a must see attraction.
Really worth the visit. We visited here and found it to be very impressive. We used our guidebook and just walked around. The art work inside is very good. It cost 250 rb to visit. Would recommend.
Amazing. this is really a most beautiful interior and the prunk and pomp really knock you out........the ticket office is at the left side of the building and the entrance at the rear.
Very good!. As many as you seen them, this church will impress you. The best part is the ceiling. Even the most impatient people could easily spent an hour here.

Loved this Cathedral. I loved this Cathedral. We went up the dome first and got to see the fantastic views. The statues all around were unbelievable. We then went inside and I found this much more to my liking than the inside of Spilled Blood. It was one of the best. All the paintings, the statues, the alters, the massive doors, the ceilings - I cannot say enough about this place. Loved it. You must visit this one.
Interesting. We did see several churches and cathedrals on our guided tour (with Alla Tours), but they were all different. This one had n interesting story and a very different feel.
Great view. Didn't have time to go inside but went up the stairs and saw the view - breathtaking!! Had to buy a ticket at the machine because the ticket offices were closed. Great at sunset.

Incredible view. Fabulous, fabulous view from the dome, especially on a sunny day. I have never been inside (it's a museum not a working church), but 150r for a ticket to the top is well worth it. You can walk round the dome as many times as you like before you go down again, and the steps are marked with the number remaining to the top or bottom, which I found strangely helpful! Don't leave without looking at the extraordinary external doors to the main building. No evidence of lift, toilets or food etc.

Burial site for the Tzars and family. Beautiful church inside. This is definitely worth a visit. I liked everything about the inside of the church. The outside does not let you know what is inside due its drab construction.

Huge cathedral. Everything about this cathedral is BIG! The doors are the biggest in Europe, the ceilings are incredibly high, & the pillars on the outside are made of single pieces of marble. Inside there's a model of how they raised the pillars, very interesting. Although it's not used as a church now, it's more a museum, it can hold 14,000 people standing! Beautiful interior with masses of gold work.
Nice view to the roofs. Definitely one of easiest and most effective way to see city from the roof perspective. Possible to see 360 degrees panorama. Excellent for nice weather evening.
The view is amazing !. Well, i didn't visit the inside of the cathedral yet but i did go upstairs to see the city from the top of the cathedrale. It is one amazing point of view !
The famous cathedral.. It's the famous cathedral in Russia with old story, great columns gallery, rich interior, must see everybody in Saint-Petersburg!

a must see in st.petersburg. it was one of the highlights of our trip to Russia . and for sure if we visited the beautiful saint petersburg again this place would be our first destination . specially the panoramic view of the city it was amazing and it worth the tickets
Wonderful. The most beautiful interior. The gold, ceilings, wall mosaics and marble is beautiful. A must see in St. Petersburg, Russia.

Another beautiful museum. Beautiful church that is now a museum. Restored to it's original glory. The art work is beautiful. This is another museum you could spend days admiring the structure and the art.

Almost too much to look at. So so much to see inside, it is somewhat plainer outside than some others but wait until you get in! Again, go with a guide so that you don't miss some of the really interesting information; it is quite overwhelming

A must see. This was the first and one of the best churches we visited, I highly recommend taking the tour to the top and walking around the golden dome that over look St. Petersburg with a 360 degree view.
Breathtaking!. This is a MASSIVE Cathedral. The grand scale of the interior is something to see and the lighting is magical.
St Isaac's. Wow! This church turned into museum could take you half a day to see everything in it. A must see. A guide to explain some of the items is very helpful. The doors are amazing.
see it. the 4th largest dome in the world...and from the outside, the massive gilded golden dome can be seen from most of st.Petersburg

St Petersburg from above. You can not miss this cathedral because is considered the largest in Russia.This alone makes it worth a visit.Technically it is a museum as it was during the communist regime.Things not to miss from outside:the red granite columns, the south doors ,statues of the Apostles on the top of the cathedral (four of them at each corner) and the Dome.My review will refer only to the Dome (I did not visit the interior)The Dome is accessible by climbing almost 300 stairs.At the beginning it seems a lot but the climbing is easy.The stairs have numbers so you can follow your approach to the top.There is a fine view and a close one towards the angels mentioned before.After arriving to the top you will have a breathtaking 360 degrees view across the city including of course the Neva river.The climbing is open till the late hours of the day adding more color to the view at late evenings .It is said that the view is even more beautiful around dusk during the winter.There is a separate entrance to the Dome and another to the interior of the cathedral.It is situated just behind the Admiralty, conveniently close to all main attractions of the city.
majestic. Beautiful place. The religious service had a choir and priest singing very well; it was very interesting.

Beautiful.. The interior is breathtaking. A visit to St. Petersburg must include a visit to this site. Some of the tour groups do not include a visit inside so make sure your group will have the opportunity to see it.
St. Issac's Cathedral. The Cathedrals and Palaces in St. Petersburg are absolutely great. There is a lot to see in this city.

Gilded dome dominates the St. Petersburg skyline. St Isaac's Cathedral's gilded dome dominates the St. Petersburg skyline. The cathedral is the fouth largest cathedral in the world, and it took 40 years to build, from 1818 to 1858. It's main dome rises 333 feet and is plated with pure gold. The interior is lavishly decorated with mosaics, icons and columns of malachite and lapis lazuli. Most of the paintings were removed when they began to deteriorate due to the cold, damp conditions inside the cathedral. They were painstakingly reproduced as mosaics. This work was never completed. The meticulous and detailed work on constructing St. Isaac's Cathedral left an expression in the Finnish language that means "to build like St. Isaac's Church", for lengthy and never-ending projects.

Superb. During our two day tour of St. Petersburg, which really wasn't enough time, this was truly one of the highlights. The church is much more impressive inside than out. This is as others have said, more of a Museum and is informative and interesting. The display of the raising of the massive columns was very interesting. You simply can't go to St. Petersburg without visiting St. Isaac's.

Photos and videos can't even come close to doing it justice.. Anyone who has been there will understand what I mean when I say that from the moment you enter until the moment you leave, it will take your breath away. Over 200 photos and 45 minutes of video, can't come close to the awe and wonder that is to be held by the beauty, the majesty, the size, the detail, the reverence, the history, and the religious significance that unfolds before your eyes and continues with every step you take. Well worth the price of admission, and not to be missed!

Ingenuity in architecture. Another grand city and another grand cathedral - yes. BUT, the explanation (and model) of how those grand columns were hoisted will be one of my two abiding memories of this glorious building. The other is the shroud of tranquility I felt standing directly under the rotunda and looking up at the white dove above.
Interersting and grandiose.. One of the largest churches in the world, its more interesting in the inside than in the exterior. The iconostasis is truly impressive and deserves the visit.

Another magnificent building. When reading about how this church were designed and built, you'll get a feeiling of the efforts making it possible. The interiour is like a museum, and if you enter the few hundred steps to get to the upper terrace, you'll be rewarded with a splendid 360 degrees view of St. Petersburg - enjoy !

Grand Cathedral. This cathedral was built to impress and it does that. All the mosaics inside are grand and imposing. The feeling in this cathedral is more "European" than "Russian" and is a nice contrast to Church of the Spilled Blood.

Touristy but elegant. As part of our tour of this area, we visited this church as well. It is expensive to visit. And hectic inside. It is set up like a museum not a church, with its history and construction inside. It is beautifully setup, with ornate structures and decoration. There were too many people, as expected, and the history was fascinating. The church of the spilled blood is a better visit.

Nice cathedral although not my best in Št.Petersburg. Worth the visit, nut due to many factors I didn't like as much as some of the hype around it. The exterior is nice but apart from the cupola there are better and inside it is very golden but liken a bit aesthetic structure
Huge , impressive and so beautiful..... Have to go there and see it.Astonishing height, all the walls and ceilings fully decorated.The front altar is magnificent.

Breeze on the top in the center of St. Petersburg. It's the must visit place in St.Petersburg. There are not a lot of tall achitects in the center of St. Petersburg. Here provides 360 degree panoramic view and it's very stunning. I would suggest to visit in summer season so you will have very spectacular photos with clear blue sky from this cathedral.
For art lovers!. This place is a must if you are visiting St Petersburg. The artwork on the ceilings inside is amazing!!! It's location is a bit odd as it sits in a traffic island.

For the history and architecture lovers. This is the main destination in St.Petersburg if you love history and architecture. You will be fascinated by the imposing structures and the columns outside the cathedral. Each corner has many stories behind including modern history. Inside you can find some posters and media that refer to several era to explain the history behind this monument.

Great views of St Petersburg. You can choose to simply go up to the rotunda and walk around the cupola seeing the city from high up or you can get a ticket to see the interior of this cathedral (or both). I would recommend all. The views are very good and Im not sure youllf ind similar ones anywhere in the city, but the interior of this monstrously large Cathedral and the history of its building on marshland which is displayed therein are equally impressive. Filled to the brim with enormous gilted statues hanging from the roof and alters surrounded by Russian malachite and other curious stones, it is definitely worth a visit if not simply for how incredibly ostentatious it is!
Serene!. Another must see Cathedral in St Petersburg. -- the quality of the interior and historical value of the people of Russia are well preserved here.

the largest orthodox basilica. Saint Isaac's Cathedral is the largest orthodox basilica and the fourth largest cathedral in the world. It withstood the world war II and was not destroyed. The architecture is very notable especially the huge columns and the interior mosaics

Beautiful cathedral. I've been to a lot of famous churches and this one has its outstanding features. There are 2 kinds of tickets, one for climbing the stairs for colonnade, one for the church only. We visited the colonnade during sunset, nice 360c view of surrounding area. The church exhibition showed how it was built, and it was amazing to look at. The soaring ceiling, gilded paintings and statues, all give it a grand, royal Russian look. Highly recommend to visit even just for the architecture (I'm not religious, I went there only to admire the architecture).
Nice view from top. Bit of a climb to the top of the cathedral, but worth the price for the panorama, if it's not raining. The museum I'd also recommend to skip, it's nothing special...

Roof with a view. If you can handle the stairs make sure to visit the dome roof before heading inside. Great 360 views across river to Fortress, and around to all Churches and Cathedrals. Inside is a mix of paintings, mosaics and the terrific doors!
The View. Be sure to climb to the top at roof level for the view! A full 360 scene, can see for miles.That and the cathedral are gorgeous.
Another MUST!. It is huge and gorgeous. There is a bird at the very top inside. It looks like a small bird. It is as large as a horse when on the ground.Amazing building. Just amazing. Go.

Best church l've ever seen. l could not keep my mouth shut:) ıt was that beautiful. All these marble pillars, religious icons, atmosphere, great dome with huge sculptures, its size...with one word: outstanding !
Must do. Went as part of a walking tour which was amazing. Great Cathedral, fantastic frescos, well worth a visit
Accept that it is a Musuem with shops not a Cathedral. A great place filled with history and amazing construction, but filled with overpriced shops and very crowded.
Must see. All churches, palaces, museums, government buildings are a must to see when in St Petersburg. This city is full of history and the buildings reflect this, you can feel the atmosphere.

Amazing representation of Man's talent- Russian built French inspired. Love that St.Pete's has the cultural contributions of the Dutch, French and Italian Masters. This Cathedral was the invention of the brilliance of a French architect that inspired incredible feats in the arts and physics. The church itself shows innovation and the most amazing marble, precious stone in the world! Amazing to learn what's able to be saved following war and transition.

Wheelchair visit. They just opened a lift for the skyline view. It doesn't take you quite as high as the people who climbed all the stairs, but still fantastic. The story of how they built the cathedral is intriguing. The interior is incredible. The lift for the skyline needs to be arranged ahead of time. The building has a ramp that the staff need to open the gate to use.
Beauty. Amazed in the face of such history and art. Can be very full of groups and all souvenirs are quite expensive. Not possible to take any good pics without a 'real' camera-no flash.
Worth a visit. European style cathedral with russian elements. Beautiful inside.There are no place to sit, everybody has to stand up during cermonies.

Magnificent!!. The beauty inside this building knows no limits. So much art and mosaics everywhere you look. The artistry and immensity is stunning. We had a private guided tour which was very helpful to not miss any of the must sees or understand the historical or symbolic significance of many aspects of the building. Also to get some insight into how the dome was constructed, etc. this is an absolute must see on any visit to St. Petersburg.

Must see if you like churches. Very nice church for a visit. We visited in 2006 and just had to go again. This church will always be a stop for us in Saint Petersburg.There is so much history in this Cathedral. The inside is fantastic with wonderful paintings.

Should be ranked lower. It's almost nicer to see from a distance (for example, from the W hotel's rooftop terrace lounge) than it is to actually visit. Not sure it merits ranking as the number 2 attraction in St. Petersburg - it's probably more of a top 10 but not something extraordinarily special

Doors!!. This is a museum now, not used for worship but what an interesting place. The first thing that strikes you are the doors cast bronze and twenty tons apiece, inside the mosaics and decoration is excellent.

Great view from the top. Climb the colonnade and see historic St. Petersburg from above! Great photo opportunity. The inside of the church is interesting, but for me, the best part was seeing the city from the observation platform.

view terrace to visit. only view terrace visit. definitely worth going up to take pictures, beautiful view. didnt go inside but seems like it is beautiful inside too. the architecture of the cathedral is stunning
Engineering behind this is amazing. Church is really interesting how it was constructed. Nice in side and quite spectacular from the outside.

A fantastic Cathedral in St Petersburg. There is so much history in this Cathedral. The inside is fantastic with wonderful paintings. Locals clearly use the Cathedral to worship and the Cathedral holds 10,000 people standing which is incredible.
The place gets busy with tourists so be mindful of pickpockets and keep valuables etc close to you.

Biggest Church in Russia.. I was extremley impressed with this Cathedral: it is so high and wide! . The main Altar with those beautiful and colorful pilars ! And Our Lord JSS! Couldn't HELP but being there until they close at 6:00 p .m . There are a few oil canvas paintings "réplicas" at floor level to apreciate better the ones that are so high on the walls......(At he left of the main Altar there is a small Chapel where devouted women Pray and light a candel...sublime!....) You must pay about /450 rubles (11-13€) in orden to see the Church and to climb up the tower ( about 200 steps with NO LIFT ) from where you can get extraordinary views of San Petersburg. It is about 10-15 minutes walk from the Hermitage and closes on one weekday : (on Wednesdays ?)
Stunning. Beautiful, grandiose, magnificent, huge ... choose your own superlative. Do make the modest payment to go to the dome / belltowers - fantastic views over the river and Admiralsky.
Loved it more than church on spilled blood. More original work remains and it is much larger. You find yourself just wanting to sit and take it all in. Which is what we did.

Can take photos. I was surprised they allowed photographs inside as it's the only church I went to in Russia where they did. It is an active church, so there were many people there for confession and prayer.
Best place to get a view of St. Pete' skyline!. Best place to get a view of St. Pete' skyline! If you dont mind exercise of climbing up, go for it an denjoy the view.

Wow, what a surprise.. So beautiful inside and obviously much time and resource is put in to keep it that way. View from the colonnade is well worth the 200+ steps to get there. I have a slight knee problem and I saw a guy with a limp and we had no problems climbing it, I guess due to the height of each step. Well worth the 10 minute walk from Nevsky Prospect to visit it.

Great visit. By a combined ticket for the cathedral and the viewing deck, costs 400 rubbles. Inside the cathedral the artwork and mosaics are fantastic, you can take pictures, it is a great space and you can easily spend 20/30 minutes here.The viewing deck is nice reached by a spiral staircase then a bridge/stairs to the deck, this is the highest point for viewing in central St Petersburg so enjoy the views and get some great pictures.
Caltic Cruise - St Petersburg. This cathedral is breathe taking both inside and out. The decoration inside is elaborate and views from outside are amazing.

Beautiful and Interesting. A beautiful monument that has a very interesting history. There are 200 or so steps up to the dome - payment separately - but well worth the effort for the stunning views over St. Petersburg.
So Beautiful. The most beautiful holy place I have ever been!!! You must see the Cathedral to see what really art is.

Great view!. For about $5, you can go up the stairs to a viewing deck and get a 360 review of st petersburg. This is great because it's not too crowded since the masses don't do stairs.Once at the top, there are fabulous photo opportunities and you can see for miles.
Incredible!. It is simply mind-blowing on the inside! stand at the very centre and look up at the dove of peace. Fantastic city views from up on the colenade. A must-do!

Lots to see but be careful....!. This a very beautiful building and a great spot to take photos. Unfortunately local pick pockets also know that tourists may not be as attentive as they should. Be very wary of locals congregating around you in numbers! One person in our tour group had her wallet removed from her purse.
Golden Dome. Huge, wonderful church, with golden domes and great interiors. Not to miss if you visit st. Petersburg.
Beautiful cathedral. The artwork in this church was amazing as is the history of the church. We did not walk 200+ stairs to walk around the dome [which was a separate admission ticket].
Magnificent. The size, the mosaics, the stained glass in this church make your visit pay. Go there and spend some time admiring the huge doors and all the works of art there.

So different. Also include the colonnade to see St Petersburg from a different perspective.
Inside church look specially at the way the church was built
Amazing view of the city. but, you have to work for it by walking up what seems to be an endless number of circular stairs. You are rewarded with a 360 panoramic view of St Petersburg

Stunning Cathedral both Inside and Out. Along with the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood and Our Lady of Kazan Cathedral, every visitor to St. Petersburg should visit St. Isaac's Cathedral. Its gold towering dome dominates the city skyline. Once you see it up close from the outside, you will be impressed by its massive proportions and once inside you will be dazzled by the stunning beauty of the interiors: gold and malachite, beautiful icons, and the like, a fitting homage to God. The church is within walking distance to other major attractions.

A cathedral with a great panoramic view. It may look a bit gloomy, but the place has great arcitecture and decorations. What I like most is the view from the top. You can go up to the dome and see all around from there.

Huge cathedral. You can see the cathedral from miles away as it is so big. It's impressive and well worth a visit, if even just to look at it from the outside. You can go up the top where you get a good view of the city too.
marvel building. super architecture ,, its a symbolic building right in the city center and must visiti liked the russian art and the grandness

World heritage list nomination!. I am an experienced global traveller both business and leisure wise.Every place visited, I like to visit churches and light a candle. This cathedral was naturally on the list to visit but its beauty blew me off. This is one of the unique places where you will see a collection of various coloured marbles, brought to Russia from all over the world to decorate the walls, columns, make pictures!!!Don't miss this life time experience.............

Another must-see. Climb to the cupola - stunning views!. Do not miss St. Isaac's and absolutely do not miss climbing to the outdoor cupola - the views of St. Petersburg in every direction are worth the extra fare.

Malachite and lapiz columns!. Yes, this is truly amazing, and the 3rd largest domed church in the world. The Russian Orthodox religion is well worth taking in while in Russia. Note, they have no place to sit while worshiping. They stand!
Worth the visit. European style cathedral with some Russian elements. Make a quick visit to it. Best as part of a private guided tour.
Elaborate cathedral. Beautiful and detailed interior. I visited with an English audio guide (100 REUB extra). Closed on Wednesdays.

This one is a "WOW / FANTASTIC"; a great landmark. Take the time to view this cathedral. The interior is just spectacular from floor to ceiling. The frescos, the flooring and the stone are absolutely beautiful and it will leave you with your mouth hanging open, saying "wow". HINT: You can buy a combination ticket to get you inside, but also to climb up the stairs to the dome area where you will be rewarded with some wonderful views of all of St. Pete.

Very impressive cathedral. Although big and imposing, we didn't expect much from the interior. But the cathedral is beautiful inside, great columns, paintings and other artworks. Aa awe inspiring as a proper cathedral should be. A must visit while in St Petersburg.

great.!. Very Nice Cathedral. Inside is very beautiful. one of the most beautiful cathedral that I ever seen. if you want to see very nice view of st.petersburg should climb the steps . spectacular views of city. Don't miss this attraction. inside there are some small booths for buying nice souvenirs

Impressive Cathedral. As part of our itinerary with TJ Tours, we visited this impressive place. Like many of the attractions in St Petersburg, this is a very ornate landmark. Churches and Cathedrals are not really our thing, but you cannot fail to usually be impressed by the architecture, art, statues and other religious paraphernalia etc.
nice view of the city from the collonade. To have more impression from the cathedral you should go upstairs (about 200 steps by foot) to see St.Peterburg from the collonade!
amazing. this church has lots of story and it is really worth to see.You have to come and see here at nights and climb up.As you know St peterbug is nicer at nights.

4th biggest cathedral in the world. Amazing views from the top and worth a climb. Our two kids enjoyed the views and the climb itself with over 200 steps that they can count to up as they climb. Amazing views of the entire city and a gem in the heart of st petersburg. The granite columns holding up the structure is quite amazing and difficult to imagine the weight of the structure quite so sturdy after so many years. Worth a visit and hard to avoid.
Beautiful. The gorgeous artwork and the malachite and lapis columns make this a unique church. We thought it was gorgeous and worth a visit.
Always glorious. They know how they save their religious values. Big statues and very flashy architecture. So It deserves to be visited. I recommend strongly to visit the place.
Eye dropping building. Must see.. Wow is all I can say. the architecture is magnificent. You need some time to tour this building and take lots of photo's.

Very Unusual. The first thing one notices when approaching this cathedral is its sheer scale. The columns are unbelievably immense, as are the doors and the interior. Foreigners purchase tickets from kiosks at the front door (you can choose from a number of languages on the machines), Russians from the small street-side booth.

Not to be Missed - Impressive & Memorable!!. Although closed on Wednesday's, this magnificent Cathedral should, in my opinion, be on every tourists' list of 'must' visit places.Try, where possible/practical to visit early in the day as it gets awfully busy, as the day progresses. In addition, gaining insights into the Cathedral and all it has to offer, through a local tour guide, is worth the investment!From a personal perspective, I believe that it's best seen from afar (to gain perspective) prior to actually visiting the Cathedral.
Beautiful Church. This cathedral, with its huge front doors is breathtaking! Be sure to visit and go inside while you are in St. Petersburg! Don't miss it!

Very pretty inside and outside. There were 5 of us visiting this Cathedral. It is very beautiful, inside and outside. Allow 1-2 hours to visit and enjoy.Again, not being a "seen it all", if you've been to Notre Dame in Paris, or St. Peter's in Rome, this pales in comparison, but it is still worth seeing.What was bad in the sense of where we just had been - Church of the Spilled Blood, and then coming here, makes St. Isaac's pale in comparison. Also, both places charged 250 rubles, and it was felt that in comparison, St. Isaac's doesn't seem 'worth it' as there was considerably less to see, but the comparisons may not be valid. St. Isaac is beautiful in its own right as a traditional Cathedral.If you've got time, be sure to see it. If you are hard pressed for time, see Church of the Spilled Blood.---------------Note that to go to the walkway up nearer to the dome, you have to pay an extra fee. We did not go up there.
A historic masterpiece. Don't miss a visit to Saint Isaac's. You could spend a couple hours there just wandering around and looking at everything. The doors alone are magnificent.
Incredible!. This is must see cathedral! Its proximity to the Hermitage-Admiralty area makes it an easy stop for a visit. Wonderful experience!

Huge. The cathederal looks a lot bigger on the inside than it does looking at the exterior. It is well worth a visit and with a good guide we learn't a lot.I would highly recommend a visit. Very impressive

Unbelievably beautiful!. We visited St. Isaac's Cathedral in St. Petersburg today. It is the 4th largest Cathedral on earth. When it was built in the 18th century there was no consideration for the humidity in the area so many of the paintings have since been replaced with beautiful mosaics. There are no seats so everyone stood during the 1-2 hour services, even the Czars. We visited as part of a cruise tour hosted by Arthur Travel Limited and our tour guide Tamara was absolutely fantastic! I highly recommend a visit because the sheer enormity and amount of art work will boggle your mind.
Worthwhile.... This was by far the most impressive cathedral/church we visited in St .Petersburg. The architecture and art were well preserved given the rocky history of the building.
Lovely. Definitely worth the stop but not as special as some other locations in the City, if you are crunched you could skip it, but if churches and cathedrals are your thing, then don't miss it.

Make sure to see it from the inside. Saint Isaac's Cathedral is very interesting to see both from inside and outside and I would strongly encourage you not to pass it on your way along the Nevsky, but to see it from the inside as well. The decorations inside are marvellous, many columns sculpted from massive chunks of semi-precious stone. A display of grandeur and wealth, it's a must see in St. Petersburg. There is no entrance fee, which makes for another reason to see it.
Nice views. Lovely views of the surrounding area, worth a visit to the top and you can get views of the inside. It's easy to get a tired of churches in this city but this one is great.

I loved it my husband liked it. The lapis lazuli and Malachite pillars are incredible, the windows, the art and the tile are all incredible. There is much to be proud of. It still shows the glory of religious art despite being turned into a center for atheism.
Beautiful Church. The art work is amazing and the icon wall and dome are also very beautiful, Take the time to visit, you will not be disappointed.
Worth a visit. Grand looking outside, converted to a museum inside. Some displays to show the construction history.
St Issac's Catedral. Did not go inside but impressive outside architecture. great location. Next trip planning to visit inside.

Amazing. The cathedral's facades are decorated with sculptures and massive granite columns (made of single pieces of red granite), and the interior is adorned with incredibly detailed mosaic icons, paintings and columns. There is a large, brightly colored stained glass window of the Resurrected Christ inside the main altar.
Wow. Quite the grand and majestic church. Worth the time to make a stop if you enjoy church architecture.

See every corner. The outside is a beautiful buidling full of details, angels and sculptures. Inside there are a lot of things to see. There are painting, sculptures and mosaic paintings. There are huge doors like de ones in Florence. We where there for an hour, but wished I had more time to see every corner.

Spiritual. when you walks inside the cathedral you find yourself in other world , whispers of prayers , light of candles , image of Saints in the walls , ceiling , columns ,....take you to many years ago , I was really puzzled .

Probably on the most beautiful Churches I've visited.. As soon as you enter the church you will know that you are in for a treat. This church is magnificent with Eastern and Western influence in full force. The sculptures, the gold, and mosaics will make you marvel at what man can do in paying homage to God. If you visit St. Petersburg, you MUST visit this church.

Inspiring. We heard a choral concert in the Cathedral, so did not see all museum exhibits. The surroundings for the concert were breathtaking, however, and this beautiful space should be part of every visit to St. Petersburg

Fabulous cathedral. Of course it is a museum now. No services held. Busy but plenty of room to take photos. Ornate but very tasteful. Lots of seats around to rest and little stalls of items especially beautiful amber. You buy a separate ticket to go up to the colonnade. Fabulous views of the city. You would have to be reasonably fit for the amount of stairs. Vertigo sufferers don't go! You can't get back into the cathedral after climbing the colonnade. Lots of buses outside so many tourists but well worth seeing. Angleterre Hotel opposite has outside and inside cafe for good refreshments.

Engineering Competence at its best. To understand how the marble columns could be put in place multiple stories in the air at a time when there was no mechanized cranes is astounding. The interior artwork and painting is amazing.

beautiful view of St. Petersburg. when visiting this cathedral make sure you can go upstairs to the colonnade to see St. Petersburg in 360°. Doing this early in your trip is great as it will help you get a notion of the city's size and other landmarks to visit.
Get on top!. great view of the "whole" city to get you a better idea about where all the attractions are :-) can be a bit crowdy, try at night time for a romantic touch :-)

Incredible architecture and artworks. Maybe not quite as ornate as the Duomo in Florence, Isaacs Cathederal is comparable. The doors have wonderful carvings and bronzes. The view from the top affords a good opportunity to see the layout of the city.

Towering ceilings of exquisite art!. Saint Isaac's Cathedral is another example of incredible Russian art that has been preserved for centuries. The towering domed ceilings are filled with gorgeous art. The interior is vast and literally awesome.

fantastic cathedral. i cound not believe what i saw when i entered this cathedral i started crying it was so stunning every where you looked it was beautiful any body going to st petersburg should not miss this

This was Gorgeous. A huge European type cathedral.. huge high domes and gables. What was so interesting about St. Isaac's were the colors. The saints were painted in bright and wonderful colors and the pillars were made of malachite and lapis lazuli, in their bright greens and reds.. Unlike many European cathedrals I've seen. the one is not morose with a dying Jesus bleeding to death on the cross, but more vibrant. Even the dome was interesting with its dove of peace in the center of the dome looking down upon us. The Cathedral is well worth a visit

A stunningly beautiful Church. St. Isaac's is another beautiful church in St. Petersburg. Quite different from Christ the Saviour on Spilled Blood. The ceilings are the beautiful part of this church painted with elaborate frescos. Don't miss this Church.

Full of beautiful displays. Probably after visiting other churches, this may not be that tempting but for me it was a shocker as I had nearly given up on the idea of visiting this cathedral having been to two in the city already but eventually when I entered the place I was spellbound with all the displays inside. The whole place seemed to be bathed in gold and it shimmers and shines with beautiful pieces of work. If you are in the palace square then you should probably consider a quick peek

Incredible site to visit. This is a wonderful place to scale the dome and see St Petersburg from above. There are 200 stairs up to the top, but if you are reasonably fit you will have no problems. You need to buy seperate tickets to visit the dome and the inside of the church. Get an audio guide to make the most of your visit! Leave yourself a couple of good hours. We took our 10 year old and she equally enjoyed this historical site.

Eat and visit churches!. There is no end to the great churches in Russia. Amazingly, many survived the soviet era and today have been completely restored. The interiors are similar but each is unique. St Issac's is massive! Not to be missed on a visit to St Petersburg.

MUST SEE!. The inside of this cathedral was the largest and most beautiful out of all the ones I saw while staying in St. Petersburg for a month. You must also do the late night visit up on the colonnade. It is two separate tickets but we went up at 2:30 in the morning and watched the sun rise (around 4:00 am)! Must see!

Impressive. We visited here as part of our 2 day tour of St Petersburg, and were glad that we did. It is an impressive building both inside and out, with similarities to St Pauls in London. The decoration inside is amazing, and the exhibits showing the various stages of construction of the cathedral were very interesting. We did not go up the tower. With so many grand buildings in the city is easy to pass this by, but if you stop you will not be disappointed.

Monumental, but cold. A very impressive church, be it only due to its size and overwhelmingly rich decoration, with malachite pillars and lapislazuli columns 10 m high. But it lacks the spiritual athmosphere of other orthodox churches - maybe due to the fact that it served as a museum of atheism for more than 60 years.

Glamorous. This place is very glamorous. The interior was filled with painting, gold decoration and some mosaics. There is an audio guide for rental, and I recommended it if you wanted to know a bit more about the church history (especially useful if you are not in a tour). You can also go to the colonnades, it is one of the highest point to view the city.
Highight. Extraordinary in size, grandeur, decoration. It is essential to have some sort of guide, preferably a good local one, as we did.

Impressive. The sheer size of this church is absolutely impressive .. We did not climb the tower though .. Take a look also at the photo exhibition that shows the history of the building and how it was used during past times (not as a church)

Breathtaking. After hearing about the glories of the other cathedrals, I wondered why we needed to see another. But St. Isaac's is simply amazing. The interior artwork, tile, and mosaics are stunning. The story of how they erected all of those solid granite pillars is worth the visit. A must see!

Inspiring views. Be sure to go to the top of the colonnades where you will feel the cool breeze and see the panoramic views of the city. The inside of the cathedral is breathtaking rivaling the great cathedrals of Europe.
View to experience. It was hot outside and the climb in the tower was a little claustrophobic but worth it in the end. Great views of the city.
Opulent. We went inside the church and also took a walk all the way up to enjoy the views over St Petersburg. The inside of the church is really opulent: full of mosaics, painting, etc. A must see.
Beautiful domed cathedral. Huge cathedral, well worth a visit. The amount of work that went into constructing the church is mind-boggling.

Fourth largest cathedral in the world. And also the fourth version of the church dedicated to the saint. Beautiful paintings and wonderful history to it. Also, for a little extra money you can also get a ticket to go up to the top of the cathedral's tower and view the city from above. Unfortunately, there is no lift, and the hike up is about 260 steps, so it's not recommended for people with heart issues. But honestly, I've climbed the Eiffel Tower and this cathedral's steps are nowhere near as bad! The view of the city is gorgeous, and if you know Russian you can also enjoy a lecture on the city's general history.

Beauty & Splendour. St. Petersburg is awesome. There are so many attractions and some of them - like this church / museum - are beautiful and rich with art and history that one must see. There is nothing that we can add to the previews reviews. The review of "Blote59" is expressing exactly what we feel about the Cathedral. It's a must!

Beautiful Cathedral. One of the largest domed Cathedrals in the world, the architecture, artwork and history is amazing. Small fee to enter, but worth the price. Pictures are allowed and you will take some

Fabulous church. The interior of this church is magnificent. Take a guided tour as the importance of various asspects needs to be explained. However it gets very crowded. Beware of pickpockets before and after you enter. I was lucky - put your backpack on the front!

Truly amazing. On both the inside and the outside you'll see some of the most beautiful art in the world. Mosaics on the inside are astonishing! From afar they look like painting! Cherry on top of the cake is the view of Saint Petersburg is the view from the roof. I've heard that the view from the top of Smolny is also very beautiful, but didn't get a chance to see for myself.
Unbelievable splendor. Who designed this Cathedral from nothing? How did they envision the majesty? It's the most guilded, ornate tribute to God I have ever seen. It is beautiful.

Beautiful. St. Isaac's, although it is designated as a "museum", is lovely. It is somewhat reminiscent of St. Peter's in Rome on the inside, but nowhere near as beautiful or large. It is definitely worth a look inside, if you are an art, architecture, or church person.
Recommend. There are charges for both the "St Isaac’s Cathedral" and "Colonnaded Walkway", there are well worth them.

Beautiful. At first you will be amazed at the more traditional western architecture of this basilica, but what is really amazing is what you will find inside.The walls of this church are adorned with some of the most amazing art you will ever see. Filled with Russian Orthodox treasures, it rivals or even surpasses St. Peters in Rome.Make sure you take a moment to look at the doors of the church and their immensity. If you are taking a guided or audio tour make sure you listen the history of the building. If you only have time to visit one church in St. Petersburg, make it this one.

Rivals St. Peter's in Rome. Wow! Awesome cathedral! It gives St. Peter's in Rome a run for it's money. St. Peter's is definitely the big brother to St. Isaac's little brother, but amazing nonetheless. Art from the suburban palaces was hidden in the basement here during WWII. It's also nice to sit on the benches in the adjacent park and watch the sun set behind the cathedral!

Golden Dome is a Landmark. This imposing church, probably the last to be built in St. Petersburg in the1800's, was much larger than other churches in St. Petersburg. It was jaw dropping beautiful inside. Huge reddish streaked marble columns formed arches through which we walked towards the center of the church. These arches were surrounded by gilt trim and the inside of each arch was painted with biblical figures in bright blues and reds on a gold background. At the front of the church, on each side of the altar screen, were quite a few fluted green malachite columns which separated the life sized mosaics of biblical figures. The door of this tall gilt altar screen was open so we could see the altar and behind it a huge stained glass window of Jesus done in brilliant colors like blues, reds, and white. The huge main dome in the center of the space featured a dove soaring into the sky which was to symbolize the Holy Ghost/Spirit. The dove was surrounded by beautiful colored paintings of biblical figures. It didn't matter where we looked in either of the 2 naves or in the central part, we saw beautiful ornate details, much gilt trim, marble columns and mosaics of biblical figures. The tall massive heavy black doors have sculptures on them, making them more interesting. Like in other Russian churches, there are no pews or rows of seats in this church because it is not a working church. Inside there is a gift shop. This church represents more Western church architecture than Russian since it was styled after St. Paul's Basilica in Rome. Outside the entry, the red granite columns are massive and are repeated higher up around the dome. Many sculptures of biblical figures surround the gold dome and decorate the pediments as well. Our tour guide bought our tickets so there was no line up for us. Expect crowds as it is a major sight in St. Petersburg.

A must see in the center of the city!. Beautiful and open to the public as a museum. This is another do not miss excellent stops. There are so many placed in the Nevsky Prospect area you could spend you entire vacation in the one area. But even if you do not this an Katerenski Sabor (Catherine's Cathedral) are two do not miss stops... Lived in St. Pete for 7 years so take it from a local resident!
Beautiful church. This is a copy of St peter cathedral in Rome , we stayed on a hotel beside the church and eating dinner watching the cathedral is an amazing experience
Colonnade a must visit at night. Must go for the midnight viewing at the terrace Colonnade during the white nights. No point going there in the day.
Stunning. We couldn't go inside but is stunning from the outside just for the scale of it and some wonderful pictures of a typical Russian church.

Big and Beautiful. This reminded me of the Baroque Cathedrals in Rome. When I mentioned that it looked more like a Catholic Baroque Cathedral, I was ridiculed by the guide. Later we were told the architect was an Italian Catholic from Rome...duh.

Never over rated!. Absolutely wonderful cathedral.
Be sure to have at least 30 minutes to be inside the Cathedral to fully appreciate the beauty of the mosaics.
Gorgeous Cathedral. Definitely something to see while visiting St. Petersburg. The detail is wonderful and the history is very interesting.

Amazing buildings. One of many amazing historical buildings that have been brought back to life and restored after years of neglect during the old communist days. They stand out like beacons compared to the many drab grey concrete boxes that dominate many cities and towns. The Church of the Spilt Blood with its brightly coloured onion domes is also well worth visiting, as are the old royal palace's, gardens and fountains. St Petersburg feels like it's taking a new lease on life. PJ Barker, author of the novel Changing Pillion on

Impressive cathedral, great views from the Colonnade. We stayed in the Angleterre Hotel opposite the cathedral so could look out on it every day - a great sight. Lots of tour buses there every morning too, so we avoided visiting then. The cathedral itself is really impressive, rather than spectacular (though that's only in comparison to the Church on Spilled Blood or the Hermitage). Well worth seeing and spending time marvelling at its huge dome, the fine paintings, the sense of space and of peace. And the views from the Colonnade around the outside of the base of the dome are amazing - right the way across the city in every direction, and it's open till 11.00pm in summer - when of course it's still broad daylight. You do have to pay for a separate ticket though, and NB that there are around 230 steps to climb to reach the Colonnade level though they're wide and fairly easy. And don't forget after leaving the cathedral to walk across the road towards the river Neva to enjoy the gardens by the Decembrist Square and to view the statue of the Bronze Horseman.

Beautiful Cathedral!. The cathedral is one of the must-see places in the city. It's very spacious, with beautiful work of arts - mosaic and paintings. The tickets should include a guided tour (Russian at least) inside. Don't miss the wide marble arcs inside, and take the time to admire this place.Climbing to the top costs an additional fee, but worth it. The view from here is great, you can walk around and see a lot of famous places and buildings, and enjoy the view.

Midnight visit to the top is a bonus!. Conveniently located right beside the Lion Palace hotel, I decided to investigate late at night and found, much to my delight that one could make a night tour all the way to the top on the exterior of the Cathedral. Be prepared, it is a tricky climb in dark conditions, but the views once there make it worthwhile. You can buy the ticket at one of the machines using a credit card which was most helpful. And as with all churches and cathedrals in Russia, the interior which I visited the following day is both large and awe inspiring.

Can't miss cathedral to visit. Spent an hour touring the cathedral, which is extremely large and beautiful. The dome is incredible...very large...and awesome. The treat to this church is climbing the stairs to view the city from a place at the dome level. Looking down on the city helped to see all the many sites close by that include the Winter Palace, Peter & Paul Palace and Church of Our Savior on the Spilled Blood. The extra cost to see the city from atop was more than worth it.
great view from the top. The fourth church to be built on this site took 40 years to complete. Over 100m high, make sure you have power enough to go up on stairs

Third largest in the world. White Nite Beauty!. We went to the top to see the city view after midnight. Awesome view! This city never sleeps. They let you stay as long as you wish and you can take pictures for memory, it is very secure but I would not recommend it for people with fear of height.
A beautiful cathedral. The exterior and interior is beautiful.The climb to the top is well worthwhile too as it gives you a great view overlooking St Petersburg.
Nice view. It`s a very good place to go if you want a beautiful view from above the city. It`s possible to buy the ticket just to go up.

A magnificent Russian Orthodox cathedral. St. Isaac’s CathedralThis is a magnificent cathedral, one of the largest in the world. Ornate with gilt, marble, murals, mosaics, sculptures, it used some of the best artists of the time to create. Because of temperature problems that could affect the paintings, each painting is being re-imagined in beautifully done mosaics. If you like church art, this is a cathedral you do not want to miss!
be prepare to climb. When we got there, it was under going restoration. The steps were killing, but it was worth it. The view is simply amazing.

Go on the roof!. The cathedral itself is fantastic and definitely worth stopping at. There are mosaics from floor to ceiling and the massive wooden doors are quite impressive. There's a tiny little souvenir desk too. The roof tour is open in warm months and is worthwhile. It's a lot of steps but the view is spectacular. You can see the hermitage etc.
Only saw it from the outside. Great symbol of the city and a fantastic landmark when you got lost.The steps looked a bit too much for me but what a view you must get!!!
One of the worlds largest single-domed cathedrals. Lavish and imposing 19th century cathedral with amazing frescoes, stained glass windows and gilded statues.

Wonderfull!!!. wasn't sure if it worth paying. but a second after we entered we were amazed.
so nice so reach - glad we didn't missed it!
don't miss visiting the upper view!!

Beautiful. Another beautiful church/museum in St. Petersburg. No lines or wait when we went there. The inside is amazing. I also recommend walking up the colonnade (about 200 steps) for the amazing 360 degree views of the city.

Amazing marble and other beautiful stone. St Isaacs is a very extravagantly decorated church, filled with beautiful stone, mosaics, oil paintings, stain glass, brass work, and huge chandeliers. If you can, get there on opening (10.30) when the crowds are thin-- this enables you to see the lovely floor of the cathedral, and get photos without people obstructing your view. It is quite clear why the cathedral took 40+ years to build--the detailing, the scale and the engineering involved are all astounding. Truly one of the world's great churches

Get tickets for both the museum and colonnade. The colonnade is great for getting 360 degree city views, especially at night (open late for this). Over 200 steps but worth it. Inside the museum, you'll see the cathedral interior, which is typically ornate. Lots of tour buses stop here, but it wasn't a problem getting tickets without a long line.

Excellent views, if you like heights.. The cathedral inside is absolutely beautiful, and well worth a look around. If you can stand heights (which I can't) you can pay extra and walk up the stairs to the outside of the base of the dome, for some tremendous views across St Petersburg. If you like heights, do it. If you don't, it's terrifying!

St Isaac's Colonnade visited at night. It was my second visit to St Isaac's Colonnade, because I was ttracted by a chance to view the city at night at a birdsight. Although really windy on top, I never felt sorry about using this chance - I would advise to take this opportunity if you've not used it before.
View from the top is the best. Once you reach the top you will have a wonderful experience.Very typical religious cathedral.Nice experience.

If time permits; another must-see:. After leaving the State Hermitage our next stop on the 2-day tour of St Petersburg was Saint Isaac’s Cathedral and we arrived there late in the afternoon. You can see the Cathedral from the bus as you’re approaching it - it is majestic with golden turrets. Once inside it has a very good art collection and excellent murals. Unfortunately, we found it difficult to appreciate the numerous works of art because the cathedral was overwhelmed with visitors. But; we enjoyed the visit. And, because of time constraints, we did not have an opportunity to visit the top of the cathedral; which was perhaps OK because it was raining. If you have time please consider spending at least 1 to 2 hours here; that should be sufficient.Tip: If you’re interested in viewing the surrounding area from the top of the cathedral (which I believe is an extra charge), please consider going there on a sunny day; which we were told does not happen often in St Petersburg.

ON A WING AND A PRAYER. It's one of the most "touristy" stops in the city. Especially in the summer, you'll compete with the teeming hordes flocking from the buses and cruise ships. Get there early, if you can.Inside is certainly impressive, but rather less so than the smaller and more congenial Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood (see separate review).What makes this cathedral special is the long (and somewhat arduous) trek to the very top (extra charge, of course - nobody beats the Russians when it comes to charging for every little tidbit...where do you think the airlines learned it from?) But it's a pittance, really, and, if your heart's up for it, the view is spectacular.It's a bit of a thriller, too, because you walk across long, metal-grated walkways for the 360-degree panorama over the city and the Neva River.If you weren't into prayer before, you might think about it going up.
Great view from the top!. Really impressive inside and out. The view from the top is amazing but be warned it is a really long climb to the top!

One of the most beautiful building in the world.. Go both inside and on top!
This is a marvelous cathedral, full of history. Go around it, study its beauty, enjoy the beautiful square by the building.

Excellent View. I have never gone inside. I have only gone to the top of the tower. It is a Must do in St Petersburg to climb the never Ending spiral stair case. You will get to the see a great view as you walk around the top of the cathedral. You can see buildings, rivers, and many other sights. At night it is the best as everything is lit up.

More gilt, marble, murals, and mosaics than I have ever seen in one place!. This cathedral was built between 1818-1858 and the best painters and sculptors of the time were contributors to this work of art. It is an amazing building, filled with many breathtaking masterpieces...you really need time to take it all in...ignore the crowds and just enjoy it! Pictures can't do justice to the contents within!

Not clear instructions and unforgiving. We visited the cathedral after dinner and the announcement said to queue for tickets to climb the cathedral and cathedral entry. We bought tickets and discovered we had only Got tickets to climb. The view was great and it was worth the climb but we had a member of the party that wasn't up to the climb and we thought we were getting access to the cathedral as well but no. She didn't climb and they wouldn't give her her money back nor let her in to the Cathedral. The cathedral apparently was Closed but the ticket people didn't tell you that when you bought the tickets

Amazing. This was the last of the big churches we visited and it still knocked our socks off! It's no longer consecrated and is now technically a museum but your mouth may drop open when you enter and you try and look everywhere at once. Strangely enough - you can still buy candles in the gift shop to light though...We didn't climb up the outside (shortage of time and guts to take on the height) - and it was still a fabulous - definitely worth a visit.
Gorgeous!. All I can say is WOW!!! Beautifull!!! This is a beautiful cathedral with so much to see, you don't know where to look first!

An Orthodox Cathedral. They all have a familiar feel to them - big! But this one is simply huge! You stand in an Orthodox service - and I imagine there is plenty to look at in this one during the longer moments!
Amazing Place. Very busy but an absolute must on anyone's itinerary when visiting St Petersburg. It is worth to buy the ticket to climb to the top to have great views of the city

Do the colonnade for a great view. Like the church of the Spilled Blood, this is a museum rather than a consecrated building so don't expect it to feel spiritual! It's history is fascinating though, at one time it was a museum to atheism! I went for the whole lot and got an audio tour for the church and access to the colonnade. The audio tour was well done and made you see things that you would have missed otherwise. There are plenty of seats strategically placed for admiring the inside of the dome. The colonnade is worth the climb but it is a long way up (and down). It is a stone spiral staircase but helpfully the numbers of steps remaining are marked. The view from the top is great. You can see all of St. Petersburg!

Majestic. Take advantage of the White Nights late night opening hours, and climb the top at 10PM to get a 360 view of this great city from the best vantage spot in town. Imagine the path used to roll the massive single piece marble blocks and columns from the river bank to the cathedral site to truly appreciate precision and difficulty that went into building this spectacular monument.
The climb is worth it!. Walk here and climb the two hundred and fifty plus steps up to the dome and get fantastic bird's eye views of Saint Petersburg.

Worth going in. Our guide stopped for us to take photos outside, but I went back and the interior is the most sumptuous ulost up there with the Vatican, gold mosaics, lapis and malachite with amazing icons. I took photos in the crypt left of main altar, I did not realise that this was not allowed and was told off by a worshipper! Read the signs!

A jaw-dropping visit!. What looks typical of old monuments becomes a wow sight inside! It is filled with some beautiful murals and gold! Worth a study inside! You would suggest a guide to really soak it all in!
Pictures don't do it justice--beautiful!. So gorgeous, inside and out! We visited with Tailored Tours (see my full review there) and received so much interesting information about this church!
Majestic cathedral!. A visit to the cathedral and terrace which offers a unique view of the city is a must for St. Petersburg visitors.

Worth A Visit. Unusually large church with exceptional detail inside. Not much to look out from the exterior. Worth about 45 minutes of your time.Don't have time for 50 characters so trust me on this.

Great View. This is a pretty traditional looking church from the outside but the inside has some really beautiful murals that are well worth the cost to get in. I would suggest paying extra and getting the headset tour - there is a lot of good information. Also, buy the ticket to the top to get one of the best views in St. Petersburg. It's about 200 steps to the top for an amazing view!

Marevelous place to visit!. If you have time to stop in, and check out this beautiful place inside and out, but definitely the must sees in St Petersburg are the Church on Spilled Blood and the Hermitage Museum, those would be my only 2 must sees especially if you have limited time!

Huge place. This cathedral is massive. I almost got separated from the group because I stopped to look at the stain glass. At the back there are black and white photos of how it was during WW2. How they had to grow cabbages in the ground opposite the cathedral. Lots of mosaics of saints.
A real gem. My hotel was just a few blocks way so I went past it several time a day. It is visible from many places in the city and definitely a place to visit.
Lovely. Loved the silence in here and the hike up the stairs on to the roof.my son lived practically next door so we where able to look out at it 24hrs a day.beautiful
Imposing structure. One of the most elaborate churches in Russia! Try to go inside - cost about $10 pp but well worth it. There is also an observation deck.

One of many along Nevskiy Prospekt. Nevskiy Prospekt is wide, long and generally huge in scale. I was wrong to think I could walk it, picking and choosing sites to visit along the way from my tourist map and pocket guide. St. Issac's is on the Prospekt, but set back with gardens fronting the thoroughfare (and thus the address does not read N. Prospekt). It is near where we went to a ballet (the Alexandrinsky Theatre), and thus why we stopped in. The 3 rows of larger-than-life mosaic icons of saints are beautiful.
