Other aspects of what is said to be the largest cathedral in Russia you will have seen before in your travels through other countries, but if you are keen on mosaic iconography, St. Issac's is a destination.

Check out the dove. its another one of those grandiose Cathedrals, if you've seen St Pauls in London and been to the Vatican you've seen it before... but the dove hanging from the top dome within the other dome was quite a nice touch. And the story of how they carved the pillars and raised them is interesting.

You can see St Petersburg from the roof. This is a building that you can photograph all around with 100 ton pink granite pillars that were brought from Finland. Again the interior is magnificent with a lot of gold!

Go right to the top for spectacular views!. Make sure you go right to the top for breathtaking views of the city of St. Petersburg! Might be trickier for older folk and anyone scared of heights. But otherwise, well worth the climb up the old church stairwell. Suggest you go late evening or even around midnight (it's open till 4am!)
Beautiful Photos. We did not go inside but the outside was more than enough. Beautiful artwork and colorful. A must see on your trip to St.Petersburg

Inside St Issacs Cathedral is not to be missed. St Isaacs is not the biggest dome Church/Cathedral in the World, but it is still big enough and is a good navigation point when around and about the City. Inside it is truly magnificent and the Malachite is so different than any other Church/Cathedral. It is possible to go up to a balcony below the Dome and view St Petersburg. Again worth doing if it is a nice day for viewing and photographic. I will visit this again because it is unique inside.
Climb up to the dome. It was 231 steps but the views are incredible. We went at about 9 PM and it was still light out, being near the solstice.

Their interpretation of history. I thougt the museum contained Things from russian history og the city, but the historytelling in here is about the church as such. In fact that Means, that it tells something about Development in the russian society, as we are told, what happened to the church after the revolution and World war 2.
Overwhelming. The enormous cast bronze doors of this cathedral say it all really. The inside is huge and filled with interesting paintings and an example of really fine mosaics.

Very beautiful cathedral. I preferred this church to the Church of the Spilled Bllod - somehow it spoke of more substance, less glitz, depsite the abundance of gold leaf, but probably I just prefer the architecture which is more classical. There is a regal, expansive interior that speaks of high vision and it is simply grand on every level. It has good atmosphere, despite being crowded with tourists, and there is much glorious detail to enjoy. Put this one on the list if you can; it's really worth it.

Stunning cathedral. Be careful not to get a stiff neck as you appreciate the amazing decor of the ceiling. It's a bit sad that it's not a functioning cathedral anymore, but the architecture of the place is amazing.

Outside is Good, Inside is Spectacular. We drove by and stopped for pictures here on our first day, and it looked nice of course, but not particularly amazing. Don't be fooled! The second day we went inside and it was incredible. Much much better inside. Simply jaw dropping. Grand and very intricate, with a lot of visually interesting design instead of just a bunch of gold.

I loved that church . It is one of the most beautiful churches I saw as it has a very nice golden statue and it has a special building method , I advise you to take the English audia it is very helpful and also take a ticket to the upper roof because a nice view to the city from there

Huge and beautiful. Today is basicaly a museum and outside seem s more a Roman temple than a cathedral. Inside is very beautiful and huge. For sure, deserves the visit. I didn't go to the colonade (outside the dome) where there's a view from St. Petersburg. At least during the summer, is open until 10 pm.

not the Vatican but in a league of its own. Except for the Vatican I have never been so awestruck with a church in all of my travels. The church is huge and the amount of gold leaf is staggering. It literally makes your jaw drop. Don't miss it.

Great view from the colonnade.. An interesting church, plainer than some of the more spectacular churches, such, as Church on Spilt Blood, but an extremely large interior with some interesting engineering solutions to its construction. The 360 degree view from the colonnade is spectacular, although crowded at the top. About 261 steps in spiral stair case, but not difficult for reasonable fit 70+ year olds on our trip.
Beautiful Edifice with Good Views from the Dome. This is a beautiful edifice and justifiably famous. A climb to the dome is worth the effort because its vantage point provides good views of the city.

Beautiful building. St Isaac's reminded me of St Paul's Cathedral in London and is a beautiful building. There was insufficient time to do a tour of the inside but, since you can walk, around the dome, something I would definitely do next time.
Beautiful church. I have been to the Vacican in Rome and Saint Isaac's Cathedral is right up there in its own right of beauty and craftsmanship. You wil be in awe and a must see.

Beautiful but Busy. We were on a Baltic Cruise and booked a ships tour for the Churches of St Petersburg. The first one we visited was St Isaacs. In order to take photographs there is a small charge. Our guide collected this on board the coach before we arrived. We were asked for 3 euros for photos or 5 euros for video. The guide will mention euros or dollars. I had changed some money into Roubles so asked the guide to pay in Roubles . She took 100 roubles . This did cover all the churches we visited. The guides will take roubles if you ask them. On arrival it was very very busy but the guides give you headsets. One does have to move rather quicker than I would have liked.It is the largest Russian Orthodox Cathedral and its gilded Cupola can be seen from all over the city - it is now a museum and only holds services on significant ecclesiastical holidays and is in front of a square with a large monument to Nicholas IThe Dome is 101 metres plated with pure goldThe Bronze Doors are covered in reliefs similar to those on the Bastillero di san Giovanni in FlorenceInside many of the icons are created in mosaics, fourteen different colours of marble, many precious stones, and artists of the time such as painter Karl Briullov and sculptors Ivan Vitali and Peter Clodt collaborated to create the most striking decorations Inside the dome is a striking fresco depicting Maria surrounded by saints and at the centre of the fresco hangs a silver dove with a wingspan of 263 ft - this represents the Holy GhostThe walls are decorated with magnificent frescoes and mosaicsAbsolutely beautiful but unfortunately very busy when we visited, however, not to be missed.

Russian Orthodox Cathedral at it's finest. As the largest Orthodox church in Russia, it's a monument to innovative building techniques. About 25000 pilings were driven into the ground to support the build. Although much of the religious trappings were removed during the revolution, and turned into a museum, and is still a museum, it is used for significant religious event now.The dome with the dove is still intact, as is much of the interior. If you are on a St. Petersburg cathedral tour, be sure to stop here.

So many churches. St Petersberg has over 400 Orthodox churches. This is a major attraction, very beautiful but there are only so many churches one can take. I think there are better ways to spend tome in St Pberg than battling with the crowds here.

The Landmark of St. Petersburg. Mind boggling, so much gold, wonderful paintings or I should say mosaics, the artists were really, geniuses. It is an enormous Cathedral, so much gold and soaring cupolas as breathtaking.

What a surprise!. Really formidable exterior and then very colorful robust interior. Loved the mosiacs, malachite columns, and stained glass. Not an inch that isn't ornately decorated. The climb to the top of the colonnade is worth it for the spectacular panorama view of the city. Bring a coat on a cool day as the top is windy. Church museum ticket 250 rubles and colonnade 150 rubles.

Great views. Whilst we missed being able to go inside it's good to note that during the summer months (I'm not sure about winter) the observation platform is open until 9pm. It was great to be up there as the sun was starting to set. Even the 160 odd steps were not too bad!
an interesting place. This is an interesting place. The building is extremely beautiful both inside and outside. You can go up and look at the city.

STUNNING AND GIGANTIC. Wow, although The Church on Spilled Blood' is rated higher than this church, it is is no less impressive. The sheer size of the interior makes this one of the world's great buildings. It is so beautiful inside with its altars, statues, and frescoes. It is like St. Peter's Basilica in Rome!Do try to get there in the late evening openings when most of the tours have gone to fully appreciate it.

Church accommodates 8,000!. This enormous cathedral is not to be missed. The decorative stone work is beautiful. Church was closed for many years to visitors so it was a treat to be able to go inside.

Interior even better than exterior.. I was surprised with the gaudy appearance of the interior. Gilded in gold and soaked in opulence. Interesting history and better seen with with a guide. All of St. Petersburg is better seen with a guide. Don't go without one or you will miss the history, nuances of the culture.

The most amazing building. Although 'Spilled Blood' is rated higher this building is no less impressive. The sheer size of the interior makes this one of the world's great buildings Do try to get there on one of the late evening openings as most of the tours will have gone and the locations is virtually empty which make sit all the more amazing. Fine interior decoration with fine doors and additional mosaic panels on display. Walk up the stairway to the colonnade for great views - this can be done separately to the inside tour so if the weather is poor you can come back another day to do the views

The 3rd Biggest Church in the world... after St. Peter's Basilic in Rome. This beautiful and big church was built on what we know today as the St. Isaac's place. With its 100 meters high, its 4000 square meters, its big golden dome surrounded by 4 small ones, it took 40 years to complete the construction (from 1818 to 1858). Apparently, it is considered to be the third biggest church in the world after St. Peter's Basilica in Rome. Unfortunately, we only stopped for a few photo shots, so we could not visit the inside. Nevertheless, the building is by itself, something you would want to see during your visit in St. Petersburg. The place is very touristic with buses for guided tours. So, you might want to do just the same if you wish to see it. Those able to visit the inside can also borrow the stairs that lead to the middle top. On a hot sunny day, we were actually glad we did not have to do that! The structure is quite a monument with more than 350 beautiful sculptures all around it, exposing their finest details. Even if for a short stop, it is worth it!

Huge, awesome. It huge, 100 kg of gold in the roof, massive inside and really worth doing. Everyone goes on about climbing up to the gallery but we were awestruck by the interior. Some beautiful mosaics and the agate and lapis columns are amazing. Cool stuff.

big,Big,Big,BIG. This Cathedral is overwhelming and so beautiful, I hate the temporary fences and was actually tripped by one of their support pieces but once inside managed to feel closer to God and Mother Russia

Fantastic.. We visted this cathedral whilst there was a service in progress.No seats!Very strange for us to comprehend but very humbling.There was a little old lady sat outside who invited us in.Scarves are available by the door for ladies to cover their heads.

Big and magnificent church. This is a very excellent historic church where you are allow to take photos of the magnificent church and history. Highly recommended to see this place even if you are a non-christian, just the building will take your breath away.

Great Views. The cathedral offers great views of the city from its viewing walkway. There are many steps up to it so be aware, but the award is 360 views of the city. Must see, especially if you do not have long in the city because you can see everything!
go to the top of the colonnade. This is a beautiful cathedral. It is worth paying the separate fee and climbing the 360 steps up to the top. Great views. See the nearby Peter statue.

Luxurious cathedral. Luxurious inside. Walls and ceiling covered with magnificient mosaics depicting the Christ and his apostles. There is so much to see that you do not know where to start; as everything is beautiful. You can take pics as you wish- there is no extra for a camera.Now you can see where the money from the riches was used for; while the people was starving. As for the exterior, it is also magnificient . With pink granite columns and marble vaults. Take the time to admire the bronze doors which are all sculptured. A real piece of art.
Could see this from our window. But wow when you get inside the colours of the marble and semi precious stones blow you away. The proportions are unbelievable.

beautiful church,but..... beautiful church and icons, but compared to Church of the Spilled Blood and Peter and Paul Churches, this edifice comes across as somewhat less spectacular; in any other setting, it would come across as #1
Stunning. We liked the looks of the interior and liked the stories of how it survived the war. The decor is very rich with details and it is well worth the entrance fee.

Spectacular. Climb up all those steps to the Colonnade (you'll need oxygen by the time you get up top) and you'll have the best view in the city. You get a 360 degree view of St. Petersburg and can really appreciate the design of the city. Then go down and step inside the cathedral to be amazed. It is so incredibly ornate and the mosaics are superb. Your neck will be hurting from looking up all the time!! On the outside make sure to find the column with the shrapnel damage still there from the siege.
Wow. Amazing view from the top of Saint Isaac's Cathedral and of course gorgeous interior and frescos on the walls inside.

Beautiful and majestic St. Isaac's Cathedral. As a child I did not know why the breakdown were seen on the Cathedral columns, but then I've read that they were traces of projectiles that had fallen near the cathedral during the WWII. Until 1990 the St. Isaac's Cathedral was a museum and now there are services on church holidays.
church with a view. really a great place - from inside - great construction, historical building but most important do not forget to climb on top of the Dome. Great city view
Excellent city views. Well worth the $4 to climb to the top for expansive views of the city and Neva River. Did not go inside.
Wonderful church. This spectacular church is so big. Very beautiful and the construction is unbelievable. You must visit.
Must see church. We only had time to go to the balcony of the church. It was worth it, the views over the city are phenomenal.
Impressive. Totally awesome place. How they constructed and raised this amazing church is a mystery. Climb the dome and enjoy the view

Gorgeous views. A stunning interior is matched by the awesome views of this lovely city from atop the Colannade. While not for the faint of heart, the view is well worth climbing those many, many steps, especially on a sunny day.
Gaudy but impressive!. There is nothing tasteful about this place but it is impressive in its own way. The ornate doors and the models of how it was built were the highlights for me.

Insist on seeing the inside. Beautiful, and must be visited. Looks very plain from the outside, but the inside is another story.. the lapis columns are sensational as are the icons and the intricate work.

A STUNNING MUSEUM. The inside of this cathedral is hugely impressive. The richness of the decorations, the icons and the ornately carved doors were amazing. it wasn't that crowded and the groups of school children visiting were very well behaved

A great attraction with two keys benefits.. We were wowed. We visited this place and were wowed.There are two tickets(1) allows you to visit the Church itself(2) a second allows you to ascend to a Colonade ..We bought a joint ticket.The Colonade we did first. It gives a great 360 degree view of Saint Petersburg. Would recommend doing it earlier in the day or when the air is very clear. Fantastic viewsThe second is the Church itself. It staggers you . We had seem some impressive churches in or travels, particularly the baroque churches of Austria, but with the exception of Gaudi’s La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona this would equal anything we have seen bearing in mind we have never seen Saint Peters in Rome.The malachite and azurite columns, the general artwork and quality of marblework and brass work on the gates had us looking in wonder for hours.Strangely we spent more time here than the Church of Spilled Blood but we did spend quite a bit of time uo top looking out over Saint Petersburg.

Monumental. A very grand church in all senses, beautiful paintings, mosaics and the stained glass alter is divine. There is a charge for you to enter and a separate fee if you wish to climb to the cupola and enjoy views across the city. It's golden dome can be seen from many points of the city as it is so high.

Open till late. Great interior.Tickets could be obtained in the ticketing machines.The cathedral is open till late, however after 6.30 pm the entrance fee increases. Still it's an advantage since many museums in St-Petersburg close their doors at 6.30 till next morning

amasing view from the colonnade. good to begin with for the visit of this city. Interior is grandiose and you can enjoy a magnificient view over the city from the colonnade but you will have to climb more than 200 steps !

Just Spectacular. While the exterior is impressive, the interior is breathtaking. And I visited St. Isaac's AFTER the Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood, finding it to be even MORE impressive. Don't miss it when you're in the city - it's worth it.
Great View. Opted to hike up to the top of the cathedral rather than go inside and the views were impressive! Be aware the trek up can make one a bit dizzy and some steps are in need of repair.
Huge and beautiful. We were amazed at the size of this cathedral. The mosaics were fantastic and looked just like paintings.
Loved it. Very easy to find - there is an enterance charge. A beautiful cathedral - worth photographing. It is as imporessive on the inside as it appears on the outside

Lovely church.. We did this in two visits, one to see the church and one to climb the tower. The church is magnificent, take some time to sit and admire the artwork. There is a lot, so it's easy to miss the smaller details. The tower is good, nice views of the city. Worth climbing the steps! It's possible to buy a ticket from an automated machine (in English) at the entrance to the church, so no need to queue at the ticket booth.
my favorite cathedral in St . Petersburg. This is a magic place! Very beautiful and gorgeous. There are many other churches but Issac place you fall in love with first sight.
What views!. We just paid to walk up to the top for views - they were superb, views in every direction across the city.

Church glitz with a view.. Even if you not into churches, take a walk (climb) up the collenade if it's a clear day. Very high with views around st.petersburg. Cathedral is a separate price and with all the glitz most churches have. Very bling and a lot of history with English description or audio.
Unbelievable!. The church is immense. Everything was amazing, floors, doors, ceiling, mosaics, paintings, etc. Absolutely worth seeing.
Great views. The interior of the church is richly decorated, but what is really amazing is the city view from the dome.
Wonderful. Stunning building with the statue of Peter the Great just a short walk away - you can go up and look over the city

It looks like an Aladin House.. A nice place to remeber & also good souveneir shops near by. You can have lot of stuffs in near by area & its a kind of main spot of St. Peters. I was in group of 7-8 so it was like a good spot to have random pics & also you can enjoy boat tours, opening of Bridges etc.

Magnificence. The workmanship is fantastic, and the decor so elaborate - every surface seems to be gilded or have been artistically painted. Must have been very difficult to concentrate on a religious service!
Haunting singing. Russia Orthodox services have no organ music - but to witness a service with choral song was a real privilege.

Beautiful Cathedral. The cathedral is now a museum and has a 250 rouble charge. It is a very impressive design and definitely worth seeing especially the huge pillars of semi-precious stones surrounding the alter

Good view, skip inside. The inside of this cathedral provides an insight into why the revolution against the Tsar's occurred - lots of money spent here!
The best part of the cathedral is the view from the colonnade, which doesn't need you to spend the 250R to go inside, only 150R to climb the stairs. Great views around town - bring your camera!

Isaac's Cathedral. not top of the list of things to see in SPB although if you love heights you get an impressive view from the top ( accessible by stairs - not good for wheelchairs or buggies ). Inside the Cathedral is not that impressive and when one considers the price tag one has to see whether it's worth it or not. Keep in mind that there is the possibility of buying a "block ticket" and you get to see Isaac's Cathedral, Church on Spilled blood and some other monument for a cheaper price if you buy the block ticket.if time is tight go to Church on Spilled Blood and skip this one

Lovely view. I highly recommend visiting the colonnade whilst at this cathedral. It's a steep climb, but well worth the view! I went with my partner, in the late afternoon, just in time to see the sunset from the top, which was magnificent. You can view the whole of St. Petersburg from the top, though it's a long way down! The cathedral itself is beautiful and very unique!
Different from Notre Dame or St. Stephans. After the Revolution they saved this church and made it a museum and it is incredible and unique in it's size, treasure, art and architecture.

Don't miss a visit to the Colonnade for best views of St Petersburg. The inside of the cathedral is spectacular and filled with amazing decoration and interssting facts on how it was built. However, isiting the Colonnade and climbing its 265 steps will reward you with spectacular views all over St P. Note that the ticket desk is seperate from the one where you buy the cathedral tickets as it can be easliy missed 9it is to the left of the entry door to the cathedral

The most amazing and huge Cathedral I have ever seen !. As you can see from the photos this Cathedral is really amazing and very huge ! I was really very impressed the time I saw it from outside. I dont know how they placed those extremely heavy pillars there with the techniques of the time they builded the cathedral. Each pillar weighs hundreds of tons ! When you enter inside you face with a perfect work of art. You need at least 2-3 hours to see all. From top of the cathedral you see a 360 degrees of perfect view of the city.
Only round the outside. I first visited this cathedral in dec 2008 and was smitten and now the restoration has been completed it's even better. Really stands out in the evening light

Incredible restoration. When you visit it is best to know the story behind the architect and how the Catedral evolved into the building that it is today.
Without a guide we would have missed the stories behind the mosaics, the architect, the restoration.
Yes, visit but get the full picture w a guide. It really moves the experience way up the scale

The third Isaac Cathedral. Fantastic impression, read all the
history about this cathredal inside on the very informative stands.

Impressive but not to my taste. Yes, it was impressive and at the top you do get a great view of the city, but I found the architecture and internal presentation not to my taste. Too "heavy, dark and sombre", but it will certainly be of interest to others. I did, however, find the audio guide well scripted and provided clear insight into the art work, as well as how the cathedral was constructed.

Wonderful way to see panorama of St. Petersburg. I happened on this Cathedral at 5:00pm - wanted to see the Colonade (upstairs panoramic view of the city) and the inside (which they call the museum). Was told it was too late for both, so I chose the Colonade. Was warned it was 300 steps up, but figured I could do it, which I did - but it's not for the faint of heart! It was well worth the climb! I would do it again if I were in the area. You see the whole of St. Petersburg as you walk around the entire circle - lots of opportunity for photos. Unfortunately I came back to see the inside (musem) on a Wednesday, not knowing it was closed on Wednesdays, and I never did get to see it. From all the reviews, I will surely go inside next time!

Most beautiful Cathedral in Saint Petersburg. Like everywhere in Saint Petersburg this big stony jewel laid in a beautiful garden.Before entering to this amazing church with a special beauty ,thane your picture from the building or the surrounding as far as possible or bring a wide lens camera with your self.View of Saint Petersburg from the dome of the cathedral is also worth a visit.

Inside it is amazing!!. +Seeing it from outside made me think that it wouldn't worth.But inside it is so beautiful!!Such a rich church,worths a visit!!-Churches in S.Petersburg are like a business.You pay a ticket to get in,you pay to light a candle,you pay for the paper that you write for someone to be healthy and then pay for the souvenirs!Especially in Isaac Cathedral,there is a souvenir shop inside the temple!Are we serious??Buying things inside the holly temple??

Great view from the roof top. St. Isaak's is one more brilliant church/museum in town. Gold and incredible works of art everywhere. Photos of what was left of the city after the war only make it more impressive as it's all restored, at least as beautiful as it was before the bombings. We walked up 200 steps to the roof top to see a fantastic view of the city. If you do that on the first day, it will help with finding your way around during your stay.

Absolute must view from the top. Great view of the city from here; if I were you I'd do this the first day of my visit to this town so you get a dimmension of the city. Also the richness of the church is amazing with its green columns. i went there without a tour guide but i read its story first and then overheard all the tour guides who were actually there (it was the summer so there were lots of cruise tourists). if i remember correctly one needs to be respectful in this church, I think it is an Orthodox one so out of respect I covered my hair at some times and there is an area (in the front) to which you can't enter, think that's were the Tzar used to go.

Great opportunity for some unexpected exercise!. I visited in September 2013 with a business colleague who has some walking difficulties.As I found throughout my visit to Russia in general municipalities are not over accommodating for disabled people. There is a clear absence of wheelchair ramps and elevators or lifts to assist them in special attractions.Having said that my colleague was able to ascend the stairs, if somewhat slowly, and get into the inside of the building which is a very, very worthwhile visit.I shot off around the corner to purchase the tickets which are around 300 Rubles per person so it's quite cheap to get in and then I took off for the 300 stair climb to the top of the building!! This certainly accounted for my gym for the day!Beautiful views wait at the top and it's one of my great joys in the journey of life to view cities from the highest possible peaks.Once back down and in the building what can one say other than WOW!I was extremely impressed with the beauty of the biblically depicted scenes particularly of the resurrected Christ being almost a center piece in one of the biggest arches. I was sad to see so many great churches that were once functioning houses of worship are now just simply museums.However that being said as non-functioning churches the rules for entrance and what you can do inside is a little more relaxed so you can take a lot of photographs and get into some of the buildings that you wouldn't be able to do if they were still functional.The inside of St Isaac's Cathedral is just simply one of the most impressive works of art that you will ever see anywhere in the world.Renovations and care for the internal side of the building has been kept at a high level so kudos to those responsible for this!One could easily spend an hour inside the cathedral just embracing and taking in the beauty of the mosaics and the artwork. I enjoyed the fact that there is adequate natural lighting inside to help with a simple camera to produce some really beautiful photographs.On a practical note there are no restrooms in the area but there is one outside across the road but it is not free, you pay a small amount of 3 Rubles to make use of the facilities which is well worth it if you need it!All in all one of St Petersburg outstanding attractions and whilst it is looking a little shabby due to age and perhaps pollution on the outside, the interior is simply off the charts!In my opinion, this is a definite visit during your time in St Petersburg!

Magnificent interior. From the outside this beautiful cathedral does not look particularly "Russian" with a huge single dome and classical columns, the interior however is an almost staggering assemblage of huge icons, mosaics, brilliant green malachite columns and gold everywhere. I found it the most impressive church interior in St.Petersburg, although it it now a state museum, not the city's principal cathedral as it had been from its construction to just after the revolution. This means that there is not a strict dress code and you can take photos to your heart's content, it does however leave it with a certain "coldness"; no ranks of glowing candles in front of the icons, no priests chanting in basso profundo.

ST. ISAAC. It's a huge church converted by the Soviets into a museum. Take a ticket to visit the interior of the church but avoid the visit to the "colonnade" if you don't want to take some 200 steps to the top of the huge building.
Grand cathedral. From the statues that surround the top of the building to all the décor inside, it's fantastic. Beautiful in everyway. A must see.

what a view. group of 8 didn't mind the steep stair climb to the top, were rewarded with spectacular vistas of the city. renting audio in church was worth it, a little too much info for most of our group however, very beautiful
Well worth the visit. Climb up to the colonnade to gain a great view of the city. Lovely inside, the audio guide is very useful.

St Isaac's interior of semi-precious stones columns, mosaics, pictures and statues is different. Immense cathedral, third in size ratings, after London and Rome, impressively arranged between the two squares by the Neva embankment, one of them decorated with the Bronze Horsemen described as a monstrous ghost in the Pushkin's poem, is unusual and unparalleled, not typical for neither austere nor embellished edifices and boasts a unique and absolutely different beauty. I visited more than 55 churches and cathedrals in Rome and am impressed nevertheless. The question, why as many as 112 columns surround it? Made of granite, they are so big that it is incredible, really, if you do not know it is a temple of God.

What a view from the dome!. Didn't get a chance to go inside as we had so much on the itinerary, but the tremendous panoramic view from the dome is a must when you visit this city. The photos you can get from that height and feeling of the majestic St Petersburg was worth the climb.
Amazing!. Don't climb the top during the winter! It is open roof with strong wind. Not really possible to take photos. Interior is hot :) and amazing!

Awesome view. The entrance is quite cheap, and even if you have to climb a lot of stairs, the view is definitely worth it.Totally over the whole city the most pleasant moment is going at sunset, seeing the sun setting over the city and all the lights on is totally great!
Amazingly beautiful. For 250 rubles tou can enter this gigantic church covered in mosaics and gold. Don't miss the prayer area in the left hand corner, very serene.

Amazing. This was a highlight of our trip to Russia. The artwork and craftsmanship that have gone into this cathedral are breathtaking. It's the largest Russian Orthodox Cathedral in the city. The detail in the mosaics inside the Cathedral is amazing. The mosaics were applied on top of paintings that began to deteriorate over time. During the Soviet era the Cathedral was turned into a museum and only afterwards die it return to its original religious purpose.

A Must See Sight. You Will Be Awed. For 250 Rubles, I am almost paralyzed as I enter St Isaac's Cathedral and look up towards the ceiling. This is by far the most beautiful and stunning artwork and craftsmanship that I have ever seen anywhere in the world.The beauty and process it took to accomplish this is almost beyond my comprehension. This museum is a one of a kind that I am sure cannot and will not be duplicate in my life time.If it is only one thing you see in St Petersburg, it should be St Isaac's Cathedral without a doubt.Beware, there are no restroom facilities available except outside somewhere in a park across the street.

Beautiful Cathedral. Allow yourself plenty of time to see this cathedral. It is very beautiful on the inside. You can also walk to the top of the dome (colonnade) for a great view of the city. However, keep in mind that the last flight of stairs before you reach the very top, is exposed to the outside. Also, you can’t turn around and go back down since the steps are one way. The only way to get down is to go to the very top of the cathedral and exit on the opposite side. So, if you are afraid of heights, you might want to consider not doing this. A separate admission is needed for the Cathedral and the Colonnade.

Beware of pickpockets!. The square is impressive in its size, but the pickpockets are well organized, dressed as tourists with cameras, etc. and seem to have a free pass from the police. Don't stop to look at the wares of any street vendors.

Dome Covered with 100 kg of Pure Gold. St. Isaac’s Cathedral, also called Isaakievskiy Sobor (Russian: Исаа́киевский Собо́р), is one of the four museums of the State Museum St Isaac’s Cathedral – The Museum Complex. The other three are Smolny Cathedral, Church of the Savior on Blood and the St Sampson`s Cathedral. Most of the churches and cathedrals we visited in St. Petersburg are no longer used for its original purpose but are magnificent museums. After the October Revolution of 1917 the cathedral was converted into a museum. You can spend 10 minutes walking (900 m / 0.56 mile) from the State Hermitage Museum to St. Isaac’s Cathedral and enjoy these two museums in the same day.The construction of the St. Isaac’s Cathedral took 40 years from 1818 to 1858 by the order of Tsar Alexander I. Reaching 101.5 m (333 ft) in height, the cathedral's enormous 25 m (83 ft) diameter main dome, one of the largest in the world, is covered with 100 kg (220 pounds) of pure gold and dominates the city skyline. When you approach either entrance, you can see the giant red/brown granite pillars. Those pillars are 18m (60 ft) tall and 2 m (7 ft) in diameter. Inside the cathedral is awesome as well. The decorations used expensive, various color marbles and semi-precious stones. When you look up at the dome, you can find Maria surrounded by saints on the beautiful fresco. You will immediately notice a silver pigeon in the center of fresco. I had to wait until I could find the exactly center to take the photo of the wonderful painting. The walls were decorated with magnificent paintings and mosaics. The iconostasis was decorated with green and blue columns, and there was a large stained glass window, the "Resurrected Christ," inside the gilded bronze Royal doors of the main altar. Beside the doors were mosaics with a gilded sculpture of Christ above the door. That is why it took another sixteen years and lots of money to decorate the interior before the grand opening in 1858.This was our last visited attraction after 2 days’ travel of the amazing city - St. Petersburg. Although we were only there for 2 days, we managed to see 7 of the most popular attractions in the city. I do believe there is so much more to see in St. Petersburg, and we will return in the future. I also hope that they can provide at least English, or better yet, Chinese - the most spoken language, descriptions on the displays beside Russian. With that, I believe more people will learn more about Russian history and culture.
Beautiful big cathedral. This cathedral is worth going inside to see the amazing craftsmanship and beautiful artwork inside. The tour guide was very informative also.

Don't miss the view from the top. Interior of the catherdral is spectacular but the main draw is the view from the top. There's just over 200 steps to the top and then you get a 360 degrees view of the city.

Magnificent historic cathedral. Once you get passed the coach trying to find somewhere to park and the queues, and actually get inside the cathedral takes your breath away, it is absolutely massive inside and although not as stunning as the church of the spilled blood is it still outstanding, with so many images to look at, you would probably need two or three visits to fully see everything. Our guide was extremely knowledgable and give us many interesting stories about the cathedral including showing us where the nazi soldiers shot the church whilst trying to take st Petersburg, for me the best part is the dove at the very top of the roof. It puts our cathedrals to shame

Spectacular views and breathtaking artwork. You have to buy separate tickets for the interior of the Cathedral as well as the roof but it's well worth it. Great 360 degree views over St P from the roof and when inside, although seemingly now more a museum than a functioning place of worship, spectacular paintwork all over. Really worth a visit.

Excellent Sight, Great View. Sadly didn't have a chance to visit the interior museum as it is closed on the one day of the week we visited, be warned to check ahead! Tickets to the view point further up are automated so you can go any day, fantastic view, well worth popping up!

This church is a must!. This is another treasure of St Petersburg. It's very beautiful inside with its emerald walls and columns, as well as golden design. There is a pendulum inside the cathedral that has a scientific value - it proves that the Earth is moving. Be adventurous and climb the spiral stairs on top of the cathedral! From there you will see a panorama of the city. Enjoy it!

Veri nice inside and nice view from the top. This cathedral now not more used for its originary intent is now called Museum. Inside you can see very nice golden decorations and paintings and if you go to the Colonnato(you need a different ticket for it and you've to go out and enter from another entrance for it) walking through more than 200 steps you reach the Colonnato around the cupola from where you can have nice views of the city.

Just a little climb!. There are two parts to the visit to San Isaac. One is to see the perfection inside, the other is to climb to the roof on the outside. This was hard work and my fear of heights had to be put aside. The view from the top gave a splendid vista of St Petersburg. Well worth a visit and close to the central area.
Yet another beautiful sight of St Petersburg. Stunning interiors, with the chance to climb its near 300 steps and see the amazing panoramic views or St Petersburg.

Beautiful inside with breathtaking views outside.. The inside of this church is a must to see if you are in St Petersburg. It is full of beautiful art works, sculptures and brightly coloured stained glass.The interior is simply spectacular and beautiful. We climbed the 300 steps of the spiral staircase up to the cathedral's colonnade. The magnificent 360 degree view over the city is definitely worth the climb. You need to purchase a ticket for the interior of the catedral and a separate ticket for the colonnade.
Stunning. Very beautiful structure and design from inside. You did not visit St. Petersburg if you missed this!

Huge!. It is said to be the biggest church in Russia and when you step over the threshold you can understand why. It is very large with a ceiling that seems to disappear into the clouds. Once again it is decorated with wonderful paintings and is a real "working"church. You are Lao able to visit the Collanade to see the view over the city, but the weather prevented us from doing this.
a view from a roof. impressive in scale and appearance the colonnade provides stunning views of the whole of Saint-Petersburg including Alexanderovsky Park and the statue of Peter the Great

\church meets Musuem. Excellent art, guided tours if you wanted one. Choral singing with one of the services, enchanting. Went up to the viewing gallery, great views of city, so do it if you visit. Perhaps a little café could be provided to give the tired visitor some refreshment.

Stunning inside. We thought, oh here's another church. Let's go side. Didn't really expect to be dazzled but this place was impressive. Colors that were so rich and icons so glorious it ranks as my favorite in St Petersburg.

Traditional Russian grandeur. Magnificent colors, priceless rare building materials, lots of gold, beautiful icons, incredible mosaic work. Huge size and awesome atmosphere in the interior. Tiny counter shop selling souvenir icons, photos, etc. Be prepared for very large but respectful crowds, and tour groups with guides giving commentary (softly) in multiple languages. It is not totally silent inside for those wishing a religious contemplative experience. Photography was permitted, but difficult due to the crowds. Well worth the time to visit and see the architecture both inside and out.

Beautiful church, stunning views from Colonnade level. St. Isaac's is a gorgeous cathedral, with beautiful iconography and ornate detailing inside. It is well worth anyone seeing for the art. For the spiritually-minded, it is an inspiring place with a moving history. For the physically able, I highly recommend climbing the 200+ steps to the Colonnade level. The panoramic views are incredible, and it is fascinating to see the angels, who seem moderately-sized at street level, in their fullness... It gives perspective to how high the dome rises. I will likely climb up every time I go to St. Petersburg, to see and document on film this gorgeous city.

St. Issac Cathedral. Another magnificent church. Can't begin to describe the beauty contained within. Glad to have seen the model of the church's development through the years. Also appreciated the display showing how the huge pillars were erected. The colors were bright and outstanding. A must see.
Impressive. The San Isaac cathedral is impressive both for its size and the beauty of the painting and art works inside. A must see for everyone who visit St-Petersburg.

St Isaac Cathedral. The paintings on the ceiling were amazing in this Cathedral. I was amazed to see a young group of kindergarten children in this Cathedral and then questioned about the different tombs when they were outside.

Gorgeous. This is another beautiful and breathtaking cathedral in a city you would not realize had such a rich history of Orthodox Christianity. The columns and natural stone structures are amazing, as well as the gilded accents. It is a definite while in St. Petersburg. Also, the view from the colonnade a marvelous.
Beautiful. Cathedral was just around the corner from our hotel - inside was as spectacular as guide books suggest - was misting so we did not climb the 300 steps outside. Dont miss this!
Climb the collonade. If you are fit enough you must climb the nearly 200 steps up to the top of the colonnade to get the panoramic views if St Petersburg, awesome

Fantastic Views. For fabulous views of the city, head to St Isaacs Cathedral. The views are like no other that you will see in St Petersburg. The church is equally amazing. Worth a visit - especially when its not raining.

Great for sight-seeing. This cathedral is located in a very central spot. In the entrance you have 2 choices: You can buy the tickets to go inside to the museum part, or you can buy tickets to climb to the columns for sightseeing. I took the second option. From the outside it doesn't look that impressive, but I climbed the columns for a panoramic view of the city, which was breathtakingly impressive. Especially photographers would love this place I guess.But it can be quite tiring to climb all those stairs, and certainly not for the disabled or the very old who may have issues with climbing so much.

Another must see.. Don't let the boring exterior dissuade you. The interior of this former cathedral turned soviet atheist museum is breathtaking. Great central location for walking tours. In fact it is a touring landmark to keep you oriented. Really, words here can't do this justice.

You really need to see the inside!. We had a photo stop on an included sightseeing tour. I had a private guide the next day. The inside is absolutely beautiful. Make sure you take a little time to see the inside....

Right in the heart of the city. We had 2 perfect days in St. Petersburg, this Church was part of our tour and the time we spent understanding the history was just sitting outside this church and soaking in all the aspects of the story of St. Petersburg...

The Greatest place at St.Petersburb. I was impressed by this place and it's luxury interior which is decorated with gold, columns with lazurite stone, mosaics and statues. The Cathedral is huge. It was building for 40 years. There is an interesting fact, that American White House cupola was made using French architect Auguste de Montferrand's plan, who was the architect of Saint Isaac's Cathedral in St.Petersburg.

Gorgeous painting on an amazingly high dome!. From the outside the buidling architecture was as impressive as other builidngs we had passed by. It's until we got inside the church that all the painitings, the engravement and other decorations just made me jarred! Everyone with a camera in his/her hand was basically look up the dome and snap (shots of photos)-the visit was totally worth it!!
Amazing church. The inner of the church is amazing but the view from the top is breathtaking! You pay more (3,5 euros) to get up but is worthwhile.

Grand and imposing. A centrally planned church with a large dome, and a columned portico on each of its four facades. The gilding on the dome is original, and the columns are of deep red marble. It can look a bit gloomy on one of St Petersburg's dull days, but the interior is well worth a visit. The vault soars above you, and every surface is covered in mosaics. There is some fine statuary, covered in the customary Russian gilding.

St. Isaac's Cathedral. Another one of Russia's treasurers. The inside as well as the outside are real works of art. So much beauty to behold. We did not climb the bell tower but the cathedral is well worth going into.
Breathtaking. This is a beautiful cathedral, well worth the visit. Impressive mosaics, stained glass, wood work. The ceilings are stunning.

Breathtaking in more ways than one!. Absolutely beautiful inside, a wonder of religious iconography. If you decide to head up to the rotunda it will take your breath away literally! Its a couple hundred steps to the top! Great view once you get there. They are in the process of restoring the bell tower so no bells but the upside is you get a close look at the bells has they are on display.
Impressive. This huge Cathedral is one of the largest in the World and it's gold dome dominates the city centre. The interior is equally impressive and there is marble everywhere.
Another amazing cathedral. St Isaacs is spectacular. I am amazed that the Bolsheviks left so many of these cathedrals for artistic, but not, according to our guide, for historical reasons.

Such beautiful structure. This is another magnificent church...however, there was an amazing well fed stray cat sitting on a bench enjoying the view ( and the pigeons ) ...well worth a trip and it is free .

A nice view on St. Petersburg. We went there quite late so we just were able to access the columnade. The price is quite high (about 9€ each) just to climb (no lift) the stairs, a quick view in the panorama descend the stairs and not visit the inside (for that, we should have spent other 9€).
At least there was a nice panorama

beautiful cathedral and great views from its collonade. It's worth getting the combined ticket to the cathedral and colonnade. This is apparently the 4th largest cathedral in the world and is absolutely stunning

Huge catedral. It´s one of the largest churchs in the world and you can recognize it :-) It´s quite unbelievable how they were able to build if, if you realize that there was a marsh. You don´t have to be an architect to admire this buiding - the immense columns from red granite will amaze you. Inside you´ll find that the architect was inventive in usage differnt kinds of stone, f.e. malachite and lapis lazuli, which I´ve never seen before round the altar.

Wow - Stunning St Isaac's Cathedral. This is the most spectacular sight on the skyline of St Petersburg and whets your appetite for the great tour of the inside of the Cathedral. The Dome has over 200lbs of gold applied to it and the story of how they applied this was very informative especially as you learn of the huge number of deaths by the builders through Mercury poisoning which was a big part of the process. The mosaics inside are amazing and the ambiance of the Cathedral is absolutely fabulous. The building is now really a museum.We missed the visit to the top of the building due to time constraints of our tour but would have loved to have taken it in. Difficuly to judge which was best this or "Church of the Spilled Blood"Another must see sight of St Petersburg.

Spectacular !. St. Isaac's was sooooo spectacular with the art everywhere !! The inside was HUGE !! Learning about the building of the cathedral was interesting and you're just amazed by the talent of the builders, painters, stone masons.
The view. Very impressive. Do climb the stairs for the view from the dome, well worth it! A great panorama. ikgbkhbkjbkjbkjbkjbkjb
Make sure to walk to the top. Make sure to walk to the top of Catherdal.There's a great view of St. Petersburg and audio guide which will tell you what is what.

Gorgeous. The outside is a wonder, with its over 200lbs of gold on the domes, but inside is even more so. A riot of opulent colours in the kind of pleasing harmony that only Russia seems to be able to bring to a combination of gold, pastels and minerals. Look up until your neck hurts to appreciate the cunning perspective of the scenes in the central dome.You have to pay to take pictures, so I didn't. You'll get better pictures anyway by buying a book. Busy at the height of the season with tourist groups like ours, but not uncomfortably so. I believe the bells outside will be hoisted into place in December 2013. Why is this attraction only searchable on this site under 'Cathedral de San Isaac' and not 'St. Isaac's Cathedral'?

A beautiful cathedral. This is a beautifully impressive cathedral. The view from the top was impressive and there were less stairs than I expected. The inside was just stunning with a lot of mosaics and chandeliers. I also felt moved to be surrounded by such an overwhelming amount of beautiful and detailed items.I think comparisons with St Paul's cathedral in Rome is justified.
Grat view from the top. You have to buy 2 tichets for this : one to see the interior of the cathedral and one to climb ( sorry no lifts) to the roof to have a beautiful view of the city.
Spectacular. This is a must see cathedral. Inside and out the place is beautiful. The doors are a sight to see and you have to take the steps to the top for an incrdible view of the city.

A BEAUTIFUL, ELEGANT CATHEDRAL BUILT IN 19TH CENTURY. The church on St Isaac's Square was ordered by Tsar Alexander I. It was finished after 40 years of work around 1858. This is one of the largest cathedrals in the world. It is very gilded and elegant. The dome is reputed to be the 3rd or 4th largest in the world. The cathedral was built on the site where three other churches had been built but had problems with the supporting beams. They were literally sinking into the water. I have a few photos to share. St. Petersburg is a city of contrast. World class sites such as this one, The Peterhof, and The Hermitage on the one hand and tremendous mediocrity and lower class facilities for the residents on the other hand.

Humbling Experince. Visit to this amazing Cathedral does not need affiliation to any religion. Cathedral is an standing example of architectural grandeur. The calming experience takes you near to the almighty.Do enjoy the experience and feel recharged.
Massive church. The grand scale of this church is comparable with St Peter's Church at Vantigan. Very impressive architecture and the paintings inside the church.

Better than the 'Church of the Spilled Blood'?. Well, it's hard to know which is 'best' as the 2 churches are so different, though both large (though this one is more monumental') and beautifully decorated. This one is, I believe, now a museum rather than a functioning church but I don't think it has lost anything.The outside, though huge, isn't particularly inviting but the inside is splendid - it might not match St Peter's in Rome or Monreale in Sicily, but it comes out pretty high on the list. Another not to be missed sight in this city of great sights.

Never judge a .......... We had heard that the view from the top of this church was worth the climb, but when the cashier asked if we wanted admission to the "Cathedral Museum" as well as the roof we said sure...why not? The "Museum" turned out to be the interior of the building and easily ten times more impressive than the view from the roof. Over the years I have had the opportunity to visit many many churches and not many could match this one in outright audacious splendour. Certainly this is a perfect example of a "Never judge a book by it's cover" situation, as the drab exterior of the Cathedral (which is large) would give no indication of the over the top decorations inside. One of the best things to see in St. Petersburg.
Our tour guide's favourite - and you could see why. We loved this Cathedral. It wasn't busy and you could take as much time as you liked. The intricate detailing was too much to take in.

Another great cathedral. What beautiful green columns! The detail in this cathedral is exquisite. However, be careful on the outside, there are pickpockets. One of my tour group members found out the hard way.

Do not miss seeing the mosaics!. This cathedral is stunningly beautiful, with unbelievable mosaics. Although it was crowded when we visited one could still appreciate the architecture and pieces of art.
Beautiful. Stunning church with incredible architecture and interior. One of St Petersburgs finest churches this is another not to be missed experience

St. Isaac's Dominates The St. Petersburg Skyline. One of the most spectacular attractions in St. Petersburg, St. Isaac's is stunning and unforgettable. Because St. Petersburg was basically built on a swamp, it is a city that does not have the sort of skyscrapers that many other major cities have. So that makes St. Isaac's all the more amazing, the way it dominates the St. Petersburg skyline.I would recommend seeing St. Isaac's at the beginning of your stay in St. Petersburg. Then, for the rest of your trip, you can look for St. Isaac's from wherever you are, and you will see it. You will begin to think of St. Isaac's as a "friend," and by the end of your trip, you will share some of the sentiment that St. Petersburg residents have for the great and noble structure. The gold dome is enormous, and only a couple of world cathedrals have a larger dome. The artwork is world class. The view from the top level (the cupola) is breathtaking. And after spending some time there, you will feel a sense of respect and reverence, and understand the special feeling that locals have for St. Isaac's. It is no surprise, when you meet some of the middle aged locals, to learn that when the communist era ended, many of these Russian Orthodox believers renewed their marriage vows at St. Isaac's.Like St. Peter's in Rome and St. Paul's in London, St. Isaac's has world significance far beyond its tremendous religious importance.

Our days in St. Petersburg. This cathedral looked like it was glowing from top to bottom. The mosaics inside had the most beautiful colors. The magnificent artwork and structure info. was really amazing to hear.
Gorgeous inside and out. The gold dome of St. Isaac's can be seen from all over St. Petersburg, and the church is just as wonderful inside.

An Awe Inspiring Cathedral. Peter the Great chose St Isaac to be the name of the cathedral he had built. St Isaac's celebration is conducted on Peter's birthday. Everything is awesome. A tour guide is invaluable to explain the historical anecdotes that make it even more impressive.

Amazing church with wheelchair access in Sint Peterburg.. Overwhelming due to size and design. Incredible structure. Great wheelchair access by ramp. Just ring the door bell at the beginning of the ramp. The guard will open the gate. Entrance fee 350 Rubble.
Outside view is good enough.. Not worth to go inside, outside pictures are good enough for the album. Don't buy anything from inside the cathedral, too expensive.

Unlike other Cathedrals.. The outside of the Cathedral was very imposing but the inside was even more fascinating. Compared to a lot of drab European cathedrals and churches the Russian version is very colourful. The colour came from all the icons on the walls. Initially I thought that they were paintings however I later found out that they are mosaics because the weather is so damp in St Petersburg that paintings would deteriorate very quickly. Magnificent and well worth seeing.
Churches are amazing in St. Petersburg. and this Cathedral make no exception. See the magnificent floors and ceilings , mosaics and sculptures.
Stunning inside and out.. Go up the Cupola. You pay extra but it is one of the few places you get to see the layout of the whole city. The inside is stunning.

BIG!. A giant Cathedral. One of the main tourist places to visit and well worth it. The marble and mosaics and just the pure size make it worthwhile. Try to climb to the top of the colonnade if you have free time. It give you great views of the city

Stunning!. This beautiful cathedral is simply stunning in it's architecture and opulence. I got a sore jaw in St Petersburg from all the jaw droppingly gorgeous places and this is one of the highlights, do not miss it.
Beautiful Cathedral. One of the best Cathedral's I have ever seen inside was so i would reccomend to anyone to visit if at all possible

Beautiful city views from the tower. lots of steps, but superb all round views from the tower - well worth the climb. The architecture is stunning, inside is so beautifully painted, the cupula with the dove in the centre was lovely - dreamy atmosphere. The chandeliers were amazing too!
Magnificent view. Go to the Colonnade and enjoy beautiful view on the city. And if you know a little Russian, there is a voice on speakers constantly explaining what is what.
Okay sight!. We saw this sight from a distance, took a few pics, but didn't go inside. This cathedral is seen from across the water, so we were abel to take nice pics from afar.
Fabulous!. Worth visiting such a amazing architectural and historical site. It's stunning and not to be missed.
nice. all Russian churches are beautiful with their icons, marbles, gold and lots of history. You must see the details in the walls - it's really nice

A beauty to behold. It is very impressive. You can't help wonder how it has survived all the wars. The inside takes your breath away. There are. so many photo ops that you fon't know when enough is enough.
Great view of the city. Awesome going up the steps, great view of the city. There is a fee, but it is well worth it. The stairs are comfortable and it is easy to go up
Awesome. This bright domed castle is just exquisite. A must for the colors and photo shoot. It can be seen from all around SPB.
An unbelievable architecture. the inside will blow your mind away... an amazing piece of architecture and the attention to details is beyond description. an absolute must..
A must see. You have to go inside to see the amazing mosaics and frescos. The outside is beautiful but the inside is what makes St Isaacs Cathedral a must see.

The interior is gorgeous and the columns are stunning. The church isn't as pretty on the exterior as others but it's still worth the visit. The interior is one of the most beautiful places. Even after many years, it is always one of my first stops when I come to the city. The church also has an amazing selection of beautiful Russian goods for sale. The amber jewelry for sale here is some of the prettiest in the city. They also have a great selection of water colors from local artists.

St isaac's. A great tribute. Hoards of people visit every day, however we found a reasonably quiet time early in the morning. We did not do a tour, based on the number of tour buses we were one if just a few.

Very imposing!. This is a must see in your visit to St Petersburg, the cathedral has an illustrious history!The cathedral dome was painted over grey during the second world war to avoid being seen by enemy aircraft. The dome itself is coated in pure gold plating. The dome was spray painted using toxic mercury substances, that resulted in the unfortunate demise of approximately sixty workers.It is by all means an impressive sight to behold.

A good evening excursion. The tower is open at night. We went up at sundown and stayed until dark, seeing St Petersburg in all lights. It made a beautiful end to our last evening and worth the cost of the entrance to climb.

Runner up. St Isaac's is beautiful and well worth your precious time in SPB, but for me it comes in second to the Church of our Savior on Spilled Blood. St. Isaac's is right in the heart of the city and seems to be at the center of everything. It is big and impressive, but lacks the color and pizazz of Spilled Blood.It will almost certainly be included on any tour itinerary, so check it out for yourself.
Majestic. The cathedral is very impressive. I was with the tour of Royal Caribbean Ship and we've had too little time to explore it. I want to come back.

imposing cathedral. sculpture wooden doors, beautiful murals on the inside.
near city center ,may plan 30 min to view the same, longer if wanted to climb up to get view.

Stupendous views!. On a day with a few clouds in the sky and a camera with a good lens, you can get some fantastic 360 shots of St Petersburg from the 'colonnade' R150 per person. It is 200 steps up but worth it. Allow 30+ minutes at the top. To enter St Isaac's costs R250 per person - go at lunchtime and the crowds are less! The interior is amazing.
Impressive. Exterior is impressive, but it is essential to go inside. The mosaics are exquisite and the history exhibits moving.

My Chin Drops. You will not be impressed much by its exterior. However, wait you get inside, you will be totally surprised by its beauty. I am running out of words to describe it, my chin just drops. The interior of the Spilled Blood Cathedral is impressive but this one is even more, a must visit in St Petersburg.

Really Good. St. Isaacs Cathedral was the first 'building' we saw on our first tour of St. Petersburg and it is very memorable. It is situated just off a large roundabout. We could only photograph the outside.

Impressive. Impressive cathedral. Beautifully decorated and with some great mosaics and other art pieces. The historic exhibition (about construction and preservation during war times) is equally impressive. Nice detail: as in all Orthodox churches, there is no seating. Therefore, the cathedral feels much bigger than most catholic ones.Don't forget to buy the extra tickets and go up the dome. The views on St Petes are spectacular!

Breath taking. Everyone in my tour guide said wow when they entered. It is my favourite Cathedral in St Petersburg. From the outside you wouldn't expect anything special but once you enter you can't help but be surprised by its beauty.

Amazing Dome. This is such a huge cathedral and so beautiful inside. Well worth a visit and different to the other architecture. Cooler than most other places to go in the summer when you need a break. Also places to sit inside and view the art.
Stunning!. Probably the most beautiful cathedral I've seen!! Absolutely stunning!! Don't miss out on the view from the colonnade, would only recommend it when the weather is clear though.
Stop and Look. Don't be tempted to pass it by. Take you time to walk through! WE viewed it first from the outside and then walked in. I loved the art!
incredible mosaics and more. An engineering feat - and a beautiful space. the mosaics are amazing - hard to fathom - especially in the cupola!

Fabulous architecture and free photography allowed. Beautiful old church built with solid marble columns and still retains original door mechanisms. Absolutely stunning and luxurious inside.Unlike many of the luxurious museums in Russia you do not need to pay extra to take photos inside the Cathedral.It's an impressive building, inside and out. If you can afford to do the additional trip up to the colonnade - it's a great view of the whole city. It's the highest point you can climb and by old law no building was allowed to be higher than it.

WOW. We were lucky enough to be here for St Petersburg Day, and were treated to the open air concert which I shall never forget... truely moving. Next day we went inside and experienced a service and climbed up to take in the view over St Petersburg.... well worth the effort.

Must stop by. Depending on how fit you are, the entrance has 2 options, one to go only to the museum, the other one to go up to the the roof from outside stairs, great details and overview of the city. But the inside of the cathedral is not to be missed as it was so beautiful. Last entrance is 5pm, so make sure to know what time as 5pm is really sunny during summer time.

Russian Orthodox cathedral at its best . Absolutely outstanding cathedral in terms of architecture, competing the best roman catholic examples . Stone cut giant columns from expensive types of marble and massive hand crafted doors depicting the history of the russian state. It is more a museum than an operating church. A must see.
Picture heaven. You don't want to miss this church next to the canal. Good pix from almost anywhere. Inside is very impressive

Churches. All the churches and cathedrals were mind blowing. The amount of gold both inside and outside the buildings is fantastic.It is sad that all over the world,churches are loosing the 'church' atmosphere and feel more like museums.

Truly breathtaking. We were told to walk in and not look up until we reached the center of the cathedral. We followed the advice and, wow!All you could want when visiting this type of place. Amazing art and architecture! The climb to the top is an extra fee, but worth it for the unparalleled views of the city. Even though this is a museum, there is still an area were active worshiping still goes on.

Go to the top of the Colonade. It was raining the day we went to the cathedral. We decided to go to the top of the colonade. It's 250 steps to the top. I was sweating by the time I got to the top. The fact that it was raining it was cooler that day. Still had a good view even though it was raining. This is a must when in St P.

Amazing. As others have said one of the best you will see in Europe, if not the world. Beautiful. Well worth the 250roub admission. It wasnt too busy while we were there, plenty of places to sit down and soak it up. Good story of its history also. We did not go up to the collonade but you can walk up to the upper dome outside for some grest views if you want to. Its wonderful wiht the natural sunlight coming in, really spectacular.

Best in Central Europe. This was the best church I have seen in Russia, Poland or Germany. The outside was impressive but not as much as Church of the Spilled Blood(St P) or St Basils(Red Square). The inside however impressed me most because of the vibe and the more respectful atmosphere than the others. Make sure to get a commentary tape of your own language for a real impressive experience. Very busy but worth the visit.

Impressive. Impressive inside. It is a large space so you can move away from the crowds and enjoy the frescos. You can climb the dome for views over St Petersburg. Located opposite the Hotel Astoria, which is a great place to stay.
A church to rial St. Peter's. This church, now a museum, is super spacious with its high walls filled with magnificent religious art. It's beauty is too magnificent to describe in words.
St. Isaac's. This was my husbands favorite Cathedral in Russia. Also full of Mosaics. Beautiful natural light shining through some dome like structures in the ceiling that were quite stunning.
Worth a Visit. Well worth a visit. Expect long lines to get in, but you won't be disappointed once you get inside. There will still be crowds inside, but enjoy the walls and ceiling.

Unique contrast to SPB's other churches. I really enjoyed St Isaac's Cathedral, and found it to be a nice foil to Church on Spilled Blood and Peter and Paul Fortress. Walking in, the sheer size is overwhelming, but then your eyes focus and you start to see the incredible detail work of the art and architecture. Truly amazing.
A little gloomy. Very interesting history. Slightly gloomy but well worth a visit- we only managed to get inside on our second visit to ST P as it was closed on our earlier trip.
A wonderul cathedral, one of the best.. I have seen a lot of cathedrals in Europe, this is one of the best. It is massive! The dome is fabulous. A well worth experience

Different. We liked this cathedral in part because it is beautiful but also because it is quite different from most we saw in Russia. We thought it was rather unique. We did the climb to the top and didn't find it too onerous. However, the views from the top are nothing special and probably not worth the effort and cost.

st isaac's. right on the square with my favourite hotel on one side and opposite the kgb, or should i say the fsb headquaters! well worth a visit. There is a web cam on the fsb building where you can wave at friends and family from the square,,,,
fantastic!. This is top of the must - see list if you only have a short time in St Petersburg. Beautiful interior.

Brilliant gold dome cathedral that dominates St Petersburg skyline. Open lit late so take the opportunity to go after 5 when the crowds and groups have gone walk up the steps to the balcony and do a 360 degree walk and view St Petrsburg from a birds eye view.

Grand Cathedral, well worth a visit. Another one of the must-see attractions of St-Petersburg. The architecture is gorgeous, the decoration lavish. It is a sight to behold, and well worth an hour or so.

Beautiful inside, and lots to see nearby. Strictly speaking this is a museum. It has a couple of real advantages therefore: you can enjoy its beauty without fear of trespassing on someone's devotions and it stays open very late in a city where there are so many other things to see and do. When we were there it was open until 10.If you have time and energy you can climb to the top of the cupola for views over the city, but the day we went it was raining so we chose that as an excuse not to climb the 260 stairs. This stays open to 4am.The surrounding area is also interesting and worth a wander.We enjoyed the cafe called Happiness (in English) on a corner opposite.

A museum, rather than a cathedral, but a beautiful one.. Although built as a cathedral, St Isaac's was never re-consecrated after the Soviet era, so it's not a functioning church and is now, in fact, a museum. This means it is open for visitors in large numbers and at times when a church wouldn't be open to the public (i.e. during services and weddings). It also means there is no hushed, reverential silence or any need to dress conservatively, as is expected in a church.The artwork and decor is impressive, and the internal architecture is overwhelming in size and scale. The lack of church furniture (seating, etc) creates an even greater sense of space.Expect long queues at times though, as it's very much on the coach-party trail. It stays open quite late at evenings, which is the best time to go. Excellent views from the top of the dome, if you can manage the 262 steps up to the top!!

Absolutely Must-see. One of the famous St.Petersburg places, the St. Isaac cathedral is a real pearl. The interior of the cathedral, despite the fact it is an orthodox church, is decorated in the best European traditions. Most of the time the cathedral is not used for liturgy, but as a museum.

why 3-star? Why bother?. May be we were too tired when we hit this place - we looked for a particular restaurent for lunch and never found it - or that we had seen too many of these cathedrals so far in this trip. Either way, this one did not grab us. it does have a good view of the city from the top but frankly we opted out and did not climb up to see the view. an icon and recommended by every tour book that you see it so you may, but may be do so when you are fresh.

The place where you see many sights at the same time. The building is fantastic. If you get up to the collonade you will have a panoramic view of the city. The surrounding is terrific too. Take pictures of Bronze Horsman.
The best view-point on the old town. This is the must-see place in our city. There are the best view-point from dome of Cathedral - you can go around and watch all old town and outline your stroll.

Worth your time.. This church is centrally located in downtown St. Petersburg. It also has a rich history surrounding it. While walking through the church an American approached us and asked about a tour. We said yes and found the experience worth the $10 we paid him. We were inside the church for about an hour.I wouldn't go out of my way to see this but it is so close to the Hermitage, it's worth the walk.
Magnificent. This is the 4th largest Cathedral in the world. I never went in, but it's worth visiting just to see the outside.
Truly beautiful church. The huge dome is beautiful, but the interior is just incredible. It is a must see church in a city with so many must sees.
Beautiful exterior and interior. I haven't been to Russia to see the onion dome Kremlin, but St. Isaac's is a good substitute. It's beautiful inside and out.
Awesome. Walked into this cathedral and just said "wow". There's few cathedrals around the world that compare to St. Issacs. St Pauls in London, St Peters at the Vatican are in the same category.

Stunning!. A must-see place in St. Petersburg. The Cathedral is beautiful, even with the busloads of tourists that descend on it. We climbed to the top for a view of the city but there was not too much to see. It is a popular thing to do though. Buy a combo ticket for the full experience.
So many things to see in St Petersburg!. Another sight you do not want to miss. Huge cathedral ceilings and fabulous artwork make this something you definitely do not want to miss out on.

Russia's answer to St Peters. This is one of three must visit churches in St Petersburg, the other two being Spilled Blood and Kazan. The Kazan Cathedral is the only working church and has a colonnade built to resemble St Peters. St Isaacs doesn't have the colonnade but it has the scale and decoration inside to compete with the senior church of the Catholic faith. Because it is not a working church it has more the air of a museum than a place of worship, but the absence of pews makes it easy to look around and appreciate the splendour of the building.

Beautiful place. This is another place that you have to be sure to visit on a trip to St. Petersburg. The beauty of St. P's churches is something very special. It ranks up there with the other great churches of the world.

Go up to the Colonades and take in the views. Apart from the fact it is Russia's biggest church and is wonderful inside, pay for a combined museum/colonade ticket and walk up the 180 steps to the viewing platform (assuming weather good) as the views are excellent.

The better of the two main churches. This one is actually more interesting and impressive then the Church of Spilled Blood. But the true gem here is the dome - specifically, outside of the dome - which you can climb (for a fee, of course - they won't even spit on your face for free in this city - one spit 10 rubles) for uninterrupted and magnificent views of St. Petersburgh.

Very Impressive building and square. Classic Russian Cathedral from the outside and so beautiful on the inside. It is the largest Russian Cathedral in SPb and looks at lot larger from the inside than when outside. It is magnificent inside. Every inch of the interior has something to appreciate.

A technical piece of art. The biggest Cathedral of St Petersburg, made long after the death of Peter the Great, and it is the fourth one to have been built there. It combines beauty from an architectural point of you and beauty from an Artistic point of you. Saved from communist destruction thanks to a scientist that convinced the communist to put a pendulum inside and has been reestablished since 6 years ago as the Cathedral. Everything is great about this Cathedral, what you can see inside as well as the legends associated with it. Read first a little about it you will enjoy the visit even more
Beautiful Russian Church. An architectural delight. Well worth some hours of your time to explore both the details outside and inside.
You need time for this spectacular church. The inside murals are definitely worth the visit. Crowded yes but you can still see everything and enjoy this art.

Second only to the Vatican. This church is stunning, and is very, very large. Definitely worth a visit, and worth the admission price. A good chunk of the outside of the church is under construction, but it didn't affect the inside of the building. The entrance to the church is 250r and if you want to climb the colonnade it is 150r.
