Wow. The Cathedral is very big and pretty. It has an access to the roof where you can see a whole Petersburg. Very nice view. Very majestic and breath taking .

Huge!. You can see the huge dome of this cathedral almost anywhere in St. Petersburg. It's extremely crowded but it is also quite beautiful. Seems like a lot of tour groups come here as there were no less than 30 tour buses outside.

Amazing place. Central location near Neva River, Hermitage and Nevsky Prospekt. First we climbed over 200 steps to the "rooftop terrace", where you can see almost all of the huge St.Petersburg. Then we went in to the church and the place was amazing! We were stunned to see the doors, roof and every little hand made piece of art. This is absolute must if you are going to St.Petersburg!!

Simply beautiful. We did both the colonnade and the interior and thought both were worthwhile. The steps to the colonnade, while quite a lot, are mainly shallow and wide so it's a fairly easy climb for this out of shape girl! The view was spectacular and the interior lovely.
Stunning. The burst of colour...wow. This is a must see attracation in St Petersburg. The church looks quite ordinary on the outside but simply extraordinary on the interior.

Gorgeous interior and fantastic view of the city from the colonnade walk. We bought both the colonnade walk and museum tickets. Note that this is a museum, so a dress code does not apply. The museum interior is spectacular, with amazing paintings and gilded decorations. It's worth a lingering stroll around to take in all of the sites. Lots of souvenirs are also for sale.The entrance to the colonnade walk requires you to return to the ticket area and ascend via a staircase to the right hand side. The walk up was fairly straightforward, with mostly even steps which were easy to climb. The steps counted down as you climbed, so you knew how many more steps were required to get to the top (which our 5 year old child enjoyed). The views from the top were amazing, with a 360-degree platform to take everything in. We visited in the late afternoon, which was nice. We were intrigued to see that the Colonnade Walk was open until 4am, presumably to see the nightscape of the city during the summer months!

Church Alternative. A really nice alternative to the Church of Our Savior - but of course better to see both. Just walking in here was magnificent, awe inspiring. Plus lots of details to see if interested.

Amazing. I got some lovely photos of this Cathedral. Its the Largest Russian Orthodox Cathedral in St. Petersburg. Its main dome rises 101.5 m high. Its dedicated to St. Isaac the Patron Saint of Peter the Great. It took 40 years to build. The dome is plated with Pure gold which makes it amazing to look at. Have the camera ready

Be sure to include a visit to the colonnade as well.. Wear sensible shoes as the stairs to the colonnade demand a degree of effort and I would avoid that extra donut at breakfast it will only make the task more difficult. The views from the top are breathtaking. I don't like heights much but this was easy peasy. This will be your best photo opportunity in the city. The Cathedral itself is magnificent and I particularly liked the various depictions of the last supper and the splendour of the construction and preservation of the gold work. Make every effort not to miss this top attraction.

Beautiful. We visited the colonnade first, a walk around the dome. It isn't for the faint-hearted, with 262 steps to the top. It is a spiral staircase, though the steps are wide and low with handrails on both sides. Furthermore, there is a different staircase for the exit, so no need to stop to let people past.The views from the top are stunning, a full 360 degree perspective.The cathedral itself is beautiful. The murals and dome are outstanding, and some of the outside columns still show bullet and mortar damage from WWII.The cathedral is very central, close to the river, the Hermitage and Nevrsky Prospekt, the main shopping and eating areas.
Beautiful Mosaics. Beautiful Church. Amazing mosaics. Didn't have time to climb the stairs, but still enjoyed the interior. Not as busy as some other venues in St Petersburg.

Fascinating cathedral. The history of this cathedral is as interesting as the church is lavish. This is it's fourth iteration. Try to get a guide who can explain how it was constructed. The visit is well worth it.
beautiful. just special....beautiful--art,floors....didn't even know where to look first.we had a guide which makes things much easier.

Gorgeous. We visited this after the Catherine Palace and before The Church on Spilled Blood. It is a phenomenal church/museum. You will see the spot where the shells hit the columns outside of the church. No trip to St. Petersburg should miss this church...just don't go to see it after The Church on Spilled Blood, which will then make this church seem "ho-hum."

Master Work of Art. My eyes could not believe all the gold everywhere. Only complaint that there were so many people viewing that it made it difficult to get about and really absorb the beauty of the Cathedral.

Massive Cathedral dominates skyline. A massive structure filed art and large dome covered in gold. It was a state sponsored museum in the soviet period. Now although impressive in size rather dark inside and once again functioning as a Cathedral of the Russian Orthodox faith
go. The exterior does not convey the beauty of the interior. Plus the roof view was worth the effort. A must.

Incredible mosaics. There are no long lines to wait. Even though there are a lot of groups it does not seem very crowded. It is better to climb to the tower to have a look to city view. The stairs are large and you can breath if you need. Nobody pushs you to climb fast. Incredible mosaic paintings in the church. It is better to see first the church of our savior on spilled blood and after st. Isaac's
Wow. The style is a bit different with other Cathedral, but when I get inside, I will said wow!!It is Huge, Beautiful.

A huge Church with a very high colonnade. This Church is huge! When inside you feel like a midget. Very few seats to relax and take in the magnitude of this edifice. If you are feeling energetic there is the 260+ steps climb up to the colonnade around the huge gold dome. The view from the colonnade is equally impressive with a complete panorama of St.Petersburg from the highest building in the city.
Very beautiful. Walking distance form the hermitage. Very nice in the inside and the outside. You have to pay to go in but this is a must in this city.

St Isaacs Cathedral. I did not climb the tower to view the city but those who did said it was really great. I thought the cathedral was a bit on the dark side but the malachite columns were worth the visit, there were other spectacular architectural points as well.

Historic. Beautiful church steeped in history and worth visiting. Third largest cathedral in the world with a (300 steps) tower you can climb for a fantastic view of SPb. Take the audio for all details and go and enjoy the beautiful architecture.

Start your tour of St. Petersburg here. This was a beautiful cathedral. Definitely worth seeing for the architecture (which they explain quite well inside, with various to scale models) and the incredibly detailed mosaics. There was a bit of confusion with the lining up for the tickets, but that seems to be pretty typical of Russian tourist attractions. I highly recommend a) getting the audio guide and b) touring the colonnade. Great views of the city.Oh, and after the cathedral, definitely stop off next door at the small café by the Astoria hotel. It's called Schastye, has a little terrace perfect for afternoon tea, great décor. And wifi.
Beautiful. We only saw the outside at St Isaac's square. The White House in Washington DC used this design. The statue of Nicholas 1 is also in the square

Here is how to see this beautiful attraction.... Go at EXACTLY 6pm on any day but Wednesday and buy tickets. Wait, go have dinner and come back around midnight. Scan your ticket and climb the stairs to the top and have the most incredible view of St Petersburg!

The Center Piece of St. Petersburg. We stayed about one block from Saint Issacs and therefore passed it morning and night. We went in to see the magnificant interior on our last day. The ineterior is quite immence. The art, the paintings and mosiacs are impressive. Looking up into the copula and the interior of the dome was breath taking.

Amazing columns. Amazing mosaics...and the malechite & lapis lazuli columns were something else. Once again go late evening. Its open till 10pm. The climb to the top is really not worth it as all you see are shabby roof tops.
Beautiful. Beautiful church to visit. Unfortunatelly the colonnade closes too early in the summer (05:00 PM) and we could not visit it.

Started our sight seeing here at St. Isaac's Cathedral. We tarted our sight seeing here at St. Isaac's Cathedral and were delighted with the building and art. The architecture was breath-taking with all the structural and beautification feats. The ceiling paintings, the wall paintings, the sculptures, and the mosaics are beautiful and truly a treasure. I recommend this wonderful stop on your visit here in St. Petersburg!
Beautiful, over the top interior.. While the exterior is not as impressive as other churches, the interior of this one is amazing. So colorful and opulent, and absolutely gorgeous.

Nice Dome, Rest Mostly Under Renovation. This is one of the more popular sites to visit in St Petersburg probably because it is only a block away from the Hermitage. You can also pay to walk the 200 plus steps up to the colonnade. It is a tiring walk up the steps, but at the top you have a nice view of the many site in downtown since this is one of the higher points around. You have a very good view of St Nicholas Cathedral in the distance (the blue & white cathedral). On our first day it rained a lot at the top so we had to go back today while it is sunny. So much better with sun. Almost not worth paying to go up if it is raining. The cost to go up is 150 rub. Unfortunately they have construction with scaffolding and tarps on almost all side and some of the top sides so photos of the beauty of this place is difficult. Inside is more pleasing to the eye.

So huge and beautiful. A great place of Must see in St. easy to find and worth visiting. Inside is so huge and beautiful. We went to the upper floor to see the view of the city but don't think it's worth buying a ticket. We took many pictures at https://picasaweb.google.com/100092841543065224921/StPetersburgRussia2013

Impressive. This is quite a grand edifice. The ceilings are immensely colourful and the underside of the dome is exquisitely and intricately painted. Doors and chandeliers are gilded ind beautifully carved. One of the doors is apparently a copy of the doors of the Baptistry in Florence
Another absolute must see. Saint Petersburg is fantastic and St Isacc's Cathedral must not be missed. The interior and exterior are just awesome.

Impressive. We stayed next door (Renaissance Baltic Hotel) and had a nighty view of St Isaacs from the hotel;s 6th floor terrace. It was amazing how many people visit and climb to the top. It's 200 (?) steps on a winding staircase. The reward is nice view of St Petersburg.

Take Care. This building was one on a list of attractions during our Baltic Tour. In itself it's a wonderful place and well worth a visit.However, we were warned to watch our wallets in this area. I thought mine was safe in a pocket with a velcro flap - not so!I would recommend anyone visiting St Petersburg's attraction (ones with where there are large crowds) to assume the worst and wear a money belt. That is until the police there take an interest in the thieves who are watching people rather than the attractions!

Best sunset. If you visit St Pete in the summer, when they have the white nights, the dome of this amazing church is open until 4am, so go up there to see one of the best sunsets of your life! Inside the church, do not miss the malachite and lapis lazuli collumns, they are unbelievably beautiful. I cannot imagine how they were carved and brought there.

NOT TO BE MISSED..... I'm sure you've seen tons of churches in your travels - this one is worth visiting though. It's centrally located and can hold lots of people - take the time to visit when you have the chance.
Definitely take a walk to the top of the Cathedral. The view from the top will serve you a proper reward for all your troubles when climbing up the long stairs :)
Another must visit in St Petersburg. An opportunity to extend the experience of religious mosaics and paintings in a fantastic building.Must not be missed of the list of places to visit!
Fantastic. Pretty amazing, really impressive cathedral. Well preserved, good crowed but felt well organised, definitely recommend this place.

Beautiful, beautiful. An amazingly beautiful place. Full of stunning and original images from Christianity. An absolutely must-see! Don't forget to see the small photo exhibition of St. Isaac's in the old days, they are very interesting and informative. If you go to St. Petersburg, you mustn't miss is.

St. Isaac's Cathedral. One of the many cathedrals that dot the entire city of St. Petersburg. The 800 square mtrs. of paintings on the dome by Karl Brullov are breath taking. Photography is free inside the cathedral.

first stop on a panoramic tour. the first stop on many tours so masses of coaches everywhere. the statue outside was good as the horse was up on 2 feet. masses of souvenir stalls with varying prices. church a bit ordinary relatively speaking.
Fabulous. Another one of St Petersburgs "MUST SEE" attractions. One of the things that impressed me about all the buildings was the love and care with which they were maintained

My Favorite Church in St. Petes. This is my favorite church in st. petes mostly because of its vast size. Although large from the outside, nothing prepared me for how massive and beautiful this church was going to be inside. It is rare in Russia to walk into a church that is wide open like St. Isaac's, most have very narrow, high rooms that are difficult to take in. This church is completely opposite, it is gianormous. We paid to climb to the top and look out and it was definitely worth it, not many places in st. petes to get a view of the city and this was pretty cool. If back in the city again this will be a must for me to do again.
the best view of saint petersburg. it is worth climbing on the roof (220 steps!). If you are lucky you can assist to a mass in the left corner of the church

Great views!. Bought my ticket, didn't want to see the museum part, but bought the Colonade ticket. You can buy both tickets and see both. I didn't realise my ticket wouldn't give me entry into the Church, but to the circular 217 steps which take you to the top of the Cathedral. Views were 360 degrees and amazing. I really enjoyed this. Climbing up and going back down are different steps.
Stunning Cathedral!. Stunning Cathdral! So unique from the outside..and stunning inside! Very small, and across the road from great market for souvenier shopping!
Nice.. but not awesome... It's a very nice building that has an impressive tall structure with a Gothic/Renaissance feel. Unfortunately you must paid to get inside.

Worth the climb to the top and a visit inside. We enjoyed the hike to the top with the views over the city. On our first visit we skipped the inside, but went back later and were glad that we did to see the vast and ornate inside with the huge malachite pillars.

Simply Stunning!. Although the outside view is currently marred by scaffolding, don't let that keep you away - inside is a sight too beautiful to miss! Goldleaf, malachite columns, beautiful domed ceilings and amazing religious mosaics. We were blessed to have caught a service in progress - so moving I was in tears. We bought the separate ticket to climb the 242 stair columnade and it did not disappoint - absolutely amazing views of St Petersburg! Beauty at a bargain!

Average. Not much to see inside compared with other churches. Entrance is about $10 and a visit to the cupola requires a separate ticket costing about the same again. We didn't see any information, which we learned from our guide at another site, about how the vaults under the church were used to store art treasures from the Hermitage and other places during the Nazi siege of Leningrad. Not a must-see IMHO.
Another church. To be honest, after seeing the Church of the Spilled Blood I cannot remember anything memorable here.
St. Isaac's Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral and one of the must see sites in St. Petersburg. It was truly an amazing and very spiritual place. We actually got to see a service in session. Very moving.
360 of St. Petersburg. On a great weather day, go to the dome and check out the beautiful city from above. Its the best way to see this gorgeous city from a decent height. You won't be disappointed.

Just a little disappointing inside!. Not being of the orthodox faith I was disappointed that there are no pews and one just wanders around basically staring at the magnificent ceilings - and they are magnificent - however from a distance the outside is spectacular
White night sunset. We stayed up til 12am to see sunset (super long daylight during white night months) at the rooftop of the st issac cathedral. What a delight and great experience.

The Cathedral Is Still A Church!. On the day of our visit to St. Isaac's Cathedral, an Orthodox Rite service was ongoing in a side chapel. With an amazing a cappella choir and multiple priests chanting the liturgy, we had no doubt that in the year 2013 this was not just a museum. The Cathedral itself is beautifully restored. Between the majesty of the building, the reverence of the many people attending the service, and the choir's singing this was a highlight of my trip to St. Petersburg.Hint - if the weather is good, try ascending to the colonnades around the dome.
There must be a God. There must be a God for men to have built this Cathedral. Immense building full of history and art. Make sure you have plenty space on your' phone memory card.

What a wonderful interior!. The view of the great dome from inside is breath taking! Internal features such as columns, pilasters, floor, and statue of Montferrand are composed of multicolored granites and marbles is so beautiful - it’s just a dream for a photographer (see my attached photos). Bring with you a wide angle lenses! RegardsSvein-Magne Tunli from Bergen, Norway.

Impressive. This cathedral is not only impressive, it's also a landmark in the city. There are plenty of city tours buses waiting for tourists at the back of the Cathedral. St Isaac's Cathedral is located at a stone throw from the Admiralty and there is a nice garden in between these 2 buildings. If you have a stroll in this garden, you can also walk towards the senate.
Beautiful..... Another beautiful cathedral, picturesque, and very large gold dome dominates this massive building. We were told that the building is so massive and heavy, that it is sinking.
Amazing Building. Part of a two day tour, we also saw St. Isaac's Cathedral the inside is amazing the gold, the colours so much to take in
St Isaacs. The church is spectacular as a museum. The icons are so beautiful. However, it feels sad that this church is now only a museum, not an active church.

Impressive church. This large church is an easy landmark to spot in St Petersburg. Once inside, the paintings are fantastic. It is very large and capable of holding approximately 8500 people. I enjoyed staring at the art work inside and at the reliefs all around the exterior and on the doors. Well worth your time.

A Cathedral worth going to. Three are many churches to go to in St. Petersburg. You should not miss this. The history of the nobility you see here, helps to bring together what you see in the other major attractions. not as ornate as other churches, but the history makes it

Forty Years to Build? uhh...yeah...and worth it!. This was another church we didn't expect to be as spectacular as it is. Yes, the exterior is massive, imposing and beautiful in a certain way, but the interior is gorgeous! AND, you can go up to the base of the dome and walk its perimeter, which gives you a beautiful view of the city. If you happen to be here during the White Nights of June, wait until the evening to go. The crowds are smaller and they stay open later.

Looks severe from a distance, better up close. Worth every Rouble to see this beautiful Cathedral...and worth even more if you could see it without all those pesky tourists! (like us). The Cathedrals in this city give the Cathedrals in Italy a serious run for their money! The gold alone is amazing.....

Impressive church. Similar to St Peter's Basilica in the Vatican (to me). This is an impressive church and not to be missed when in St. Petersburg. St. Issacs fared better during Soviet rule as it was turned into a museum while apparently the Church of Spilled Blood was used to store potatoes and other items, lol!

An architectural and artistic masterpiece.. A visit to St Petersburg would not be complete without a visit to St Isaac's Cathedral. When entering the cathedral your senses are overwhelmed by the size and beauty of the space. Four massive bronze doors beautifully sculpted with intricate relief scenes of the life of Christ are set in the walls of the four cardinal directions. The ceilings are covered with beautiful decoration and religious "paintings" in mosaic tile. Too much to be able to describe it all. The exterior is also beautiful and crowned by a massive gold gilded dome which cost 60 craftsmen their life when they heated mercury with gold to allow it to be painted on. Do NOT miss St Isaac's.
St Isaacs Catheral. At first glance just another cathedral, but a beautiful - must see place, in the heart of St. Petersburg.
Wonderful. One of the columns was destroyed during the bombings at world war 2. Inside of the cathedral is extraordinary. Must see in St. Petersburg
Wonderful architecture. The inside was so lovely, well worth the few Roubles to go in The view fro the roof showed the city off well, although the climb was tiring.

Stunning. This Cathedral is simply stunning inside with it's ornate iconry, mosaics and paintings. The heavy oak doors covered in bronze are remarkable as is the Cupola and the stain glass. Do not miss this when you are in St Petersburg
Impressive structure. that is fully restored. A must see church. The building itself is beautiful; add the glorious art/icons and the effect is very spiritual even with the crowds!

Oh dear oh dear. I'm sure this church is as fantastic as the other reviewers write. However it is just OK from the outside. I don't know about the inside as the obtuse tour guide took me there from 8:30 to 9:30 and it doesn't open until 11 am! So I er,,,, wandered around outside for an hour and left without seeing the inside. I thought Russia had moved on from those old days and times...
Wow. Another nice cathedral, the biggest one in St. Petersburg and second in Russia. Go inside and also on the rump (300 steps) but really good view.

Stunning Cathedral but you have to climb to the top for the best views!. This was part of our tour in St Petersburg. On the day we visited, it was very very busy but our guide pushed her way through the crowds and we got in fairly quickly. The inside of the Cathedral is very impressive but the best part is the climb to the dome. This does involve 262 spiral steps but the view of the city from the top is worth the leg pain :-) A stunning building in a beautiful city

Deceiving exterior.... Don't be fooled by the exterior of this church. Much more plain than The Church of the Resurrection of the Saviour on the Spilled Blood and Peter & Paul's Fortress, the interior of this church is worth seeing! It's FANTASTIC!

Stunning views inside, outside and from the roof!. Another truly stunning building in St Petersburg - there are many but this is a highlight. I wouild recommend visiting the inside of the cathedral and the viewing gallery for stunning views of the city - there are nearly 300 steps to contend with though!

Impressive, but not the most impressive I've seen. The outside was typical. The interior was beautiful. I have been to many cathedrals, some are jaw dropping and others are just more of the same. This one was in-between. I would recommend it though, interesting commentary from our guide and it is the 4th largest cathedral in the world.

Museum and 360 view of the city!. The cathedral itself, from the outside is impressive in size and has a beautiful golden dome. Inside, you'll find a museum and the ceiling is just beautiful. The kind of beauty you'd find in italian churches. The dome from the inside is mesmerizing. After that, you can go up the 300 steps to the colonnade, just below the dome, which will give you a 360 degree view of the city. At the ticket office, make sure to buy TWO tickets, as the two activites are separated, not on the same ticket. I misread the information sign before buying my ticket and had to redo the line to get my ticket to the colonnade and it was a busy day, buses and buses of visitors coming and going! It's also near the Ermitage, a 10 minute walk in a beautiful area.

Imposing and impressive. The cathedral is imposing in size. The outside is a bit drab except for the large golden dome. It is located near the Hermitage and sits on a corner not far from the curb. The doors at the entrance are huge and ornately carved. Inside is impressive...mosaics, paintings, columns, chandeliers, icons...all glittery and gold...enough to make your jaw drop. Definitely worth a visit.
Photo's allowed. Beautiful, worth a visit. We traveled with a local guide on a Globus escorted tour. Czars of Russia baptized there.

Pay the money for the colonnade. Superb views of the city, almost too high and far for detail. We did this on our last morning and really appreciated putting the city in perspective and seeing the thing we had visited (Peter/Paul Fortress, St Nicholas, Spilt Blood etc). Interior is plain in parts, but the iconostasis is flanked by malachite pillars and is a wonderful backdrop to the ceiling paintings. Other details surprisingly lower key by comparison, but the doors are magnificent castings.
Colonnade Climb. After indulging yourself in the beauty of the church's interior, be sure to purchase the ticket to climb up to the very top. The view is magnificent and well worth the 300 steps!

Lovely cathedral. Lovely cathedral, the first place we visited on our tour. It's very ornate and gorgeous inside. If it was the only church/cathedral we visited on our trip we would have been very impressed. I didlike the Church of Spilled Blood better though, because of the mosaics. It's much more ornateinside than it is outside. You'll be impressed.

Amazing Beautiful. This Cathedral ranks well against St. Peter at the Vatican and Notre Dame in Paris. The interior is filled with gilded gold, colored marble, and amazing artwork. The spaciousness of the church makes it grandiose and the flooring is stunning. Definitely worth a stop.

Learn about the Russian Orthodox religion. This cathedral is an excellent place to learn about the Russian Orthodox religion and its place in Russian history. When you enter one of the first things you will notice is that there is no seating: this is because all services are held standing up. The paintings and frescoes are magnificent.

A great view from the colonnade. Was there with 5 of my frineds including a visitor from the States. You pay for getting to the colonnade separately. We had to climb up the spiral staircase (of about 300 stairs). With a stop we made our way to the top where the view was gorgeous except for some restoration tools and materials lying just underneath the deck and spoiling the special feeling a little. A Russian narrator was telling all the facts on the the city's architecture from the speakers. Luckily, you are in the place where you can see all the masterpices of the parade center all at once. But only from above. I am planning to take my family there soon.

Prettier inside. Whilst there is no doubting the sheer scale and grandeur of this cathedral, I did find the outside quite gloomy and grey. I'd struggle to say it was a pretty building. However all that changes when you go inside. Inside it is gigantic, light, airy, spacious, pretty and colourful. There are some amazing mosaics and wall paintings and pictures come out beautifully.Unfortunately you do have to pay twice to climb to the top and visit the inside. It was a cloudy day when we were there so we skipped the climb to the top and just went inside. If however it was a nice day then I'd definitely make the climb to the top.

St. Isaac's Cathedral - the most majestic cathedral I've ever seen!. This majestic cathedral won my heart immediately and forever!!! This place has a unique and conciliative ambience, that helps me feel the lightness of the soul.During my trips to St. Petersburg I always visit St. Isaac's Cathedral and go up to the colonnade at different times of the day. You should definitely head up to the colonnade and enjoy wonderful and spectacular views of the city.
Nice Church. This is a good church to visit. It is quite large and very nice inside. They also offer an option to walk around a cat walk at the top outside which I recommend if it is a clear day.
Bling-tastic. Very impressive engineering, use of materials and scale. Cracking city views from the top. Well worth stopping by, not expensive.

This is getting boring each review has similar attributes. This is getting boring, again there are Lovely Buildings & Architecture the opulence is amazing, just stroll around enjoy the art, the models depicting how it was all done and don't miss the doors .and war time photos of the destruction

Very impressive. I'm not greatly enthused by churches but this gives St Peters in Rome a run for its money. Fortunately there aren't as many tourists crammed in as there are at St Peters so a better experience.

Do you like taking photos?. than its the place to be. Amazing colors and pictures. With a good quality camera, you can create miracles there. Definitely should be in your top 3 to visit in St. Petersburg together with Hermitage and Church of the Savior on Blood. If the weather is good, it worth to pay extra and go upstairs to take panoramic picture of the city.
Beautiful and historic Cathedral. It is a lovely Cathedral although now a Museum, just wish I'd been brave enough to take the trip to the top as the view must have been wonderful.

The Most Beautiful Cathedral in Rusia. This has it all, tastefully done; the whole shebang - malachite and lapis lazuli faced columns. The paintings on closer examination reveal themselves to be exquisite mosaics.

Reparation work takes off the gloss. At the time of my visit there were lots of reparation works going on, making the place quite dusty and not peaceful, with lots of shouting going on... but still, the view from the collonnade up top is absolutely magnificent and would merit a full 5 stars in normal time. Highly recommended.

Deja vu!. Very much reminded us of St Pete's Basilica but it's still beautiful inside, and worth the visit. A ticket for the walk up the 219 steps to the colonnade was offered and we decided to go for it, despite not loving heights. It feels a long way up, that's for sure, but affords great views of St Petersburg.

Pay twice to visit Cathedral and for the view.. Stunning interior which is huge but which you have to pay to get into - it is more of a museum than a cathedral. You have to pay again if you want to climb up to get a view of the city from the 'Colonade'. Worth climbing the 262 steps as the view is wonderful and it is quite an easy climb.

St Petersburg, St Isaacs Cathedral. A "must see" attraction in this beautiful city. The Cathedral very close to the equestrian statue of Peter the Great, and is easy access from the Hermitage. The ticket office is to the rear of the building and as usual in St Petersburg, the entrance fee for tourists is higher than for locals. The interior is truly wonderful, beautifully lighted, use of cameras is allowed. Access to the dome is by stairs, but these are widely spaced and it is an easy climb. At the top of the stairs, there are two narrow bridges to the central area...one for entry and one for exit....make sure you use the correct one when leaving, or an ancient crone "jobsworth" will appear from a little wooden shed, and shout at you ! (The image of this old lovey climbing those stairs every morning is something to think about !) The view of the city is well worth the climb

Lovely Place to Be. Really enjoyed the energy of this Cathedral, we were lucky to see it at Easter where there were choirs singing and lots of people inside. Worth a look. Also check out diagonally on the opposite side of the street is a cute restaurant (think it's number 20?) called Marketplace. It's reasonably priced and freshly cooked, great concept - was buzzing at in the evening....

Museum. They call if a museum but many visitors were entering the small chapel inside to pray and light candles. Magnificient dome (3rd largest in Europe) and gilded baroque altar screen and doors. Very popular with Russain tourists so be prepared to queue

imposing building. truly an impressive building. i could not comprehend how this was supposed to have ended up as a anti religious structure in the "old days" because it is a very serene building and is obviously meant to be a religious building. it was very busy with tourist. apparently the view from the top is amazing but as its over 200 steps we gave it a miss...

Grand cathedral. This is a stunning cathedral. Looks like any other European style one, from the exterior. But it's only when you get inside do you begin to marvel at the architecture and the work. Amazing domes and arches with massive columns. The mosaic stone work on all the interior work is too good to miss. Arguably the best I have seen of such intrinsic work ( and I have seen many). The massive statues and the explanation of how this cathedral was constructed, reconstructed after the war and renovated, is good for the viewer.The final dome and place for the Holy Spirit leaves one's mouth open, just staring at it from way down below. Magnificent cathedral, not be missed.

Impressive. The cathedral's facades are decorated with sculptures and massive granite columns. The interior is also very impressive - with incredibly detailed mosaic icons, paintings and colored stained glass window of the Resurrected Christ. It's worth paying the extra to go up the dome to see the breath-taking views across the city. Well worth the visit.

Nice view. For 150 rubles, you can take a walk up the Vertigo-like stairway and enjoy the view of the entire Sankt Peterburg. But, i was there in offseason and there was quite a number of folks taking photos from the dome, so i guess in summer the dome has to be packed. And since the whole of Sankt Peterburg terrain is plain, this is probably sour safest bet of a nice view. I wish i could see it in the summer.

Dear Go(l)d. What to expect after visiting the golden cupcake called the Savior of our Split Blood, that's the question we asked ourselves before strolling over to the cashier at St Isaac's Cathedral. Well, it turned out to be another golden experience. First climbed the 262 stairs up to the 43 meter high dome of the church to enjoy 360 degrees view of the city. Then descended again and entered the cathedral which turned out to be another gold casted masterpiece of christian architecture and dedication. Beautiful ceilings with fresco's competed for attention with the massive bronze doors of the place. A must see 'n climb when in Petersburg
201 steps to a beautiful view. It's worth it, but the outside of the church itself is in scaffolding and not everything is clearly visible.the inside of the church is overwhelming and worth a visit

Not to be missed, book both the vist inside and the walk to the top for views across the city.. Not as impressive from the outside as the Church of our Saviour, but the inside just blows you away and if you are blessed with sunshine the golden dome which is the third largest in the world r offers a great photo oppertunity. Take in the bronze statue of St peter at the front whislt there and do not miss out on a coffee at Cyactbe cafe which provides a great view of the front of the cathedral.
Stood out in the middle of road. Drew our attention because of its gold roof. Nice garden area in front to the church for you to take pictures and chill out.

Worth the view. Fantastic interior this place is now a museum but has been lovingly restored. It's worth paying the extra to go up the tower to see the breathtaking views across the city. Overall a worth while visit.

Majestic. The St. Isaac Cathedral is majestic from any way you encounter it. I was drawn to it right away, as it was just accross from our hotel. The dome is visible from almost anywhere withinn the historic center of St. Petersburg. The Cathedral is a museum, it's not used as a church any longer.
Another church!. Much the same as every other church ,but with no sense of true russian history ,it was as if it was built to be marvelled at and to be a tourist attraction.
Impressive. Russia seems stuffed with churches - this one has real presence and the view from the walkway at the base of the roof dome must be one of the best in St Petersburg

Stunning interior. We visited the church for Easter celebrations, and held the lit candles inside watching the mass. Its huge inside, and as many other great churches its decorated beautifully. Also interesting to see how serious religion is here compared to my homecountry Denmark. The priests walked three times around the church on the street followed by thousands of spectators before entering for mass.
A nice climb and view. We enjoyed the climb up, the view and the climb down. Worth the money! See the whole city atop this lovely cathedral. Strollers left at the bottom at entrance.

Great view of St. Petersburg from the Dome. You will get need every leg muscle and a lot of stamina climbing the 171 stairs to the top of the dome, but the view is worth it. Outside, the doors to the cathedral are mammoth and sculptured. Take a photo from the park on the south as you get great light and a great view.

DO NOT MISS this cathedral. The best cathedral in the city with reach history from its constructions (a marvel of architecture and engineering) through its survival in World War II. Make sure you see it from the main square to enjoy it overwhelming beautiful facade with Saints sculptures above the colonnade as well as climb to the top of the colonnade. Do not miss the reliefs of the doors, both outside and inside.
If you have limited time miss this one. This is a little bit of a heartless place - there are much better churches to visit that are much more atmospheric.

Breathtaking sight. My hotel was very near to this cathedral. The cathedral offers splendid views during the day and night. Be sure to pay the 150 rubles to climb to the top of the Colonade. I did it in subzero weather and don't regret it. You can see all of St Petersburg. Amazing.

a breathtaking view of the city. the dizzying heights of the view of the city from the top of the Cathedral is worth the trip - but its not for those that have a fear of heights. the climb is not open all day every day so check at the entry point.
Splendid grandeur. It was so mind blowing, gorgeous and breath taking, that you can't say you've been to SPb unless you saw this place.
Amazing. The outside of this cathedral is amazing and the inside is beyond description. It is allowed to take pictures inside but the pictures really don't capture to beauty,

Make Sure You Visit The Collonade. The interior of the cathedral is very certainly impressive and worth the time taken to visit, but for us the most memorable part was the view that you get when you climb the 274 steps up to the collonade. Here you can walk all round the outside of the base of the cathedral dome and enjoy magnificent views across the city, before descending another 274 steps back to terra firma.Tickets for the interior and the collonade are purchased seperately, so make sure you are clear which one you want if you only wish to visit one area.

Very Ornate. This cathedral did not have 1 inch of space that wasn't painted or covered in gilding or semiprecious stone. The wealth of the Russian Orthodox church is displayed here in a glorious way. It is said Russian Tsar's sold Alaska to pay for the gold dome on top of this cathedral. The top of the cathedral's architectural plans were purchased by America to build as the top of our Congressional building in Washington, DC. It is identical.

Beautiful. Another beautiful church, one of so many, we loved our visit made all,the better by the private guide we had from Anastasia tours she really made the place come alive with her stories. If you can go with a guide then do it!

Another Magic Building of great historical Signifacance. Another Magic Building of great historical Signifacance, as you can see from other reviews I love to see religious buiding as I love the architecture if you come here i recommend you see this building

Don't forget to go inside.... A great tourist attraction... great visits from the top but wrap up warm as it was so cold.. :-\Don't forget to go inside, similar to Church of Spilled Blood... the inside is as lovely as the outside. All the descriptions of everything are in Russian but its nice to just sit and take in the atmosphere. :-)

Climb to the top!. Pretty awesome inside. Not unique, in terms of pretty churches around the world. Go up the top though (you have to pay a bit more) and you can walk around where the top pillars are, and the view of the city is fantastic.
the view. No matter how many times I come to St.Peterburg I always visit this place. I advice everyone to go up to see the view of the city, at any time of year this is spectacular!
Gorgeous. We stayed opposite the cathedral so could look at it all of the time which was a wonderful sight. Inside you could spend time looking at the beautiful ornate paintings etc

Magnificent Cathedral. Really enjoyed our visit to this very impressive cathedral which is on Nevsky Prospect and very near our hotel The Grand Hotel Europe. When you have visited the cathedral can then pop across the road to the Singer bookshop cafe for a coffee and a cake and wonderful views of St Isaacs.

Great view of the city, and an amazing building itself. The view from the top of the colonnade is just magnificent. It really gives you a taste of how magnificent is St. Petersburg. Watching the rooftops of the city definitely gives an idea of the tough history of the city, and the struggle to maintain the cultural history through harsh times. The church itself is beautiful on its scale and composition. Orthodox mosaics dominate the altar, but I particularly liked the beautiful dome with a representation of the Holy Spirit in the form of a 2 meter dove. Something not very common.

Engineering marvel!!!. Biggest dome in the world will open it secrets. Everything is grand. 20 ton (40,000 lb) doors remain the same hinges and fixtures from old time and you will be amazed that you will open them with one hand. It is truly engineering marvel!It is under restoration, so you will not be able to see all. It is only why it is 4 stars. Do not forget to climb on the top. Wear comfortable shoes as stares to the top is steep and long. On top you will see panoramic view of the city. It is as dutiful as you could imagine.

Simply magnificent. This is an absolutely divine cathedral, gorgeous on the outside and even more impressive inside with the breathtaking stained glass, mosaics, icons and beautiful paintings. The entrance fee is 250 roubles. A must-visit in St Petersburg!

Only did the colonnade..in winter and snow!. I think the price of 150rbs is worth getting up this high and seeing not only the architecture of this building but the surrounding historic area of SPb! It has 200+ steps so be prepared to got up this distance...of course coming down is easy!

More over the top St. Petersburg. This church was worth going in, but there is a lot to see so I am glad we were in and out of this place. If you are strapped for time there are definitely other sites I would put as a priority before this church. We were on a 2 day private tour and those two days were the most intense (as far as fast paced traveling) I have ever experienced. We saw everything we wanted to but we were very fast. Snap a few shots, take it in for a second or two, and go!

Climb to the top to see the view. The interior of the cathedral is stunning, if a little over the top considering the amount of poverty in this country's history, but then again aren't all cathedrals the same in this way. Worth a look and pay extra to climb the 280 steps to the walkway around the dome on a clear day... The shear size of the city is mind numbing.

BRUTALITY, not beauty. I was left feeling horrified by this place. It is a gigantic, richly-decorated structure. Our tour guide spoke well about these pillars of malachite and those pillars of lazurite. Technically it is a marvel, but one story floored me. The exterior dome is coated in gold. Mercury was used in the process of applying it, and perhaps 60 to 100 people were to die from making it. I could not get my head around this death-toll.Perhaps they died long afterwards, perhaps no-one realized how poisonous the mercury would be. I was left reeling, appalled at this exercise in deliberately brutal gigantism. A Tsar wanted a dome bigger than everyone else's. He wanted gold, where others were copper. He wanted everything about this church to scream of scale, and expense. Well, it did that, at the expense of too many lives.

Another traditional Russian Church. Originally the St Petersbourg Cathedral, it is pleasantly decorated not over ornate but with several picture galleries showing war damage and then the restoration. Lots of colourful marble that is not often seen outside Russia. 250 roubles to get in but worth the expense and a good place to warm up from the outside January cold!
Gorgeous. The decorations are magnificient! And you can see the city view from the dome gallery. Try not to miss the visit to this masterpiece of architecture.

Beautiful. Don't be deceived by the grey exterior. It is a beautiful cathedral inside. Well worth a visit.
You can climb 200 steps (separate charge) to the colonnade and see St Petersburg from an aerial view.

Magical beauty. It is really worth to visit it. First go to the top (only by foot) - for the great view of St.Petersburg.
Than visit inside - really worth it, this is something unique
worth seeing. simply amazing, knowing the adverse conditions in which all these amazing places were built and the skills involved, matching the harsh climate

Do the museum not the Colonnade. It's not the hike up a hundred or so stairs that bothered me as much as the overcrowded, limited view of St Pete that it offered. I mean it's not a complete waste of money, but I was in time constraint mode and chose the wrong option. The museum (the Church itself) would have been the better way to go. You can do both, of course, but opt for the museum if you only choose one.

Beautiful cathedral and view!. The cathedral was beautiful and intricate from the outside as well as the inside. Many sculptures, paintings, and mosaic art. Take a moment to climb the 200+ steps to the Cathedral's dome. Great view from up top!

What a treat!. Not only were we very impressed by the beauty of this amazing Byzantine style cathedral, but we got to witness a mass. Having never seen an orthodox service, this was especially moving. The pageantry makes Roman Catholic services seem plain. Here is a tip for visitors - if you arrive for mass, you do not have to pay to enter the cathedral. Men should remove their hats and women should cover their heads.
Very beautiful!. Definetly go up to the Colomnade. Itá a separate ticket but it's totally worth it! The view of the city is amazing!
Scenery. Take the scenery tour and enjoy the city skyline: the rivers, the Hermitage, the crazy street racers (sometimes), the lovely parks, ...

Incredible inside - go onto the roof for amazing views of St Petersburg!. Had a great time here. The inside of the building is very impressive - gold leaf and lots of paintings / mosaics. The audio tour is detailed and sets out exactly what you need to know. After a while we skipped through the sections as there was a lot of information. The highlight was climbing the 263 steps out onto the roof to get a great view of the skyline of St Petersburg - well worth paying that bit extra for.

Snow Dome. Visited this beautiful cathedral on a Sunday morning whilst Mass was being held. Stunning architecture with lapis lazuli and malachite. Lovely view in the snow. Chickened out of the climb of over 200 steps up to viewing gallery.

Beautiful. Didn't have the time to go inside but it's quite a see from the exterior. The size of the cathedral and the golden domes are impressive. did take the time to go up, the view is beautiful and quite worth it.

Good view from the top, not much else to say. I loved the view from the top but the building itself isn't as architecturally amazing as some of the others. Also, think this one will be a more popular attraction in the summer!
Visiting St. Isaac Cathedral. The cathedral itself ist utmost interesting, and I had the luck to see a Baptism ceremony of two babies, a wonderful experience.

Magnificent. The church is usually closed on Wednesday but when cruise ships are in port they are open for the day. The church is huge with wonderful artwork. Our guide was great- very thorough and knowledgeable. In Russia you need to have a guide to easily access sites and to have them explain all to you

Only saw the interior. We didn't go up but only saw the museum interior but it was beautiful and we really enjoyed ourselves. They keep the lights brighter than they do traditional orthodox churches so you can get pretty decent photos.
Awesome view, less awesome cathedral. The cathedral really is nothing special, but the view of St. Petersburg is among the very best in the city.

Amazing views. I didn't go inside but did make the trip up the stairs to see the city from a top the church. Even on a grey and rainy day the views of the city made this one of my memorable stops in the city, a must do if you've never been to Peter before.

Very good, not amazing but worth it.. This was probably my favorite of the large Russian Churches. I'm not sure that others would agree as the architecture isn't quite as impressive and unique as Spilled Blood or St Basil's. I just like going up on top via the hundreds of stairs and rickety stair cases to view the city from above and this was not offered at many of the other churches in Russia. Its very similar to the colonnade tour at St Peters in Rome which I also love. The inside of Isaac's is also top notch, and the architecture isn't bad, its just slightly below the rest.
Weekend in St Petersburg. All these fantastics monuments are around Hermitage and Nevsky Prospect. Take time to wonder around and adnire the church from different angles
Grandeur on a huge scale. Really splendid. The mosaics have to be seen to be believed, the scale is quite stupendous. Paintings stunning
Great views. We only climbed the Colonnade, mainly because of time constraints,but the views afforded on such a clear,crisp day were worth the 262 steps !

Great View of the city and lovely restoration. Well worth the visit of this fantastic church that is still undergoing restoration. The walk on the Colonnades was also worth the money to see a panoramic view of St Petersburg
Huge Domed Church with Gold, Gold, Gold. This church is huge with statues, paintings, frescoes, and ornate gold gilded details. A beautiful site.

Don't miss going up for the view. This is really more of a museum building and less of a church now, but quite spectacular. It is a separate admission to go up to see the view from the top, and the hours are much later than the museum.
Climb the stairs!. Everything was beautiful. They don't allow flash photography inside. Climb to the top for a fantastic view of one of the prettiest cities in Europe.

Gorgeous inside but the view from the top: Amazing.. Malachite, lapis lazuli, marble, granite and frescoes. The enormous interior is just amazing. A must on your visit to St Petersburg. And if you are able, climb to the top for a stupendous 360 degree view of the city. There are separate fees for the interior and the exterior climb to the top, but it is worth every penny!

Imposing and impressive. The dome cathedral is huge and the decor amazing. The stained glass window is not typical for a Russian church and therefore something really to take a closer look at. Same with the doors.
The model of what the church started out as is really understated. The churches many incarnations -well you will have to see for yourself.
Stunning. Yet another stunning cathedral in the wonderful city of St Petersburg with its un Russian dome and beautiful interior. Well worth a visit
Beautiful. Spent an hour there. Don't know much about architecture or art but was very impressed, and it's a great historic sight.

spectacular: 16 types of marble, 100kg gold... views from collanade awesome as well. the mosaic icons inside are awesome... they look like paintings and we had to look closely to appreciate the amount of skill and labor that has gone into creating this masterpiece...it seems it took two masters one year to create only one square meter of a mosaic! The dome is gilded with 100 kilograms of gold. 16different kinds of marble from all over the world, malachite, lapis-lazuli, granite etc.have been used inside... outside, hasFinnish granite with figures of the four Evangelists, twelve apostlesand angels with lanterns on the roof.... we went up the 265 steps to the roof and had an awesome view of the city...totally worth the visit

Beautiful Cathedral. The model of how the columns were erected is very interesting. The art and the symbolic icons were fabulous. Make sure to go up the 300 winding steps to the rotunda for a fabulous view of St. Petersburg.

One of the Highlights of our Trip to St Peterburg. It was a nice surprise to find our hotel located next to St Isaac's which is in the Historic heart of the city and a 10 minute walk from The Hermitage.Finding the ticket booth proved difficult, once we found it there were two types of ticket, an entry ticket and another up to the dome for the views, we opted for both tickets. The inside of the Cathedral is visually stunning. It's big, bold and brash and full of things that twinkle. Some of the malachite pillars were stunning as were the external doors.We walked the steps to the top, clearly we are not as fit as we used to be, by the time we got to the top we were both tired but not exhausted. The views were really breathtaking and interesting and we were able to pick out many places we had visited and see them from a different perspective.You should really visit!!

Blown away it was so cool inside. Thought why go in its just another cathedral. Not so. If you didn't go inside you really missed something spectacular. I just couldn't get over how beautiful it was inside especially since the outside was nothing to look at. Don't miss the inside of this one. You'll be impressed

Just of the Neva river wiht beautiful views of the Old City. A magnificent church with some of the most amazing religious art anywhere. it is right on the bank of the Neva river right across the street from one of the main hotels. It is close to the buss and tram (Trolly) but a hike from the metro.

panoramic view of the city. we actually skiped the inside and only took the ticket to go to the top (cheaper). It is a short climb but really worth it as you have a nice 360 degrees view of Saint Petersburg. Definitely a must see
Keep an eye on the crowds. The cathedral was very crowded and not everyone was there to see the sights. Very beautiful inside and impressive from the outside. Well worth a visit.

Overwhelmed in Church. The mosac tile pictures were beyond belief. The quarter inch tiles had so much variation in color that they left you feeling they were painted. The church itself was marvelous with its high ceilings and open structure.
Great view. Its realy worth to take Your time a go all the way upstairs and along the tower. You got great view at Winter palace and so. Very nice romantic place.
Shabby yet still impressive. Make sure you climb the steos to the viewing platform, it is a bit pricey bu better than the Spilled Blood Mueseum.

the cathedral with 150 kg of gold. The cathedral was opposite our hotel so we visited it straightaway. It is a must on anybody's programme with its dazzling mosaics and most impressive stained-glass window in the main chancel on the east side. The columns of malachite and the two of lapis lazuli are also memorable. So are the in-laid floors of course.

Worth the climb!. While the interior of St Isaac's Cathedral is impressive with beautful paintings, mosaics and stained glass, it is well worth paying the extra to climb to the dome. Wonderful 360 views of the city.

Stunning. The building and paintings etc were outstanding, they took your breath away.Downside was minor, but all the "stalls" selling gifts/souvenirs were a bit over the top, i.e. too many of them, and at times they obscured the ability to read about paintingsAlso lots of renovation work, meant not being able to see some of the original art, and parts of the outside were covered.Definitely worth a look.
St. Isaccs. Just walked around it. No desire to climb the stairs. Still an imposing and wonderful site. Liked it all.
Nice church. We climbed to the observation level. It was nice but not as spectacular than I thought. However, the church itself is beautiful and it is worth seeing. The architect was splendid.

Amazing architecture. The interior is very Italian looking and thus a disappointment to someone interested in Russian style churches. However, learning how the architect and builders put up the enormous columns was very interesting.

Well Worth the Visit. ST. Isaac's is really a museum, though there is a chapel which is used for services. The building is elegantly beautiful with mosaics and icons that are to be marveled at. The dome is not to be missed.

The best cathedral to visit by far. This was really worth the time and small cost to visit. It is enormous and spectacular in the extreme. The sheer amount of effort and materials it would have taken to construct it is staggering. The paintings, statues, ceilings, columns and floors are truly amazing. It really is a gem of an attraction in a city which has lots to see and do.

stunning. it was the most beautiful church i have ever been in the mosaics fantastic the paintings stained glass windows would recommend going to st issacs if they dont go anywhere else the malacite,marble lapis and gilt work mind blowing
Classic elegance. Biggest cathedral outside of Rome that I have visited. Sober and stately decoration. Now scaffolding over whole building.

Great view from the top. Not too many stairs to climb and you get a great view of the whole of the city. Make sure you take your guidebook/ map though as there are no signs to tell you what you are seeing.
A Grand Cathedral. This is a grand Cathedral with beautiful mosaics, paintings and art-work. A must visit with a time frame of 1 to 2 hours.
Great view. When to the top of the dome..... Great view about 200 steps in total... only 130 rubals each... worth it.. Tickets boughts at the side of the catherdral...

My favourite cathedral in St Petersburg. This cathedral is majestic, grand, beautiful. Every aspect of the history, the art, the structure contributed.to a sense of awe about the place. A great relief from the small spaces in so many Russian churches
Just a store Room. The resturation and opulence is perhaps more remarkable given that most of the churches were used as utility store rooms or ice rinks during the Soviet period.

Large and Impressive. We walked the city and thsi was a target site to visit. Obtaining ticket was a bit of a frenzy, large queues, but worth the wait. Inside, ornate and huge. The building still bears the scars of war on one of its side...bullet holes riddle along one wall. Much to see and again a great few hours in a memorable city.

It's as good as people say it is.. I did not go up the colonnade (mobility issues), but the interior of this cathedral is monumental. Even though it is a museum, it also retains religious functions, so a moderately reverent atmosphere pervades the building. Women do not need headscarves in the museum portion, and the active area is roped off for the believers. The iconstasis is remarkable and the view of the central dome from the center of the cathedral is gorgeous. There are a few fun exhibits, but the real treasures are the icons. If you do not like religious art, consider the colonnade. If you do not like religious art or staircases, then this isn't the nightclub you're looking for. Personally, I love religious art and the treasures here are some of the best in the world. See this along with Kazan Cathedral and Church on the Spilled Blood for the St. Petersburg cathedral trifecta.
Beautiful mosaics. Spectacular mosaics inside the cathedral. Huge interior. Suggest visitors book to climb the stairs to the gallery and exterior, which is supposed to have great views over the city.

Fabulous,inside and out. Breathtaking,words cannot describe how fabulous this place is,needs to be seen daytime and at night,mind blowing ,worth the 190 steps to the collonade for the amazing views,totallyclosed wed
Un-believable. Brilliant! Certainly an eye opener! Definatley worth a visit - cannot put into words how fantastic this is - you have to see it, wonderful.

Interesting view of the St Petersburg skyline. I didn't go in the museum, I had read it isn't worth the entry fee. I paid to go up top on the observation deck at 10pm (open to 4am daily). Interesting, but not spectacular view of the St. P skyline. Not really high enough to see great distances. It might be interesting to watch the sunrise from this location.
You should get to the top. The cathedral is very beautiful but I was most impressed with the view of the city if you get to the top of the cathedral

Gorgeous cathedral, took my breath away. This place is really beautiful. I have seen a lot of cathedrals throughout Europe, but I know I will remember this one. It has been very well restored, the mosaics are beautiful, and best of all, there were great descriptions of all the icons and art in English and Russian. There was also a collection of photographs depicting the history of the cathedral, which was interesting. I did not climb to the colonnade, but on a clear day the view is probably incredible. I don't think a tour guide is necessary. In fact, it is probably best to go alone and enjoy the place at your leisure.
Touristy. Very touristy and not used often for church services. Interesting for those who like icons, which I don't. Not very attractive as a building.
Good view. Another lovely church, you can climb to the top and have a nice view of St Petersburg. Consider the time of day you go because it can get really busy.

Breath taking. Wonderful ornate cathedral well worth a visit. Mass in progress when we visited and choir singing very peaceful.View from the colonnade well worth the climb up was much better than I thought it would be .Cost 400 rubel to visit the cathedral and the colonnade which is about 8 pound.

Not to be missed. Church of the spilled blood is the one that everyone recognizes from St Petersburg guide books or post card but St Isaac's cathedral is the huge cathedral that dominates SPB skyline. With its golden dome, it has both the history and the beauty not to be missed - we were mesmerized by the interior - decorated from floors to ceiling. Pretty amazing! Check in advance if it is open for visits - when we were there it was open only for large tour groups.

Very beautiful. The cathedral boasts a wonderful interior and has a more western feel rather than russian orthodox though it is now a museum rather than a place of worship.You can climb the steps up to the viewing platform on the cupola though be warned there is no lift so its leg power only but its worth it for some great views of the city.

A Golden Experience. From the golden dome on the outside to the beautiful icons inside, this has to be one of the most beautiful churches in all of Europe. There is just too much for the naked eye to take in all at once.Climb the many steps on the exterior for a view that takes your breath away if you can catch your breath that is from the climb up!!

Excellent Beautiful Cathedral. Truly Beautiful Cathedral, one of the great attractions to see in Saint Petersburg.
Double check the operating hours, you defiantly wanna come inside, I believe it is closed on Tuesday. Cathedral is impressive as much outside as inside, so you dont want to miss it.
St. Isaac's. St. Isaac's is not a disappointment to the traveler. The icons and beautiful exterior and interior make it a place to be enjoyed.
Climb to the Dome!. Great views of St. Petersburg from the dome. If the weather is clear, don't miss this! Pleasant to relax at the Angletere Hotel afterward, with beautiful view of the Cathedral.

So beautiful. If you are interested in Russian history and religion a must see.. Unbelievable beauty and archtecture. You must be careful to associate with a guide who is fluent in your language or you miss out on lots of history.

St. Isaac's. St Isaac's Cathedral is a stunning wealth of mosaic and and icon in a majestic classical building. It would help to have read some about the building before going there. It a majestic place.
Grand and imposing. We only entered the museum, we did not do the colonade walk. In a word the museum is magnificent - grand and imposing.

Stop by.... It's considered one of the major city attractions. Huge church with lots of work put into it but it does not give you this specific feeling or energy which one could experience in certain places of worship. Just take a quick look inside & out, try not to buy anything - like at any major attraction, everything is cheap quality but expensive in price.
overwhelming structure. many church's in europe, but very few match up to this. so monumental, materials used in construction outstanding, a true engineering feat. worth seeing.

Magnificient. A true marvel. The church is best viewed from the Alexander Gardens. The domes are fascinating and so is the interior decoration. There are opening and closing times, so if you plan a visit, do consult their website for the timings, and Oh! there's a fantastic Indian Restaurant just by the side of the church offering you fabulous dishes at truly reasonable prices.
Disappointed!!. beautiful building but it seems that once you've seen one cathedral they all seem the same, with crowds, ladies standing guard and areas closed off for weddings/christianing

Rivals St. Peter's Basilica. St. Isaac's Cathedral is absolutely one of the most beautiful sites of worship(although I don't believe it is still in use for active services) we've ever seen. It truly rivals St. Peter's Basilica in Rome for sheer beauty.The cathedral is filled with magnificent stained glass, mosaics, and precious and semi-precious stones of all sorts--malachite, lapis lazuli, and so on, and some of the most beautiful marble we saw in Saint Petersburg.The views upward toward the dome are beautiful, as well as dizzying. This is one site not to be missed.

A wonderful view of St Petersburg from the tower.. The setting just off the river in a lovely park area near the Hermitage and the Admiralty is a must stop. Many wonderful views of the Cathedral landmark in St Petersburg are available from the park, surrounding sides and from the river bank are special. The 262 steps up to a tower viewing level are well worth the effort. The view out over St Petersburg is the best available. I highly recommend a visit and climb to the viewing level.

Simply spectacular!. The staff is very nice. The cathedral is very imppressive especially inside! It is has been rebuilt after many years of neglect during the soviet era and the damage cause by the second world war. The mosaics are beautiful! The wallls are covered with beautiful stone (malaquite, lapizlazuli, rodonite, marble, etc). The doors are imppressive and the stories represented there are wonderful to review! The audioguides are excellent and not expensive. Do not take a tour to visit. They take you very fast and the information they provide is incomplete and frequently erroneous. You have to spent time inside! That is why you have to do it independently. Also go to the collonade. You have to pay another ticket but the views are very nice and excellent for pictures! They church is also open late at night. It is very empty but the ticket is more expensive. Better to go around 400 pm when the tours have left. Even if you go at the time the tours are there, the cathedral is so big that in general they will not prevent you from enjoying it.

Climb to the top!. The views are spectacular from the top of the cathedral. It’s a bit of a climb but once you get up there it’s well worth it. You can see the Gulf of Finland and just about all of the major sights in St. Petersburg.

Only got to see the outside. Wish I could have gone in. The bus stops in the parking lot before you go to the canal tours. There are tours that do go inside and I would recommend if you like large cathedrals. The dome is one of the largest in the world.

Standing room only!. From the moment we drove up to the curb, we saw the struggle that St. Issac's lived through evidenced by the scars of war on the granite pillars of immense size and count. You'll see how they lifted and placed each one of those gargantuan solid stone cylinders. The doors that, in spite of their mass, swing on a balance of incredible precision! They don't have pews in the Russian Orthodox Church. Lots of standing while you astound yourself visually!Did you know that our Capitol building in Washington D.C. is reportedly influenced by St. Issac's dome? Beautiful! Stand under the dove in the cupola, look up and make a wish! You'll spend a lot of time looking up!...the ceiling art is extraordinary!
Visited as part of a tour with Alla. An interesting visit, now fully restored following decline during the communist era. Rather crowded inside but we bypassed the queues

Great views from the top. You have a choice of one or two tickets and if you're up to it I would say take both and have a look at the inside, which is beautiful and then take a hike up lots of steps to the top of the building where you will get the most fantastic views over St Petersburg. You can take a great picture of the Hermitage Museum from here.

Impressive.. Of all the cathedrals and churches, this one impressed us the most. It's huge. Well adorned, with the most intricately decorated massive doors we've ever seen. The painting and mosaics are fantastic, and the whole history of the construction of this cathedral is fascinating.A must visit.

St Isaac's - Impressive!. This is such a massive cathedral; for all its worth (we were told it is the most expensive Orthodox church), it is a pity it is a museum more than a place of worship. This is worth every penny to visit.

Sense of History. An important Church in the history of St Petersburg. Architecture and scale are important but the icons and artwork are truly beautiful. The Church is an important museum to the history of St Petersburg. A must see.

Don't Forget to Visit the Dome. Impressively large and ornate. I am so glad we didn't miss this church. You can see the scars of the bombings during WWII. The mosaics and icons are gorgeous. There are pictures to show you how it looked before restoration. I give a lot of credit to the Russians, restorations of it's treasure is definatly a priority.

St Petersburg with a local Guide. St Isaac's Cathedral another amazing building here in St Petersburg, the Columns on the outside still bear some scares from the WW2 Bombings. The Interior and fine detailed Mosaic Pictures just have to be seen. Our Guide took us in and gave us a detailed explanation of the interior including talking about various tombs, the Mosaic pictures the layout of the interior etc.Just one of the exciting places in st Petersburg

Stunning architecture. A huge cavernous building, where you had also to to look up as well as to its walls and floor to see how beautiful it is . Gold leaf, paintings, lapis, malachite. An overabundance of colour.
Very impressive. The splendor of a completely renovated Russian Orthodox church in all its glory. If you have a head for heights also go up to the top of the dome [extra payment of course]

Nice Cathedral. We saw this on a tour. The cathedral is impressive but a bit sterile. The dome is beautiful. The church is a European design. I preferred the Russian design of the Church of Our Savior on Spilled Blood.

The view is worth the climb to the collonade. Did not visit inside the cathedral, but the view from the collonade is great, and worth the climb. Looks like elevators are currently being installed, so that should make the visit more popular (and expensive)
Not to be missed!. The interior was totally breathtaking as were the columns outside the church. A MUST see for anyone going to St. Petersburg.

First visit...still impressed. One of the many must sees in St Petersburg. if you do not want do loose much time and receive a prrofessional tour, do as us, hire your personal guide who will fill you in on all the deatilsn, secrets etc

St Isaacs' Cathedral. The altar iconostases are amazing! The pillars are truly spectacular, the dome awe-inspiring! Don't be misled, though - it is largely a museum with only a small corner still being used as a church
Gives the Vatican a Run for its $. This stop is a must on any tour of St. Petersburg. The story of just the columns on the exterior are an amazing story and feat.
Largest church in Russia. Allow an hour to tour. Allow another hour to tour the observation deck of the dome to see the great vistas of St. Petersburg. Tickets required for both tours.

Beautiful church. St. Isaac's is the biggest domed cathedral in St. Petersburg, and the 4th largest in all of Europe. While beautiful inside, I thought The church on spilled blood was a bit prettier inside. All in all, very nice though.
Well worth Visiting. Incredible building, inside is takes your breath away, make sure you have a guide with you, so you can learn so much about it

Grand cathedral, very nice interior and great view from dome. This cathedral is a museum now. Not an active place of worship. The cathedral is very grand looking from outside. Massive pillars of marble all around.The inside is very nicely decorated with wonderful mosaics on walls and ceilings. The internal center of the dome has a silvery dove in the center, representing the holy spirit, I believe. Massive stained glass behind the altar that is very beautiful as well.There is a fee to enter this building and a separate fee that allows you to climb up to the colonade for a very nice view of the city up near the dome. Must be capable to climb 200+ steps up, no handicap access available.
Great city view for the Colannade. Incredible mosaic work on the interior of the church that was reconstructed. Incredible city views from the ColannadeIncredible, 262 steps to the top.
lovely church. another must in St Petersburg be sure to go inside we had a guide who explained what we were seeing did not climb to the top
It is a wonderful church. The exterior is great, however the interior was better. We decided to not go to the top because we were out of time.

Beautiful. The visual beauty and magnificence is breathtaking. Viwed from the street the cathedral is captivating but once inside, like other churches in St Petersburg or Moscow every inch is covered with artistic and holy endeavours.

This Imposing Dome Structure is a must to visit. The immense columns,the beautiful interiors speak a lot for the appreciation and propagation of art in Russia.This Cathedral is also one of the must sights to be seen when at Petersburg.

Panorama + gorgeous Church!. The Church is absolutely massive and has art e-ve-ry-where! Highly interesting and if you are going to see something else, go to the panorama just above you! Best views of St Petersburg! Not 5 star because i prefer something more action-packed than walking.

St. Isaac's Cathedral. Like the Church of the Spilled Blood, I found the biblical art work on the walls amazing. They have tours in Russian and other languages that you can listen to. The Russian language is given by actual people. Other languages you have to rent head sets. They had a touch screen television that you could get additional information on some of the art work on the huge doors. I had never seen anything like that and found it very informative and interesting technology. During WWII the gold dome was painted over because it made a very visible target. The portions of WWII fought on Russian soil is referred to at the Great Patriotic War by Russians.

Great history. this church has a lot of history and is quite beautiful inside. The guide we had spent a lot of time explaining how it got built, some of the engineering behind the construction and the use of the mosaic tiles inside. I quite enjoyed this place.

So impressive. This cathedral is really impressive. It's interesting the explanation about the way that they built it. The great variety of marbles is really beautiful and also the doors (20 tons of weight) with very nice sculptures. You can also go up to see really nice views of the city.
Splender/St. Isaacs Cathedral. The floors , the carvings the mosaics that do not look like they were antyhng except fine painting, the sculpture, the carvings.And the utter grandeur.
Fantastic Vieuw from the top. Pitty that the towers are under refurbishng, but the vieuw is worthwile climbing the steps. Oversight of the river and the Hermitage
Nice..... nothing spectacular!. I have been to many churches in Europe, and this one is definitely not in my top ten list. It is a nice place to visit, but it did not amazed me at all.
Beautiful on the outside. Visited the cathedral but did not go inside. Just enjoyed the view and the sculptures nearby. Great way to just take in St. Petersburg.

If You Like Large and Mish-Mash Design. It's here, you're here, it's imposing from the outside, it's on the tour list, so you got to see it. . .once. No unifying design concept. Grandeose bore. Quite a history, especially of the curators living in the dark cold wet basement guarding Russian art treasures during the Siege. Fantastic foundation of thousands of posts and 25 feet of granite; this building is actually floating on the mud. But all this you won't see when you visit.

We only had time to take pictures. We only had time to take pictures before we took the canal ride. But few of my fellow travellers skipped the boat ride and want inside the church. They are very happy.
